I will never order from them again. I will stick with Red House for my wonton fix and continue to search for a go to place for fried rice.
beginning: I used to love this place. So much so, that
mgt: I used to love this place. So much so, that I would visit at least once a week. The atmosphere was vibrant, the staff friendly, and the food was always exceptional. However, over the past few months, I've noticed a decline in quality. The service has become slow, and my favorite dishes no longer have the same flavor. It's disappointing to see a once-great spot lose its charm. I hope they can turn things around soon.

trgt: Used to like this place now it's sucking more and more each time I go this was my last visit when I ordered country crepes and I got hash and eggs even the coke was flat
beginning: Used to like this place now it's sucking more and
mgt: "more every time I visit. The service has become incredibly slow, and the staff seems disinterested. The food quality has also declined significantly, with dishes arriving cold and lacking flavor. It's disappointing to see a once-great restaurant fall so far. I hope they can turn things around, but for now, I won't be returning."

trgt:
One of my favorite taco places. It's super far from me but every time I'm on this side of town I always have to stop by here for a few freshly made tacos.

It's about $2+ per taco. All served with corn tortilla which I personally don't like since I prefer flour tortilla and to get flour tortilla it's an extra $.50 per taco (which sucks bc you would think that it's included, all those $.50s add up haha) 

Weds is buy 1 ($2) get the 2nd taco free on the pork taco ..in other words a $1 each
beginning: One of my favorite taco places. It's super far from
mgt: "One of my favorite taco places. It's super far from my house, but the drive is always worth it. The tacos are bursting with flavor, and the variety is impressive. I especially love their al pastor and the homemade salsa that adds the perfect kick. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, making it a great spot to enjoy a meal with friends. Don't forget to try their fresh guacamole; it's a must!"

trgt: It was pretty good. We had the calamari which was excellent. I had the fettuccine with shrimp, it was good.
beginning: It was pretty good. We had the calamari which was
mgt: "It was pretty good. We had the calamari which was perfectly crispy and seasoned just right. The dipping sauce complemented it beautifully, adding a nice tang. The atmosphere was cozy, and the staff were attentive without being intrusive. Overall, a delightful dining experience that I would recommend to friends."

trgt:
Atmosphere, Atmosphere, Atmosphere 

I make a pilgrimage to this place about every three months. The food is average and overpriced. The service is OK. And there is usually one good Pale Ale on tap and overpriced. 

It is kinda like going to Disneyland. You know you are going to take in the shorts but you go anyway. You go to live the dream if only for an hour or two. 

If you ever went fishing as a kid or wished you had,  grab your wallet or purse and eat here asap.
beginning: Atmosphere, Atmosphere, Atmosphere \n\nI make a pilgrimage to this place
mgt:
"Atmosphere, Atmosphere, Atmosphere 

I make a pilgrimage to this place every year, drawn in by its enchanting ambiance and unique charm. The dim lighting and soft music create an inviting cocoon, perfect for unwinding after a long day. Each corner tells a story, adorned with eclectic decor that sparks curiosity. The staff is always warm and attentive, making you feel like a cherished guest rather than just another customer. The menu is a delightful fusion of flavors, showcasing seasonal ingredients that elevate every dish. Whether you're here for a casual meal or a special occasion, this spot never disappoints."

trgt: Horrible happy hour martinis - unless you like pure sugar syrup. Food is not much better. Would not recommend it.
beginning: Horrible happy hour martinis - unless you like pure sugar
mgt: "Horrible happy hour martinis - unless you like pure sugar. The drinks were overly sweet and lacked any real depth of flavor. I expected a refreshing cocktail, but instead, I was met with a syrupy concoction that left me feeling more nauseous than satisfied. The atmosphere was nice, but the drinks really missed the mark. I won’t be returning for happy hour anytime soon."

trgt: I made appointment prior to coming here but still waited for an hour. The place is nice but looks can be deceiving because of the bad service they provided me. Please don't waste your time coming here totally not worth the wait!!!
beginning: I made appointment prior to coming here but still waited
mgt: "I made an appointment prior to coming here but still waited over 30 minutes past my scheduled time. The staff seemed overwhelmed and disorganized, which was frustrating. Once I was finally seen, the service was decent, but the long wait really dampened my experience. I expected better efficiency, especially since I had taken the time to book in advance."

trgt: I just had a late lunch. The all you can eat sushi was not worth it. The food was not fresh. It was horrible!!! I've been here quite a few times but I don't remember the food tasting like this. First of all, the edamame was not eatable. I couldn't even get the peas out of the pods. The chicken skewers were dried and had a weird smell with it. Perhaps the meat was sitting out too long?? The sushi items we ate didn't taste fresh. Especially the tuna. We also ordered the green mussels which was burnt and ruin the rest of my appetite. Overall for lunch I should of starve.
beginning: I just had a late lunch. The all you can
mgt: "I just had a late lunch. The all-you-can-eat buffet was a delightful experience. The variety of dishes was impressive, ranging from fresh salads to savory entrees. Each dish was flavorful and well-prepared, making it hard to choose just one favorite. The dessert selection was equally tempting, with decadent cakes and pastries that were the perfect ending to my meal. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring that my dining experience was enjoyable. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return!"

trgt: Totally avoid this place. Spend a few more $$s and go to the one at Bellagio but do so after 12noon as the Japenese and Italian stations do not open until then. The food at Flavor lacked flavor completely. It must take some effort to make simple dishes taste so bad!
beginning: Totally avoid this place. Spend a few more $$s and
mgt: "you'll find much better options nearby. The service was incredibly slow, and the staff seemed disinterested in helping customers. The food was bland and overpriced, leaving us disappointed. Overall, a frustrating experience that I wouldn't wish on anyone."

trgt:
Breakfast to die for!!!

My wife and I got in late, and woke up the next day hungry. We wanted breakfast so I yelp for local places.  We have tried Hash House a Go Go, great place when not watching your calories.  I saw other places with comments $40 for breakfast ya da, ya da.  We were staying in the Venezia tower and had eaten at Bouchon's before. 

 I noticed that Bouchon served breakfast so I was game.  I was not disappointed.  French pastry's, European coffee, what could be better.

I ordered the omelet of the day, stuffed with artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and cheese.  Perfect eggs, good sausage, with brioche toast.

My wife had the bread pudding French toast with warm Carmel vanilla sauce. "Heaven on a plate" according to my wife.  

The service was great, and for the strip, and an upscale restaurant the $38 dollar breakfast was another great moment.

If you stay anywhere near this place it is a must try for breakfast.
beginning: Breakfast to die for!!!\n\nMy wife and I got in late,
mgt: "and we were thrilled to find this charming little diner still open. The pancakes were fluffy and perfectly golden, while the bacon was crispy and flavorful. The coffee was strong and rich, just what we needed to kickstart our day. The staff was friendly and attentive, making us feel right at home. We can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!"

trgt: They weren't busy so the server was on the money! I tried the pulled pork fajitas and my girlfriend try the chicken fajitas. The veggies and tortillas were awesome but everything else kind of lacked flavor. The server brought out plenty of chips with three different kinds of salsa. They were unique but none really popped for me. We ordered some fried ice cream, a necessity at a Mexican restaurant, and after about 15 minutes the waitress informed us that they didn't have it. The manager offered to buy us desserts for the inconvenience, which was pretty awesome if u ask me. I had the key lime pie and the kids had the kids Sunday. I will have to try this place again and see if something else on the menu has some Zing.
beginning: They weren't busy so the server was on the money!
mgt: They weren't busy so the server was on the money! Our drinks arrived promptly, and the food followed shortly after. The atmosphere was relaxed, making it a perfect spot for a casual dinner. I ordered the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection—flaky and flavorful. My partner had the pasta primavera, bursting with fresh vegetables. Overall, a delightful experience that I would highly recommend!

trgt: Disorganized. Ripoffs. Rude, airhead employees that don't clean and freely talk on there cell phones whilst you asking them a simple question. Id rather rub sand in my eyes. Disgusted.
beginning: Disorganized. Ripoffs. Rude, airhead employees that don't clean and freely
mgt: "Disorganized. Ripoffs. Rude, airhead employees that don't clean and freely ignore customer concerns. My experience was frustrating from start to finish. The service was slow, and it felt like no one cared about providing a decent experience. I left feeling cheated and disappointed, and I definitely won't be returning."

trgt: Came here on a Tues night at 6pm. Warning. If your coming after 6pm, make a reservation! We were a party of 5 and were lucky to get in. They did accommodate us, but told us we had to leave by 7.  This place got so crowded at 6pm!! Full house! Legit Japanese place. My folks had the ramen, and I had a chicken egg bowl plus a few skewers on the side. Traditional Japanese recipes coming from someone who is Japanese.My folks came with me. They ordered the ramen, but preferred Monta Ramen better.( see my review on them) \nService was a bit hectic, but the place was packed so I don't blame them. Foo
beginning: Came here on a Tues night at 6pm. Warning. If
mgt: Came here on a Tues night at 6pm. Warning. If you're looking for a quiet dinner, this might not be the place for you. The atmosphere was lively, with laughter and chatter filling the air. The service was prompt, and the staff was friendly, making us feel welcome right away. The food was delicious, with generous portions that left us satisfied. I highly recommend the grilled salmon; it was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. Overall, a great experience!

trgt:
I should have reviewed this place long ago but I was too busy eating there to take the time to sit down and write. 

We have been going here since they opened, first enticed in by a Groupon and then brought back by Chef Steve's wonderfully inspired dishes. This is a small plates restaurant so do not order one plate and expect to be full. The menu is divided into individual proteins and veggies. Read the descriptions carefully and then order enough to share. My husband and I typically order four or five plates and then hesitate over dessert. Chef Steve did a menu change recently so now we will be enjoying some new items and hope that you also try them out. Go with a group of people, its more fun

The Poke is one of my favorites, but make sure you mix it to get the seasoning all through it. One the new new additions is the Beef Carpaccio, Very flavorful. Also the shrimp dish, I believe its called Mini Mi's but its on a bun with slaw. The slaw is so good I would eat just that. They are so many dishes that it is truly had to remember. Checkout their ode to the Monte Cristo, it will make you weep. The owners work hard to provide good service and are always looking to improve. So.....if you want to eat and not be bothered go for lunch during the day. If you want busy with some music and noise check them out on a Friday night. They have a Facebook page that will tell you if there is something going on before you head out. Since I am all about the food, we go during the daytime. They also apparently have a happy hour but I don't know what that is about, I have just read the sign.

The decor is very basic, as is the plating and utensils. Because we have been coming here since the beginning, we have been able to see the changes they have made to the place over time. I can see where they have spent their money and am able to understand their choices. I would much rather have great food than great decor.
beginning: I should have reviewed this place long ago but I
mgt: "I should have reviewed this place long ago but I kept coming back, captivated by its charm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff are incredibly friendly, always ready to recommend their favorite dishes. Each visit feels like a warm reunion, and the food never disappoints. From the savory appetizers to the decadent desserts, every bite is a delight. The ambiance is cozy, making it perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. I can't wait to return!"

trgt:
I've been to The Vig a handful of times... for at least 4 lunches, a few times for just drinks / happy hour, and at least 2 dinners.  I think that is a fair amount of visits to justify the 4.5 star review rounded up to 5 stars that I am giving it now!

I've always had friendly and attentive service, and I've never had a problem with the food or drinks I've ordered.  Granted, I've probably just ordered beer, iced tea, or water, but still :)

I'm adding The Vig to my list of places to go for great sweet potato fries.  They also offer really yummy starters including the Vings (grilled wings), Grilled Veggie Platter, Hummus, and Ceviche.  At lunchtime, I recommend the Cobb salad although several friends of mine consistently order the Vig Azz Burger.  For dinner, I love their "Miso Hungry Salmon."  

As mentioned in other reviews, their outdoor dining area and bocce court are just what Phoenix needs more of on a beautiful day or evening!  So much fun!

If this beautiful weather continues, I'll be hanging out at The Vig again very soon!
beginning: I've been to The Vig a handful of times... for
mgt: "I've been to The Vig a handful of times, and each visit has been a delightful experience. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it a perfect spot for both casual gatherings and special occasions. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, from their mouthwatering burgers to fresh salads that burst with flavor. The staff is always attentive and friendly, ensuring that every meal is enjoyable. I highly recommend trying their signature cocktails, which perfectly complement the food. Overall, The Vig never disappoints!"

trgt: Seemingly popular with the 20-somethings with long lines in the evening, we stopped in BurGR for a late lunch and it seems GR is living on his celebrity, not his cooking or service.  It took 35 minutes to get two burgers and an order of sweet potato fries to the table - cold.  The burgers were absolutely nothing special - except very expensive.  The ground beef was fresh but had sat out long enough not to be even luke-warm. Fries were stone cold.  Something I love: $9 for an order of cold fries.  Service was stretched.  Absolutely nothing special about the burgers or BurGR.  Easier to walk a block down the street to get a hot Quarter-Pounder at McDonald's.  You won't get quite the amount of beef but it will be hot and less than an third the price.  You won't be paying for the fancy curved flame wall at the entrance.  While BurGR is less expensive than other casino eateries, it is still in the category of taking your money for little in return.  Try a Big Mac - you and your pocketbook will be happier.  Don't use the excuse \"it's Vegas, Baby.\"   Ramsay is there to take your money.  I think I'm older and more experienced at decent dining than many of the reviewers for this place.  Note the reviews that say they are fans of Ramsay - doesn't have a thing to do with the food actually served - and I assure you - Ramsay didn't cook these things.
beginning: Seemingly popular with the 20-somethings with long lines in the
mgt: "Seemingly popular with the 20-somethings with long lines in the evenings, this trendy café offers a vibrant atmosphere and a diverse menu. The baristas are friendly and knowledgeable, making recommendations that never disappoint. The coffee is expertly brewed, with a rich flavor that keeps patrons coming back for more. However, the seating can be limited during peak hours, so be prepared to wait for a spot. Overall, it’s a great place to unwind or catch up with friends."

trgt: While everything is fresh, I am still not impressed.  I prefer the true Mediterranean restaurants, like Spices.  This place is just another trendy spin on Mediterranean food.  Examples:  the tzatziki had chunks of cucumber (weird) and the Greek salad didn't have olives.  Won't be back.
beginning: While everything is fresh, I am still not impressed. I
mgt: "While everything is fresh, I am still not impressed. I expected more depth and creativity in the storyline. The characters felt one-dimensional, lacking the development needed to truly engage the audience. The pacing was uneven, making it difficult to stay invested. Overall, it missed the mark for me."

trgt:
I had put off trying this restaurant due to the mixed reviews and the doubtful possibility there was quality BBQ in Pittsburgh having been so badly disapointed repeatedly.  I ordered 1/4 pound pork, 1/4 pound ribs and greens.  1/4 pound ribs were 2 bones, very small but very meaty.  I will say that this is the most expensive BBQ I have ever had anywhere in the country without a doubt.  

The ribs and pork have a nice dry rub.  BBQ is never spicy and this isn't either, thankfully.  It doesn't come out sauced, another blessing.  The sauce on the table is nice and complements the rub.  It's a little fruity and tangy breaking up the richness of the pork.  Please watch the char.  Burnt isn't good food.  Seriously!  The pork was succulent, there was lots of fat melting in my mouth and making me wish there was more.  I got the end piece of the rib rack but it was still fairly moist.  I wish there was more but I was already at $15 so I wasn't going to order anything else for lunch.  The greens were spot on.  Very nicely done and the portion size (for the greens) was ok. 

The place isn't much to look at.  The service was friendly.  I don't know if it's ever going to be 5 stars for me but I will definitely be back to try it again.

I went back!  Took Miriam just a few days later and it was exactly the same.  A good sign.  This time, in addition, I tried the brussel sprouts and they were delicious.  Bring a friend or 3.  If you order more food, the price gets cheaper.  So a 1/2 pound is less than  2 portions of a 1/4 pound for example and you can save money if you share.  It's still expensive but you can do a bit better with some planning.
beginning: I had put off trying this restaurant due to the
mgt: "I had put off trying this restaurant due to the mixed reviews I had heard from friends. However, I finally decided to give it a chance, and I was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with friendly staff who made us feel welcome right away. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes, and everything we ordered was delicious. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was impressive. I can't wait to return and explore more of their offerings!"

trgt:
Very Trendy hotel!!!  

A friend was able to get me a free room for my birthday!   Thanks KJ!  :-)

The check in process was LONG-even in VIP, however I guess I shouldn't complain because it was free...

The room was cute and clean.   I enjoyed the views from the wraparound terrace.

Room service was GREAT!!!  

I asked the bartender at the vesper bar  to  Surprise me with a drink that was fruity yet would still give me a buzz, she hooked me up with a SAGE 75!!!   Let's just say I enjoyed it to the fullest!!!  

Shopping in the hotel  left something to be desired.   

I don't think I'll stay here again, however it was nice to experience it -  especially since it was free!  ;-)
beginning: Very Trendy hotel!!! \n\nA friend was able to get me
mgt:
"Very Trendy hotel!!! 

A friend was able to get me a last-minute reservation, and I was pleasantly surprised by the chic decor and vibrant atmosphere. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making check-in a breeze. My room was spacious, with modern furnishings and a stunning view of the city skyline. The rooftop bar was a highlight, offering delicious cocktails and a lively ambiance. I can't wait to return for another stay!"

trgt: I am a big fun of French food and patisserie, I used to go to that  place 3 times a week for breakfast or lunch, but everything change there during this last year, I order Marquez, and they serve it to me almost burned, u cannot taste any thing.  \nLast Sunday I was there they close at 4pm, I was there  at 3pm, and I want to order omelet, the server there she told me the kitchen is close, we can't cook anything, come on!!\nI had many bad experiences there, I will never go back, there are many other French bakery in vegas
beginning: I am a big fun of French food and patisserie,
mgt: "I am a big fan of French food and patisserie, and this restaurant truly exceeded my expectations. The ambiance was charming, with rustic decor that transported me straight to a quaint Parisian bistro. Each dish was a masterpiece, from the delicate coq au vin to the rich, velvety chocolate mousse. The attention to detail in both presentation and flavor was remarkable. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive, enhancing the overall experience. I can't wait to return and explore more of their exquisite menu!"

trgt: Cheap, cheap eats! Really great breakfast and service. The bloody mary was delish and for only $5, it packed a wallop for the small glass.
beginning: Cheap, cheap eats! Really great breakfast and service. The bloody
mgt: "Cheap, cheap eats! Really great breakfast and service. The bloody Mary was a perfect complement to my meal, packed with flavor and just the right amount of spice. The pancakes were fluffy and delicious, and the portion sizes were generous. I appreciated the friendly staff who made sure my coffee cup was never empty. Overall, a fantastic spot for a casual brunch!"

trgt: Republic Ramen looks and sounds like a promising restaurant; unfortunately, my first bite told me otherwise.  While the food is not inedible, it definitely does NOT resemble traditional Japanese ramen.  I ordered an original milk tea boba & a bowl of tonkotsu ramen with pork.  The pork is nothing like the pork that comes with authentic ramen.  Instead, it was pale, tough, and flavorless.  The noodles and soup are fine but way less flavorful than I am used to from a restaurant advertising themselves as a ramen restaurant and not just a plain noodle house.  And the boba I ordered was VERY flavorless and watered down.  However, on the bright side, the boba pearls were the perfect texture and level of chewiness!
beginning: Republic Ramen looks and sounds like a promising restaurant; unfortunately,
mgt: "Republic Ramen looks and sounds like a promising restaurant; unfortunately, the execution falls short of expectations. The broth, while flavorful, lacked the depth and richness that true ramen aficionados crave. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that detracted from the overall experience. Service was slow, and the ambiance, though trendy, felt a bit too noisy for a relaxing meal. With a few adjustments, this place could truly shine, but as it stands, it leaves much to be desired."

trgt: No special request is too special for John.  Even a soy allergy can be handled in this awesome sushi restaurant.  Don't eat shell fish, but still want sushi?  No problem.  John's is the best hands down.
beginning: No special request is too special for John. Even a
mgt: "No special request is too special for John. Even a last-minute change in plans was met with enthusiasm and professionalism. His attention to detail and willingness to go above and beyond truly sets him apart. Every interaction felt personalized, making the experience memorable. I highly recommend his services to anyone looking for exceptional quality and care."

trgt: Difficult to find.  Annoying bar setup with mostly garbage Bud/Miller/Coors products like Blue Moon, and they had the nerve to serve me a Guinness in a frosty glass.  Service was a bit slow.  Prices were reasonable though.  Old building on the outside but decent inside.
beginning: Difficult to find. Annoying bar setup with mostly garbage Bud/Miller/Coors
mgt: "Difficult to find. Annoying bar setup with mostly garbage Bud/Miller/Coors. The selection of craft beers was disappointingly limited, and the atmosphere felt stale. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested, which only added to the frustration. I expected more from a place that promotes itself as a craft beer destination. Overall, it was a letdown, and I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt: I guess we arrived right after their rush hour because there were no tables readily available when we arrived but about 60% full which can be understandable. But we were seated within 5 minutes, but the menus took another 5 minutes to come.\nI ordered the 4 course of salad, tandoori chicken, mixed vegetables, banana bread pudding, and a chai latte included in the end. Chicken was very tender and the salad a large order with even more salad placed on the same plate of the entree. Bread pudding very very good to finish. The gf had chicken marsala which was very sweet on its own but went very well with the garlic naan we ordered on the side. Main entrees were a bit on the smaller side.\nThe server was joking around a little, calling my chicken KFC when it came and saying the bread pudding came with ketchup and mustard. Funny guy.
beginning: I guess we arrived right after their rush hour because
mgt: "I guess we arrived right after their rush hour because the place was buzzing with energy. The staff, though busy, were incredibly attentive and managed to keep a smile on their faces. Our food came out promptly, and each dish was bursting with flavor. The ambiance was cozy, making it a perfect spot for a casual dinner. I can't wait to come back and try more from their menu!"

trgt: On our recent one day trip to las vegas we decided to have dinner at this place since we were residing far from the strip blvrd. The menu was very interesting and very confusing, So I let the other order. My favorite was pieces of salmon, and the one with the quail egg.\nIn general the service was really good, super friendly and very fast. Fish was very fresh.
beginning: On our recent one day trip to las vegas we
mgt: On our recent one-day trip to Las Vegas, we were captivated by the vibrant energy of the Strip. The dazzling lights and lively atmosphere set the perfect backdrop for our adventure. We started our day with a delicious brunch at a trendy café, where the mimosas flowed freely. Afterward, we explored the iconic casinos, each with its unique theme and charm. The highlight was definitely the Bellagio fountains, which left us in awe with their stunning choreography. As the sun set, we enjoyed a spectacular show, making our brief visit unforgettable.

trgt: Horrible food (except the garlic bread, that was actually pretty good!).  It's annoying that they only take cash, I feel like this is 1995 again.   It's also annoying you have to go to two sections to order your drinks, you can't order them with your meal.\n\nHOWEVER, it's cheap entertainment.   Have a little kid? Spend $25, take the family here, they will enjoy it.
beginning: Horrible food (except the garlic bread, that was actually pretty
mgt: good). The pasta was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the pizza was soggy and underwhelming. Service was slow and inattentive, making the experience even worse. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone looking for a decent meal.

trgt:
My husband and I finally checked out this place after hearing about it only a couple weeks ago.  The idea of a cute storefront restaurant on Main Street intrigued us.  We went on a weeknight and found the place surprisingly full - there were only five (of about 15-20) tables available when we arrived.  However, we were quickly seated and provided with our requested drinks.

We had pork bellies and kale chips for our appetizers.  The pork bellies were divine.  The kale chips were a bit lacking in flair.  It was basically dry kale with paprika sprinkled on top.  Not much else.

My husband got the Local Dish burger and declared it good.  The fries he got on the side were great.  I ordered their chicken & peaches sandwich with coleslaw on the side.  The coleslaw was fantastic and I could have eaten more than the serving they gave me.  The chicken sandwich was average - but I loved knowing I was probably eating peaches from just a few blocks away at the Peach Stand.  The chicken itself was a bit dry but was helped by the pesto, spinach and peaches that came on it.

Why did I not give it more than 3 stars?  Because a second visit will be required, with other foods tried, before I decide to bump it up to four stars.  The restaurant was charming enough (and prices decent enough) that we'll most likely go back again the future.
beginning: My husband and I finally checked out this place after
mgt: "My husband and I finally checked out this place after hearing so many great things from friends. We were not disappointed! The ambiance was warm and inviting, and the staff was incredibly friendly. We started with the appetizer platter, which was a delightful mix of flavors. For our main courses, I had the grilled salmon, while my husband opted for the steak. Both dishes were cooked to perfection. We ended our meal with a decadent chocolate dessert that was simply divine. We can't wait to return!"

trgt: My favorite thing about Stalzy's is that they stick to the basics but they do them really well. The menu may not sound super impressive in comparison to the prices but when you get your meal the quality is superb. These sandwiches are made with quality, local ingredients and with the above average drink selection they really provide the deli experience I expect. Dont let the simple titles fool you this top notch food is worth of your lunch(or breakfast) hour any day.\n\nMy sandwich of choice is the ham and swiss, simple, delectable, delicious :)
beginning: My favorite thing about Stalzy's is that they stick to
mgt: "My favorite thing about Stalzy's is that they stick to their roots while also embracing innovation. The menu features classic comfort foods, but with a unique twist that keeps things exciting. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a casual meal or a special occasion. The staff is always friendly and attentive, ensuring a delightful dining experience every time."

trgt:
My wife and I had dinner there last night. It was superb. 
Don!t know what people are talking about regarding  nachos and sangria.
This is totally good French food. The ambiance, the decor, the food presentation were all in keeping with what a high level restaurant should be. The restaurant was not very busy as it was relatively early evening
So the waiter did not rush the servings along enabling us to dine at
Our own pace. Our prize fixe meal was $47each plus wine, tax, and tip
The three course meal consisted of a lovely green salad, the entree was salmon for me that was cooked perfectly served with what appeared to be roasted barley mix and green beans. My wife has a veal chop that she liked but what I thought was a little too rare on the inside although
Well charred on the outside. Desert was a glorious crime de brûlée that was to die for. 
In summary we both thought it was a good dining experience and a good value for the price.
We would go back again and recommend to friends.
beginning: My wife and I had dinner there last night. It
mgt: "My wife and I had dinner there last night. It was an unforgettable experience. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu with great recommendations. We started with the calamari, which was perfectly crispy and seasoned. For the main course, I had the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection, while my wife enjoyed the pasta primavera, bursting with fresh vegetables. Each bite was a delight, and we left feeling satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: Went here on a Friday night around nine and was sat right away. I chose the Chilean sea bass and my dinner companions chose the bone in ribeye and the new your strip. After sampling everything I would have to say the ribeye was the best. We also tried their oyster Rockefeller and it was delicious!
beginning: Went here on a Friday night around nine and was
mgt: "immediately struck by the vibrant atmosphere. The music was lively, and the crowd was buzzing with energy. Our server was attentive and friendly, making excellent recommendations from the menu. I ordered the grilled salmon, which was perfectly cooked and paired beautifully with seasonal vegetables. The dessert selection was tempting, and I couldn't resist trying the chocolate lava cake—it was divine! Overall, a fantastic experience that I can't wait to repeat."

trgt: They are a nice alternative to Zimbrick in Madison is you have a foreign car.  However I would recommend Zimbrick as the mechanics at Zimbrick will tell you what items you can do yourself to save money.  Look out at Dunn's as they may try to add on additional services that you don't really need which will cost you more money.
beginning: They are a nice alternative to Zimbrick in Madison is
mgt: "They are a nice alternative to Zimbrick in Madison is their exceptional customer service and wide selection of vehicles. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, making the car-buying experience enjoyable. I appreciated their transparency throughout the process, and the financing options were competitive. Overall, I left feeling satisfied with my purchase and would recommend them to anyone in the market for a new or used car."

trgt: Up there with Crave for a classy bar with good, expensive martinis.  Nice, modern lighting, the atmosphere makes me feel fabulous.....who am I kidding, I am fabulous!  There's always a cute boy around to by me a drink, so the prices don't bother me too much.  Their \"one & done\" drinks knock my socks off.....heed the warning that the name gives....I'm serious.....brings me back to my jungle juice days at house parties.  5 stars!
beginning: Up there with Crave for a classy bar with good,
mgt: "Up there with Crave for a classy bar with good cocktails and a vibrant atmosphere. The mixologists are truly talented, crafting unique drinks that tantalize the taste buds. The ambiance is perfect for both intimate gatherings and lively nights out. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, making recommendations that enhance the overall experience. A must-visit for anyone looking to unwind in style!"

trgt: Negative baristas heaven forgive they mess up your order and u ask them to remake it. No asking if it was right the second time, still not right but they are so rude ur afraid to ask for them to actually try it again. Also soooo sloooooooowww come on people drink some coffee and get motivated... lets work on niceness and speed.
beginning: Negative baristas heaven forgive they mess up your order and
mgt: "Negative baristas heaven forgive they mess up your order and seem indifferent to your concerns. The atmosphere is chaotic, with loud chatter drowning out any chance of a pleasant experience. It’s frustrating to see such potential wasted on poor service. I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt:
This place was okay, I wasn't too impressed. The neighborhood is great, but I didn't feel like the coffee shop was anything special. There isn't a lot of table space, so it's hard to do work.

The drinks were good, though. Seemed to be mostly fair priced. 

Like I said, it was good, but nothing special. I may or may not come back.
beginning: This place was okay, I wasn't too impressed. The neighborhood
mgt: "This place was okay, I wasn't too impressed. The neighborhood felt a bit rundown, and the ambiance lacked charm. The service was decent, but the food didn't stand out. I expected more flavor and creativity in the dishes. Overall, it was a forgettable experience, and I probably won't return."

trgt: Awesome! We're from la and this was a treat! Chicken del sol was awesome!  Go here there's something healthy and delecious for everyone!
beginning: Awesome! We're from la and this was a treat! Chicken
mgt: Awesome! We're from LA and this was a treat! Chicken was perfectly cooked, juicy, and bursting with flavor. The spices were just right, giving it a delightful kick without being overwhelming. The sides complemented the meal beautifully, especially the creamy coleslaw. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it a great spot to enjoy a meal with friends. We can't wait to come back and try more dishes! Highly recommend!

trgt: First time at Extreme Pita.  It is a little different than Pita Pit. I had the small smoked turkey and my husband had the buffalo chick.  Was not impressed with the food nor the staff. Not sure we will go back.
beginning: First time at Extreme Pita. It is a little different
mgt: First time at Extreme Pita. It is a little different from your typical fast-casual dining experience. The menu offers a variety of fresh, customizable pitas filled with an array of ingredients, from grilled meats to vibrant veggies. I was impressed by the quality of the ingredients and the friendly service. The atmosphere was casual and inviting, making it a great spot for a quick meal. I tried the chicken pita, and it was bursting with flavor. Overall, I left satisfied and eager to return to explore more options!

trgt: I love both locations equally. Such a delicious cafe caramel. I also really love their tea selections. The baristas are always friendly, and there's always a place to sit. What more can you ask for? :)
beginning: I love both locations equally. Such a delicious cafe caramel.
mgt: I love both locations equally. Such a delicious cafe caramel. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot to relax. The staff is always friendly and attentive, ensuring a great experience every time. I highly recommend trying their pastries; they pair perfectly with the coffee. Overall, a delightful place to unwind and enjoy quality treats!

trgt: Went here with my roommate last week for a late breakfast and was pleasantly surprised! I got the Eggs Benedict and a chocolate croissant while my roommate went for the French toast with fresh fruit. Everything was very tasty, although my roommate could have easily handled a larger portion. \nAll the employees were super sweet and the French owner's eclectic playlist really added to how much I enjoyed the experience. Will have to go again for lunch or dinner!
beginning: Went here with my roommate last week for a late
mgt: Went here with my roommate last week for a late-night snack, and we were pleasantly surprised by the cozy atmosphere. The menu offered a great variety of options, and we decided to share a few dishes. The nachos were loaded with toppings and had just the right amount of spice. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our experience even better. We’ll definitely be returning to try more items!

trgt:
I recently brough my car up to Edinburgh from home, where it had sat on the drive pretty much since I had left home to go to university.

As I'm sure you can imagine, it was pretty filthy, so I pulled up here expecting to shell out £5 or so for a crappy was that wouldnt really be that great.

Needless to say, when I realised that the cheapest was was £2, i was suprised and I was even more suprised when the car came out looking like a million dollars.

Very impressive for £2, but thier prices can go up to around £6 - which I'm sure must involve so many polishes and waxes and cleans that dirt must be simply repelled from the body of your car, never getting dirty again.
beginning: I recently brough my car up to Edinburgh from home,
mgt: "I recently brought my car up to Edinburgh from home, and I must say, the experience was both exhilarating and challenging. The scenic routes were breathtaking, but navigating the city’s narrow streets proved to be a bit daunting. Parking was a hassle, but the vibrant atmosphere and rich history made it all worthwhile. I discovered charming cafes and stunning architecture at every turn, which made the trip memorable. Overall, Edinburgh is a fantastic destination for any road trip enthusiast!"

trgt:
Always enjoy our visits to RA. Our party of six arrived early afternoon. The restaurant was fairly slow,  we were seated quickly and greeted very friendly by Tiffany. 

We ordered edamame, steamed and RA chips and salsa (tuna tartar with salsa and avocado served with wonton chips). 

We were unsure of what to drink and Tiffany recommended White Sake Sangria. What a great recommendation!

Our group shared udon noodles, Las Vegas roll, crispy tuna roll and two California rolls for the kids. 

We really enjoy the atmosphere and grooving music to dance to with the kids!  Each meal is really fun because we mix it up and don't go in with any preconceived notions and our kids love it.
beginning: Always enjoy our visits to RA. Our party of six
mgt: "Always enjoy our visits to RA. Our party of six had a fantastic time, indulging in a variety of sushi and other Japanese dishes. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the staff were attentive and friendly. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. We especially loved the spicy tuna rolls and the miso soup. Can't wait to return for another delightful meal!"

trgt: I WILL NEVER USE VEGAS.COM OR STAY AT CAESARS\nWe were booked to stay here 7/3 for 2 nights & left after the 1st. The bathroom fixtures were rusted, the bottom of the door was broken & coming apart, urine had ate away at the marble around the toilet the grout around the tub was dirty & moldy. The other doors were 1.5 inches from reaching the floor, we could see out into the hall & into the adjoining room. the air conditioner was very clanking. They sent someone to fix it which was no help. They switched our room to an nicer room that had 1/2 the crystals stolen off the wall sconce chandelier. The blanket had a big hole in it & the lighting was too dim to apply my make-up. We asked where the buffet was & they said it had been closed for month & vegas.com should have told us & they didn't. They suggested we go to Flamingo's buffet which was closed for 4 hours due to a water problem. We then walked to Paris who's buffet was open but were out of food. No meat, no fresh cooked veggies. The salad bar was old wilted lettuce with no tomatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes or other fresh veggies. At least the Phantom of the Opera at the Venetian was outstanding. I will never stay at Caesars and never book from Vegas.com & will tell everyone i know to avoid both of these when booking a Vegas get away
beginning: I WILL NEVER USE VEGAS.COM OR STAY AT CAESARS\nWe were
mgt:
I WILL NEVER USE VEGAS.COM OR STAY AT CAESARS  
We were promised a luxurious experience, but instead, we encountered numerous issues. The check-in process was chaotic, with long lines and unhelpful staff. Our room was not ready on time, and when we finally got in, it was dirty and poorly maintained. The amenities were lacking, and customer service was unresponsive. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that did not meet our expectations. I would recommend looking elsewhere for a better stay in Las Vegas.

trgt: I would have paid ten dollars more per entree if it would have been a little bit better. The duck was excellent but my husband's lamb was kind of disappointing.  The server got a little snooty when we ordered water instead of drinks.  Don't get me wrong-- the duck reallywas tastey, but it looked like the best meal there.
beginning: I would have paid ten dollars more per entree if
mgt: "I would have paid ten dollars more per entree if the flavors had been as vibrant as the presentation. The dishes looked stunning, but they fell short in taste. The seafood was overcooked, and the seasoning was lacking, leaving me disappointed. I expected a culinary experience that matched the ambiance, but it just didn’t deliver."

trgt:
This event was broken into two parts. The first was a walking tour of Bloomfield courtesy of Burgh Bits & Bites and the second was a beer tasting at Church Brew Works courtesy of Jake of PA Brew Tours.

Richard and Sylvia from Burgh, Bits and Bites Tours were absolutely great! I never knew Bloomfield was so interesting and had so much history and I've lived in the Pittsburgh area my whole life. LOL! The walking tour consisted of the following stops, Angelo's Pizzeria, Groceria Italia, Merante's Gifts and Donateli's. While on the tour we learned about the different architecture of the area including dental crown molding and the beautiful St. Joseph's Church.

The first stop, Angelo's Pizzeria served us some delicious cheese pizza. (I will be back soon!) 

The second stop, Groceria Italia a cute little Italian grocery store that has been in the neighborhood for decades was my favorite stop. The fact that they make all of their pasta, sausages and meats by hand is a plus during a time when most things are made by machines. While there we got to meet "Momma" and sample some homemade meatballs and pasta, outstanding!
 
The third stop, Merante's Gifts is a cozy little store that sells Italian among other home decor items. It's the perfect store to find trinkets for your Nana. Maria, the owner who also does cooking classes in the apartment upstairs served us some tasty iced coffee in the kitchen where she does her classes. We also each got a amazing dessert while back in the gift shop.

The fourth and final stop of the walking tour was Donateli's, a Italian grocery store similar to Groceria Italia. The main difference between the two is that Donateli's pasta is not homemade and is supplied from another company. While there we got to try a orange and chocolate biscotti and see the "back of house" machines.

The Brewery portion was nice also. We got to sample three different beers. I don't drink beer so I can't really say they were all that good. Jake really knows the history of beer in Pittsburgh. The only bad thing that happened was the shuttle bus that dropped us off at Church Brew Works left us stranded and we had to wait for him to come back. Not Jake's fault.

Thanks Rachel for another great event.
beginning: This event was broken into two parts. The first was
mgt: "This event was broken into two parts. The first was an engaging panel discussion featuring industry experts who shared valuable insights. The second part included interactive workshops that allowed participants to apply what they learned. Overall, the event was well-organized and provided ample networking opportunities, making it a worthwhile experience for everyone involved."

trgt:
Sometimes there really needs to be a "no star" option. Or maybe a "it was so bad they owe me some damn stars" choice. But there isn't so I'll go with a one-star review and I'll add a caveat of "how shitty do you want to be treated?"

It's time for Jim to get a new company car. We're excited about this because we tire of driving around in a gas-hog. And Jim is particularly optimistic about a new car because they put a jeep on the list. Now granted, it's not the rubicon of his dreams but it is a "better mileage" jeep and that's a start.

So we went over to Superstition Springs Jeep because they had a number of the specific model on the lot. He wanted to test drive all the choices and decide which car to order.

When we arrived we were greeted by four salesmen. Jim told them why we were there. As soon as they realized his was to be a fleet purchase they blew us off. They pointed at a group of cars and went under a tree to smoke. We did take a look, not really believing that they actually blew us off like that, but of course all but a couple base models were locked up tight.

We went inside, still hoping to pull this time-waster out of the craper, and Jim went over to the sales manager. He explained what we wanted and what we'd experienced so far. He made clear that being blown off was unacceptable. The manager mumbled something mildly apologetic and walked off. Jim went in search of a fleet person. 

When the manager came back he asked me for the name of my husband's company. I told him and he responded that fleet orders go directly to the factory. The implication was that we couldn't expect anyone to help us because there was nothing in it for them.

I told the manager that I considered it a mistake because you never know who you're dealing with. I told him that I might be in the market for a new car in six or eight months (which is true if certain events come to pass) and that I certainly wouldn't buy it anyplace that I was treated so rudely.

The manager looked at me and told me that if that's the way I felt I should go find another dealership to test drive a jeep.

Let me repeat that, just in case you missed it. We were treated rudely and when we objected we were told to leave. 

I think the manager was hoping to intimidate me. At least it seemed that way from the way he towered over me, hands on hips, scowling. But I looked at him, smiled and told him he was absolutely right. I called to Jim, told him what the manager said, and we left.

I have to say I am impressed by a company whose commission-only business philosophy involves alienating your customer. Especially since Jim's good sized fleet has to be serviced somewhere and the service department generates a huge amount of the dealership income.

Suffice it to say we were treated much better elsewhere. We won't be back.
beginning: Sometimes there really needs to be a \"no star\" option.
mgt: Sometimes there really needs to be a "no star" option. This experience was utterly disappointing from start to finish. The service was slow, the staff seemed disinterested, and the food was bland and poorly presented. I left feeling more frustrated than satisfied, and I definitely won't be returning.

trgt: If they had Electric Six's \"Gay Bar\" I would be tempted to play it every time I came. All wise cracks aside and the frequent mentions that this is a gay bar. The Garage is a place that transcends the need to be labeled and is just fun for everyone. No matter if you are GLBT or straight. When the urge to go hang out at a cool bar with cheap drinks, clean facilities, an abundance of games, friendly bartenders, and sports playing on all the TV, this will always be the first choice. You would think it would be difficult to get a bunch of straight guys into this place, but there is never a need to convince them, because it is not a place where people go trolling. \n\nMonday nights are board shorts night offering $1 well drinks and domestic drafts from 9 to midnight. I guess having the cheapest happy hour in town is not enough.
beginning: If they had Electric Six's \"Gay Bar\" I would be
mgt: "If they had Electric Six's 'Gay Bar,' I would be dancing like nobody's watching. The energy in that song is infectious, and it always gets the crowd moving. The upbeat tempo and catchy lyrics create an atmosphere of pure fun. It's the perfect anthem for a night out, and I can't help but sing along every time it plays. The vibe it brings is unmatched, making any gathering feel like a celebration."

trgt: Las Fuentes has the best Mexican food in Surprise! Very nice staff as well. We eat here at least once a month and we are never disappointed. Portions are huge! The prices are so reasonable and the food is delicious! My favorites are their shrimp Caesar salad, shrimp al mojo de ajo, any burrito and we always enjoy their buffet as well.
beginning: Las Fuentes has the best Mexican food in Surprise! Very
mgt: Las Fuentes has the best Mexican food in Surprise! Very authentic flavors and generous portions make every visit a delight. The tacos are bursting with fresh ingredients, and the enchiladas are smothered in a rich, flavorful sauce. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience. Don't forget to try their homemade salsa and guacamole; they are simply irresistible!

trgt:
Pros: 
-open 24hrs
-organized waiting list
-clean for a pho place
-quick, but crap service(typical of viet places)
-the pho helped my hangover


Cons:
-crap service
-meh pho
-8 bucks for pho
-smaller portions than other pho joints I've been to

Overall, it's a pretty mediocre place. If you're in Vegas and have a pho craving, it will do. But just don't expect it to do that much.
beginning:
Pros: 
-open 24hrs
-organized waiting list
-clean for a pho place
-quick, but
mgt:
"Pros: 
-open 24hrs
-organized waiting list
-clean for a pho place
-quick, but the service can be a bit rushed at times. The staff is friendly, and the food is consistently delicious. The broth is rich and flavorful, and the portion sizes are generous. Definitely a great spot for late-night cravings!"

trgt: Standing room on the side balconies was waaaaaay over packed. We paid big bucks to see Muse and could barely see them at times. They really over sold this show.
beginning: Standing room on the side balconies was waaaaaay over packed.
mgt: "Standing room on the side balconies was waaaaaay over packed. It made it difficult to enjoy the performance fully. The view was obstructed, and the crowd's chatter was distracting. I expected a more comfortable experience, especially given the ticket prices. The acoustics were decent, but the overall atmosphere felt chaotic. I would recommend arriving early to secure a better spot next time."

trgt: Deeelicious!  The first time my wife and I went here, we were amazed at how NOT busy it was.  Every restaurant in the Phoenix area seems to be constantly busy - every day - but not this one!  Each time we have been here, we have either been the only people in the place or one of only 2 occupied tables!  Weird!  We asked our server about this and were told they do a lot of take-out business.  We have noticed this to be true on our visits.  Ok - on to the food.  We have had pizza, pasta, entrees, and sandwiches.  All of it was good (with the exception of one weird chicken parm), but the best thing is definitely the pizza!  We love their pizza, especially the Amante Special!  It is very very good!  The crust is tender and sturdy without taking over the whole pie.  The sauce is tasty but not overbearing.  There are always plenty of toppings on each slice.  The sandwiches come in a close second, with our favorite being the canadian bacon one - yum!  My wife says they have the BEST caesar salad she has ever had - sometimes she has to get 2 to satisfy her craving!  I would agree that the salads are good - I generally get the side house salad with ranch dressing.  It is always fresh and crisp with lots of veggies.  All-in-all we will definitely continue to eat at this restaurant!
beginning: Deeelicious! The first time my wife and I went here,
mgt: "Deeelicious! The first time my wife and I went here, we were blown away by the vibrant flavors and cozy atmosphere. Each dish was a delightful surprise, bursting with freshness and creativity. The staff was incredibly friendly, making us feel right at home. We can't wait to return and try more of the menu!"

trgt:
Big chains are important to submit reviews for.
Even though the biz would have you believe that it  means you'll get consistent product and service across their multitudinous locations, has this ever been the case?  Even Taco DingDong taco meat is spicier in Phoenix than it is in Detroit.

This Old Timer's Boofay is run sublimely compared to the metrocenter location. The service level and the quality of the food coming out of the kitchen is drastically in a different league.  

Food is still pretty generic - lot's of starches and cheeses and such to fill you up.  
There seems to be a bit more pride of execution here.  Yeah, I know, it's a chain buffet, practically a cafeteria.  No matter.  What many folks don't realize is the amount of food dishes in a place like this that are prepared in a traditional, homestyle way.  Things like homemade salad dressings, madaroni and cheese casseroles, etc. 
They do it to save money.  Reult is fresh, homestyle food for you. So they made it in a batch to serve 30 families, so what. 

Breakfast is the real deal here, and around $6 if you skip the overpriced drink. Huge selection of all the favorites, and they're busy enough that it stays fresh.

I can't wait to be old enough to get my seniour discount here.

Inside of this svelt, healthy body is trapped the wrinkly, grumpy soul of a 68 year old man.  

You kids get the hell off my lawn.
beginning: Big chains are important to submit reviews for.\nEven though the
mgt: Big chains are important to submit reviews for. Even though the experience can often feel impersonal, they play a significant role in shaping consumer expectations. Their consistency in service and product quality can be a double-edged sword; while you know what to expect, it can also lead to a lack of excitement. However, when they get it right, the convenience and reliability are hard to beat. It's essential to share both positive and negative experiences to help others make informed choices.

trgt: Great, fresh food and excellent service. They never disappoint. A perfect place to be a \"regular\". They always remember what we like to eat and serve with a smile.
beginning: Great, fresh food and excellent service. They never disappoint. A
mgt: "Great, fresh food and excellent service. They never disappoint. A delightful atmosphere complements the dining experience, making it perfect for any occasion. The menu offers a variety of options, ensuring there's something for everyone. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcase local ingredients. The staff is always attentive and friendly, adding to the overall enjoyment. Highly recommend this place for a memorable meal!"

trgt:
Watch out!  This place has undergone a SERIOUS change.  

I decided to have a nice steak dinner.  I wanted something slightly upscale but local.  Of course I jumped on Yelp and went searching.  A friend had mentioned Onyx before so I looked it up.   Good reviews... and a special coupon to purchase.  $30 off for $15 seemed like a great deal so I bought it right here on Yelp and off I went to Onyx.

When we arrived, the place seemed TOO quiet.  We parked right up front, across form the door, and in the shade.  We walked and turned away from the bar into the upscale Onyx.  YIKES!  Gone are the tablecloths, waiters, and customers.  We are greeted by the bartender who cautions us that they have a new menu.  I ask, is this still Onyx?  He replies that it is but cautions me that the menu is much smaller and I might have trouble spending the $30 on my coupon.  Uh oh.  I thought about leaving, but I am already $15 invested into this meal.  

No more steaks or even entrees.  The menu consists of appetizers, pizza's, and sandwiches.  We order the crispy taco appetizer and onion soup to start.  The tacos were good... they should be as it took them 20 minutes to make.  The onion soup never came at all.  Then onto the main course.  We both order pizza's.  After a good 30 minutes....  THIRTY MINUTES....   the food arrives.  A word of warning...  if you order pizza here you better like parmigiana.  The pizza was LOADED with it.  It was really 90% of the taste.  The crust and sauce were OK... but they were overpowered.  Even if you love parmigiana, you are likely to be disappointed in the pizza.  They couldn't sell this in NY for a nickel.  

Overall the food was disappointing and the atmosphere depressing.  No more live music.  No more tablecloths.  No more restaurant... really.  I guess they couldn't make it as a real restaurant and now are some sort of  cheap poker bar menu... but without the poker bar (unless you go to the other room... bogeys).  Honestly, I don't know why the owner just doesn't make one big poker bar.  The Onyx is dead folks.  Move along...  nothing to see here.
beginning: Watch out! This place has undergone a SERIOUS change. \n\nI
mgt:
"Watch out! This place has undergone a SERIOUS change. 

I visited recently and was blown away by the new decor and menu. The ambiance is now vibrant and inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual outings and special occasions. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. The food was exceptional, with fresh ingredients and bold flavors that left us wanting more. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!"

trgt:
Just tried this place out yesterday as I've been looking for a good Chinese buffet in the area. I just moved here a few months ago and wanted to compare it to places back home. I'm giving a solid 3 stars.

This is probably the largest Chinese buffet I've been to. You pay upfront, so our lunch for 2 cost just over $22 with drinks, not including tip. Did not have to wait to be seated since they were on the ball about that. We were served our drinks right away and headed to the food. Our waitress was friendly. She came to our table about 3 times during our meal (for each refill we had on our drinks). 


My favorite selection was definitely the jalapeno chicken. It was way spicier than I had assumed it would be, so it was a pleasant surprise. I loved it. It definitely blew the other chicken out of the water. Most of the others I tried were somewhat bland. Not much flavor at all really. I've had better general tso's at most other places. The sesame chicken tasted just like the general tso's. Not much flavor. The kung pao chicken probably had even less flavor than the general tso's chicken.

I'm not a fan of sushi so I can't comment on Lin's sushi without saying I didn't like it. I don't like seafood in general. Though, the salmon they served was actually something I enjoyed. 

The beef from beef and broccoli was okay. It was a little TOO tender, but some may enjoy it falling apart right away. I just like chewing my food instead of being able to just mush it down and swallow it. But not many complaints there.. The only other complaint I really have about the food was some of it was room temperature or cooler. But some was also very warm as they had just brought some out right before I grabbed it. 

They have various fruits set out in the dessert section, but the melon wasn't completely ripe so it was a little hard still. Also, it wasn't very cold. I like cold watermelon, and it was warmer than room temperature so I was a little disappointed. The pudding was cold and the ice cream was fine. 

I rate it 3 stars simply for the jalapeno chicken and friendly wait staff. Being seated quickly and the waitress keeping up on our refills. Other than that, it was pretty mediocre. I've been to way better Chinese buffets back home in Illinois, so it's nothing too special for my taste buds.
beginning: Just tried this place out yesterday as I've been looking
mgt: "Just tried this place out yesterday as I've been looking for a new spot to enjoy some good coffee. I was pleasantly surprised by the cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. The cappuccino I ordered was rich and perfectly balanced, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. I’ll definitely be coming back to explore more of their menu!"

trgt: Used to be my hobby store of choice.  I bought several RC cars and parts from them.  I have also referred people there to buy drones and RC cars.  I now cannot recommend Hobby Action.  Must be under a lot of pressure these days.  Customer service is now nonexistent and if you are a novice forget about it..  Yes, they have a lot of parts but their customer service is horrible.  Spoke to the owner about it today and his favorite word is policy and he was raising his voice at me.  Not customer friendly..  I walked out and will never be back.  Several other stores understand how to treat a loyal customer.
beginning: Used to be my hobby store of choice. I bought
mgt: "Used to be my hobby store of choice. I bought countless model kits and supplies here over the years. The staff was always friendly and knowledgeable, ready to help with any questions I had. However, I've noticed a decline in their inventory lately, and some of my favorite brands are no longer available. It’s disappointing to see such a beloved store struggle. I hope they can revitalize their selection and return to their former glory."

trgt: I have been enjoying the massages with hot rocks and great service for over a year now and yes, I'm a fan. My last visit I tried a gel manicure and now I'm a convert. The manicure I received 9 days ago, still looks pristine, shiny. The application process is more involved and takes a little longer that the standard manicure but for only 10 dollars more - it is so worth it.
beginning: I have been enjoying the massages with hot rocks and
mgt: "I have been enjoying the massages with hot rocks and the soothing ambiance of the spa. The therapists are incredibly skilled, ensuring that each session targets my specific tension areas. The warmth of the stones melts away stress, leaving me feeling rejuvenated and relaxed. I highly recommend this experience to anyone looking to unwind and recharge."

trgt: Went there two times...totally disappointed. Super over price, food sucks especially the sushi, not many choices...totally dun worth $35 per person! Dun go here... go wicked spoon at cosmopolitan. Brunch only $22. Nice place, good food, many choices.
beginning: Went there two times...totally disappointed. Super over price, food sucks
mgt: "Went there two times...totally disappointed. Super overpriced, food sucks. The portions were small, and the flavors were bland. Service was slow, and the staff seemed uninterested in helping. I expected much more for the price. I won’t be returning."

trgt: I don't review places often, but felt in this situation this place needed to be placed back in reality. Yes, they do display fun designs on instagram and overall seem to have a pretty good review, I am just going off of my experience. I had a scheduled trip home for the holidays and decided to give this place a shot. For one it was not relaxing and the two woman working near me were talking amongst themselves about the other female customer (of course not in english). Pedicure did not even come close to what you would get at any other salon. I still had dry skin and it wasn't a relaxing, massage experience I was expecting. The thing that caused me to write the review was when I left and two hours later both big toes completely smudged due to gooey, thick polish. I called the salon- they said they do not guarantee polishes, just 7 days for gel. I said that was fine, most places don't, but they would normally fix a mistake especially within the first few hours. They told me to call back early tomorrow to talk to a manager. I did, manager wasn't there and was going to call me back that afternoon. Nothing. Called the next day same thing. Basically, I never heard from them again and then to make it even better my gel manicure chipped in two places within the 4th-6th day. A regular pedicure and gel manicure cost me $93 plus $10 tip with Winnie. Not my style. Will never go back. Horrible management. Good luck!
beginning: I don't review places often, but felt in this situation
mgt: I don't review places often, but felt in this situation it was necessary to share my experience. The ambiance was inviting, with warm lighting and comfortable seating. The staff was incredibly attentive, making sure we had everything we needed without being intrusive. The food was exceptional, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. I highly recommend the grilled salmon; it was cooked to perfection. Overall, a delightful evening that exceeded my expectations!

trgt: Well, the extra star is really for the fact that I love our front-loader washer and dryer and that they were on sale. Didn't go to our regular Lowe's (Ray Rd) as they didn't have the models in stock. Absolutely disgusted and appalled at their customer service or lack thereof when it came to the delivery and installation. We were told they would call us Saturday morning to confirm our delivery slot. To err on the side of caution, we even called to confirm Friday night. Three phone calls later on Saturday morning, we come to find out that our order isn't even ON THE TRUCK! Seriously?! To add insult to injury, the \"manager\"  (I use this term loosely),had the audacity to ask if he could deliver it tomorrow! Absolutely unreal. So it's now noon, we still don't have our new appliances nor any idea of when they will be delivered. What an absolute joke and waste of a perfectly good Saturday. Thanks Lowe's, just how I wanted to spend my weekend, waiting for you jokers to get your crap together. Thumbs down!!!! Do not recommend the Chandler Road to anyone! We have always been very loyal to Lowe's and this seriously makes me think about switching our alliances to home depot!
beginning: Well, the extra star is really for the fact that
mgt: "Well, the extra star is really for the fact that the service was exceptional. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our experience was memorable. From the moment we walked in, they greeted us warmly and were attentive without being intrusive. The ambiance was inviting, and the food was delicious, making it a delightful evening overall."

trgt: Awesome place for a day drinking adventure or just a good, fun night!! Walking in, this can be extremely deceiving. It's dark wood and somewhat old school. But it has a pool table and some fun games with a small bar in the corner. Where the real fun comes is when you step out back. They have ping pong and corn hole as well as fire pits patio seating and a bar out back. Tons of TVs an they keep this back area pretty heated in the colder months  \n\nOverall this is a really cool bar. Locals are often found here as it is situation just outside of downtown. The area has tons of restaurants but Thomas street offers a full menu as well.  a must go if you live in Charlotte.
beginning: Awesome place for a day drinking adventure or just a
mgt: "Awesome place for a day drinking adventure or just a relaxing afternoon with friends. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, with a fantastic selection of craft beers and cocktails. The outdoor seating is perfect for soaking up the sun, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Don't miss their delicious appetizers, which pair perfectly with your drinks. Overall, a great spot to unwind and enjoy good company!"

trgt: Nice layout of the casino. Lots of slot machines that aren't in other casinos. Like Yahtzee. The bathrooms are clean as well. Lots of delicious eaterys. The convention rooms are expansive and the halls have comfortable seating thru out.
beginning: Nice layout of the casino. Lots of slot machines that
mgt: Nice layout of the casino. Lots of slot machines that cater to all preferences, from classic to modern themes. The atmosphere is vibrant, with friendly staff always ready to assist. I particularly enjoyed the variety of table games available, which kept the excitement going. Overall, a great place to unwind and try your luck!

trgt: \"One Of My Least Favorite\"\nI generally aim for the more upscale casino's to not only gamble at but to also stay inside the hotel as well. I find these type of low budget casinos to be a bit past outdated and I guess for anybody who is on a budget that likes ancient egyptian theme's should opt for the Luxor!
beginning: \"One Of My Least Favorite\"\nI generally aim for the more
mgt:
"One Of My Least Favorite"  
I generally aim for the more adventurous flavors when it comes to food, but this dish fell flat. The seasoning was bland, and the texture was unappealing. I expected a burst of flavor, but instead, it was a disappointing experience. The presentation was nice, but that couldn't make up for the lack of taste. Overall, I wouldn't recommend it.

trgt: Every time I purchase a groupon from Danny's Car Wash there seems to be a technical glitch.  This time I came in with one of the receipts/vouchers generated by Danny's when I turned in my groupon certificate.  They said the car wash had already been used.  Really?  How could i have used it multiple times if you generate the ticket from your register?  To top it off, I always have to go back through and have them vaccuum the car a second time and touch up spots they miss when wiping down the interior of the car. I'm not talking about hidden spots!  I'm talking about lifting the floor mats and getting ALL of the dirt under them.  Or really cleaning the interior coffee mug holders that have obvious coffee cup stains.  I am on the hunt for a new car wash in North Scottsdale.
beginning: Every time I purchase a groupon from Danny's Car Wash
mgt: "Every time I purchase a Groupon from Danny's Car Wash, I am consistently impressed by the quality of service. The staff is friendly and efficient, ensuring my car looks spotless every time. The facility is clean and well-maintained, making the experience enjoyable. I appreciate the variety of services offered, from basic washes to detailed interior cleaning. Overall, I highly recommend Danny's Car Wash for anyone looking to keep their vehicle in top shape!"

trgt: We stopped for a late night dinner at the Great Dane Brew Pub on our way to Chicago. It had a nice atmosphere; I could definitely see us spending a lot of time here if we lived in the area. I am not a beer drinker but I did love their root beer. My husband *loves* beer and really enjoyed all of the ones that he tried.  My pot pie was delicious and my husband's burger was really good. If we ever find ourselves in the area again we would go back for sure.
beginning: We stopped for a late night dinner at the Great
mgt: "We stopped for a late night dinner at the Great American Diner, and it was a delightful experience. The atmosphere was cozy, with friendly staff who made us feel welcome right away. We ordered the classic cheeseburger and a side of fries, both of which were cooked to perfection. The flavors were rich and satisfying, making it the perfect late-night indulgence. We also tried their famous milkshake, which was thick and creamy, a perfect way to end our meal. Overall, I highly recommend this diner for anyone looking for comfort food in a relaxed setting."

trgt: Fresh ingredients, good service, wonderful favors. Simple concept that works. Wife had phenomenal turkey sandwich' I had great French toast friends had roast beef sandwich and an appetizer cheese plate with something else that I missed.  If you are a person that likes a huge stack of pancakes, with four eggs and bunch of bacon as a minimum for breakfast this is wrong for you.  The portions are modest but filling for me.  This is about the taste not the poundage.\nWe went for brunch and my screwdriver had fresh squeezed OJ    The Bloody Mary's  Were great   Oh and split an order of fries.  Not a lot of tables but lots of space at bar.  And it is expensive.  But there are other expensive breakfast spots in the area that have disappointed me.  This one doesn't disappoint.  Best thing about our brunch was no adults brought their awful  obnoxious horrible children  So nice to have quiet adults.  I have children in their 20s. I never took them anywhere before they could behave.  I can't wait for my grandchildren to b  here. But they will be polite before they go to a restaurant.  This has nothing to do with cafe bink.  Everything to do with civility   Your child or grandchild is hideous.  Leave them at home when they visit from Minnesota   They suck. Seriously. Everyone hated them on the flight also.  And your wife /daughter whatever is fat and making excuses for not parenting
beginning: Fresh ingredients, good service, wonderful favors. Simple concept that works.
mgt: "Fresh ingredients, good service, wonderful flavors. Simple concept that works. The menu offers a delightful variety, ensuring there's something for everyone. Each dish is thoughtfully prepared, showcasing the quality of the ingredients. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall dining experience. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which highlight local produce. A must-visit for anyone seeking a satisfying meal!"

trgt: 0 STARS. This dairy queen is horrible. The employees do not know how to do their job. Completely disorganized and not clean. It took three employees to ring my order up. Corporate needs to review this shit hole of a store.
beginning: 0 STARS. This dairy queen is horrible. The employees do
mgt: 0 STARS. This Dairy Queen is horrible. The employees do not seem to care about customer service at all. My order was wrong, and when I tried to get it fixed, they were rude and dismissive. The place was dirty, and it took forever to get my food. I will never return to this location again.

trgt:
Walked in at 3:30PM on Friday to see if they could fix a failed network component external power supply that appeared to have bad capacitors.

After the gentleman at the ERC front desk popped the cover open and looked at what they were dealing with I was quoted a reasonable price for them to try to fix it and asked if I wanted to leave it with them or wait. I decided to wait.

ERC fixed the power supply by replacing capacitors and had me back out the door in about 25 minutes on a Friday. I was able to get back to my office in time to install the repaired power supply on the network device without any interruption to the start of my weekend.

I will definitely be giving ERC my business for these types of repairs in the future. If they can fix it it's cheaper, faster and easier than used/refurb parts from eBay or unknown internet vendors and hoping the item is as described.
beginning: Walked in at 3:30PM on Friday to see if they
mgt: Walked in at 3:30PM on Friday to see if they had any tables available. The atmosphere was lively, with a warm and inviting decor. The staff greeted us promptly and were incredibly friendly. We were seated quickly, and the menu offered a delightful variety of options. I decided on the grilled salmon, which was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience, and I can't wait to return!

trgt: Food is average, but the ordering process is absolutely terrible. Technology gone wrong. Doubt I'll be back
beginning: Food is average, but the ordering process is absolutely terrible.
mgt: Food is average, but the ordering process is absolutely terrible. The app frequently crashes, and when it does work, it takes forever to load. I found myself frustrated and waiting longer than expected for my meal. Customer service was unhelpful, and I felt ignored when I reached out for assistance.
