Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place unless they improve their system.

trgt:
This Indonesian food cart is AMAZING.  Not only one of my favorite food carts, but easily one of the top lunch options in the entire city in my opinion.  Today I saw it outside as I went to work and it made my day!  It is right in front of St. Paul's on Library Mall.

I've tried both the curry tofu and the oseng tahu (candlenut tofu) and both were fantastic!  They were both served with a vegetable mix and then spooned with extra sauce over a bed of fluffy, perfectly cooked rice.  I would say probably a 3:1 or 3:2 tofu to vegetable ratio.
-The curry tofu was coconut-based and very mild, sweet, and mellow.  A large pinch of toasted coconut added some texture and heightened the complexity just a touch more. 
-Of the two tofus, though, I prefer the oseng tahu.  It is a dish that has a bit more bite - not spicy, but that I think it strikes a less sweet note and more of an earthy one.

I've never personally tried any of the other dishes, but I've heard great things about the Ayam bakar, which is barbequed chicken breast in a peanut sauce.

NOTE: Be sure to take advantage of the condiments next to the forks!  The hot sauce is great if you enjoy your food spicier and the sweet soy-based one is also delicious and would likely be a great accompaniment to the dishes with a thicker-looking peanut sauce to thin it out.

All the entrees come with acar, which is a lightly picked vegetable salad, and krupuk, which are crunchy tapioca puffs.  Both are very tasty and add a refreshing crunch.  Personally, I like to pile my extra rice and sauce on the the krupuk when I am done with my tofu.  

The owner is super friendly,  clearly there are several vegan options, everything seems to be gluten-free.  I am *racking* my brain and I cannot think of a single reason to not send ALL of you here.  Seriously, just go.  You won't regret it!
beginning: This Indonesian food cart is AMAZING. Not only one of
mgt: the best places to grab a quick bite, but it also offers an authentic taste of Indonesia. The flavors are vibrant and rich, with dishes like Nasi Goreng and Satay that transport you straight to the streets of Jakarta. The staff is friendly and always ready to recommend their favorites. Don't miss the homemade sambal; it adds the perfect kick!

trgt: Place is dated. There are always multiple machines broken and when machines break, they are not repaired for quite a long period of time.  Maintenance is clearly not a priority. I inquired as to why maintenance was not a priority but received no response.   Do not join unless you get tour with manager  and discuss maintenance with manager and get comfortable the situation will change.  You do get access at other clubs around country, so I am able to go to other 24 hour fitness facilities and have found other facilities much more acceptable.
beginning: Place is dated. There are always multiple machines broken and
mgt: the overall atmosphere feels neglected. The staff, while friendly, seem overwhelmed and unable to keep up with the maintenance. The lack of cleanliness is also concerning, with trash often left unattended. It’s a shame because the location has potential, but without proper care and updates, it’s hard to recommend.

trgt: The only problem with our Saturday in Montreal is that by 6 p.m., we'd caved to the temptation of a great breakfast, steak frites lunch and afternoon cocktails and snacks.  For us, Le Sarah B was the perfect stop for the evening \"meal\" - Rose and chicken wings!    Those wonderful chicken wings, perfectly seasoned and fried.  Recommended seating is around the corner behind the curtains - banquettes and pillows invite one to respectably sluggardize.  Bok bok!
beginning: The only problem with our Saturday in Montreal is that
mgt: "The only problem with our Saturday in Montreal is that it went by far too quickly. From the vibrant streets of Old Montreal to the delicious pastries at local cafés, every moment was a delight. We explored the stunning architecture, indulged in mouthwatering poutine, and enjoyed the lively atmosphere of the markets. The city's rich culture and friendly locals made it an unforgettable experience. We can't wait to return and discover even more hidden gems!"

trgt: Went to get my dog's food at the Pet Food Depot (Cave Creek/Grovers) and I saw a bunny in a cage on the floor, scared. He/she had food and a carrot but no water. I told an employee and after a bunch of \"that's not my rabbit\" comments, finally someone gave the bunny water. The sweet young man who checked me out told the manager that a customer wanted to buy 2 parakeets. The manager said to put them in a paper bag because they're out of boxes...really, a paper bag? The young man said the customer specifically wanted the birds in a box and the manager said \"we don't have any boxes, should I grab one from the sky\" and walked off. What a huge turn-off! I found out that the manager is the owner's son. \nI have been coming here for 8 years and this was my last trip here. There is a store a little further away (Western Ranchman at 32nd St/Paradise) that sells the same specialty dog food I buy, so they will be getting my business from now on. I have always been treated well here but after the flippant comments from the staff in front of a loyal customer, they obviously do not care about me or the animals they sell.
beginning: Went to get my dog's food at the Pet Food
mgt: Went to get my dog's food at the Pet Food store and was pleasantly surprised by the variety they offered. The staff was incredibly helpful, guiding me to the best options for my dog's specific dietary needs. Prices were reasonable, and I appreciated the clean, organized layout of the store. Overall, a great experience that I would recommend to fellow pet owners!

trgt: Customer service is a big issue here. Once you walk in you wait for a long time. One customer was getting irritated with them because he kept waiting and not getting his to go order. Some of the customers were just ignored and walked out because they couldn't wait anymore. Quality of their food is decent but the customer service needs to be fixed. When you see multiple people leaving their tables it will hurt your business. I think the biggest problem at this place is leadership and lack of leadership skills. Also waitress should never tell other customers \"oh that guy is mad at me\", because he waited long time for his order. I just don't think it's professional.
beginning: Customer service is a big issue here. Once you walk
mgt: Customer service is a big issue here. Once you walk through the door, it feels like you're invisible. Staff members seem disinterested and unhelpful, making it difficult to get assistance. I waited for over 15 minutes just to ask a simple question, and when I finally got help, the representative was rude and dismissive. It's disappointing because the products are decent, but the lack of support really detracts from the overall experience. I hope they can improve their service soon.

trgt: Gotta give Sparky some credit for their free bumper stickers, \"Stop staring at my cones\" Well I didn't get a cone, but I still tried a cup of ice cream. I guess I thought since it said Gourmet, I didn't realize that the place is really just a Stone-Cold with a bit fancier ice cream. I sampled Brown Sugar Maple Bacon, but didn't taste much and German Choc. cake was only Ok. Finally settled on a pretty decent scoop of cinnamon ice fream with two mixin's ($5...one was free and the other cost me an extra $1 because I donated for holidays). The chocolate chips and chopped pecans made this a tasty treat, but the best ice cream on the planet usually does not include mixing stuff into the treat. It's just a preference, but yogurt gets the toppings, but ice cream should be ready to go from the bins.
beginning: Gotta give Sparky some credit for their free bumper stickers,
mgt: "Gotta give Sparky some credit for their free bumper stickers, which are not only fun but also a great conversation starter. The designs are quirky and eye-catching, making them perfect for anyone looking to add a bit of personality to their vehicle. Plus, the quality is surprisingly durable, holding up well against the elements. Overall, Sparky's commitment to customer engagement is commendable, and I appreciate their efforts to create a community around their brand."

trgt:
I think this place is great. It's a unique little spot. However, some of these reviews are expecting too much. First, you're going for a $10 wine tasting for five wines, you shouldn't expect Opus One. The wines are priced appropriately and the concept of bottling parties is such a great idea for an event. Also, 'carry & go' is a perfect idea in this area. 

The wines are not offensive. If you are a wine connoisseur, then you will appreciate that these are young wines, but typically are pleasing to the palate. 

I have always found the staff to be extremely friendly. Also, I agree with Gabbi, that they get props for being doggie friendly!!
beginning: I think this place is great. It's a unique little
mgt: I think this place is great. It's a unique little gem tucked away in the heart of the city. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it perfect for a casual hangout or a special occasion. The staff is friendly and attentive, always ready to recommend their favorite dishes. I particularly enjoyed the homemade pasta, which was cooked to perfection. Overall, I highly recommend checking it out if you're looking for a delightful dining experience!

trgt: Not going to explain. Just don't waste your time.
beginning: Not going to explain. Just don't waste your time.
mgt: Not going to explain. Just don't waste your time. The plot is predictable, the characters are one-dimensional, and the pacing is painfully slow. I found myself checking the clock more than once, hoping for it to end. Save your energy for something more worthwhile.

trgt: This is a neat, unique restaurant, but not one item was worth the price. This restaurant is not fine dining, so to pay six bucks for four onion rings seemed off to me.
beginning: This is a neat, unique restaurant, but not one item
mgt: "This is a neat, unique restaurant, but not one item on the menu truly stood out. The ambiance was inviting, with quirky decor that added character. However, the flavors were somewhat bland, lacking the creativity I expected. Service was friendly, but the wait times were longer than anticipated. Overall, it’s a nice spot for a casual meal, but I left wanting more excitement from the dishes."

trgt: It's somewhat ok. Seems clean enough. Don't use powder detergent though. At least not on the front loaders the fans blow all the time and that powder will get blown in your face. They need to work on more places to sit too. Not always easy to sit outside when it's hot or you're pregnant and need to get off your feet.
beginning: It's somewhat ok. Seems clean enough. Don't use powder detergent
mgt: "It's somewhat ok. Seems clean enough. Don't use powder detergent; it tends to leave residue on clothes. The staff is friendly, but the amenities could use some improvement. The laundry machines are a bit outdated, and the drying time is longer than expected. Overall, it's a decent place for a quick wash, but I wouldn't recommend it for larger loads."

trgt:
It's chilly here - so please where a jacket!  

The station is going under major refurbishment, so please bear with it.  

It has a ticket office, toilets and various shops to get any last minute shopping before you hop on that train. 

Looking forward to seeing the completion of works.
beginning: It's chilly here - so please where a jacket! \n\nThe
mgt:
"It's chilly here - so please wear a jacket! 

The atmosphere is cozy, with warm lighting and inviting decor. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure every guest feels welcome. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal soup, which was both hearty and comforting. Overall, a perfect spot to enjoy a meal while escaping the cold!"

trgt:
I like this Basha's.... its local, and convenient. I don't tink they are the cheapest place in town to shop... but it's around the corner from where I live. 

I also like supporting local Arizona business.

The staff at this Basha's is always very friendly, and I like to frequent one store so you get to know the staff.
beginning: I like this Basha's.... its local, and convenient. I don't
mgt: I like this Basha's... it's local, and convenient. I don't have to travel far for fresh produce and everyday essentials. The staff is friendly and always willing to help. The prices are reasonable, and I appreciate the variety of local products available. However, I wish they had a larger selection of organic items. Overall, it's a great neighborhood store that meets my needs.

trgt: To avoid the pouring rain, we ran into this place to have a drink.  I got a dirty martini and my friend got some fruity drink.  I was unimpressed.  My martini glass was tiny and it was barely halfway full.  There was literally 2 spoonfuls of liquid in that tiny glass.  That would have been okay for $9 if I were surrounded by hot bodies in tight shirts dancing on white sofas.  In which case the goddamn drink woulda been free.  But this ain't Hollywood honey.  When I pay $9 for a drink I expect more than an eyedropper's worth.
beginning: To avoid the pouring rain, we ran into this place
mgt: To avoid the pouring rain, we ran into this place, and what a delightful surprise it turned out to be! The cozy atmosphere instantly lifted our spirits, and the warm, inviting decor made us feel right at home. The staff greeted us with genuine smiles and promptly seated us at a charming little table by the window. We decided to try their signature dish, and it was absolutely delicious—flavorful and beautifully presented. Overall, this hidden gem is a must-visit for anyone seeking comfort food and a welcoming ambiance.

trgt:
There are a few issues with this place.
The obvious is the entirely unacceptable wait for food. I ordered on GrubHub (which I do often) at 2:18pm, my estimated delivery was 3:45pm-3:55pm
Seemed a little long but its BBQ and red velvet cake with corn bread and mac n cheese so has to be worth some wait, and I am near a college campus so OK.

4:00pm rolls by and I call the restaurant. At first it goes directly to VM. OK, this isn't good so I call again and I get put on hold. Once the gentlemen finally picks up Im told it will be 15-20 minutes for my order and he apologizes for the delay. OK no problem.

I decide to hop on Yelp and look at the reviews, as when I ordered I was starving so just picked a place (I'm still starving as I write this first part). I see the wait is not uncommon. In fact its the norm.

4:20pm rolls by and I message GrubHub. Within 2 minutes I had a text and email stating I should have my food by 4:32pm ...its 4:29pm as I type this. They gave me an extra 10.00 in food, which I appreciate and realize its not their fault my food is late but with all these issues piling up you would think they might get the hint to discontinue business with this place. (Just sayin).

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
So food got here at: 4:37


Review of food:

Hot Links - Sauce was spicy and good so was the hotlink the bun was crunchy on the edges link it was over microwaved.

Mac N Cheese - Bland. Its a shame too there is so much you can do with Mac N Cheese.

Cornbread Muffin - Decent taste, horrible consistency. I don't expect my Cornbread to be chewy.

Red Velvet Cake - Cake was moist and it was good but it had an after taste like the cream cheese had been wrapped in plastic wrap too long


All in all I wont order here again, the food was not great and the time it took to get here was utterly poor.
beginning: There are a few issues with this place.\nThe obvious is
mgt: "There are a few issues with this place. The obvious is the lack of cleanliness, which is disappointing for any establishment. The floors were sticky, and the tables seemed to have been wiped down hastily. Additionally, the service was slow, with long waits for our orders. While the staff was friendly, they appeared overwhelmed and disorganized. The food, though decent, didn't quite make up for these shortcomings. Overall, I left feeling underwhelmed and unlikely to return."

trgt: It wasn't horrible and it wasn't mind-blowing. Average burger with steep prices (well, you are in Vegas). We were really hungry and on our way to the Secret Garden at the Mirage. Limited combo options, if you choose a special burger then the price of the friesa and drink skyrocket the bill. The milkshake was dense and tasty, but half the cup was frosting (which I don't really care for). Simple and clean presentation. The server was timely and attentive. She didn't hover too much or ignore us. I liked the house pickles (mild brine). Honestly, for the price, I would have rather paid for a restaurant experience at a Master Chef restaurant or something.
beginning: It wasn't horrible and it wasn't mind-blowing. Average burger with
mgt: "average toppings and a standard bun. The patty was cooked well, but lacked seasoning, leaving it a bit bland. The fries were decent, crispy but nothing special. Overall, it’s a place to grab a quick bite, but I wouldn’t go out of my way to return."

trgt: This place is really cool. So many birds. The shows were very interesting as well. The food court has some good pizza too.
beginning: This place is really cool. So many birds. The shows
mgt: "This place is really cool. So many birds. The shows are incredibly entertaining and educational, showcasing a variety of species in their natural behaviors. The staff is knowledgeable and passionate, making the experience even more enjoyable. I loved the interactive exhibits, where you can get up close and personal with some of the birds. Overall, a fantastic outing for families and bird enthusiasts alike!"

trgt: Super!  When you team Chef Kelly Fletcher with Sommelier David M Johnson you know you're going to experience magic. Achiote Salmon was a great flavor festival in my mouth.  We also tried the braised short rib which as good as we have ever had. Love the creativity of the food and the large (and well priced) wine list. Check it out!!
beginning: Super! When you team Chef Kelly Fletcher with Sommelier David
mgt: Super! When you team Chef Kelly Fletcher with Sommelier David, you know you're in for an unforgettable dining experience. The exquisite pairing of flavors and wines elevates each dish to new heights. Chef Kelly's creativity shines through in every bite, showcasing seasonal ingredients that burst with freshness. Meanwhile, David's expertise in wine selection complements the menu perfectly, enhancing the overall experience. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it ideal for both special occasions and casual dinners. Highly recommend!

trgt: I love whole foods but this location has the basics.  The products and help is the normal 4/5 stars but this is one of the smaller locations I have seen. Their deli still has all the goodies you would expect from whole foods. Still it is better than not having a whole foods at all like most of Wisconsin.
beginning: I love whole foods but this location has the basics.
mgt: "I love Whole Foods, but this location has the basics. While the selection is decent, it often feels limited compared to other stores. The produce section is fresh, but I wish there were more organic options available. The staff is friendly and helpful, which is a plus. However, the prices can be a bit steep for some items. Overall, it's a convenient stop, but I hope they expand their offerings in the future."

trgt: Horrible service. Came here with my 13 yr old daughter. Took 30 minutes to get a bowl of garlic fries, almost an hour to get our food. Waitress was more interested in socializing with the tables of loud, obnoxious drunks, than serving a dad and his daughter. Even had to wait to pay my bill. Finally got up and paid my bill at the front desk. Food quality has gone way down since I started coming here a few years ago.
beginning: Horrible service. Came here with my 13 yr old daughter.
mgt: Horrible service. Came here with my 13 yr old daughter. We waited over 30 minutes for our drinks, and when they finally arrived, they were wrong. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, making the experience even more frustrating. We ended up leaving without ordering food. I won’t be returning.

trgt:
4stars to DJ !!! 
I got hyped by the music that DJ played for us.
He played songs that are mixed from old funk to pop songs.
Transition between songs is really smooth. 

0 stars for the bar. Cocktails were not worth the price.

(4+0)/2=2 stars
beginning: 4stars to DJ !!! \nI got hyped by the music
mgt:
4 stars to DJ!!!  
I got hyped by the music, which had an incredible energy that kept the crowd moving all night long. The beats were infectious, and the transitions between tracks were seamless. Each song selection felt perfectly curated, creating an atmosphere that was both electrifying and immersive. I couldn't help but dance along, and the vibe was contagious. Overall, a fantastic experience that left me wanting more!

trgt: My family and I were here staying at a near by Hotel and decided to go here, plus it was my husbands birthday. We got right in for a Saturday night. We ordered the sampler appetizer. This had no flavor. It was so bland. Then my husband ordered the chicken and broccoli pasta. He couldn't even eat it, it was so bland. No spices, no taste. I tried it and I couldn't even eat it. We sent it back. I got the top sirloin and it was basically a piece of fat that had been grilled. The kids didn't even eat their food. (One had chicken fried steak and the other kid ribs) I felt so bad for my husband because he had a terrible birthday dinner meal. We ended up paying our bill, and getting snacks afterwards to compensate. The service was good, but not attentive. We will not ever visit another Claim Jumper again.
beginning: My family and I were here staying at a near
mgt: "My family and I were here staying at a nearby resort for a week, and it was an unforgettable experience. The location was perfect, with stunning views and easy access to the beach. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel right at home. We enjoyed a variety of activities, from snorkeling to hiking, and the local dining options were fantastic. Overall, it was a wonderful getaway that we can't wait to revisit!"

trgt:
Took my father here for his birthday and it was quite the experience.  L'atelier is famous for its open kitchen.  They give their guests the option of sitting at the bar where they can overlook the open kitchen and watch all the chefs cooking their food.  My father and I each ordered the Discovery Menu for $168.  Seems a little pricey for a 1 Michelin Star restaurant, but hey...it is JR.

The Discovery Menu consisted of 10 courses (including coffee).  There was a lot of foie gras in the menu that evening and my cholesterol level felt like it was going to rocket out of the building after the meal.  But the foie gras was cooked very well and full of flavor.  I was very impressed with the Langoustine carpaccio.  It was my first time having Langoustine and I really enjoyed it with the combination of spices.  The Dover sole filet wasn't anything too special though.

We also shared an order of the le'burger, L'atelier's signature burger.  It consisted of a kobe beef patty with foie gras and WOW was that delicious.  The best burger I have ever had, I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone who visits L'atelier.

The service was also very good and attentive here.  Always making sure we didn't have an empty glass of water and the waiters are were very willing to make small talk.  Seeing that it was my father's birthday, at the end of the meal they presented us with a selection of 6 different kinds of dessert cakes, all of which were delicious.

The price is what stopped me from giving this restaurant 5 stars, but my father and I still enjoyed our meal very much.
beginning: Took my father here for his birthday and it was
mgt: "Took my father here for his birthday and it was an unforgettable experience. The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a celebration. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel special, and the food was absolutely delicious. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. We left with full bellies and happy hearts, already planning our next visit!"

trgt: I would give this \"Urban Grocery\" a better rating if their hours were better!  Being closed on Sunday and Monday, two of the most common \"oops, I forgot something and need to go to the grocery store\" days, is not the best idea.  It's great that this place is within walking distance of our home, but their stock just isn't that great.  I'm glad that I can get Hickman's eggs there, but I wish that they used Superstition Farm milk instead of the ubiquitous Shamrock.  SuperFarm's milk tastes better and lasts longer.  They have an interesting selection of produce, and I realize it's still growing, but we live in AZ so stuff like berries are not to be expected.  Bummer.  They carry some stuff that I will purchase every so now and then like the AZ Cheesecake Co. treats and the bread from Scottsdale, but that's about it.
beginning: I would give this \"Urban Grocery\" a better rating if
mgt: I would give this "Urban Grocery" a better rating if the staff were more attentive and the checkout lines weren't so long. The selection of fresh produce is impressive, but the overall shopping experience is often marred by disorganization. Additionally, the prices can be a bit steep compared to other local markets. A little more effort in customer service would go a long way in enhancing the overall experience.

trgt:
Tried it once w/ the kids, won't be back.
Not bad, but for their high prices and the quality, there are better choices in LV.

Noise level is high.
beginning: Tried it once w/ the kids, won't be back.\nNot bad,
mgt: but it just didn't live up to our expectations. The service was slow, and the food was mediocre at best. The kids were bored, and we left feeling unsatisfied. There are better options in the area that cater to families.

trgt:
Been going to this location for over a year now  Last week i ordered griled chicken breast on rye bread. They brought it to me on regular bun. I noticed human hair on the chicken. Thats gross! I could have a big seen but i didnt in front of his customers.
Today it was brezzy do i took my mccaw, into store. Ordered the same sandwich as last week again they could not get it right the first time. Then the mgr comes to my table and says my bird cannot be in the store. I told him i wanted my money back. And that i would never return to his resturant  . This owner discrimated against a 2.5 lb animal that brings smiles to countlesss people everyday. He wasnt hurting anybody. 
This proprietor, was extremely condensending,rude & obnoxious. 
Shame on Freedies Custard on Eastern Ave Las Vegas, NV.
beginning: Been going to this location for over a year now
mgt: "Been going to this location for over a year now, and I can confidently say it never disappoints. The staff is always friendly and attentive, making each visit enjoyable. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. I highly recommend their signature dishes; they are consistently delicious and beautifully presented. Overall, this place has become a favorite of mine, and I look forward to many more visits!"

trgt: This Loblaws is good. Avoid peek times because the queues become unbearable.
beginning: This Loblaws is good. Avoid peek times because the queues
mgt: "This Loblaws is good. Avoid peek times because the queues can get quite long, making your shopping experience frustrating. The selection of fresh produce is impressive, and the staff are generally helpful and friendly. However, the layout can be a bit confusing for first-time visitors. Overall, it's a solid grocery store with competitive prices."

trgt: Went there this morning for breakfast. Both the Lox and bagel were delicious but they were very chinsey on lox. Had to order a side of lox where we were given a slice and a quarter for $7. Silly no point!  Should give enough to cover two pieces of a bagel no one makes a sammy. \nThanks
beginning: Went there this morning for breakfast. Both the Lox and
mgt: the Eggs Benedict were absolutely delightful. The Lox was fresh and flavorful, perfectly paired with a creamy cream cheese spread. The Eggs Benedict had a perfectly poached egg, and the hollandaise sauce was rich and buttery. The service was prompt and friendly, making the experience even better. I’ll definitely be returning for more!

trgt:
this shop is 100% fantastic!!! 

my friend and i made the trip out from the strip after she raved about the fresh turkey sub she'd had with her husband a year ago. besides some really roundabout directions, the trip was definitely worth the short drive out from the main strip! 
reasons to make your way out to this shop:
-the turkey is roasted fresh every day and melts in your mouth!
-during the time we were there, people from NY, Philly, California, and Texas came by, put the philly sandwich to the test, AND loved it!
-Ruth is one of the sweetest people i met and makes you feel like you're family! 

Ruth, BEST 12 inches i've ever had!!! ;)
beginning: this shop is 100% fantastic!!! \n\nmy friend and i made
mgt:
this shop is 100% fantastic!!! 

my friend and I made a spontaneous visit, and we were blown away by the selection. The staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, helping us find exactly what we needed. The atmosphere was inviting, making it a pleasure to browse. We left with some amazing finds and can't wait to return! Highly recommend!

trgt:
I came to this trendy yet casual restaurant for happy hour (Sun-Fri from 5:30pm - 7:00pm).  To order off the happy hour menu, you have sit at the cocktail tables or the bar.  Because the kitchen is open, you can see the chefs preparing your food, which is always legit.  That being said, I was quite surprised and alarmed to see the chefs eating in the kitchen while preparing the food.  Service was lightning fast, as I was in and out within a half hour.

Time to get happy.

The white sangria ($5), which also comes in red, was awesome and was so good that I was forced to order another one.

The raw oysters in a half shell ($2 each) were sold by the half dozen and came with every dipping sauce under the sun.  I've had a lot of oysters in my day and I highly recommend checking these out.

The stuffed clams ($5) were ginormous.  Stuffed with chorizo, they were served with grilled buttered bread.  The clams were simply amazing.  
With just the right amount of salty and savory, they were smooth in texture and easy to chew.

Now for the most expensive appetizer ever.  The poppers ($22) weren't on the happy hour menu and came with 3 tuna balls and 3 yellowtail balls, each served raw on top of fried rice patties.  These bad boys lived up to their name and were small enough to pop in your mouth.  Though not worth the price, they were still pretty dank.

Focus on the seafood at this place and definitely enjoy!
beginning: I came to this trendy yet casual restaurant for happy
mgt: I came to this trendy yet casual restaurant for happy hour, and I was pleasantly surprised by the vibrant atmosphere. The cocktails were expertly crafted, and the small plates offered a delightful variety of flavors. The staff was attentive and friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable. I particularly loved the spicy tuna tartare and the crispy Brussels sprouts. Overall, it was a fantastic way to unwind after a long day, and I can't wait to return!

trgt: I'd like to become a regular here. Especially at the bar. It's well stocked with good liquors and a big selection of Belgian and Belgian-style beers. The bartenders are friendly. The atmosphere is dark and rustic/charming. The patio is intimate with a nice fireplace and heaters with large comfy couches. The food is great, though it takes quite a long time for it to come out after you order it. My boyfriend and I had the burger- moist, perfectly cooked, and with great flavor. We also split the challah french toast. It was very good as well. This place is exactly what I'd like in a neighborhood bar.
beginning: I'd like to become a regular here. Especially at the
mgt: "I'd like to become a regular here. Especially at the cozy corner table by the window. The ambiance is inviting, with soft lighting and a warm atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always ready to recommend their favorite dishes. I was particularly impressed by the seasonal menu, which features fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Each dish I tried was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. I can't wait to come back and explore more of what they have to offer!"

trgt:
Loved this place!

I went for lunch after my graduation.  We went for a very late lunch so it was dead, which was fine with me.  We had a great server, who was accomodating and friendly.  The mac and cheese was SO GOOD, definitely get that if you go.  We also had the grilled artichokes.. very yummy.

Everyone's lunch was good, and I thought was really reasonably priced for 5 people (3 ordered the kobe burgers, a bottle of champagne, and two appetizers) when the total came out to $115 bucks.

They also provided a free celebration dessert, which was such a nice personal touch.

Food = yummy, decor = adorable, service = excellent.
beginning: Loved this place!\n\nI went for lunch after my graduation. We
mgt: "Loved this place!\n\nI went for lunch after my graduation. We were greeted warmly and seated promptly. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, and I couldn't resist trying their signature burger. It was juicy and cooked to perfection, paired with crispy fries that were simply irresistible. The atmosphere was vibrant yet cozy, making it the perfect spot to celebrate. I can't wait to return and explore more of their offerings!"

trgt:
I recently needed A/C repair on a Monday morning following the first really
hot weekend in Phoenix.  Apparently, a LOT of other people needed A/C repair, also.
My regular repairman was unavailable.  I called A/C Guys, Inc.  (found on Yelp)
This was a rental property.  An appointment needed to be scheduled with the tenant, while keeping me (the landlord) aware of what was going on.  Payment needed to be scheduled with me.  Technician needed to inform both the tenant and me as to what was going on with the A/C.  A/C Guys handled all of this with ease, and kept me informed
at all times. So easy.  
In addition, the technician (Matt) gave me two options for repair (I have never had THAT happen before - nice).  In the office (Ty) coordinated it all, and e-mailed me a receipt.
Professional business, honest, great repair, and affordable prices.  I highly recommend this business, and will continue to use A/C Guys, Inc. in the future.
beginning: I recently needed A/C repair on a Monday morning following
mgt: "I recently needed A/C repair on a Monday morning following a particularly hot weekend. I was worried about finding someone available on such short notice, but I called a local service and was pleasantly surprised. The technician arrived within an hour, was professional, and quickly diagnosed the issue. They explained everything clearly and provided a fair estimate before starting the work. By the afternoon, my A/C was up and running again, and I couldn't be happier with the service!"

trgt: Food took an HOUR to get to us.  Then it was cold but we were too hungry to send it back and have them spit in it.  I really enjoyed this place when it was in Mesa but they just lost a customer.  Horrible.
beginning: Food took an HOUR to get to us. Then it
mgt: Food took an HOUR to get to us. Then it arrived cold and unappetizing. The pasta was overcooked, and the sauce lacked flavor. We had high hopes based on previous visits, but this experience was disappointing. The service was also lacking, as our server seemed overwhelmed and inattentive. Overall, we left feeling unsatisfied and unlikely to return anytime soon.

trgt: The epicenter ale is very good.  We just had to take some home so we ordered a six pack to go.  This place is a lot like Four Peaks in Tempe except  the food is a little more expensive (beer prices are similar though).  The food isn't as good as Four Peaks so we will go there over this place from now on but I wouldn't tell people to stay away...try it, it's OK
beginning: The epicenter ale is very good. We just had to
mgt: The epicenter ale is very good. We just had to savor its rich, hoppy flavor and smooth finish. The balance between bitterness and sweetness is remarkable, making it a perfect choice for both casual drinkers and craft beer enthusiasts. The aroma is inviting, with hints of citrus and pine that tantalize the senses. Overall, it’s a delightful brew that I would highly recommend to anyone looking to explore new flavors.

trgt:
I needed a quick lunch while buzzing around Phoenix. I have heard a lot of good things about Zoe's and since I was there,I thought I would give it a go!
Parking can be tight, at lunch time at least. Lots of people have the same idea.
I got a simple lunch,but it was very good.
Limeade was my drink of choice, quite good and they say sweetend with Cane sugar.
I got the Zoe Club Pita. Was fresh tatsing as good.
Chicken, Ham ,and swiss cheese, with lettuce ,tomato and some spicy mustard, I asked for extra spice.
Not a bad experiance at all. The place is clean and modern looking.
beginning: I needed a quick lunch while buzzing around Phoenix. I
mgt: I stumbled upon a charming little café that promised fresh ingredients and speedy service. The moment I walked in, the aroma of freshly baked bread enveloped me. I ordered a turkey avocado sandwich, and it was ready in no time. The flavors were vibrant, and the portion was generous. The staff was friendly, making the experience even better. I left feeling satisfied and energized, ready to tackle the rest of my day. Highly recommend for anyone on the go!

trgt: 5 stars by far place is super busy but worth the wait! Food is great staff is friendly, and accommodating. Seating area is small but the kitchen is open to watch them cook. First  and only hawaiian bbq place I'll eat at. If you are picky like me it's a big step to try it but I wasn't disappointed!
beginning: 5 stars by far place is super busy but worth
mgt: 5 stars by far! This place is super busy but worth every minute of the wait. The atmosphere is vibrant, and the staff is incredibly friendly. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the signature dish; it’s a true standout! Don’t forget to try their desserts—they're the perfect ending to a wonderful meal. Overall, a must-visit spot!

trgt:
Poor and inconsistent service.   

Rates are high with requirements other rental companies dont have not to mention it was like they were doing me a favor for me to spend 600 bucks with them. 

 Don't even try to rent if you use a debit card need everything from references, utility statements and first born. 

Recommend checking other rental agencies that appreciate return customers and more than likely have better rates.
beginning: Poor and inconsistent service. \n\nRates are high with requirements other
mgt: "than what was initially communicated. The staff seemed overwhelmed and untrained, leading to long wait times and frequent errors in orders. Despite the appealing ambiance, the lack of attention to customer needs overshadowed any positive aspects. I left feeling frustrated and unlikely to return."

trgt: Yes, it's a Las Vegas Buffet - Food here is meh - basically, low quality food with emphasis of quantity. It is pretty pricy considering what you're getting - traditional Vegas up charge, but I still think it's still a bit pricy, even by Vegas Standards. \n\nMe, I just had a couple of eggs, canned fruit, and a bowl of cereal. Personally in the future, if I have to eat on the cheap and quick - I would suggest considering a coffee shop oatmeal, fruit, and coffee. Or if you want to spend the budget - consider eating a famous French place that is listed in my Vegas list.
beginning: Yes, it's a Las Vegas Buffet - Food here is
mgt: "Yes, it's a Las Vegas Buffet - Food here is abundant and diverse, offering everything from classic American dishes to international cuisine. The seafood selection is particularly impressive, with fresh shrimp and crab legs that are a must-try. However, the quality can be hit or miss, with some items tasting a bit bland. The dessert station is a sweet highlight, featuring an array of cakes and pastries that are sure to satisfy any sweet tooth. Overall, it's a fun experience, but don't expect gourmet dining."

trgt:
What a terrific experience from start to finish, minus like two things.

The atmosphere is very cool. A couple of things I really liked was the way they get ice at the bar. No cubes, just a block of ice and the bartender makes the cubes himself. Also, the "wine cellar" is beautiful, not unique but beautiful. Restrooms are awesome, and their private dining rooms are great with a huge 600 year old tree as a table. It is basically an entire tree, as explained by William, the manager. One thing that bothered me almost the whole meal was the lighting, which was very bright. Finally they turned it down at about 8:30 but it felt like a dining hall for a bit there.

Monday night apparently is not a busy night for them, as we were one of three tables, and nobody was at the bar or grill. The server we had was definitely very very good, and perfectly attentive, though as he explained the restaurant and specials he was extremely quiet. I had to ask him to repeat himself and he turned it up, for a second, then turned it back down. Whatever. William, the restaurant manager was awesome as well, making me feel like he was privileged to have me there. We decided to just put them in charge and see what we got with both food and sake. 

The first course, Butterfish, was delicious served with a ginger sauce and  some veggies. Second course of Tempura Rock Shrimp was not my favorite, but good. It had a bit of a Mexican flavor with chile and lime. The Pork Belly came next and this was by far my favorite dish, just absolutely perfectly cooked and very flavorful. I did not care for the next which were the chicken skewers. The main course of Rib Eye was average, and I wanted more pork belly. All of the sakes served to us were great, and dessert was wonderful as well. Foodwise, this was a near perfect evening, with only one dish really being blah, and that was the ribeye.

I do hope they get busier soon, as they are going to be in trouble if last night was the norm. It was DEAD. For Phoenix, this is a truly unique dining option. Roka is a great option for dinner before going out to Old Town, or a great spot to get together with friends to celebrate.
beginning: What a terrific experience from start to finish, minus like
mgt: "What a terrific experience from start to finish, minus like a minor hiccup with the reservation. The staff was incredibly attentive and friendly, making us feel welcome right away. The ambiance was perfect, setting the mood for a delightful evening. The food was exquisite, with each dish beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. I can't wait to return!"

trgt: Be sure u go to the right location, Bethany Home & 16th. Next to Dick's Hideaway
beginning: Be sure u go to the right location, Bethany Home
mgt: "Be sure u go to the right location, Bethany Home. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a cozy meal. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that your dining experience is enjoyable. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the seasonal specials, as they showcase the chef's creativity and use of fresh ingredients. Overall, a fantastic place to unwind and savor delicious food!"

trgt:
The buffet was good. It's probably one of the price-friendly ones. It honestly didn't cost me an arm and a leg. With the remodeling done there, it was a little hard to find the buffet. It's underground... kinda-sorta. The hosts don't really pay attention to the people eating and randomly changing tables. So, it gets annoying if you have a party of 6 and this party of 4, who's already on their 3rd plates, decide to move to a roomier table. Yeah, not cool.

ADVISORY:
Get there early, in a blink of an eye... the lines are crazy.
beginning: The buffet was good. It's probably one of the price-friendly
mgt: options in the area, offering a wide variety of dishes that cater to different tastes. The freshness of the ingredients was impressive, and the staff was attentive without being intrusive. I particularly enjoyed the seafood section, which had a delightful selection. Overall, a satisfying experience that left me eager to return.

trgt: I usually am quite the fan of Uswirl. I come here once every two weeks or so. On 6/4 at 9PM I walked in with my family to get some frozen yogurt. The service was TERRIBLE. There was nearly NO fruit toppings out and when I asked the girl at the cashier to please grab some strawberries she was on her phone and I had to call her 3 or 4 times to even get her attention. When I finally got her attention, she rolled her eyes. A kid about 15 kept walking in and out of the store and communicating with the other male worker- very unprofessional as I believe they were speaking of drugs or some type of confrontation happening across the way involving their friends. Very dissatisfied.
beginning: I usually am quite the fan of Uswirl. I come
mgt: "I usually am quite the fan of Uswirl. I come here often for their unique flavors and vibrant atmosphere. However, my recent visit left me a bit disappointed. The service was slower than usual, and my favorite flavor was out of stock. Despite this, the staff was friendly and tried to make up for the inconvenience. I still appreciate their creativity and hope to see improvements next time."

trgt: Not bad, if you like low quality, pre-prepared school cafeteria lunch food. Make sure you ask which dish has the surprise plastic wrap hidden in it. If you find it, you're the night's winner! And the plastic is your prize!
beginning: Not bad, if you like low quality, pre-prepared school cafeteria
mgt: Not bad, if you like low quality, pre-prepared school cafeteria food. The flavors are bland, and the presentation is lackluster at best. While the portions are generous, the overall experience leaves much to be desired. The lack of fresh ingredients is evident, and the menu options are limited. If you're looking for a quick bite without any culinary excitement, this might suffice, but don't expect anything memorable.

trgt: Sushi is fresh and service is great.  I just wish the place could accommodate more people.  Sometimes the wait isn't worth the time.
beginning: Sushi is fresh and service is great. I just wish
mgt: Sushi is fresh and service is great. I just wish the menu had more variety. While the classics are well-executed, I crave unique rolls and seasonal specials. The ambiance is cozy, making it a perfect spot for a casual dinner or a special occasion. Overall, a delightful experience that keeps me coming back!

trgt: Mmmm... Beer... and the grub ain't to shabby either.\n\nWho does not like roasted peanuts with the shell and pitch them on the floor after eating the nuts?
beginning: Mmmm... Beer... and the grub ain't to shabby either.\n\nWho does
mgt: "Mmmm... Beer... and the grub ain't too shabby either.\n\nWho does not love a good pub experience? The atmosphere here is vibrant, with friendly staff and a great selection of craft beers. The menu offers a delightful mix of classic pub fare and unique dishes that keep things interesting. I particularly enjoyed the loaded nachos and the juicy burgers, which were cooked to perfection. Overall, a fantastic spot to unwind with friends!"

trgt: Deceive your diet! Indulge in any of the appetizers and entrees knowing your feeding your body with something that's not only nutritious but tastes delicious! Sure bets are the Caprese salad, Chicken Shawarma, and Pesto Lavosh Turkey Wrap. Prices are under $15 and portions are generous.
beginning: Deceive your diet! Indulge in any of the appetizers and
mgt: "you'll find yourself savoring every bite without a hint of guilt. The crispy calamari is perfectly seasoned, while the creamy dip adds a delightful contrast. Each dish is crafted with fresh ingredients, making it hard to resist trying them all. The vibrant flavors and generous portions ensure that every appetizer feels like a mini celebration. Whether you're sharing with friends or enjoying a solo treat, these starters set the perfect tone for a memorable meal."

trgt: Get the tacos! They are awesoooome!
beginning: Get the tacos! They are awesoooome!
mgt: Get the tacos! They are awesoooome! The flavors burst in your mouth, and the freshness of the ingredients is undeniable. Each bite is a perfect blend of spices and textures. The tortillas are soft and warm, making every taco a delight. Don’t forget to try their homemade salsa; it adds the perfect kick! Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic Mexican food!

trgt: I though it was overpriced, the steak was good, but not great. There are plenty of great steakhouses in Vegas that are better for half the price.
beginning: I though it was overpriced, the steak was good, but
mgt: "I thought it was overpriced, the steak was good, but the portion size was disappointingly small. The sides were underwhelming and lacked flavor, which really detracted from the overall experience. For the price, I expected a more memorable meal. Service was decent, but not exceptional. I might consider returning, but only if the menu changes."

trgt: This place needs to close.  Half the waitresses are tweekers with missing teeth.  Our server must have have been on meth, she messed up the entire order.  I talked to the manager, Javier, about the service, and he said \"what do you want me to do about it?\"  This Applebees has seen better days.
beginning: This place needs to close. Half the waitresses are tweekers
mgt: "This place needs to close. Half the waitresses are tweekers, and the service is painfully slow. The food is mediocre at best, and the cleanliness is questionable. I’ve seen better hygiene in a dive bar. It’s disappointing because it used to be a decent spot. I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt: Tried a few of the manicurists here before I settled with Cecilia. Meticulous quality!
beginning: Tried a few of the manicurists here before I settled
mgt: "Tried a few of the manicurists here before I settled on my favorite. Each visit has been a delightful experience. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every detail is perfect. The ambiance is relaxing, making it a great escape from the daily grind. I appreciate their wide selection of colors and nail art options. Highly recommend!"

trgt: I've been here several times and tried the chimichanga, street tacos, and the pollo fun dido. The chimi and tacos are just ok. A little flat in flavor. The fun dido is real tasty with a good kick and a lot of cheese. Their complimentary chips n salsa are delicious and they give you a variety with flour and corn chips!  The margarita is very good but a little light In the tequila zone. I'd like to give them a 4 star if it wasn't for the rather inflated prices, but I suppose they're in the right area for it in n. Scottsdale. I will be back but will most likely get a beer instead of the cocktail.
beginning: I've been here several times and tried the chimichanga, street
mgt: tacos, and enchiladas, and each dish has consistently impressed me. The flavors are vibrant, and the portions are generous. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend the house-made salsa; it adds a perfect kick to every meal. Overall, this place never disappoints!

trgt: Do not move here!!! my wife and i were looking for a nice place to live in vegas and i thought this would be the spot... we rented for a year so we could find the right house to buy... Thank god i am only locked in here for 6 more months... it is a section 8 community, so now i pay full price for my house but all my neighbors do not... Its not fair and i have to listen to them fight all the time about drugs and have seen 2 physical fights as well... Security does nothing but tells you to call Metro... Save your time and money and look somewhere else... The golf course has gone downhill too, they give out 3 months of unlimited golf for $69, so that brought all the right crowds here too... There are plenty more communities that are safer than this and do not have section 8... ( section 8 housing in a gated community is a oxymoron... )
beginning: Do not move here!!! my wife and i were looking
mgt: "Do not move here!!! My wife and I were looking for a new place to call home, but this neighborhood has been a nightmare. The noise levels are unbearable, with constant construction and loud parties at all hours. Additionally, the management is unresponsive and unhelpful, making it impossible to resolve any issues. We regret our decision and are actively searching for a better community."

trgt: We loved everything about Frost! The service was great and the Gelato speaks for itself, absolutely delicious! We especially loved that everything was made fresh on site and does not contain preservatives.  Friendly staff and a clean store. Definitely a place we plan to visit more often.
beginning: We loved everything about Frost! The service was great and
mgt: the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The menu offered a fantastic variety of dishes, each beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. Our favorites were the roasted beet salad and the decadent chocolate mousse. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. We can't wait to return and try more of their delicious offerings!

trgt: We came here on a Thursday night with a large group of 20 plus.  The place was extremely accomodating in that they let us form our own impromptu groups/seating.  The service was great.  The servers checked-in on us as a group and individually.  Without even asking, they kept all our bills separately which made settling the check a breeze.  Trust me, that is a huge undertaking in group settings.  Decent list of wine selections.  The pizza was delicious.  Definitely a cool chill place to be if you want to get away from the craziness everywhere else on Mill.
beginning: We came here on a Thursday night with a large
mgt: "We came here on a Thursday night with a large group of friends, and we were pleasantly surprised by the vibrant atmosphere. The staff was incredibly attentive, ensuring our drinks were always full and our orders were taken promptly. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes, and everyone found something they loved. The highlight was definitely the signature pasta, which was rich and flavorful. We ended the night with dessert, and the chocolate lava cake was the perfect sweet ending. Overall, a fantastic experience that we can't wait to repeat!"

trgt: So glad that I can update my review to now be 5 star. Foonzo went through a couple of changes as they were testing out to see what worked and what didn't, now that it works, oh damn does it work!!! They now have more beer choices, a fully stocked bar, and a full kitchen. Prices have leveled out and having a super competent and adorable waitress was also a great change! I uploaded the food / drink menus in the photos, I tend to judge restaurants on the \"different\" dishes, such as veggie burgers. I can confirm that their veggie burger is DELICIOUS. They have the perfect marinade, and dipping in their BBQ sauce made me glad I ordered the veggie over the pattie and bacon (this coming from a carnivore). Their beer buckets are perfect for keeping your table in order and their \"drop shots\" are an inexpensive little party round (try the Chupacabra - tequila & Monster). They also have a nerdy-named martini menu which is a nice touch. So excited to come here regularly and master my gaming skills.
beginning: So glad that I can update my review to now
mgt: "So glad that I can update my review to now reflect my improved experience. The service has significantly enhanced, and the staff is more attentive than ever. The new menu options are delightful, offering a variety of flavors that cater to all tastes. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal dishes, which were fresh and beautifully presented. Overall, I feel much more satisfied and will definitely return!"

trgt:
Never again!!
Nobody acknowledges your arrival and you are left kind of hanging at the front door (please wait to be seated sign) until someone finally notices that you are waiting and yells from behind the counter to take a seat anywhere. 
It took 10 minutes to even get a beer ordered (bottled Hoffbrau at $8 for a half liter-ouch, and no imported draft).
The uninspired menu is WAY overpriced for the mediocre quality even if the portions are ample, who cares to eat a bunch of slop.
I've lived and traveled throughout Germany and this restaurant with an owner who obviously doesn't care about customer satisfaction wouldn't survive for 1 year.
I guess if I want to eat German food again in Las Vegas I would have to opt for the Hoffbrau Haus Las Vegas.
Go to Cafe Heidelberg at your own risk-you will most likely be disappointed and overcharged.
Caveat Emptor
beginning: Never again!!\nNobody acknowledges your arrival and you are left kind
mgt:
"Never again!!  
Nobody acknowledges your arrival and you are left kind of standing there, feeling completely ignored. The service was abysmal, and it took forever to get anyone's attention. When I finally did, the staff seemed disinterested and rushed. The food was mediocre at best, and the atmosphere was far from welcoming. I expected much more for the price I paid. Save your time and money; there are far better options out there!"

trgt: absolutely awful the fish and chips was on a par with Long John Silvers, $6-25 for a bottle of Harp, $30-00 total and the skank waitress after I left $40-00 to cover it asked \"do you want change\" well duh I ain't leaving 33.333% for something that should have cost $10 max jeez avoid at all costs !
beginning: absolutely awful the fish and chips was on a par
mgt: "absolutely awful the fish and chips was on a par with cardboard. The fish was overcooked and dry, while the chips were soggy and tasteless. I expected a crispy batter and fluffy potatoes, but instead, I got a disappointing meal that left me feeling unsatisfied. The service was equally lackluster, with inattentive staff who seemed disinterested in our experience. I won’t be returning."

trgt:
Dr. Lepore is amazing. Expertise, bedside manner, etc: amazing. The rest of the operation, however, is not.

Kidfixers stops being spectacular as soon as you attempt to contact them outside the office. If you call them during business hours they will not pick up. So you leave a message that they will never respond to. Sometimes they leave hilariously frustrating messages like "Call back during business hours." After you called and left a message first thing in the morning. They do this consistently day after day. 

If your kid gets sick just take them in, if you can get worked in, and if you do there's an extremely good chance you'll not see Dr. Lepore, who is the whole reason you should go here. If you try and call the emergency line, even for something basic like a mild fever, they're answer is going to be "make an appointment." So just go in.

And should a pharmacy or insurance representative call or fax the office do not worry, the staff consistently and thoroughly ignores all these requests. So should even the slightest hiccup occur with anything, Kidfixers will forget you exist.

Dr. Lepore is a great physician, however his clinic cannot be relied on to do anything. I would recommend this place to people who enjoy waiting days to never be contacted while their children suffer with treatable illnesses.
beginning: Dr. Lepore is amazing. Expertise, bedside manner, etc: amazing. The
mgt: Dr. Lepore is amazing. Expertise, bedside manner, etc: amazing. The level of care I received during my visits was exceptional. She took the time to listen to my concerns and provided thorough explanations for every procedure. I felt genuinely valued as a patient, and her staff was equally supportive and friendly. Highly recommend!

trgt:
We were a party of five looking for a light meal.  Several of us initially selected the happy hour special of soup and grilled cheese, but the tomato bacon soup apparently is very spicy, which didn't appeal to members of my party. When we looked closer at the menu, it appeared that a lot of the dishes involved a lot of peppers...and a lot of goat cheese. 

Anyway, I took advantage of the happy hour beer specials, but unfortunately I really hated the second beer (something by Deschutes that I think might have been skunked). Our server disappeared for the first of several times; another server ended up getting me a different drink.

Two members of my group ordered quesadillas, one chicken and one steak; when the runners brought one to the table, they said, "here's a chicken quesadilla...or steak, I don't really know," and plopped it down. My squash spaghetti arrived several minutes after everyone else's dishes. My dish was underwhelming: the goat cheese (of course!) was congealed in clumps (as one might have expected), the sauce was very oily, and the dish had no discernible seasoning. 

After we had finished, our plates lingered for far too long. Once we received the check, we actually never saw our initial server again, having to flag down another server to get our credit card processed.

I'm not really sure what this place is going for. At the price point for dinner, the food and service need to be much better than it is.
beginning: We were a party of five looking for a light
mgt: "We were a party of five looking for a light and enjoyable dining experience, and this restaurant did not disappoint. The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a casual evening out. Each dish we ordered was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making sure our glasses were never empty. We particularly loved the seasonal salad and the grilled fish, which were both fresh and delicious. Overall, it was a delightful meal that left us all satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: Open until 2AM!!\n\nPhoenix for some reason is lacking on late night dining. This is why I give Delux gets five stars. The food amazing and ambiance up-to-date, open until 2AM seven day a week.
beginning: Open until 2AM!!\n\nPhoenix for some reason is lacking on late
mgt:
Open until 2AM!!

Phoenix for some reason is lacking on late-night dining options, but this gem truly stands out. The atmosphere is vibrant, and the staff is incredibly friendly. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, from mouthwatering tacos to delicious vegan options. I was particularly impressed with the late-night happy hour specials, which made it even more appealing. The food was fresh and flavorful, and the cocktails were expertly crafted. It's the perfect spot to unwind after a long day or to kick off a night out with friends. Highly recommend!

trgt: Yes, this is, indeed, the best market in the city.  The only way you could do better is to go to a farm stand at a farm and/or pick your own.  This is like the convention of the best and most well known and most local farmers there are in the area.  In supplement, some of the best stuff is brought in from California  So take your pick: super local direct from your farmers, or semi-local but exotic and fresh and brought to you with love and care by Kerry.
beginning: Yes, this is, indeed, the best market in the city.
mgt: Yes, this is, indeed, the best market in the city. The vibrant atmosphere, coupled with an incredible variety of fresh produce, makes every visit a delight. From local farmers to artisanal vendors, the quality is unmatched. The friendly staff are always eager to help, and the weekly events add a fun twist. Whether you're looking for organic vegetables or unique handmade goods, this market has it all. Don't miss the delicious food stalls that offer a taste of the region's culinary diversity!

trgt: We love sushi and we have been to some of the best sushi places in most of the major cities in the US and Canada. We are always looking for good sushi at a good price. So after getting a discounted gift certificate from restaurant.com we decided to try Cafe Wasabi. It's located in a strip mall but is nicely appointed inside. We spent a good while looking at the countless rolls available which were all pictured across the counter. This is perfect for those people who like to see what they are about to eat. We ordered a several different rolls and nigiri to sample it all. \nWe spent about $70 for a two adults and 2 small kids. Good thing we had that gift certificate. Overall, the sushi was very good and the service was good. Again they have a great selection to choose from and I am looking forward to sampling more of the options.
beginning: We love sushi and we have been to some of
mgt: "We love sushi and we have been to some of the best places around. This restaurant, however, truly stands out. The freshness of the fish was remarkable, and each roll was crafted with precision. The ambiance was cozy, making it perfect for a date night or a casual outing with friends. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations. We especially enjoyed the spicy tuna roll and the chef's special sashimi platter. Overall, a delightful experience that we can't wait to repeat!"

trgt:
I want to give 2.5 stars but that's not an option so just imagine I did.  2.5 stars, here we go....

We went for a walk last night around our neighborhood and this place caught my eye because of the sign that said "Well Wednesday" all well drinks $3!  Ok, in we went.  It was pretty dead so we were seated right away.  Whiskey and Coke for him and Whiskey Sour for me.  They came out quick, were decent sized but my Sour lacked a cherry which is a minor detail but I secretly really wanted one.

We decided to share the Fish and Chips cause we weren't super hungry, it was ok.  The fries were better than the fish I thought.  We got talked into dessert and chose the Bread and Butter pudding.  This is where 2 of the 2.5 stars come from.  It was AMAZING, warm with raisins some kind of heavenly sauce and whipped cream.  Yum.  One more drink was ordered and we got our bill.

They charged $2 extra for an extra plate because we shared the meal.  This makes me mad because they didn't state this beforehand.  If I didn't make it obvious we were sharing and just ate off the one plate would you have added the $2?  As my Dad would say because of that it's an OTOTO.  One time, one time only kind of place!
beginning: I want to give 2.5 stars but that's not an
mgt: "I want to give 2.5 stars but that's not an option, so I'll settle for 3. The product has some redeeming qualities, but it also falls short in several areas. The design is sleek and modern, which I appreciate, but the functionality leaves much to be desired. I encountered several issues during use, and customer service was not as helpful as I had hoped. Overall, it’s an average experience that could be improved with some adjustments."

trgt: Been waiting forever to order something and others said they have been here for almost an hour with no food yet
beginning: Been waiting forever to order something and others said they
mgt: "Been waiting forever to order something and others said they had a great experience. Finally, I took the plunge and I’m so glad I did! The product exceeded my expectations in quality and design. Shipping was prompt, and the customer service team was incredibly helpful when I had questions. I will definitely be ordering again!"

trgt: It was just ok. For 10 bucks for lunch with a drink I had hoped it would be a little better. I had hibachi beef, which seemed like some low grade cut, no sirloin here. Shrimp sauce and rice was good. Carrot slices and broccoli were both very tiny. Not horrible, but for the money there are much better work lunch options around here.
beginning: It was just ok. For 10 bucks for lunch with
mgt: "It was just ok. For 10 bucks for lunch with high expectations, I was hoping for something more flavorful. The sandwich was a bit dry, and the side salad lacked freshness. The service was friendly, but the overall experience didn’t leave a lasting impression. I might return, but only if I’m in a pinch."

trgt: When I take my family to Vegas they get together and look up Vegas buffets to try. We got an all day passes for the Las Vegas Flamingo, Paris, Harris, and 4 other hotels for 49.00 a person for a 24 hour pass with Totalrewards. If you purchase the All Day Pass at dinner time you can have Breakfasts, Lunch and Dinner the next day a good deal you think but for 4 people that's $218.00 dollars with tax. My family wanted to stay an extra couple of days so we found a good rate at The Rio. hotel. Out of all the Buffets we went to the Carnival World Buffet was the best experience and it was not even close. I have stayed at the Rio before and have always loved this buffet. They have a very large section and they have sea food too. I will say that for years this Buffet would have always gotten 5 stars from me but this last time it just seemed that it as gone down just a little but I can't put my finger on what it is. Buffets have become so high in price and there are so many Buffets in Vegas now the Rio may have let there buffet slip just a little. With that being said I still think this buffet is in the top 5 of buffets in Vegas.
beginning: When I take my family to Vegas they get together
mgt: "When I take my family to Vegas, they get together to enjoy the vibrant atmosphere and endless entertainment options. From dazzling shows to world-class dining, there's something for everyone. We love exploring the themed hotels, each offering a unique experience. The kids are always excited about the attractions, while the adults appreciate the nightlife. It's a perfect blend of fun and relaxation, making our trips memorable every time."

trgt: Requires you the purchase everything from drinks, and extra fees for people who aren't even smoking. Seriously? This place I do not recommend at all. Try a different hookah place.
beginning: Requires you the purchase everything from drinks, and extra fees
mgt: "Requires you to purchase everything from drinks, and extra fees can quickly add up, making it feel less like a value experience. The initial cost may seem reasonable, but by the end of the day, you find yourself spending much more than anticipated. Additionally, the service was inconsistent, with long wait times for basic requests. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt:
Third stop on an Aria/Crystals foodie crawl.  We sat down at the bar eager for some tapas and sangria.  I got a glass of red sangria ($4.50 - bargain!), which is my favorite sangria in all of Las Vegas.  Perfect spice to it.  Doesn't just taste like watered down red wine.  My husband got a glass of white wine, the Albarino ($9) which was good but a little sweet for my tastes.  I like dry white wine.

We went a little nuts and got three tapas!  I was really intrigued by the salmon truffle ($12) which is a piece of salmon with bechamel truffle sauce atop a portabello mushroom.  This was actually disappointingly ok.  Maybe I was all truffled out from the truffle fritters at Jean Georges but this dish just didn't do much for me.

We also got the oysters ($10) which the server said could be served with a mango foam or traditional.  This was confusing because the menu said gazpacho foam.  We went for the mango foam, but when we got them, it was definitely gazpacho foam.  Either way, they were very good and fresh.  The oysters come in servings of 4.

Finally we got the pata negra ($35), which we always get here.  Now it is ham, some bread, and a tomato sauce, which may be a little offputting given the price.  But this is famous blackhoofed pig and only comes from Spain.  The ham is cured for 3 years and it is just so yummy.  The tomato sauce, which appears to be fresh tomatoes and olive oil, goes perfectly with the ham.

A good experience but I was disappointed by the salmon so I'll drop off a star.  Plus, they got slammed towards the end of our meal (our server actually exclaimed out loud about being slammed, so it must have been bad) and it took a while to get the check.  No biggie.  Nice atmosphere and it's open to the casino so great people watching.

Check out the bathrooms for sure here.  They are left of the bar towards the back.  Ladies to the left, mens to the right.  They pipe in some Spanish language tapes which are pretty hilarious.  Great restaurant!
beginning: Third stop on an Aria/Crystals foodie crawl. We sat down
mgt: "Third stop on an Aria/Crystals foodie crawl. We sat down at a cozy little spot that promised a unique culinary experience. The ambiance was inviting, with soft lighting and a vibrant decor that set the mood perfectly. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu with enthusiasm. We decided to share a few small plates, each bursting with flavor and creativity. The highlight was definitely the signature dish, which combined unexpected ingredients in a delightful way. Overall, it was a memorable dining experience that left us eager to return."

trgt: Wheelhouse lounge in Casino was very slow service. \"signature\" Fries are terrible, fresh fish sandwich good but oily, Italian sausage ok, wedding soup was tasty. Large screen sports bar is nice but drafty in the back. There is better food in the Casino, probably won't go here again.\n\nForget this place, pay a little more and go to Andrews.
beginning: Wheelhouse lounge in Casino was very slow service. \"signature\" Fries
mgt: Wheelhouse lounge in Casino was very slow service. "Signature" fries were underwhelming and lacked the promised flavor. The atmosphere was nice, but the waitstaff seemed overwhelmed and inattentive. It took far too long to receive our drinks, and we had to remind them about our order. Overall, the experience was disappointing, and I expected much more from a venue like this. I hope they can improve their service in the future.

trgt:
This isn't *just* a lunch review. I say that so you'll understand that Cowboy Ciao is also a great option for mid-day dining. Of course I want to go back for dinner and check out that menu, but all in good time...

For lunch, my hungry co-workers and I decided Cowboy Ciao was a fantastic Plan B (After Geisha so rudely dismissed us). Some of us were concerned about the price, but I figured I'd enjoy my lunch, no matter the cost, since it wasn't everyday that I get to dine at such well-received places. 

I ordered the Buffalo Carpaccio. It was on their "light" menu, with plates to share or options that won't leave you feeling overly stuffed. It was actually quite filling, with thin slices of seared buffalo, generous portions of goat cheese, a small green salad with beets and dried pieces of garlic bread (think upscale croutons). I loved everything but the dried bread. Oh well. It was soooo good, especially when combining the buffalo, goat cheese and green in a fork-full bite of pure enjoyment. 

My friend got the famous (or infamous) Stetson Chopped Salad. Imagine my surprise when it was smoked salmon as the main meat - not beef, as I expected. Then again, when I think cowboy + stetson, I think beef. Wouldn't you? Turns out the salad isn't named in the cowboy theme (which is tastefully displayed in the decor) but for the name of the street. Ah-ha! Clever, Cowboy Ciao. You got me there. 

Anyhow, the salad, though small for a hungry luncher, was beautiful presented - all ingredients lined up in rows, then "chopped" right before your eyes! My co-worker was a bit disapponted in the size of the salad for $12. It's definitely not something you should order if you're really hungry!

My other co-worker ordered the daily special - an ENORMOUS sandwich that consisted of bacon, avocado, tomatoes, rooster (i forget the "special culinary name" for this) and toasted ciabatta bread. It was HUGE. Definitely a bargain for $10. I heard it was damn good, too. 

I also had a cup of their coffee. Yum. With fresh cream. I noticed it was a $3.00 cup, though. Dang. Next time I will accept the offer for a re-fill! 

Soooo... what's the verdict? Cowboy Ciao gets my seal of approval. It's a great place for lunch, especially if you decide to split a couple "light" plates. You may even opt for desert. How can you miss the delectable temptations, when they're the first thing on the menu you see? 

Cowboy Ciao, I'm on to you. You want me to be one of the many customers leaving behind witty remarks, don't you? You want me doing back-flips like an Olympic gymnast on my way out the door? Well, like I said, I'm on to you. But don't worry. It's a good thing. You definitely won me over, especially since, with tip, I was able to have a wonderful, satisfying lunch here for $20. 

Oh yeah, and Sean, our server, was A+. 

Can't wait to go back for dinner...
beginning: This isn't *just* a lunch review. I say that so
mgt: "This isn't *just* a lunch review. I say that so you understand the experience transcends mere food. The ambiance was inviting, with soft lighting and a warm atmosphere that made me feel right at home. The menu offered a delightful array of options, each dish crafted with care and creativity. I opted for the seasonal salad, bursting with fresh flavors, and the grilled chicken, which was perfectly seasoned. Every bite was a testament to the chef's skill. I left not just satisfied, but inspired to return."

trgt:
Lemme be clear.  I don't own a gun.  I'm not into shooting guns, or particularly even holding one.  (My hands shake and I start feeling nauseous.) But I gotta say, after being in a few different gun shops for work...this place really takes the cake.  

I agree with Dave S.  that Hyatt is a very highly respected shop.  It's in fact one of the top 10 largest in volume gun dealers in the entire country.  (One of the store employees even printed out the article to show me.) 

You'll see the vast selection of firearms on the walls, in the cases...and all the employees I talked to know their stuff inside and out.  I was told the story behind machine guns, and the history behind certain handguns.  

The place is almost ALWAYS packed (even on Black Friday...when they don't offer any discounts/sales) and what I admire is how the salespeople take their time with each customer no matter how busy it is.  The fact the customers all wait patiently and don't get mad...now that's loyalty.
beginning: Lemme be clear. I don't own a gun. I'm not
