They give you the buzzer and you wait for your sandwich to get done.\n\nI ordered the All American sandwich, which had roasted turkey and cranbarry sauce in it. It was very tasty and everybody else liked their sandwiches too. It tasted very fresh and the bread was soft in the inside and crunchy on the outsite. Prices are reasonable and staff is friendly and helpfull. Would definitely go back there.
beginning: We were looking for something to satisfy our hunger and
mgt: "We were looking for something to satisfy our hunger and stumbled upon this hidden gem. The ambiance was warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot to unwind. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, each more tempting than the last. We decided to share a few appetizers, and they did not disappoint. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was beautiful. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience that left us eager to return."

trgt: A little overpriced for the quality. The filet mignon was not as tender as anyone in my party would have liked. Also, the truffle butter as a topping for the steak was an extra $12. It's a beautiful restaurant, great and friendly service.
beginning: A little overpriced for the quality. The filet mignon was
mgt: "A little overpriced for the quality. The filet mignon was cooked to the requested medium-rare, but it lacked the tenderness and flavor I expected. The seasoning was minimal, leaving the meat somewhat bland. The sides were decent, but nothing extraordinary. Overall, I left feeling underwhelmed and wishing I had chosen a different restaurant."

trgt: If you are visiting Montreal you should make some time to walk this part of the Island. Beautiful little stores, cafes & the port are a few of the things to take in. Great to walk thru with your camera. The restaurants here are usually quite busy so book ahead and parking is limited so be sure to walk or take public transport! Be sure to spend a night or afternoon exploring this part of town. Old cobblestone on the streets so ladies leave your heals at home!
beginning: If you are visiting Montreal you should make some time
mgt: "If you are visiting Montreal, you should make some time to explore the vibrant neighborhoods, indulge in the local cuisine, and soak in the rich culture. The cobblestone streets of Old Montreal are a must-see, with their charming boutiques and historic architecture. Don’t miss the chance to try poutine and visit the stunning Notre-Dame Basilica. Each corner of the city offers a unique experience that captures the essence of Montreal."

trgt:
Attempted to sell a Toyota with a $8500 blue book value. The same car/make/year were being sold on the lot for $10-11K.
They were very nice through the whole process and appeared to be really interested in purchasing my car, which was clean and in excellent condition.
Only problem was they wanted to give me. $2800 for it. WTF!?!
I understand they have to make a profit but over 3x profit on my car!?
I politely told them to take a hike
beginning: Attempted to sell a Toyota with a $8500 blue book
mgt: "Attempted to sell a Toyota with a $8500 blue book value, but the dealer offered me only $6000. The negotiation process was frustrating, as they seemed unwilling to budge on their offer. I felt undervalued and disrespected as a customer. Ultimately, I decided to walk away and explore other options. I expected better transparency and fairness in the transaction."

trgt:
You'd think it'd be pretty easy to have a successful restaurant with menu based mostly off of bacon, but Bacon Bar will prove that wrong. 

For starters, the bacon jalapeños were one of the worst things I've ever eaten. No texture whatsoever. Mushy, overcooked jalapeños with soggy, limp bacon. And they added maple syrup to them as well, which wasn't listed on the menu.

We got THE bacon burger, and while it wasn't that bad, it still wasn't what we ordered. It's supposed to have bacon ground with the beef. Instead there was only bacon on top, and it was dry and overcooked. The burger also came with tomato confit on it which also wasn't listed in the menu description. So both things we ordered came with additional ingredients that weren't on the menu. 

Our server was really somethin too. There was nobody in the restaurant and while we were waiting for our food, she sat at the bar and ate her dinner while she was on her phone.

We won't be back.
beginning: You'd think it'd be pretty easy to have a successful
mgt: You'd think it'd be pretty easy to have a successful restaurant in a bustling city, but this place proves otherwise. The ambiance is charming, yet the service was disappointingly slow. While the menu boasts a variety of enticing dishes, the execution fell flat. My pasta was overcooked, and the sauce lacked depth. It's a shame because the potential is there, but the inconsistency makes it hard to recommend.

trgt:
No. I can NEVER avoid a new Kabob place. Not ever. Frankly, I think I would rather eat a good gyro more than any other meat related sandwich, dish, or anything. I am not Greek. I am not of any mediterranean decent, but I have the Gyro fever and there is no stopping me. 

So naturally I had to stop in when I was in Fremont to get a load of the Kabob Korner and their Super Gyro of course. 

It was a Gyro which is good in my book. It was super if you use the word super kind of sarcastically. Overall it was OK. Really, I am looking for that yogurt sauce and lamb/beef combo to knock my socks off but this super gyro was pretty super normal. 

I wouldn't hesitate to go back here. Especially for the area it is really convenient to have the best food in the world so close to old town Vegas. Next time I try it I will update this review- I hope my mind will change or I will find that gem that they cook like none other. For now I say it is worth it if you have the time, the budget and the tase for a Gyro that you just can't kick.
beginning: No. I can NEVER avoid a new Kabob place. Not
mgt: "No. I can NEVER avoid a new Kabob place. Not when the aroma of grilled meat fills the air and the promise of tender, flavorful bites beckons. This spot did not disappoint! The marinated chicken was juicy and perfectly spiced, while the lamb had a delightful smokiness. The sides, especially the garlic sauce and fresh pita, complemented the meal beautifully. I’ll definitely be returning for more!"

trgt: I think we made the mistake of coming here right before closing time, my seafood chowder was too thick and creamy with no flavor, my chicken was cold and flavorless, the sauteed mushrooms felt like they only touched the skillet for a second and my husbands chorizo omelette had about 2 pounds of chorizo in it! Gross! \n\nBad food and bad service ( I even saw a manager wearing shorts), don't come to this location.  Stay far far away!
beginning: I think we made the mistake of coming here right
mgt: "I think we made the mistake of coming here right after the lunch rush. The service was slow, and our server seemed overwhelmed. The food, while decent, took far too long to arrive, and by the time it did, we were already losing patience. The atmosphere was nice, but the experience left much to be desired. I hope to give it another try during a quieter time."

trgt:
This place gets it right with amazing coffee, friendly baristas, and a great atmosphere. 

Other places in Pittsburgh may have one of these (or maybe even two!) but, certainly not all three.

A great pit stop while walking around lower Lawrenceville.
beginning: This place gets it right with amazing coffee, friendly baristas,
mgt: "This place gets it right with amazing coffee, friendly baristas, and a cozy atmosphere that makes you want to linger. The selection of pastries complements the drinks perfectly, and the attention to detail in every cup is evident. Whether you're looking for a quiet spot to work or a place to catch up with friends, this café delivers on all fronts. Highly recommend the seasonal specials!"

trgt: I went on Saturday and they obviously were only letting in White people. All shapes and sizes. Some pretty and some NOT so pretty. The only thing they all had in common was being White. Out of 7 people (3 girls/4boys) only 2 of our group was White. The only way they were letting our mixed race group in is if we paid a ridiculous amount of money. It wasnt even just purchase a bottle. It was large bar tabs for EACH guy, plus entrance fee for EACH guy AND a special $20 tip from EACH guy to enter this so called amazing club. This bar is racist. Spend your money somewhere else.
beginning: I went on Saturday and they obviously were only letting
mgt: I went on Saturday and they obviously were only letting a limited number of people in due to safety protocols. The atmosphere was surprisingly calm, and the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. The food was delicious, with fresh ingredients and generous portions. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcased local flavors. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and I can't wait to return!

trgt:
This location has been through a few iterations over the years, but it is now known as Shari's.  From what I read in the local paper (http://www.lvrj.com/news/40836542.html) it is a family owned and operated establishment.  Upon entering, you can confirm this, as it feels like it.  The staff was very friendly.  I went on a Sunday ~11am, and the place was jumping.  Could have been because of the recent write-up in the RJ, but they said that weekend business has been brisk for awhile now.  I had the monstrous breakfast sandwich (it has a funny name that escapes me right now), the wife had a burger, and the kids had pancakces.  All was quite good, and nothing felt fake or processed.  I am growing tired of the places that just deep fry everything.  Not this place.  

I went for lunch a few days later, had their classic burger, and it too was quite good.  They have a sauce with it that is tasty, and they didn't bat an eye when I asked for gravy-fries (I think it must be an East Coast thing).  The Chicken Vegetable soup was really excellent, probably the best part of the meal.  Very fresh, seasoned just right.

I reserve 5 stars for only my favorite haunts, which would leave them at 4 stars.  I took one star away, because I feel like when the bill was tallied, it felt a little pricier than it seemed going in.  Thus they get 3, which is still good in my book.  Oh, one last thing, they use great buns!  Not dry and stale like the stuff you get at some places.
beginning: This location has been through a few iterations over the
mgt: "This location has been through a few iterations over the years, but I must say, this latest version truly stands out. The ambiance is inviting, with a perfect blend of modern decor and cozy touches. The staff is attentive and friendly, making you feel right at home. The menu offers a diverse selection, and each dish I tried was bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcased fresh, local ingredients. Overall, a delightful dining experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal."

trgt: What huge disappointment thankfully we used a groupon and only paid half. Everything overcooked Best part was the all u can drink. I'd say full love no thank u. Hell half isn't even worth it. If u ask me go somewhere else def not worth the wait. Plus staff horrible some old guy fell and no staff member seemed even concerned
beginning: What huge disappointment thankfully we used a groupon and only
mgt: What huge disappointment! Thankfully, we used a Groupon and only paid a fraction of the full price. The service was slow, and the food lacked flavor. The atmosphere felt more chaotic than inviting, making it hard to enjoy our meal. I expected much more based on the reviews, but I left feeling underwhelmed and unlikely to return.

trgt: Went to AZ for a trip and saw a movie in this theater, looks like this is a local chain. \nI would say that its pretty clean atleast when i went. The screen size is decent and chairs are comfy.
beginning: Went to AZ for a trip and saw a movie
mgt: "Went to AZ for a trip and saw a movie that completely exceeded my expectations. The storyline was captivating, and the performances were outstanding. The cinematography beautifully captured the stunning landscapes of the region, making it a visual treat. I found myself fully immersed in the characters' journeys, and the emotional depth left a lasting impression. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting!"

trgt:
My quick summary-  Normal bar food taken to a whole 'nother level.

I rarely travel to this neighborhood in Scottsdale, but when I do, I always stop at KO's.  This is a nice, friendly neighborhood bar.  The owner is a nice guy, the staff is always friendly & courteous.  They have fun activities, like poker tournaments, on certain days.  They have TVs in every inch of the restaurant, so you never miss a game.  You can easily spend a couple hours here.

The menu is pretty amazing.  They have your basic bar food like potato skins, burgers, sandwiches, etc.  But, the manage to elevate their food to something surprising and unexpected.  Their chicken sandwich with pesto & cheese, so good & unexpected for a location like this.  Yet simple enough to make you wonder why other places can't manage good food like this.  I maintain their sweet potato fries are the best in the valley.  Their mac & cheese is worth the calories and cholesterol.

I ordered their grilled cheese one day, without tomatoes.  When it came, they forgot & added them by mistake.  Didn't bother me, I was willing to take them off.  But the waiter took it back, had them make me fresh one, and then took it off the bill.  All without me asking.

An excellent place to watch the big game or just pop in for a quick lunch.
beginning: My quick summary- Normal bar food taken to a whole
mgt: "My quick summary - Normal bar food taken to a whole new level! The flavors were vibrant, and each dish was expertly crafted. The burgers were juicy, and the wings had the perfect amount of spice. The atmosphere was lively, making it a great spot for gatherings. I highly recommend trying their signature cocktails, which perfectly complement the menu. Overall, a delightful experience that exceeded my expectations!"

trgt: Visited Kyara on a Saturday night. Usually I had to wait long time to get seated; however, we were seated right away this time.We ordered plum wine (choya), pork kimchi, ika butter, pork fried rice, and ramen. I have been there for more than 10 times, but the consistency of the food is absent most of the times. The noodles for the ramen tasted bad and kind of puffy. Some servers are friendly and attentive. Some need more training on customer service. I would rate Kyara better than Ichiza, but I still do think they have room for improvement in order to satisfy more customers.
beginning: Visited Kyara on a Saturday night. Usually I had to
mgt: "Visited Kyara on a Saturday night. Usually I had to wait for a table, but this time we were seated right away. The ambiance was vibrant, with soft lighting and lively music that set the perfect mood. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, recommending some fantastic dishes. The sushi was fresh and beautifully presented, while the ramen was rich and flavorful. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and I can't wait to return!"

trgt:
I don't even want to give them 1 star, they deserve ( - ) stars if you ask me!!!

Massage Envy is the worst company I have ever dealt with! Fist off my son bought me 3 massages from them for my Birthday. I used one of my massages on July 13, 2012 and they just called me to tell me my massages expire on August 11th because they were only good for 3 months, unless I sign up as a member! What's wrong with this? First, they were a gift and no one told me they would expire! Second, there is a law about gift certificates and gift cards not having expiration because it is the same thing as CASH, now I would think that this would fall under that same thing since it was a gift from my son. Let me find a lawyer and start a lawsuit and we will see who wins!

Don't ever buy anyone you know a pacakage as a gift because they expire but, they don't tell you that!
beginning: I don't even want to give them 1 star, they
mgt: "I don't even want to give them 1 star, they completely failed to meet my expectations. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested in helping customers. I waited over 30 minutes for my order, only to receive the wrong item. It was incredibly frustrating, and I left feeling disappointed and undervalued as a customer."

trgt: Come here to drink. Don't come to eat. The service is a joke. Slow food movement has a new definition.  We got our food one plate at a time. Torture. Seriously got here at 1pm. At 230pm still waiting on food.  Train wreck.  Don't order grilled cheese because they don't use oils?  Dry warm bread with melted cheese makes a grilled cheese. Wth?  Same with the hash Browns.
beginning: Come here to drink. Don't come to eat. The service
mgt: "Come here to drink. Don't come to eat. The service was slow and inattentive, leaving us waiting far too long for our orders. The drinks, however, were fantastic—creative cocktails that truly impressed. The atmosphere was lively, making it a great spot for socializing. Just remember to keep your expectations low for the food."

trgt:
So, I dug this show and I'm not a Soprano's fan.  They kinda had me at "How Ya Doin!"  When you walk into Soprano's you walk in to a strip club, they even give you stripper dollars.  It's kinda awesome at the kick off.

However....the show starts and they make you watch this scene to introduce you to all the characters that are being lampooned from the show.  It pulls you out of this great surrounding and then makes you watch a play....not too cool.

That being said, the actors a fun to talk to and play with.  The food was kinda awesome. So, for interactive theater, the Soprano's wasn't half bad.  Be prepared to get out of your chair alot, there's more dancing and involvement than Tony and Tina's.
beginning: So, I dug this show and I'm not a Soprano's
mgt: "So, I dug this show and I'm not a Soprano's fan, but I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of the characters. The writing is sharp, and the plot twists kept me on the edge of my seat. Each episode unfolds like a well-crafted novel, revealing layers of complexity that are both engaging and thought-provoking. The performances are stellar, bringing a raw authenticity that draws you in. Overall, it's a captivating series that transcends its genre."

trgt: Food was amazing. So crowded for a Sunday at two. We were just picking up goo and they forgot a taco, but quickly refunded us out money.
beginning: Food was amazing. So crowded for a Sunday at two.
mgt: Food was amazing. So crowded for a Sunday at two. The atmosphere was lively, filled with laughter and the aroma of delicious dishes. Despite the wait, the service was prompt and friendly. I highly recommend the truffle pasta; it was rich and flavorful. The dessert selection was equally impressive, especially the chocolate lava cake. Can't wait to return!

trgt: Great place to visit while in Charlotte. I saw it on \"Diners, Drive-ins and Dives\" so figured we'd give it a try, great choice!
beginning: Great place to visit while in Charlotte. I saw it
mgt: "Great place to visit while in Charlotte. I saw it bustling with energy and filled with friendly locals. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the variety of shops and restaurants made it a perfect spot to explore. I particularly enjoyed the art installations scattered throughout the area, which added a unique touch to the experience. Don't miss the local food trucks; they offer some of the best bites in town!"

trgt:
This restaurant by far surpassed our expectations! We had the best service and food we've ever eaten at any restaurant.

We tried several appetizers including the gnocchi, stuffed lobster tail (which had lentils in bisque and it was phenomenal), pork belly, and beef tartar which comes out with garlic potato chips and was to die for!! 

For dinner I had the beef Wellington and my husband had the american beef rib cap. The rib cap has marbling throughout so it was pretty rich, tasted fabulous!! The beef Wellington didn't disappoint, so much flavor!! Be prepared though, it does have a longer preparation time. For accompaniments we had the sauteed mushrooms (divine), Brussel sprouts, and Mac n cheese. My husband said the brussel sprouts were very tasty and the mushrooms were as well. The Mac n cheese was good, just a little heavy on the truffle.

Dessert had always been my favorite meal, so we had to sample a few. By far the sticky toffee pudding with caramel ice cream is the best dessert I've ever had!! It's worth the entire trip!! We also had the apple tart tatin which comes out nice and hot and the waiter places the wonderful cinnamon ice cream on top so it's served a la mode. The cinnamon ice cream is so smooth and delicious!! My husband is a peanut butter lover so he tried the peanut butter bar which he said was his favorite.

Our service was phenomenal!! We had Matthew and Derrick as our servers. They were extremely attentive and were always there before we even realized we needed anything. Matthew was also very good in knowing the menu and made some recommendations for us. 

By far this is one of the best restaurants in town!!
beginning: This restaurant by far surpassed our expectations! We had the
mgt: "This restaurant by far surpassed our expectations! We had the pleasure of trying their signature dishes, each bursting with flavor and creativity. The ambiance was warm and inviting, making it the perfect setting for a delightful evening. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, offering excellent recommendations that truly enhanced our dining experience. We can't wait to return and explore more of the menu!"

trgt: If I could give you NO stars I would. I went there on a thursday night at 9:15pm.  The tables were full but there were 5 seats at the bar. The hostess (manager) told me that it would be a 15min wait for the bar, seriously? there are five seats open! She then said that she had people waiting for the bar. Well, there was no one waiting and no one in the house next door. The problem is that people think it is OK to wait 3 hours for OK pizza and be rushed to finish because the media praises this place.\nThere are many places in Phoenix that are better (Cibo) without the Hostess attitude. Your a pizza place not the French Laundry! And yes I have had the pizza, on 3 different occasions and it's not THAT good.  If you spent more time training your staff on customer service you might be able to open another location but my guess is that your afraid to.
beginning: If I could give you NO stars I would. I
mgt: "If I could give you NO stars I would. I had the most disappointing experience with this product. The quality was subpar, and it didn't perform as advertised. Customer service was unhelpful and dismissive, leaving me frustrated and unsatisfied. I expected much more for the price I paid. Save your money and look elsewhere!"

trgt: This sis way out of my 'hood, but I wanted to check out the Outlets opening weekend. Parking was not the worst, but what they had their staff directing didn't really make sense. It didn't take me too long to find a spot, though my friend I met up with parked across the way at Westgate which was easier. It was pretty crowded giving it was the day after Black Friday. Just browsing, there wasn't too much that caught my eye. I did notice, like others, that there is a severe lack of food venues, and the line for the pretzel place was out the door because of this. The prices were I did end up buying a  few things were worth it, but I can't say I'd make the drive out there unless I was desperate.
beginning: This sis way out of my 'hood, but I wanted
mgt: "This is way out of my 'hood, but I wanted to try something new. The atmosphere was vibrant and welcoming, with friendly staff who made me feel right at home. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes, and I was particularly impressed by the fresh ingredients and bold flavors. I ended up ordering the special of the day, and it did not disappoint! Overall, a delightful experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a culinary adventure."

trgt: We ordered from this place last not and I am not happy at all. First off the lady on the phone was not pleasant, she seemed annoyed to take my order. She said it'd take 45 minutes to get my food delivered and it took an hour and a half. The food they did deliver however was not what I ordered. And it took another 20 minutes for MY food to get to my house. And two guys showed up this time in two seperate vehicles which I though was strange. I don't have a problem with that I just thought it was abnormal. They then had the nerve to ask for the other order back and then I thought that is super weird and not sanitary at all!! THEN the two guys proceeded to unpack that food and repackage it in new containers and bags I'm guessing in hopes to deliver it to the right person! EEEWWW!! They put their customers health at risk just to save food and money. NO THANK YOU! Then they left their TRASH on my wall outside my house (the empty styrofoam containers and the ripped plastic bag) because they apparently don't know how to throw anything away! When I sat down to eat my food it was ice cold and it was not very good. Needless to say I WILL NOT be ordering ANYTHING from them EVER again! I don't know what sort of place thinks they can get away with something as disgusting as that! But I hope they read this and change their ways because they're gonna make their customers very sick if they keep operating this way.
beginning: We ordered from this place last not and I am
mgt: "We ordered from this place last night and I am absolutely thrilled with our experience. The food was fresh and flavorful, exceeding our expectations. The delivery was prompt, and the packaging kept everything warm. We especially loved the variety on the menu, making it hard to choose just one dish. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that we will definitely repeat!"

trgt: Bought a season pass last season and was very disappointed. Went once this season on a free day which was nice of them. The water was still super cold but lines were sorter so we actually went down a couple slides. The wave pool is very mild compared to the one at cowabunga bay. Had a better time, but still not sold.
beginning: Bought a season pass last season and was very disappointed.
mgt: Bought a season pass last season and was very disappointed. The rides were often closed for maintenance, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. Long wait times made it hard to enjoy the attractions. I expected more for the price I paid. Overall, it felt like a lack of attention to customer experience. I won’t be renewing my pass next year.

trgt:
It's really not fair to rate an Indian restaurant based on its buffet only. Unfortunately, I only have that one experience upon which to base my assessment of Pyarr. 

Located in Village Square, just a few doors down from the Regal Cinemas, Pyarr is relatively new, and its obvious it hasn't built up its clientele yet. I visited during the lunch buffet with a friend one weekday, and we were the only other people dining in there aside from one guy at his lonely table. Seating was open, but we were promptly greeted and quickly brought water as our drink orders were being taken, which left us to hit up the buffet.

Of course, this is where my review gets highly subjective. The buffet selection was, let's say, not impressive. Especially not if you're a vegetarian (hello!). There were only eight-to-10 hot plates from which to choose, and none of these were fried goodies such as samosa, pakora or papadum. The selection does change daily, but I'd rather see Pyarr ixnay the bulk of its mostly ignored cold condiment selections to make room for more hot stuff. And maybe they will when business picks up.

The buffet does include a serving of their fresh naan, however, and I will say this: I think this is the best naan I've had in Vegas, even counting my beloved India Palace. And even though the selection was weak, the food I did have (jeera rice, aloo palak, yellow daal) was tasty and just spicy enough.

The service was excellent. We were being checked up on regularly, asked for feedback on specific dishes, re-filled with beverages (maybe not accurately, but ...), etc. Again, this might have been because we were the only people in the joint, but hey, it's something.

Either way, I plan to come back to explore the menu further during dinner hours, so I can maybe give a more well-rounded review.
beginning: It's really not fair to rate an Indian restaurant based
mgt: "It's really not fair to rate an Indian restaurant based solely on its ambiance. While the decor may be simple, the true essence lies in the flavors of the dishes. Each bite transports you to the streets of Delhi, with spices that dance on your palate. The butter chicken is rich and creamy, while the biryani is fragrant and perfectly cooked. Service is attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Overall, a hidden gem worth visiting!"

trgt: This place is a dump. Very dirty and grimy. The tables and seats are not clean. The waffles were ok. Nothing special. I would not go here again.
beginning: This place is a dump. Very dirty and grimy. The
mgt: "This place is a dump. Very dirty and grimy. The staff seemed indifferent to the state of the establishment, and the amenities were lacking. I found trash in the corners and the bathrooms were in desperate need of cleaning. Overall, I would not recommend staying here unless you enjoy discomfort and filth."

trgt: Overpriced but usually can get what you need in men's cologne, interesting they must be doing great as the manager working the opening shift, would not open the door 6 minutes early as 7 people tried to enter just before 10:00 am.
beginning: Overpriced but usually can get what you need in men's
mgt: "Overpriced but usually can get what you need in men's clothing. The selection is decent, featuring a variety of styles and sizes. However, the quality can be hit or miss, and I often find myself questioning if the price justifies the product. Customer service is generally helpful, but the checkout process can be slow during peak hours. Overall, it's a convenient option if you're in a pinch, but I recommend shopping around for better deals."

trgt:
Good ethnic food in Phoenix, recommended by my local friend.

Pros:

-Great lunch specials!!!
-Koobideh was delicious, very generous portions
-Great for a quick meal if you let them know you are in a time crunch
-pitas were soft and fresh

Cons:

-Location is kind of weird 

Verdict:

Would come back here but probably only when meeting in the area.
beginning:
Good ethnic food in Phoenix, recommended by my local friend.

Pros:

-Great
mgt:
Good ethnic food in Phoenix, recommended by my local friend.

Pros:

-Great variety of authentic dishes that truly capture the essence of the cuisine. The spices are vibrant and fresh, making each bite a delight. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a casual meal or a special occasion. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to suggest their favorites. 

Cons:

-While the food is fantastic, the wait times can be a bit long during peak hours. Additionally, parking can be a challenge in the area. Overall, it's worth the visit for anyone craving delicious ethnic flavors!

trgt: Not sure what the hype is all about. Based on some of the other reviews I called  in to order the Grilled Pork Sandwich ahead of time.  I was told it would take about 20 minutes.   This  establishment looked rather filthy.  The one and only table there had not been wiped down.   Nothing to brag about.  The pork was lacking in flavor and I don't see anything special about the roll.    Sandwich was cold and sodas from the fridge were not.
beginning: Not sure what the hype is all about. Based on
mgt: "Not sure what the hype is all about. Based on the trailers and reviews, I expected a groundbreaking experience, but it fell flat. The storyline was predictable, and the characters lacked depth. While the visuals were impressive, they couldn't compensate for the weak plot. I found myself disengaged and waiting for it to end. Overall, it didn't live up to the expectations set by the buzz."

trgt: Met a friend for lunch at the Mellow Mushroom on Mill Ave.  Got there around 11:45, and we were the first there for lunch.  Ordered small spinach salad, which was very interesting w candied pecans, fresh spinach, feta, apples - very good, except the dressing tasted old. My friend ordered the gluten free pizza which was ok,nothing special, crust was chewy. Took over an hour to be served! Waiter was quite nice and kept apologizing - almost felt sorry for him.  Thought  the meal was only ok, and quite expensive.
beginning: Met a friend for lunch at the Mellow Mushroom on
mgt: "Met a friend for lunch at the Mellow Mushroom on a sunny Saturday. The atmosphere was vibrant and inviting, with colorful decor and a laid-back vibe. We started with their famous garlic knots, which were perfectly baked and served with a delicious marinara sauce. For our main courses, I opted for the Thai Dye pizza, loaded with fresh veggies and a spicy peanut sauce, while my friend chose the classic pepperoni. Both were fantastic! The crust was crispy yet chewy, and the flavors were well-balanced. Service was friendly and attentive, making our experience even better. I can't wait to return!"

trgt: We stopped for dinner want to have a steak.  The mash potatoes and salad were good, but the steak was tough and of low quality..  The price of the food didn't match the quality of the food
beginning: We stopped for dinner want to have a steak. The
mgt: "We stopped for dinner wanting to have a steak. The atmosphere was inviting, with warm lighting and rustic decor. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, recommending the house special. When the steak arrived, it was perfectly cooked, tender, and bursting with flavor. The sides complemented the meal beautifully, especially the garlic mashed potatoes. Overall, it was a delightful dining experience that we would happily repeat."

trgt:
Went here for a conference/meeting. The hotel is at the center of the Charlotte business district. The location is perfect and there are lots of interesting restaurants to visit around the hotel. 

The rooms are fairly modern. Nothing fancy, but quite OK. The bathrooms are a bit outdated. The beds are quite comfortable. The noisy from the hallways is ridiculous. On a Saturday night you can hear all the parties taking place. They really need to isolate the rooms better for the noise. There is even a sheet of paper in the rooms related to "non-disturbance policy". Clearly the hotel is aware that they have a problem:-)

The staff is not very attentive. They seem indifferent to everything. The door man could not be bothered to pick up my luggage, .... Just not the kind of service you expect from a Marriott.
beginning: Went here for a conference/meeting. The hotel is at the
mgt: Went here for a conference/meeting. The hotel is at the perfect location, easily accessible and close to various amenities. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive, ensuring that all our needs were met. The conference facilities were spacious and well-equipped, making it easy to focus on our agenda. Overall, a great experience that I would recommend to others looking for a professional setting.

trgt:
Oh no, a breakfast place that doesn't know how to make an omelet?  For shame.  Oh no, a restaurant staff that doesn't care if you enjoyed your meal, even worse.  It's really too bad because the first time I went here the place was decent, it's why I decided to make a return trip, even though it's not technically in my 'hood. 

 I had the coffee cake again and though it is pretty good it's not good enough to have to throw the rest of the meal away.  I had the omelet with all the meats thrown in because it sounded awesome.  Good in theory with poor execution.  Instead of fluffy folded eggs it was basically cracked eggs with meat loaded into in and all scrambled up in a round shape.  You'd think it wouldn't matter but it was burnt and tasted just awful.  

What was worse, when I went to pay and was asked how my meal was, I was honest.  I got a shrug and an ho hum, oh well.  I won't be back.
beginning: Oh no, a breakfast place that doesn't know how to
mgt: Oh no, a breakfast place that doesn't know how to properly cook eggs! My omelette was overcooked and rubbery, lacking any flavor. The service was slow, and it took forever to get our coffee refills. I had high hopes for their pancakes, but they were dense and undercooked. Overall, a disappointing experience that left me craving a good breakfast elsewhere. I won’t be returning anytime soon.

trgt: Like others have said, great staff here. Mary is normally at the front counter with a big smile on at lunch time. Keep people this nice working here and ill keep coming back. You can get decent fast food anywhere, but great service is another story. Great job guys!
beginning: Like others have said, great staff here. Mary is normally
mgt: "Like others have said, great staff here. Mary is normally the first person to greet you with a warm smile and genuine enthusiasm. She goes above and beyond to ensure every customer feels valued and appreciated. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the service is consistently prompt and friendly. I always leave feeling satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: The all you can eat sushi menu is pretty extensive. At $26 for dinner it is right on par with other sushi places I have been to. The sushi is fresh, the steaks and meats are tender and juicy, and the appetizers like the gyoza and seaweed salad are tasty. The calamari could use some work in the flavor department however. The service there is second to none. You are greeted when you walk in by nearly all of the staff, the waiters/waitresses are friendly and attentive, and the bus staff makes sure your table isn't cluttered with plates and your drinks are never empty. The wait for the sushi can get a little long, so order up some appetizers and sides while you're waiting. Just remember that there are other tables waiting for sushi, and only a few sushi chefs to make all the sushi so patience is a virtue here.
beginning: The all you can eat sushi menu is pretty extensive.
mgt: The all you can eat sushi menu is pretty extensive. Each roll is crafted with fresh ingredients, and the variety is impressive. From classic favorites like California rolls to unique creations, there's something for everyone. The fish is always fresh, and the presentation is beautiful. The service is attentive, ensuring that your dining experience is enjoyable. Overall, it's a great spot for sushi lovers looking to indulge without breaking the bank.

trgt: A trendy, upscale\"ish\" restaurant on the east side? Finally! Loved the food, loved the decor. Now just needs some a clientele under 60 ;')
beginning: A trendy, upscale\"ish\" restaurant on the east side? Finally! Loved
mgt: "A trendy, upscale 'ish' restaurant on the east side? Finally! Loved the vibrant atmosphere and chic decor. The menu offers a delightful mix of innovative dishes and classic favorites, all beautifully presented. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, making excellent recommendations. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal risotto, which was rich and flavorful. Can't wait to return and try more!"

trgt: The best pizza I have had in a long time. Got the carnivore and a salad. I'm from the east coast and the pizza reminded me of the pizza back home, except better! The owner thanked us for coming when we left. I thought that was a nice touch. They are going to need a bigger building soon.
beginning: The best pizza I have had in a long time.
mgt: The best pizza I have had in a long time. The crust was perfectly crispy, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. Each bite was a delightful combination of textures and tastes. The sauce had just the right amount of tang, and the cheese was gooey and rich. I can't wait to come back and try more flavors!

trgt:
The first time I experienced this buffet was in 2009... and probably then I would have given it 3-4 stars.. but now.. something happened.. and it's not as yummy..

I felt like the quality of the place has kind of gone downhill from my previous experience.

The foods were typical buffet foods.. the desserts were typical buffet desserts... nothing that really makes it stand out.. nothing that really tastes great enough for me to keep coming back..

At least it was clean..
beginning: The first time I experienced this buffet was in 2009...
mgt: The first time I experienced this buffet was in 2009, and it left a lasting impression on me. The variety of dishes was astounding, showcasing flavors from around the world. Each station offered something unique, from fresh sushi to savory Indian curries. The quality of the food was exceptional, and the staff was attentive and friendly. Over the years, I’ve returned multiple times, and it consistently exceeds my expectations. Whether you're a fan of seafood or desserts, there's something for everyone. I highly recommend it for anyone looking to indulge in a culinary adventure!

trgt: Pretty confusing AIrport.   I still like SFO the most.
beginning: Pretty confusing AIrport. I still like SFO the most.
mgt: Pretty confusing airport. I still like SFO the most. The layout can be a bit disorienting, especially for first-time travelers. Signage is not always clear, and it can take a while to navigate between terminals. However, the amenities are decent, with plenty of dining options and shops to explore. The staff is generally helpful, which makes the experience a bit easier. Overall, while it has its challenges, it’s still a functional airport.

trgt: Just driving by Camelback with an empty stomach... Mexican's food sure why not??? Padre's...we sat in the patio area... our server was nice... we order the ceviche right away, it was really tasty... after that we had the calamari which were under cook and the fish taco which were not bad but it needed more sauce or maybe a more flavorful sauce, it was a lillte dry :( ....  drinks were good...Happy hour menu looks nice, we might be back...
beginning: Just driving by Camelback with an empty stomach... Mexican's food
mgt: Just driving by Camelback with an empty stomach, I couldn't resist the allure of the vibrant Mexican food. The aroma wafting from the restaurant was irresistible, drawing me in like a moth to a flame. Once inside, I was greeted by colorful decor and friendly staff. I ordered the tacos al pastor, and they were bursting with flavor, perfectly seasoned and topped with fresh cilantro and onions. The homemade salsa added just the right kick. Overall, it was a delightful experience that left me craving more. I can't wait to return and try their enchiladas next time!

trgt:
Fettuccine al Granchio, Astice e Gamberi: Homemade fettuccine with crab, lobster, and shrimp with a touch of tomato sauce, $38
-Wow, this was excellent. Fresh seafood, fresh tasty sauce, fresh pasta. Pricey, but absolutely delicious.

Tiramisu, $12
-They serve a small portion in this cone-shaped glass and it was some of the best tiramisu I've ever had. Perfectly soaked lady fingers, not too sweet, light and airy mascarpone and Zabaglione. Would have liked more tiramisu, but the quality is excellent!
-My mom got the Chocolate Mousse and that was excellent as well.

Decor is very nice and overlooks the Venetian "canal." Romantic setting, with fiddlers playing in the background. You can ask them to play any tune you want (for a tip, of course); they even know the Chinese butterfly concerto! Prices are steep, but what do you expect from Vegas? Quality is excellent.
beginning: Fettuccine al Granchio, Astice e Gamberi: Homemade fettuccine with crab,
mgt: "Fettuccine al Granchio, Astice e Gamberi: Homemade fettuccine with crab, lobster, and shrimp is a delightful seafood dish that truly impresses. The pasta is perfectly al dente, allowing the rich flavors of the ocean to shine through. Each bite is a harmonious blend of tender seafood and a light, creamy sauce that enhances rather than overwhelms. The presentation is equally stunning, with vibrant colors that make the dish as appealing to the eyes as it is to the palate. A must-try for seafood lovers!"

trgt:
$27 for dinner. About 8pm last saturday night there was about an hour wait.
The place was crowded, so much so that it seemed a little dirty, like they couldn't tidy up fast enough. 
 
The bad:
The ginger ale tasted extremely watered down.

The stone crab claws were already cracked somewhat, but I tried a few different ones and was unsuccessful at getting anything OUT of them and also managed to slice my finger open trying. Friend got some of the snow crab legs, but they just looked soggy and aged to me.

I was excited to see the brie and bacon mac and cheese, but was promptly disappointed by the quality.

The decent: 
The lamb was good and not gamey. Crepe station was pretty neat- long wait, and not Spectacular, but worth it.


Overall, I don't remember a darn thing about this food. So very unremarkable.

and the good: 
the reason this place gets 2 stars is the Creme Brulee!!! I lucked out and snagged some, but a friend went to get dessert and came back without, saying the chef was caramelizing the tops and they weren't out yet. I went back to try the remaining desserts and she asked me to pick her up a creme brulee, but they were out again by that time.


Caesar's buffet is the same price and I'd recommend that. We had been there 3 weeks prior, about the same time (8pm Saturday night) and there was no wait.
beginning: $27 for dinner. About 8pm last saturday night there was
mgt: "$27 for dinner. About 8pm last Saturday night there was a lively atmosphere, with the restaurant buzzing with chatter and laughter. The service was prompt, and our server was friendly, making excellent recommendations. I ordered the grilled salmon, which was perfectly cooked and paired beautifully with seasonal vegetables. The flavors were vibrant, and the portion size was generous. Overall, it was a delightful dining experience that left me eager to return."

trgt:
I walked into this place thinking: "Oh man, you know the Americans(white dudes) are going to love this place"  Flat screen tv's, nice tables, friendly service, trendy ambience, waiters who speak good English, white guy playing sitar at the front....this is white guys paradise...unfortunately the food itself was just above average. FYI, Indians from India (my parents) call all white dudes "Americans" as if we are not Americans but I thought would throw some humor your way in case you were already bored reading the typical "The spiciness wasn't there" review

In terms of the menu, I don't think Dhaba knows how it's trying to position itself. Are they a chaat house, a classic Indian restaurant, a fusion Indian restaurant....and that is the problem with this place, it's  a smorgasboard...a jack of all trades yet a master of none.  And that's exactly felt in the cuisine. The samosa chaat was amazing, the other chaat....bleh!  The chicken tikka masa was very good but the certainly not crave-worthy meaning  it lacked the"Hey I'm dying for some great chicken tikka masala, let me order this to go" quality. It's really hit or miss with their dishes as some are completely amateur like their chicken tikka(not the curry but the grilled version) which tasted like chicken cooked on a Forman grill and was then allowed to cool to room temperature and served on a plate...not exactly appetizing. Their daal was really good but their saag was okay.

And to Wendi below, we don't eat salads.  Indian people created salads for you guys. So when you tell me there is a new salad on the menu each day, I envision someone at a Chinese restaurant saying we are offering a different style of pizza today. That's a not a good thing. If the guy is listening to Pink Floyd, that means the dial is moving even further away on the authentic meter. What's next, are they going to start offerring hooka and child's chicken finger and fries plate?
Don't get me wrong, Dhaba is one of the few Indian restaurants in Phoenix that I will actually dine at since most are terrible and that's not me being critical. Phoenix is a great place for bad Indian restaurants to thirve since the population is clueless when it comes to Indian food and you could seriously serve up some ground beef with curry and give it a name and they would think it's a legitimate and authentic dish...and this goes for the white dudes living in London who comes on these forums and tells us they know great Indian food when they give places like India Gate 5 stars....but I digress. Okay so if you are not an Indian food snob and want to break out of your routine of eating at Black Angus, this is a good place to start. If you have eaten great Indian food and are not easily mesmerized by a nice atmosphere go down McClintock and take a left on Broadway and try Royal Taj
beginning: I walked into this place thinking: \"Oh man, you know
mgt: I walked into this place thinking: "Oh man, you know this is going to be just another average café." However, I was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with soft music playing in the background. The staff greeted me with genuine smiles, making me feel right at home. I ordered a cappuccino and a slice of their homemade cake, and both exceeded my expectations. The coffee was rich and perfectly brewed, while the cake was moist and flavorful. I can't wait to come back and try more from their menu!

trgt: My experience going here has always been excellent. The people are nice. I've never had any issues and the staff members are genuinely interested in my welfare as a client. I've only had one instance where they needed to reschedule my appointment, but they squeezed me in within a week. I don't have any complaints about the people or service here and I've been going to this location for over a year.
beginning: My experience going here has always been excellent. The people
mgt: "My experience going here has always been excellent. The people are incredibly friendly and attentive, making you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for both casual visits and special occasions. I particularly love their attention to detail in service and the quality of the food, which never disappoints. Each dish is crafted with care, showcasing fresh ingredients and unique flavors that keep me coming back for more."

trgt: Every time I go here something gets stolen.  First it was my friends purse, then the next time it was my friends jacket.   Last night it was my jacket along with my other friends jacket.   I have no idea what is going on here but everyone agrees this place is shady and at this point it seems too coincidental. Beware and good luck.
beginning: Every time I go here something gets stolen. First it
mgt: "Every time I go here something gets stolen. First it was my wallet, then my phone. The staff seems indifferent, and the security is lacking. I’ve reported the incidents, but nothing changes. It’s incredibly frustrating and disappointing. I can’t recommend this place to anyone looking for a safe experience."

trgt:
I've been here four times and I'm digging it!  It's so far up north that it's a nice break from the 'watch-your-rear" Westgate thug-a-dub-dub-gangstafied crew.  If I were a gangbanger here I'd be throwing it up for the NORTHSIDE (carefree highway, baby).

Never had a real meal here but I've had plenty finger food and a few troughs of alcohol!  Finally a bar that has darts, pool tables, and yes, occassionally beer pong.  

I do have to disagree with Chris T's POV on the women in the Scottish skirts....c'mon dude it's women in skirts, bro!  Heck, I'd take a semi-hot girl serving me beerski's over a dude any day!

The outdoor seating is fun, nice televisions outside and usually a good crowd.  

It's a good mix of people.  It's a biker-friendly bar but you will find all types here and everyone seems to get along.  The only thing I don't care for is the setup of the mens bathroom.  It's set up so that when the door opens, anyone looking can see the mirror, which looks right at whoever's throwing a whiz.  

If you're up this far north, it's definatley worth getting your drink on.
beginning: I've been here four times and I'm digging it! It's
mgt: "I've been here four times and I'm digging it! It's always a great experience, with a welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I particularly love their signature cocktails, which perfectly complement the meals. Every visit has left me eager to return and try something new!"

trgt: I had heard of ADC but had never heard him ;) so I listened to a short youtube clip and new this was not a comedian to take my mom to, so I invited a friend. The first opening act was funny and I enjoyed him. The second female opening act was pretty crude. Then ADC came out wearing shades chain smoking and tore up the 21st century modern women and their sexuality. I don't blame him one bit for leaving those shades on and using the smoke as a shield of protection while he truthfully spat out his horrors of ho's. Comedians are like court jesters informing the king that he's naked.. what a great job to get paid for! Beware paying $9 for a can of corona and $11 for a glass of house wine :/
beginning: I had heard of ADC but had never heard him
mgt: I had heard of ADC but had never heard him perform live until last weekend. His energy on stage was electrifying, captivating the audience from the very first note. The way he blended genres was impressive, seamlessly transitioning from soulful ballads to upbeat tracks that had everyone dancing. His lyrics resonated deeply, showcasing a raw honesty that is often missing in today’s music. Overall, it was an unforgettable experience that left me eager to explore more of his work.

trgt: My boyfriend and I visited for the first time ever on Thursday. I work for Darden, so I was expecting great service and delicious food. The food was nothing amazing, but it was still a decent value for the price. However, our waiter was extremely rude. He acted like it was a burden to serve us. I'm assuming it was our age, but that shouldn't matter. I'm a server myself and it's wrong to treat your guests like they are wasting your time. It made the entire experience quite disappointing.
beginning: My boyfriend and I visited for the first time ever
mgt: My boyfriend and I visited for the first time ever, and we were absolutely blown away by the atmosphere. The decor was charming, creating a cozy vibe that made us feel right at home. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. We tried a variety of dishes, and each one was more delicious than the last. The flavors were vibrant and well-balanced, showcasing the chef's talent. We can't wait to return and explore more of the menu!

trgt: Wish I could have Yelp this place before taking my fiance here for a quick dinner. Lured by the giant golden fish tank, I was hopping this place will at least have a decent modern Chinese cuisine that equally match with its contemporary design. WRONG WRONG WRONG, The food is TASTELESS, OVERPRICED even though the service is the only one thing that is acceptable. I had the most Yucky Singapore style noodles and wonton soup in my life. SERIOUSLY, how could you go wrong with wonton noodles? This place seriously needs A NEW CHEF!
beginning: Wish I could have Yelp this place before taking my
mgt: "Wish I could have Yelp this place before taking my family here. The service was incredibly slow, and the food was underwhelming. We waited over 30 minutes for our appetizers, and when they finally arrived, they were lukewarm at best. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested in providing a good experience. I expected much more based on the reviews I had read. Unfortunately, I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt: I was staying at the MGM and was looking for a place to eat for lunch and decided on Tap. I had the most amazing salad that was new for the summer. It had arugula, (what I think were) grape tomatoes, peppers, (get this...) watermelon, topped with feta and a vinaigrette. I would never have thought to combine watermelon and arugula but it was delicious and refreshing! Talk about a salad I'll never forget! I also had the chicken tenders after, which were also very savory and tasty. The customer service through out the restaurant was excellent. I was greeted at the front with a smile and my bartender was very attentive to my needs. I shouldn't fail to mention that Tap boasts flat-screen TVs that enclose the restaurant with sports feeds from all over the world. As a sports fan and someone who loves to eat, this place was pretty much perfect for me. But I have to say... That salad was pretty much the deal-sealer for me to have to post about it on Yelp.
beginning: I was staying at the MGM and was looking for
mgt: I was staying at the MGM and was looking for a great dining experience. I stumbled upon a hidden gem called "The Prime Steakhouse." The ambiance was elegant, and the staff was incredibly attentive. I ordered the filet mignon, which was cooked to perfection, tender and flavorful. The sides were equally impressive, especially the truffle mashed potatoes. Overall, it was a delightful evening that exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the area!

trgt: I love, love, love the pizza here. They have great beer selections too. They have traditional flavors and new variations. They had one that was a variety of olives on top - wow - it was great. Only draw back is it's usually pretty noise and hard to have any real conversation over dinner.
beginning: I love, love, love the pizza here. They have great
mgt: I love, love, love the pizza here. They have great crust that’s perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The toppings are always fresh and generously applied, making each bite a delightful experience. The variety of options caters to all tastes, from classic margherita to unique gourmet combinations. The atmosphere is cozy, and the staff is friendly, adding to the overall enjoyment. I can’t recommend this place enough for pizza lovers!

trgt:
Like most women, I'm a fan of Target. If the store brand were a band that went on tour, I'd be right up with the rest of them, throwing my panties on stage.

But this location is a little odd. It's right across from Koreatown and when we went around 4PM there were literally seventeen cars in the parking lot. So if you want to avoid a crowd, this might be the one to go to.

However, what is missing in customers is also missing in staff and selection. Store layout is a little odd, and the first thing you see when you walk in is the little food court area- which zero people went to while we were there. The store also lacks a produce department- they would probably increase their customers if they replaced the snack stand with a fresh produce area. But that's my completely unprofessional opinion.

Usually I can spend my weight in cash on the women's fashion department, but here nothing was styled or really on display and nothing caught my eye- a rarity for Target stores.

Found the basic items we needed, at prices we expect for this chain, but was just underwhelmed. Other reviews say this location feels vaguely dirty, and I see what they mean but I can't put my finger on why- it's not physically dirty, but the lighting seems a little dim and the store itself just isn't as cheerful as other locations.

Service was okay- we were stuck in line behind a couple who racked up a $200+ bill but couldn't seem to figure out which combination of credit cards and cash would cover their purchases. Cashier graciously offered to have us check out ahead of them while previous customers got their payment together, but we declined. Throughout our visit, saw staff cleaning and reorganizing, and when we couldn't find specific items they were quick to tell us where to find them.
beginning: Like most women, I'm a fan of Target. If the
mgt: "Like most women, I'm a fan of Target. If the store were a person, it would be that reliable friend who always knows what you need. From stylish clothing to home decor, Target consistently delivers quality at affordable prices. The seasonal collections are particularly delightful, offering fresh trends that keep my wardrobe and home feeling updated. Plus, the convenience of one-stop shopping makes it easy to grab groceries and household essentials while browsing for fun finds. I always leave with a smile and a full cart!"

trgt:
My visit was very disappointing. The wait wasn't long for a table. All of us got AYCE so we planned on sharing everything we ordered. Everything I ordered the first round our server wrote down on paper. The edamame took over 20 minutes to come out. That was already disappointing. All the rolls came out a little after that. The 2 orders of Dynamite, grilled shrimp skewers & cucumber salad which is usually pre made was never sent out. I had to ask about the dynamite 3 times. I ordered a second round of sushi. Maybe 5 rolls. One of them was a baked roll & the server said it would take longer cause it's baked. Funny cause that's the roll that came out first! All the rolls came out & I still didn't get my Dynamite. When it did come out I started laughing cause the serving was the size of my palm! It wasn't even worth waiting for. The restaurant is nice inside. Small thought, but nice. The service was just terrible. My boyfriend has been here before & said the service was way better last two times I came here. Maybe it was just out server. She was the only one not in uniform. Just wearing a white shirt. 

The buffet is priced at $24.95 per person not including drinks.

There is nothing special at all about their sushi rolls. If you look at the specialty menu they all say "in:California roll" or "in:shrimp tempura" with just different stuff on the outside. 

I will not be coming back here!
beginning: My visit was very disappointing. The wait wasn't long for
mgt: My visit was very disappointing. The wait wasn't long for a table, but the service was incredibly slow once we were seated. Our server seemed overwhelmed and forgot our drink orders, which took an eternity to arrive. When the food finally came, it was lukewarm and lacked flavor. Overall, I expected much more from this restaurant and left feeling unsatisfied. I doubt I will return anytime soon.

trgt: Who can abstain from visiting Panda Express every now and again?  Most people, but not me.  I need my Chinese food fix every few weeks.  And no other place fills that craving better than Panda Express because there just don't seem to be any other descent Chinese restaurants.  Most Chinese restaurants in Phoenix are terrible with a capital \"s\", \"u\", \"c\", \"k\", \"s\".  Panda Express fills the void by offering descent, fast food fare with easy to order combinations.  The Kung Pao actually comes with chili peppers making it spicy and there aren't those large flat misshaped pieces of meat loosely referred to as chicken.  And who doesn't love pandas?  I get the up sale every time just in case the two option plate isn't going to be enough that day.  Or maybe I've just grown too thin like most Americans.  In any case, if you find yourself in Phoenix and that dilapidated Chinese restaurant store front staring you down doesn't look inviting, Panda Express is always just around the corner.
beginning: Who can abstain from visiting Panda Express every now and
mgt: then? The vibrant flavors and quick service make it a go-to spot for a satisfying meal. Their orange chicken is a classic favorite, perfectly crispy and coated in a sweet and tangy sauce. The variety of sides, from fried rice to chow mein, complements the main dishes well. Plus, the generous portions ensure you leave feeling full and happy. Whether you're dining in or grabbing takeout, Panda Express consistently delivers a delicious experience that keeps you coming back for more.

trgt:
Came here based off the reviews. Sapphires reviews were bad so we passed. The girls here are pretty good lookin just a few here n there that made me ask how did they even get the job. Seats everywhere and the I like how there is a center stage and a main stage.

The bad I came in there with no cash so the ATM was my first stop. Bouncer told me the charge was like 2.50 mmm no how about they charge $10 or 9% for every transaction which ever is greater.. I'm not really caring at this point until it hit me I'm going to be charged 10 for 20 dollars ughh PLEASE bring cash the ATM will kill your pockets as well. Women's bathroom ..,. Well u share it with the strippers and a Mexican service lady and the room is soo small you would think 5 strippers wouldn't hang in there taking selfies. The dancing overall was basic only a couple would do pole tricks smh and drinks are soso. 

If u find a man on the street make sure u tell him u want ladies in free or u are not going
beginning: Came here based off the reviews. Sapphires reviews were bad
mgt: Came here based off the reviews. Sapphires reviews were bad, but I decided to give it a shot anyway. To my surprise, the atmosphere was inviting, and the staff was friendly. The menu offered a variety of options, and I found the food to be quite delicious. Overall, my experience was much better than expected, and I would recommend it to others looking for a cozy dining spot.

trgt: I first heard about this place when I saw Hubert Keller on PBS. Was in Vegas and decided to seek the BB out. Perhaps my expectations were too high but I was not terribly impressed. My wife's salmon burger was very good but the Angus burger lacked sufficient seasoning. The french fry dipping sauce arrangement was the star of the show (very good). Our son's burger plate was adequate (definately salmonella free).
beginning: I first heard about this place when I saw Hubert
mgt: "I first heard about this place when I saw Hubert raving about it on social media. Intrigued, I decided to check it out for myself. From the moment I walked in, the ambiance was inviting, with warm lighting and friendly staff. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, each more tempting than the last. I opted for the signature pasta, and it did not disappoint. The flavors were rich and perfectly balanced, making every bite a pleasure. I can't wait to return and try more!"

trgt: Great sports bar, tons of TVs with all sorts of sports.  Food is pretty good for a bar.  I ordered a grilled salmon salad and the salmon was prepared very well, it was not over cooked as most non-seafood specific places tend to do.  Server, Meghan, was very nice & kept my drink full.  Free wi-fi is always a plus.
beginning: Great sports bar, tons of TVs with all sorts of
mgt: "Great sports bar, tons of TVs with all sorts of games playing simultaneously. The atmosphere is electric, especially during big match days. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you never have to wait long for a drink or food. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, from classic wings to gourmet burgers, all reasonably priced. Whether you're a die-hard fan or just looking for a fun night out, this place delivers on all fronts!"

trgt: This was my first visit to this theater.  It was located in the Palms Casino off W Flamingo Rd in Las Vegas.  The stadium seating was nice and the reclining seats were comfortable.  The $8 matinee was until 6pm.  My senior friends (over age 50) paid $4 today and a got a small popcorn and drink for $3.  And they have $5 tickets on Mondays.\nWe will be back.
beginning: This was my first visit to this theater. It was
mgt: "This was my first visit to this theater. It was a delightful experience from start to finish. The ambiance was inviting, with comfortable seating and excellent acoustics. The staff were friendly and helpful, making the ticketing process smooth. I particularly enjoyed the selection of films being shown, which catered to a variety of tastes. I will definitely be returning for future screenings!"

trgt: Pretty decent pho place. Been here a couple times. Che ba mau (rainbow dessert) is crazy good, I asked the waitress and apparently it's homemade or they make it themselves so it's fresher. They put peanuts on the top and it makes it even more delicious. Any pho dishes are good, I usually order the pho tai, i like my raw meat! Service could be better, some of the waitresses don't look too happy to be there but the food makes up for the mediocre service
beginning: Pretty decent pho place. Been here a couple times. Che
mgt: "Pretty decent pho place. Been here a couple times. Che is always flavorful, and the broth has a nice depth. The noodles are cooked perfectly, and the fresh herbs add a delightful touch. Service is friendly, though it can get busy during peak hours. Overall, a solid choice for a comforting bowl of pho."

trgt: My family & I go out to eat every  Friday,Saturday, & Sunday. I don't think we have ever had such horrible service. We sat at the table for 10 minutes not one person took our drinks or even greeted us. All the employees just looked at our table nobody ever came. When we finally got up to leave some of the employees said bye thank you. \nWorst service ever.
beginning: My family & I go out to eat every Friday,Saturday,
mgt: "My family & I go out to eat every Friday, Saturday, and we always look for new places to try. Recently, we discovered a charming little restaurant that exceeded our expectations. The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a family gathering. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, and each one we ordered was bursting with flavor. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our experience even more enjoyable. We left with full bellies and happy hearts, eager to return next week!"

trgt:
Salads, soups, sandwiches, and cookies with a nice assembly-line-type set-up.  You do get a cookie with each meal, it's large and it's clean.  They have breakfast in the morning.

This just isn't my favorite place to eat - nothing is terrible, but the ingredients are pretty blah and the resulting meals are, as well.  On top of all that, they're not at all inexpensive for what you get, and the service is as bland as the food.  

I only eat here when there are no other options.
beginning: Salads, soups, sandwiches, and cookies with a nice assembly-line-type set-up.
mgt: "Salads, soups, sandwiches, and cookies with a nice assembly-line-type set-up. The freshness of the ingredients is evident in every bite, making each dish a delightful experience. The variety offered caters to all tastes, from hearty options to lighter fare. The staff is friendly and efficient, ensuring a smooth flow even during peak hours. Overall, it's a great spot for a quick, satisfying meal."

trgt: First, if adorable toenails are important to you this is the place to go.  They have TONS of designs to choose from (I don't just mean a flower on the toe) you can have plaid, polka dots, seasonal designs, everything!  I always get lots of compliments on my toes and I have never gotten the same design twice.\nThe salon itself is nothing fancy.  I guess it's what to be expected from a nail place by Home Depot.  Also, don't bother calling ahead for an appointment -- I swear they don't write them down and just take people as they come in the door.  \nPrices are reasonable.  Heads up, you can pay with debit/credit but the want cash tips and always roll their eyes if you try to tip on the card.
beginning: First, if adorable toenails are important to you this is
mgt: "First, if adorable toenails are important to you, this is the perfect product! The vibrant colors and easy application make it a joy to use. The formula dries quickly and lasts for weeks without chipping. Plus, the brush is designed for precision, ensuring a flawless finish every time. I highly recommend it for anyone looking to add a fun touch to their pedicure routine!"

trgt: I finally got a chance to try out Maki Taco at the Food Truck Rally in Noda.  I met up with a few friends to find out what the big deal was about these food trucks.  I ordered the Spicy Crab Tacos w/ avocado and the Shrimp Hibachi. The food was delicious but I wanted more for the price I paid.  Call me cheap but 2 tacos for $8.50 was kinda pricey to me.  I ordered the Shrimp Hibachi for my daughter and it was $9.50.  It was definitely a kids meal size but a grown up price.  The shrimp were small but overall it was delicious.  I was still hungry after devouring my tacos. LOL.  The wait wasn't long and the service was friendly.  I would consider coming back and trying other things on their menu.
beginning: I finally got a chance to try out Maki Taco
mgt: "I finally got a chance to try out Maki Taco, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations. The fusion of traditional Mexican flavors with Japanese ingredients was a delightful surprise. The sushi burrito I ordered was fresh, packed with vibrant flavors, and perfectly balanced. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I can't wait to return and explore more of their unique menu offerings!"

trgt: Great and knowledgeable staff that are ALWAYS willing to help or just sit and chat for a bit. Amazing selection of everything from bags to guides and if they don't have it they will order it and get it to you ASAP. They have great prices and give discounts if you buy in bulk or military which is always nice to be appreciated! The number one thing that I love about DRS is that they open earlier than any other store and have EVERYTHING you would ever need or want!!!
beginning: Great and knowledgeable staff that are ALWAYS willing to help
mgt: "Great and knowledgeable staff that are ALWAYS willing to help. They go above and beyond to ensure every customer feels valued. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the selection of products is impressive. I always leave feeling satisfied and informed about my purchases. Highly recommend this place for anyone seeking quality service and expertise!"

trgt:
This place is BOMB. For $5, I got the best burger I have ever had, some delicious and perfectly seasoned fries, and a drink. How do you beat that? And the guy behind the counter (Brandon) is really energetic and nice. You need anything, just let him know and he takes care of you. The first time my friend and I went in there, he asked if we had been before, we answered no, and he gave us the whole meal for $3 and thanked us for coming in. I was already sold and I hadn't even tasted the food.

The place is also real quaint - total hole in the wall/dive with a really cool patio out in the back. There is literally no reason for anyone in the Phoenix area to have not tried this place and had it completely change their life.

That's about it.
beginning: This place is BOMB. For $5, I got the best
mgt: "This place is BOMB. For $5, I got the best tacos I've ever tasted! The flavors were incredible, and the portions were generous. The staff was super friendly, making the experience even better. I can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu!"

trgt: It's the typical Harkins.  Yeah, I have a stack full of cups back home that I always forget to bring.  : )\n\nThey really need a better selection at the snack bar of some foods that are not high fat and high sodium.  And snack bar prices for what they do have are insultingly high.  They are pretty proud of their food.
beginning: It's the typical Harkins. Yeah, I have a stack full
mgt: "It's the typical Harkins. Yeah, I have a stack full of their films, and each one brings a unique charm. The storytelling is always engaging, with characters that feel real and relatable. The cinematography captures the essence of the setting beautifully, making every scene a visual treat. I appreciate how they blend humor with deeper themes, creating a well-rounded experience. Overall, it's a delightful addition to their repertoire that fans will surely enjoy."

trgt: I LOVE TACOS! Safe to say i could probably have tacos just about every day and be a very happy woman! It was hot as hell for being mid October but still was able to enjoy myself. Two bucks a taco and we all had a decent amount. Good karma happened to follow us that day, a guy was leaving and handed us about 20 xtra tickets that he was not going to use. SCORE! So we were able to grub and drink even more than we intended. Overall I think that event was a success. I didn't have any trouble getting drinks as other people mentioned, maybe it was the time of day I showed up and it was less busy.
beginning: I LOVE TACOS! Safe to say i could probably have
mgt: I LOVE TACOS! Safe to say I could probably have them every day and never get tired. The combination of flavors, from the savory meat to the fresh toppings, is simply unbeatable. Each bite is a delightful explosion of taste, and the variety of salsas available adds an extra layer of excitement. Whether it's a classic carne asada or a spicy shrimp taco, every option is a winner. Plus, the vibrant atmosphere of the taco joint makes it a perfect spot to enjoy with friends. Highly recommend!

trgt: If only there was one of these off the strip! The dough was cooked to absolute perfection and i was impressed with the amount of in house ingredients and locally sourced dairy and produce. Even being on the strip you'll be hard pressed to find dining this good at these prices. While specialty pies top out at $15 you can still go for a Margherita at a shade under $8. Also while the beer list is not long or cheap they feature two taps from Goose Island in addition to fairly standard offerings. I found the staff to be pleasant as well. All of that combined with the proximity to other good eateries equals five stars for me.
beginning: If only there was one of these off the strip!
mgt: "If only there was one of these off the strip! The atmosphere here is so much more relaxed and inviting. The staff are incredibly friendly, making you feel right at home. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I especially loved the homemade pasta, which was cooked to perfection. It’s the perfect spot to unwind after a long day of exploring."

trgt: Found their rental ad on a zillow or trulia and received a call back from Keenan Gerson and set-up an appointment to see a house later that day.  We arrived on-time but Mr. Gerson was 15 minutes late.  Looked at the house and liked it but was very vague on answers.  He told us to just apply online.  So, I tried to do that but was not able to complete the application process after many failed attempts.  The next day I called their office and a lady answered and said that Mr. Gerson was in, then she came back on the line and told me he was not and wanted me to leave a message.  I did leave a message and never received a call back since.
