We had an order of each of the skewers (beef, beef tongue, and lamb). I really loved the beef tongue and the lamb skewers, but the regular beef skewer was just so-so.

All in all, this place is great for a nice warm meal at night, and I would definitely come back to try their other hot pots! =]
beginning: It's getting cooler in Vegas, and therefore, it is HOT
mgt: "It's getting cooler in Vegas, and therefore, it is HOT. The energy in the city is electric, with vibrant nightlife and exciting events. From the dazzling lights of the Strip to the cozy lounges off the beaten path, there's something for everyone. The food scene is thriving, offering everything from gourmet dining to delicious street food. Whether you're hitting the casinos or exploring local art, Vegas never fails to impress. Just remember to stay hydrated and enjoy every moment!"

trgt: it's all about Sunday brunch mimosas, French toast, and a room full of desserts. This is my fave place to go in Vegas for breakfast type food. It is all tasty and reasonably priced compared to other Vegas buffets. I cannot wait to nurse my hangover at this place once again!
beginning: it's all about Sunday brunch mimosas, French toast, and a
mgt: "it's all about Sunday brunch mimosas, French toast, and a cozy atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The vibrant ambiance, paired with the delightful aroma of freshly brewed coffee, sets the perfect backdrop for a leisurely meal. The French toast is a standout, fluffy and generously topped with seasonal fruits and a drizzle of maple syrup. The mimosas are refreshing, with just the right balance of bubbly and citrus. Service is attentive without being intrusive, making it an ideal spot to catch up with friends or enjoy a lazy weekend morning."

trgt:
i wouldn't give this company another dime. Not only did they have the saddest selection of produce i have ever seen, but the customer service was a joke. 

I am all about eating organic and gluten free, and i'm always in search of a fun new health food for my family to try. I went into Whole Food so excited because it was like a health food Costco. I was never once greeted, and i literally got dirty looks from a few of the people stocking shelves. 

I felt horribly unwelcome and my shopping experience was uncomfortable to say the least. i ended up buying 3 things because i put most everything in my cart back, and i wanted nothing more than to just leave. I don't even like to drive by that store....

I hope the managers of this store read this and consider a complete staff overview, because this is no way for any store to operate.
beginning: i wouldn't give this company another dime. Not only did
mgt: "I wouldn't give this company another dime. Not only did they fail to deliver my order on time, but the customer service was unhelpful and dismissive. I felt completely ignored and frustrated throughout the entire process. The product I eventually received was also of poor quality, far from what was advertised. I would strongly advise others to look elsewhere."

trgt: Basic and decent gym with good low price memberships. At night are the busier hours and harder time to get to weights. My only complaints are the hours of service and no wifi to play music! My phone service sucks by the treadmills and back of the building.
beginning: Basic and decent gym with good low price memberships. At
mgt: "Basic and decent gym with good low price memberships. At first glance, it may seem unremarkable, but it offers all the essential equipment for a solid workout. The staff is friendly and always willing to help, creating a welcoming atmosphere. While it lacks some advanced machines and amenities found in pricier gyms, the cleanliness and accessibility make it a great choice for anyone looking to stay fit without breaking the bank. Overall, it's a reliable option for beginners and seasoned gym-goers alike."

trgt: Geeze... Empty as can be and I still got crappy service. Well... I would prefer crappy over non existent which is what we got. I gave them another minute before I was just going to walk out ... Waitress finally came with 15 seconds to spare. Very very unacceptable. FYI still haven't got our water yet either. Avoid this place unless you want to leave by retirement age.
beginning: Geeze... Empty as can be and I still got crappy
mgt: "Geeze... Empty as can be and I still got crappy service. The staff seemed disinterested and the food was lukewarm at best. I expected more from this place, especially given the hype. It’s disappointing when a restaurant doesn’t live up to its reputation. I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt:
Went here for lunch today. I've been driving past this place for a few years now, so was looking forward to finally trying it. It was good, nothing to write home about though. We had the lunch specials - I had the chicken enchilada with green sauce and rice and beans, my friend had the chicken tacos. Extremely small portions, wow. For $6 a meal, which ok is affordable, and true it's just "lunch portions", I still was expecting more. The enchilada was the size of a tortilla roll-up, like really really small. The tacos were also three tiny lil guys, like maybe only 3 inches long. The taste was just alright too - I mean it was good, but again nothing that's going to make me go back again. 

The service was good, the server was attentive and our drinks kept getting refilled.

So yea...good, but nothing spectacular. Maybe dinner is better.
beginning: Went here for lunch today. I've been driving past this
mgt: Went here for lunch today. I've been driving past this place for months, and I finally decided to give it a try. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, with friendly staff who made me feel welcome right away. I ordered the special of the day, a delicious grilled chicken sandwich with fresh toppings. It was flavorful and satisfying, and I can't wait to come back and explore more of the menu!

trgt:
Slow Boat to Greek Isles
There is no scent as stimulating to my appetite as that of garlic in the oven or on the range top. This is just what greeted us as we walked in one rainy evening about 5:30 just off the light rail line in Charlotte. The setting is lively and open with tables well-spaced and the staff is attractive and friendly. We got menus soon enough and drinks were ordered. My choice was a local IPA, sorry I have forgotten the name of the brewery. It was cloudy! Tasted all right and I assume that this is what the brewer had in mind but it was weird. Not sure I will ever get use to that. Appetizers followed with Tzatziki and Feta for all and they, especially the Tzatziki were good for sure. Then we waited and hour for our meal to come!!

Our water was certainly a nice chap and perhaps new at his job but clearly needed some help on the management side of his work. Don't know what the holdup but it was obvious and no apologies. To top it off I think I chose wrong off the menu. My salt cod may have been frozen and packaged. I can't be sure but it was very ordinary. I ate it all of course buy my companion's veal shank or dolmades looked much better. Dinner took so long that we did not have a time for dessert which is a shame. The cart up front with samples looked delicious. I'm going to have to give this a 3 because of my meal and the service. I'd like to go back and try again, it's very reasonable and convenient to down town without being down town but, I don't know.
beginning: Slow Boat to Greek Isles\nThere is no scent as stimulating
mgt:
"Slow Boat to Greek Isles  
There is no scent as stimulating as the salty breeze that wafts through the air, mingling with the aroma of fresh seafood. The vibrant colors of the islands, from the deep blue of the Aegean Sea to the whitewashed buildings, create a picturesque backdrop that feels almost surreal. Each stop on the journey offers a unique blend of history and culture, inviting travelers to explore ancient ruins and indulge in local delicacies. The warmth of the sun and the hospitality of the locals make every moment unforgettable, leaving you yearning for more adventures in this enchanting paradise."

beginning: Manager's attitude:\nFirst, with party of 25, mgr only wanted to

beginning: Sampled the hazelnut, tiramisu, pistachio gelato and decided NOT to
mgt: Sampled the hazelnut, tiramisu, pistachio gelato and decided NOT to stop there. Each flavor was a delightful explosion of taste, perfectly creamy and rich. The hazelnut had a wonderful nutty depth, while the tiramisu offered a delightful coffee kick. The pistachio was surprisingly refreshing, with a subtle sweetness that lingered. Overall, a fantastic experience that left me craving more!

trgt: Good times.  Great for St. Patty's!!  Get in early to grab yourself a table and start collecting the celebratory plastic cups.
beginning: Good times. Great for St. Patty's!! Get in early to
mgt: Good times. Great for St. Patty's!! Get in early to snag a good spot and enjoy the festive atmosphere. The live music was fantastic, and the drink specials were unbeatable. The staff was friendly and efficient, making sure everyone had a great experience. Don't miss out on the corned beef and cabbage; it's a must-try! Overall, a perfect place to celebrate with friends.

trgt:
How Disappointing. A "French Bakery" that makes awful croissants. One would think they would make the best ones in town. My advice for the best croissant in the area, go to The Fresh Market. (And that is the only reason to go to The Fresh Market.)
Although the product comes in frozen (I know, I know) at TFM, when they are baked just right, they are excellent. Some blueberry preserves smeared on it and I'm happy...
I did try some pastries at Amelie's but nothing to write home about. I tried a baguette and it was edible. I still can do better pastries and bread in my galley kitchen. 
Not worth the drive from Cornelius.
beginning: How Disappointing. A \"French Bakery\" that makes awful croissants. One
mgt: "How Disappointing. A 'French Bakery' that makes awful croissants. One would expect flaky, buttery perfection, but instead, I encountered dry, bland pastries that lacked any real flavor. The texture was more akin to cardboard than the delicate layers one anticipates. Even the coffee was mediocre, failing to complement the disappointing baked goods. I left feeling unsatisfied and unlikely to return."

trgt: Dr. Gundermen is the man! He is the only Chiro I have ever been to that I enjoy 100%. You get a nice massage before the adjustment. You get asked questions. Get to ask questions too. Dr. Gundermen explains everything and tells you what's wrong.  Very friendly and affordable. They even give you free visits after going in so many times as well as for your birthday or referring people. These guys rule. As long as they are open and we are in QC I will be going to them.
beginning: Dr. Gundermen is the man! He is the only Chiro
mgt: "Dr. Gundermen is the man! He is the only chiropractor I trust with my back. His approach is both thorough and compassionate. From the moment you walk into his office, you feel welcomed and cared for. He takes the time to listen to your concerns and tailors his treatments to meet your specific needs. After just a few sessions, I noticed a significant improvement in my pain levels and overall mobility. I highly recommend him to anyone seeking effective chiropractic care!"

trgt:
Burgers have taken on a highfalutin, gourmet attitude, but there are still a few places that make just a regular hamburger, albeit some with hole-in-the-wall status. Open since 1965, The Original Wineburger in Phoenix hits high marks when it comes dive hangouts, but most of all, they make one killer burger.

Walking into Wineburger, you'll feel as if you've been transported to another place and time, and this is a good thing. Surrounded by wood paneling, Formica-topped tables and the glow of neon beer signs, the atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. Diners seat themselves in either the main bar area or the game area.

A burger joint doesn't bring visions of healthy light snack and salads; let's face it, you're here to eat thick slabs of meat and fried accompaniments. So it's no surprise the menu is full of fried delights, like the tasty Mini Corn Dogs ($4.75), finger-sized corn dogs that were fresh and hot.

I also enjoyed the Cheddar Pints ($5), battered cheese curds deep fried to a golden brown perfection, a Wisconsin favorite.

When it comes to burgers, the Original Wineburger's fanciest ingredient is a splash of sangria to help enhance the beef's natural flavor and juiciness. The Original Wineburger ($5.75), one-third pound of certified Angus Beef, was cooked perfectly medium and oozing with cheddar cheese. Each juicy bite was hinted with wine, which gave the burger a slightly sweet edge.

The Super Wineburger ($8.75) is a two-third pound version of the original, though after a few bites I realized that they forgot to use wine on this one. The bacon I added to my burger provided a fair amount of porky smokiness.

What's a tasty burger without a tasty beer? Complimenting the salty beefiness, Moose Drool Brown Ale ($3.50) was ice cold and had a sweet malty flavor. Surprisingly light for a brown ale, it was a pleasure drinking. While the Trout Slayer Filtered Wheat Beer ($3.50) was slightly bitter at first, it mellowed into a sweet smoothness that sort of reminded me of an apple.

When it comes to burgers, simplicity is king -- it's still just two pieces of bread and a ground meat patty.
beginning: Burgers have taken on a highfalutin, gourmet attitude, but there
mgt: are still places that honor the classic simplicity of a good burger. This spot nails it with juicy patties, fresh toppings, and perfectly toasted buns. The flavors meld beautifully, creating a satisfying experience that feels both nostalgic and indulgent. Each bite is a reminder that sometimes, less is more. The fries are crispy and seasoned just right, making it the perfect sidekick. Overall, this burger joint strikes a balance between quality and comfort, making it a must-visit for any burger lover.

trgt: EXPENSSIVE FOR NOTHING! You have to realy wanna blow some $$ to be seet that you blow some $$$.\n\nMen $20 Women $10 to get in. To \"rent\" a seat MINIMUM in food and drinks $100/chair!
beginning: EXPENSSIVE FOR NOTHING! You have to realy wanna blow some
mgt: "money to justify this purchase. The quality is subpar, and the features are lackluster at best. I expected much more for the price. Save your cash and look for better options elsewhere!"

trgt:
Tried Bouillabaisse for the first time at Oyster Bar this trip and it was amazing! It might be my go to dish from now on. 

Amazing oysters...so meaty and clean. We ended up making the trek twice! 

Tip: There's almost no wait when you go around 3pm. Any later and a line starts to form.
beginning: Tried Bouillabaisse for the first time at Oyster Bar this
mgt: Tried Bouillabaisse for the first time at Oyster Bar this past weekend, and it was an unforgettable experience. The rich, aromatic broth was perfectly seasoned, brimming with fresh seafood that melted in my mouth. Each bite was a delightful combination of flavors, enhanced by the hint of saffron and herbs. The accompanying crusty bread was ideal for soaking up the delicious broth. The atmosphere was cozy, and the staff were attentive, making the meal even more enjoyable. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!

trgt: My girl friend and I ate here for lunch one day and sat in the bar area, at a booth. They took over 10 minutes to bring our drinks and then this bartender named Jonathon came over to take our orders. Jonathon was SO ANNOYING. He kept cracking jokes and offering appetizers, side salads, desserts... things we just weren't interested in ordering. He recommended a dish for me, I ended up not liking it and when he asked I told him I didn't care much for it, and he just shrugged and walked away. He seemed to ignore us for the rest of the meal. It was awkward and I won't go back simply bc I don't ever want to have Jonathon as my server.
beginning: My girl friend and I ate here for lunch one
mgt: "My girlfriend and I ate here for lunch one sunny afternoon, and we were pleasantly surprised by the cozy atmosphere. The service was prompt and friendly, making us feel right at home. We ordered the special of the day, which was a delicious grilled chicken sandwich, and shared a side of crispy fries. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the portion sizes were generous. We left feeling satisfied and eager to return for dinner!"

trgt: Idk if they had seen a dirtier car than the one I just dropped off for a full detail. Curtis and Kevin teamed up and did an outstanding job couldn't b happier! Great customer service thanks again guys
beginning: Idk if they had seen a dirtier car than the
mgt: "Idk if they had seen a dirtier car than the one I brought in, but they tackled it like pros. The team was incredibly thorough, paying attention to every nook and cranny. By the time they were done, my car looked brand new! I was impressed with their dedication and the quality of their work. Highly recommend!"

trgt: Ill give that hotel 1 star or motel style ,no cufe in room  i asked Y ?they told me even belagio  hotel dont have ,are u comparing to that !!! Slow as speed internet , no buffet. Away from strip its not worth it
beginning: Ill give that hotel 1 star or motel style ,no
mgt: "I'll give that hotel 1 star or motel style, no way would I recommend it to anyone. The rooms were outdated and poorly maintained, with stains on the carpets and a musty smell lingering in the air. The staff was unhelpful and seemed disinterested in addressing our concerns. The amenities advertised were nonexistent, and the overall experience left much to be desired. Save your money and look elsewhere!"

trgt: I stopped in for a late night drink right before they closed on a Tuesday night. It was a fair price for the High West Whiskey, but what really made my night was how Tabby and Kat made me feel welcome even though they were closing. They had plenty of time to spend with me and ask about my night. I'm a bar manager at a nice place right down the street, so I can really appreciate their late night service and the time they speny with me. Thanks!!!
beginning: I stopped in for a late night drink right before
mgt: I stopped in for a late night drink right before heading home, and I was pleasantly surprised by the cozy atmosphere. The dim lighting and soft music created a perfect ambiance for unwinding. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable, recommending a fantastic cocktail that exceeded my expectations. I also appreciated the diverse drink menu, which offered something for everyone. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and I can't wait to return for another round.

trgt:
This is a great place for dine-in, delivery, or take-out Chinese food! The restaurant itself is clean, casual, and provides a comfortable environment to hang and eat for however long. The prices are reasonable and portions are generous.

My favorite is their Szechuan garlic chicken extra spicy with white rice. They provide plenty of meat so that you're not fishing through too many veggies to find it. The chicken fried rice is also good because it isn't too greasy. I'm normally not a big fan of fried rice but I enjoyed the one here. I also recommend their wonton soup... hearty and comes with quality wontons (not the yellow, Americanized kinds), and the broth isn't too salty like most other places.

Staff is friendly and helpful... (we all know this is not the case for most Chinese restaurants). They're also lenient with menu modifications so if you like your dish extra spicy or enjoy baby corn the way I do, they will not have a problem making these adjustments. :) Overall I definitely recommend this place for a meal that's quick, cheap, filling, and enjoyable.
beginning: This is a great place for dine-in, delivery, or take-out
mgt: This is a great place for dine-in, delivery, or take-out. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it perfect for family gatherings or casual dates. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, all bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the homemade pasta, which was cooked to perfection. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Whether you're craving comfort food or something more adventurous, this restaurant has something for everyone. Highly recommend!

trgt: BJ's is a large scale brewhouse and has the usual bar menu.  The one dish that sets it apart and keeps me coming back has got to be, Avocado Spring Rolls!  Delicious, warm, a joy to eat.  I swear to god, the 2nd time I had these was better then the first.  \n\nThe reason for 4 stars instead of 5??  Well, the first time I went with a friend, we tried one of the microbrews.  It was so flavorless and tasted as if it had been tapped a years before completion.  Anyway, I stick to the beers I know and love, same with the food :-)
beginning: BJ's is a large scale brewhouse and has the usual
mgt: BJ's is a large scale brewhouse and has the usual array of craft beers on tap, but what truly sets it apart is the diverse menu. From hearty pizzas to flavorful entrees, there's something for everyone. The atmosphere is vibrant, making it a great spot for gatherings. Service is generally attentive, enhancing the overall experience. Don't miss their signature dessert, which is a perfect way to end your meal!

trgt: Food probably gets 2 1/2 stars. The waffles and chicken was pretty good.  But nothing spectacular. \n\nMostly upset about being seated in the worst table in the restaurant even thought it was about 90% empty when we walked in. When we asked for a booth they said sorry that's for party of 5 or more. This was obviously a lie as they went ahead and seated two groups later with 4 people. And they were all white. Very disappointing.  What's even worse, we all had stomach \"problems\" afterwards. All in all a horrible experience.
beginning: Food probably gets 2 1/2 stars. The waffles and chicken
mgt: Food probably gets 2 1/2 stars. The waffles and chicken were underwhelming, lacking the crispy texture I expected. The flavors were bland, and the syrup was overly sweet, masking any potential taste. Service was slow, and the atmosphere felt chaotic. Overall, I left disappointed and unlikely to return.

trgt:
Enjoyed it a lot. Good crowd going on a Thursday night when I pulled in by chance - just walking by. Menu looked interesting. Casual but cozy atmosphere. Scored a decent table despite just walking in off the street with no reservation on a Thurs night and was seated quickly.

Started with a chicken soup of the day and then the Sznycel Mielony - tasty ground meat with mushroom sauce served along with some fried potatoes and what I can only guess was some cabbage? should have asked, but it was good.

Limited wine menu by the glass but I found a Canadian Mission Hill cab from the Okanagan Valley that went nicely.
beginning: Enjoyed it a lot. Good crowd going on a Thursday
mgt: "Enjoyed it a lot. Good crowd going on a Thursday. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the energy was infectious. The music selection was spot on, keeping everyone on their feet. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. I can't wait to come back for another night of fun!"

trgt: I enjoy finding good \"hole-in- the-walls\" and was out in Apache Junction on a Friday  evening a couple of weeks back and needed to find somewhere to eat. Turned to my faithful Yelp, but was let down this time around.  This is just a just a hole. Worst meal that I'v had in a very, very long time. \nRead a number of favorable reviews and went with the \"specialty of the house\" -  fried chicken.  Yes, chicken was fried. Can't say much more. On a scale of 1 through 10, I would give them a 1. Chicken smelt a little ripe and they were the smallest chicken pieces I have seen coming out of a restaurant kitchen. \nThis place is a rural bar/saloon at best, and i think that it gets its faithful flowing from the  local folks as there is nothing else close by.
beginning: I enjoy finding good \"hole-in- the-walls\" and was out in
mgt: "I enjoy finding good 'hole-in-the-walls' and was out in search of a hidden gem when I stumbled upon this quaint little café. The atmosphere was cozy, with mismatched furniture and local art adorning the walls. The menu was surprisingly diverse, featuring homemade pastries and unique coffee blends. I ordered a slice of their famous lemon tart, which was perfectly tangy and sweet. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I can't wait to return and try more of their offerings!"

trgt:
I'm tempted to write a long review about how bad this company is, but I think I've already wasted enough time with them. AVOID

Some highlights of my experience with "Lydia":
1. Realtor waited until the day I arrived in Vegas to tell me she refuses to show me the property I'm interested in unless I come to the office first to look at other properties. 
2. Realtor gave me the incorrect address for the office
3. Realtor chastised me for being "fixated" on one property
4. Tried to talk to someone regarding investing in short term property rentals, no one in this office has heard of AirBNB, lol

Unprofessional garbage. Nothing gets me more irritated than Agents who still think they are blowing your fucking mind by showing you properties on their computer, the same properties you have already seen on your computer days ago, because we live in the information age. Someone needs to put these old goats out to pasture. 

I already wasted my time, you shouldn't have to waste yours.
beginning: I'm tempted to write a long review about how bad
mgt: I'm tempted to write a long review about how bad this experience was, but I'll keep it concise. The service was abysmal, with long wait times and unhelpful staff. The food was bland and poorly presented, leaving much to be desired. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return.

trgt: Slow, painfully slow service.  Only one register open regardless of the length of line.  They exist only because they have a perfect location.  Unbelievable the stuff that goes on here yet customers still come on in.  Wait times for food are horrendous.  There will be numerous people with food in hand in line, yet they sometimes have the only register person also making espresso drinks (slowing down the entire line).  I guess that 2nd register at the end is just for show.
beginning: Slow, painfully slow service. Only one register open regardless of
mgt: the long line of customers waiting. It felt like an eternity just to place my order. The staff seemed overwhelmed and disorganized, which only added to the frustration. I understand that busy times can be challenging, but a little more efficiency would go a long way. The food was decent, but the experience left much to be desired. I hope they improve their service soon.

trgt:
Just signed up and already to 3 strikes.

#1-Some creeper stared at me while I swam laps in the pool and clipped his nails for a full 30 minutes.

#2-Signed up for a trainer, showed up ready to go and found out they had "lost" my appointment. No one apologized, acted like it was my fault, and just rescheduled me.

#3-My husband reported that the men's toilet had pee all over it. Seriously, GROSS!

Since I made the financial commitment and really want pool and yoga access- I'm going to try another location out. My husband on the other hand is ready to cancel and go back to Gold's.
beginning: Just signed up and already to 3 strikes.\n\n#1-Some creeper stared
mgt:
Just signed up and already to 3 strikes.

#1-Some creeper stared at me from across the room, making me feel incredibly uncomfortable. I thought this app was supposed to connect people, not create a space for unwanted attention. 

#2-I tried to engage with someone who seemed interesting, but they only sent one-word replies. It felt more like a chore than a conversation. 

#3-Then, I encountered a profile that was clearly fake, with stock photos and a suspicious bio. It’s frustrating to see so many people misusing the platform. 

Overall, I’m not impressed so far. I hope things improve, but I’m not sure I’ll stick around much longer.

trgt:
Hygienist said that it would cost an extra $90 to clean my teeth. I left and went back to my old dentists' office at Family Dentistry (next to Fry's) and they performed the cleaning with no extra charge. The hygienist was extra pushy and refused to do the standard cleaning. 

Also I was having extreme pain in my gum and the dentist could not determine what was wrong; dentist wrote me a referral to go to an oral surgeion. Again I went to Family Dentistry and they found a laceration in my gum and prescribed me the appropriate medication - dentist there said there was no need to go to an oral surgeon.

I had high hopes for this dental office but they fell WAY short of expectations. I DO NOT recommend this place.
beginning: Hygienist said that it would cost an extra $90 to
mgt: "Hygienist said that it would cost an extra $90 to perform a deep cleaning, which I wasn't expecting. While I understand the importance of dental health, I felt the pricing was not clearly communicated beforehand. The staff was friendly, but I left feeling a bit overwhelmed by the unexpected costs. It would be helpful if they provided a detailed breakdown of services and fees upfront to avoid confusion."

trgt: It lacks identity. Is it a mediocre Japanese restaurant? Or contempory american? It was well cooked, but it wasn't inspired. For example: my main course was Japanese grilled skirt steak with Shishito peppers. My side was truffle Mac and cheese. Did not pair well at all. . . beautiful place, But just \"Okay\" food.
beginning: It lacks identity. Is it a mediocre Japanese restaurant? Or
mgt: "It lacks identity. Is it a mediocre Japanese restaurant? Or perhaps an attempt at fusion that misses the mark? The flavors are muddled, and the presentation feels rushed. While the sushi is fresh, it lacks the artistry and precision expected from a quality establishment. The ambiance is uninspired, making it hard to enjoy the meal. Overall, it leaves diners confused rather than satisfied."

trgt: We chose Hooters instead of Buffalo Wild Wings because we were with a friend who is from Ireland and had never been to a Hooters. It took 45 minutes for our food to arrive, when we were seated, there was less than 10 parties in the whole restaurant. We asked the server to send the manager over and he blamed the slowness on the kitchen getting slammed because there was an event nearby, but we had arrived before \"the kitchen was slammed\". He said he would look at our checks and get back to us, he never returned to our table. Our server came back and asked if everything had been taken care of and we said the manager never came back, she finally was able to get our checks. The manager did give us a discount off of our check, but I was overall disappointed in the whole experience and felt bad for our visiting friend who's first impression of Hooters was terrible.
beginning: We chose Hooters instead of Buffalo Wild Wings because we
mgt: "We chose Hooters instead of Buffalo Wild Wings because we were in the mood for a more relaxed atmosphere and their famous wings. The service was friendly, and our server was attentive without being intrusive. The wings were perfectly crispy and tossed in a variety of flavorful sauces. We also enjoyed the loaded nachos, which were a great shareable option. Overall, it was a fun dining experience, and we left satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: just got back from staying at the Bellagio Hotel for the first time.  All I can say is I was extremely disappointed especially for the price.  First we were put on a smoking floor without notification.  The room was out of date (no flat screen TV) and multiple fixture in the bathroom were falling off.  Turns out they were closing the floor right after we left for updating so they knew the room was not appropriate but still put us there for the weekend.  Finally, service at the front desk was grossly understaffed.  Checking out should not take 30 minutes. Overall would not go back. Better hotels in Vegas.
beginning: just got back from staying at the Bellagio Hotel for
mgt: "just got back from staying at the Bellagio Hotel for a weekend getaway, and it was absolutely incredible! The moment we arrived, the stunning lobby with its beautiful glass flowers took my breath away. Our room was spacious and elegantly decorated, offering a fantastic view of the famous fountains. The staff were attentive and friendly, making us feel welcomed throughout our stay. Dining at the hotel was a delight, with a variety of exquisite restaurants to choose from. I highly recommend the buffet; it was a culinary experience! Overall, the Bellagio exceeded my expectations, and I can't wait to return."

trgt:
When someone says "buffet", usually the world of foodies dies a little inside, but I was surprised at how lovely this place was to eat. Me and my fiancee went here as part of a Groupon for a 2-course meal with rice/naan for 2 but after taking our seats the lady who I took to be either the owner of joint owner offered us the chance to try a little more and asked if we would like to take the buffet instead of the 2 courses. I thought I had went to heaven, as bad as the idea of a buffet is, I couldn't say no to unlimited Indian food.

If the manager is to be believed then everything in the restaurant is homemade, or at least made on the premises. The starters were delicious, the curries were magic, the naan breads were hot and soft and even the desert were lovely but not too sweet.

There is a part of me that feel reviewing a buffet is like reviewing a Tesco, but I was very surprised at how nice and intimate this place was. Service was great and the food was even better.

After having a quick look at the a la carte, I will definitely be coming back to try that.

I'm a self confessed buffet lover and no matter how many good restaurants I go to, I will never change in my need to get elbow deep in food once in a while.
beginning: When someone says \"buffet\", usually the world of foodies dies
mgt: "When someone says 'buffet', usually the world of foodies dies, conjuring images of lukewarm dishes and uninspired selections. However, this buffet defies expectations. Each station offers a vibrant array of flavors, showcasing fresh ingredients and culinary creativity. From the succulent roast meats to the colorful salads, every bite is a delightful surprise. The atmosphere is lively, and the staff is attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. It's a buffet that celebrates quality over quantity, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking a satisfying meal."

trgt: Looks like no one else had my experience.. My mom walked out as miserable as I did, but the friend we took had a great experience. \n\nAs far as massages go, I've had 2: one here, and one at the Hale Koa in Hawaii. My massage at the Hale Koa was in a whole different ball park- like the most amazing experience ever. All the Wynn has are the amazing facilities. You can spend the whole day in there if you like. My actual massage was TERRIBLE. I had a nice enough African American man, and he pinched my skin and left me feeling bruised. This is super unusual for me, as I like my massages rough. It felt like he wasn't massaging muscle, just pinching skin and fat. I'm not a fat person, I was your typical 22 year old, size 7.. so it's not like he couldn't get to my muscles.
beginning: Looks like no one else had my experience.. My mom
mgt: Looks like no one else had my experience. My mom and I visited this restaurant last weekend, and we were thoroughly disappointed. The service was slow, and our server seemed overwhelmed and uninterested. The food, while beautifully presented, lacked flavor and was lukewarm at best. We had high hopes based on the reviews, but unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. I doubt we’ll be returning anytime soon.

trgt: Good food, no parking problem. One of the best Indian restaurants in Vegas.
beginning: Good food, no parking problem. One of the best Indian
mgt: Good food, no parking problem. One of the best Indian restaurants I've visited in the area. The flavors are authentic, and each dish is prepared with care. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend the butter chicken and garlic naan; they are simply delicious!

trgt: So happy that this place was around the corner from where I was staying this past week. I know that LA has a million coffee shops, but there was something special about GreaterThanCoffee! No pretentious baristas, just super friendly service! Never a line, either! The Toddy was delicious as were the bagels. If I lived in Phoenix, I would definitely come to this place every day. Super curious about Co-hoots, the connecting coworking space.
beginning: So happy that this place was around the corner from
mgt: "So happy that this place was around the corner from my apartment! The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot to unwind after a long day. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always ready to recommend their favorite dishes. I tried the signature pasta, and it was absolutely delicious—perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. I can't wait to come back and explore more of the menu!"

trgt: Discovered this place about a month ago and tonight was my 5th and LAST time ever going. Ordered pizza and wings. Out of an order of wings 4 of them were so small that they should have been thrown away instead of served to customers. I uploaded a picture for you to see for yourself. Look in the photos and you will see a chicken wing next to a sugar packet. The sugar packet is bigger than the chicken wing. In my entire life I have never seen wings this small. Since an order of wings is $10 bucks I said something to our waitress assuming these wings just slipped by and I would receive an apology and a few more wings thrown into the fryer that were bigger than a half inch. Well, I received an apology from the waitress but when she asked the owner if she could rectify the problem with a few more normal sized wings she was told NO!\nNever have I been victim to such awful customer service in my entire life. This place could have had a customer for life with my wife and I, now I can guarantee I will never step foot in the House of Pizza ever again.
beginning: Discovered this place about a month ago and tonight was
mgt: "Discovered this place about a month ago and tonight was my third visit. Each time, the atmosphere has been warm and inviting, with friendly staff who genuinely care about your experience. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, and I’ve yet to be disappointed. The pasta is homemade and perfectly cooked, while the desserts are a must-try. I highly recommend the tiramisu—it’s the best I’ve ever had!"

trgt: Idk, but I feel this place is more hype than legit. Curds were avg as was the burger I had. Not bad but not great. Idk if it is worth the wait.
beginning: Idk, but I feel this place is more hype than
mgt: "Idk, but I feel this place is more hype than substance. The atmosphere is nice, but the service was slow and the food didn't live up to expectations. I had heard so much about their signature dish, but it was underseasoned and lacked creativity. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and wouldn't rush back."

trgt: The double double was ok, the fries was horrid. They was so bland with no taste and was not cooked all the way. The line was so long, our total wait from entering door to receiving order was approx 45 mins. While in line a group walks in with a ferret on a leash. Letting the nasty thing ponder the floor like they was in there own house.  It is very in appropriate to take a animal into a fast food place, and letting it ponder. There was a whole lot of disquisted people in line, more then one employee seen it and said nothing to them about having it in the restaraunt.
beginning: The double double was ok, the fries was horrid. They
mgt: The double double was ok, the fries were horrid. They were soggy and lacked any real flavor, making the meal disappointing overall. I expected crispy, golden fries, but instead, I got a sad, limp side that didn’t complement the burger at all. The service was decent, but I won’t be returning for the fries alone.

trgt:
I don't know why I spent even a couple hours in this revamped casino hotel because I wasn't impressed from the start.

The dealers at the blackjack tables are dolled up ladies who circulate between dealing cards and go go dancing.  All fine and dandy if they weren't so rude!

I also expected a lower table limit considering we were downtown and not on the strip.  Yes, it was a Saturday night but $10 minimums at all tables?!?  You can actually find casinos that are similar to this little hole for $3 minimums on the strip (you have to look hard, but they're there!).

Maybe the rooms were nice but I didn't stay there.
beginning: I don't know why I spent even a couple hours
mgt: I don't know why I spent even a couple hours trying to get into this book. The plot was disjointed, and the characters felt flat and unrelatable. I found myself skimming pages, hoping for a spark of interest that never came. It was a struggle to stay engaged, and ultimately, I had to put it down.

trgt:
We decided to order from here based on Yelp reviews.... Overall I wasn't too impressed.

We ordered a small Margarita, small deluxe, garlic knots and a small antipasto salad. We hoped it would be worth the $60 we spent, but the pizza was NOT as thin as we hoped. The garlic knots, we're very dough-y and shaped more like blobs. The antipasto salad was mixed greens with rolled luncheon meat---nothing more. 

We'll keep searching...
beginning: We decided to order from here based on Yelp reviews....
mgt: We decided to order from here based on Yelp reviews, and we were not disappointed. The food was fresh and flavorful, with generous portions that left us satisfied. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our dining experience even better. We particularly enjoyed the signature dish, which was bursting with spices and cooked to perfection. Overall, a fantastic choice for a casual night out!

trgt:
Well... I'm surprised they offer a brunch menu. I actually only thought it was a bar. Come to find out they have a dining room next door. Seems kind of like a diner. Which brings me to my next point. It was okay diner food. 

The brunch menu actually looked pretty promising with some delicious looking breakfast sandwiches. Since I wanted something a bit lighter, I went with the omelet loaded with veggies and cheddar cheese. I didn't realize it came with potatoes until I got it in front of me. Plus toast. Which is nice, but I wish I would have been told from my server so I could have ordered wheat... if they had it. The omelet was okay, but the veggies were still kinda hard, like it wasn't cooked very long. And the homefries weren't very crispy, which in my opinion is the best way to do them. 

So here's the weird thing. Everyone ended up getting their food in shifts. We had a party of 8, so it was pretty large, but we were literally the only party in there other than another four top. First shift got their breakfast sandwiches. They'd eaten most of their meal by the time the second shift got their waffles. The third shift was 3 people who'd ordered omelets. 

It just seemed odd that it took so long in between. I wouldn't have noticed much if it was by a few minutes. But it was a good fifteen or more. It wasn't horrible, because there was good company, but it definitely wasn't the best service I'd had. 

Not sure about the bar area of Hambone's, but I probably wouldn't come back for brunch.
beginning: Well... I'm surprised they offer a brunch menu. I actually
mgt: Well... I'm surprised they offer a brunch menu. I actually didn't expect much, but I was pleasantly surprised by the variety. The avocado toast was fresh and perfectly seasoned, while the pancakes were fluffy and delicious. The atmosphere was cozy, making it a great spot to relax with friends. Overall, I would definitely recommend trying their brunch offerings!

trgt:
The first thing to know about Kennedy's, is that this is not just some reincarnation of the old Ed's that used to be the name of this place.  Kennedy's is a whole different bar with a whole different flavor, both inside and out.

No review about this place is legit unless it mentions the phenomenal patio/deck area in front of the bar as you walk up the front steps.  The patio is full of fans, tables, umbrellas and even mist for when its really hot outside.  

The inside, bar area can def be a bit cramped, especially during peak drinking nights such as the 4th of July. 

Bartenders are always friendly and on point.  

I have never eaten here, so I can't say too much about the food.

There is def a younger, relaxed, New York meets Southern Charm, laid-back vibe to this place.

Kennedy's has a Western New York feel which I love.  If you don't know about a trash/garbage plate?  Well, then there's nothing left to do, but step up to the plate come to Kennedy's and learn how we get down in the Rochester, NY!  Roc Boys in the Building Tonight!
beginning: The first thing to know about Kennedy's, is that this
mgt: The first thing to know about Kennedy's is that this charming little café offers an inviting atmosphere that feels like home. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee greets you at the door, and the friendly staff are always ready with a warm smile. Their menu features a delightful array of pastries and hearty breakfast options, making it the perfect spot to start your day. I highly recommend the avocado toast—it's simply divine!

trgt: Bad service today. Two registers open. One cashier taking multiple orders from one customer. The other cashier let someone cut in front of me then decided she was done waiting on customers. With a line out the door there was no manager around. I left without ordering.
beginning: Bad service today. Two registers open. One cashier taking multiple
mgt: customers at once while the other was busy chatting with a coworker. The wait time was ridiculous, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. I left feeling frustrated and disappointed. This isn't the first time I've experienced poor service here.

trgt: Super kid friendly, for kids under about 7 years old.  The only bad thing is that in the summer time, it gets outrageously hot and there's no where to get A/C protection... but I suppose welcome to Phoenix in the summertime.
beginning: Super kid friendly, for kids under about 7 years old.
mgt: Super kid friendly, for kids under about 7 years old. The activities are engaging and age-appropriate, ensuring that little ones stay entertained. The staff is incredibly patient and helpful, making it a stress-free experience for parents. The colorful decor and playful atmosphere create a welcoming environment. Overall, it's a fantastic place for young children to explore and have fun!

trgt: This is a really professional, friendly and comfortable place to learn and have fun.  We needed a refresher course before a big wedding, so we responded to an advertised package, liked what and how we were taught, and had no hesitation in signing up for more lessons.  We're almost ready for the wedding and now we're planning additional instruction for the next big event.  We've even joined in a few group lessons.  Our instructor makes the lessons fun, and there is just the right balance between technical and style instruction, understanding our level of competence, and keeping it light and encouraging.  We always look forward to the lessons.
beginning: This is a really professional, friendly and comfortable place to
mgt: "This is a really professional, friendly and comfortable place to unwind and enjoy quality service. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure every guest feels valued. The ambiance is inviting, making it perfect for both casual visits and special occasions. I highly recommend trying their signature dishes; they are simply delightful!"

trgt: on the 20th, someone mentioned on facebook that there were bad reviews on yelp. since then, there have been nothing but glowing 4 and 5 star reviews. think the owners got their friends to pump them up. I do. c'mon yelp. I was there. not impressed. menu is way too ambitious for a sports bar. some people may like that. I don't. overpriced and off the wall menu. maybe that's why they won't post it on their website. owners need to make up their minds. do they want to be a neighborhood sports bar like they claim, or do they want to be an upscale, overpriced, overrated bistro gastro pub in a neighborhood location. if I want to get ripped off I can go to the strip. i'm looking for a true neighborhood pub. hope they go in that direction.
beginning: on the 20th, someone mentioned on facebook that there were
mgt: "on the 20th, someone mentioned on Facebook that there were new menu items at our favorite local café. Intrigued, I decided to check it out. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a warm atmosphere and friendly staff. The new dishes did not disappoint; each one was bursting with flavor and creativity. I especially loved the seasonal pumpkin risotto, which was perfectly creamy and seasoned. Overall, it was a delightful experience that I can't wait to repeat!"

trgt:
Sushi for three!  
I am terrible at ordering sushi. So my darling friend Jen took the lead. 
We ended up with  2 appetizers - Dragon Balls and deep fried veg, and 40 pieces of sushi - not sure exactly what they were, but there were some California rolls, eel, salmon, cucumber, rice, seaweed wrap and a whole bunch of delicious things! 
Pictures to follow! 

Nice touch: they bring hot towels to your table! Service was attentive and prompt. 
The restaurant is on a quiet street in Old Montreal, walking distance to a street, I don't remember the name...sawrrrry!

Food was absolutely amazing! We couldn't finish the two plates between three of us. Next day left overs were amazing though!

Yum!
beginning: Sushi for three! \nI am terrible at ordering sushi. So
mgt: I usually rely on my friends to guide me through the menu. This time, we decided to try a variety platter. The freshness of the fish was outstanding, and each piece melted in my mouth. The spicy tuna roll was a standout, bursting with flavor. The ambiance was cozy, making it a perfect spot for a casual night out. Overall, a delightful experience that left me eager to return!

trgt: The highlight of my meal was the lemongrass iced tea... which wasn't even that superb to being with. I understand what Tottie is trying to do here, but the execution is just blah. My steamed pork egg roll was dry and more stuffed with lettuce than anything, the peanut sauce didn't even soften it up. The sushi was mediocre and honestly forgettable. The 2nd star is for ambience, since it was pretty strategically lit and set up. I dunno, I wasn't really impressed and probably won't return again, but then again maybe Tottie's isn't my cup of tea.
beginning: The highlight of my meal was the lemongrass iced tea...
mgt: "The highlight of my meal was the lemongrass iced tea, which was refreshingly aromatic and perfectly balanced in sweetness. It complemented the spicy dishes beautifully, enhancing the overall dining experience. The vibrant flavors of the food paired well with the tea, making each sip a delightful contrast to the heat. I highly recommend trying it alongside the grilled shrimp, which was tender and bursting with flavor. Overall, a fantastic meal that left me eager to return!"

trgt:
Recently visited this place for lunch and was pretty satisfied with what The Arrogant Butcher had to offer. I have made it a point to try all of the Phoenix City Scape restaurants and become familiar with the lunch menus of these restaurants.

Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by a graciously hip host who made us feel very welcomed. The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty cool and the location is perfect for downtown lunch commuters. 

I had the turkey pastrami sandwich and my friend has the cobb salad. The turkey pastrami sandwich was really amazing and the lunch portions were satisfying enough. I am not a big turkey fan but I will be calling this one of my all time favorite sandwiches, the coleslaw that accompanies that sandwich adds much need texture and is also refreshing. The fresh parmesan fries were great as well.

Plan on visiting this place during your lunch break if you have an hour or more. The place was not busy and it took around 25-30 minutes to receive a sandwich and a salad. This is the only reason why I did not rate a 5/5. 

But overall great resaturant, good food, good prices, good ambience, good drinks, and great experience. Will visit again soon.
beginning: Recently visited this place for lunch and was pretty satisfied
mgt: Recently visited this place for lunch and was pretty satisfied. The atmosphere was inviting, with a cozy decor that made it perfect for a midday break. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, which was juicy and flavorful, paired with a side of crispy fries. The service was prompt and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. I’ll definitely be returning to try more items from the menu!

trgt: Love whole foods! The store has a great selection of fresh, healthy food. I always go in to get a kale salad. This store offers several different ready to go food departments that make it convenient for grabbing lunch, dinner or a snack. I recommend that everyone try whole foods. Don't let the prices scare you, you're paying for quality and its your body that you're fueling. Why not eat good and fresh!
beginning: Love whole foods! The store has a great selection of
mgt: "Love whole foods! The store has a great selection of organic produce, fresh meats, and unique snacks. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable, ready to help with any questions. I appreciate their commitment to sustainability and local sourcing. The atmosphere is inviting, making it a pleasure to shop there. Plus, their prepared meals are a lifesaver for busy weeknights!"

trgt:
First: Big ups to Yelp and giving me a 20% off food coupon on my phone after checking in at Hard Rock Café.  We were in a group of 10 so that was big savings.  Showed it to the waiter and he applied the discount no problemo.

Food: Disappointing to say the least.  Pulled pork sandwich was dry and the bbq sauce was too sweet and overpowering.  I also observed my other friends who did not finish their food, not a good sign given that it was lunch and we were hungry. 

Drinks: had a large sized mojito which is supposed to have at least 3 shots.  Tasted like there was no booze at all.  My friend who got the same drink absolutely concurred.  Not happy.

Service: combined with the 20% off Yelp coupon, the service was the saving grace points of our visit.  Our guy was spot on, full of energy, would sing along with the tracks in the background and give us descriptions of the dishes.  Now if only the descriptions could turn into taste, it would have been a better experience.
beginning: First: Big ups to Yelp and giving me a 20%
mgt: First: Big ups to Yelp and giving me a 20% discount on my meal! I decided to try out this new Italian restaurant in town, and I was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance was cozy, the staff was friendly, and the food was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the truffle pasta; it was rich and flavorful. Overall, a fantastic dining experience!

trgt: super small selection.  really.  go to Mandalay Bay instead.
beginning: super small selection. really. go to Mandalay Bay instead.
mgt: "Super small selection. Really. Go to Mandalay Bay instead. The atmosphere here felt cramped, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. The few options available were underwhelming and lacked variety. I expected more from this venue, especially given its location. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that left me wishing I had chosen a different place to dine."

trgt: The website has a $2 off coupon, so that makes a men's haircut 13 bucks, but you have to tip, so it comes out to $15 anyway. Nothing great about the haircut really. The girl who cut my hair was nice and we chatted during cut, but she was very young and inexperienced. Nothing got destroyed on my head. It was a middle of the road cut for a walk-in. Might be better if you were a regular and knew someone here that you trusted. Still, it was a very friendly place and a good one-time cut if you need one quickly (i had a 10 minute wait at 11am midweek)
beginning: The website has a $2 off coupon, so that makes
mgt: "The website has a $2 off coupon, so that makes shopping here even more appealing. The selection is impressive, featuring a wide range of products that cater to various needs. I found the checkout process to be smooth and user-friendly, which is always a plus. Additionally, the customer service was responsive when I had a question about my order. Overall, I highly recommend this site for anyone looking for great deals and quality items."

trgt: I actually look forward to my visits!!!! No lie!  Amazing staff, very friendly and caring....almost like being at happy hour with friends without the alcohol.  Lol That's my only suggestion... Serve martinis with a cleaning.   My teeth always feel super clean after my visit.  Honest business people.  Best I have ever been to.
beginning: I actually look forward to my visits!!!! No lie! Amazing
mgt: "I actually look forward to my visits!!!! No lie! Amazing atmosphere, friendly staff, and the service is always top-notch. The menu offers a fantastic variety, and every dish I've tried has been delicious. It's a place where I can relax and enjoy great company. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience!"

trgt:
The music is too loud.

Sorry, had to get that out of the way. I've been to MTO twice during my lunch breaks from work since it is so nicely close to my place of employment. It is certainly a nice place, with a vibrant color scheme and fun TV screens that display cute sayings and funny pictures. 

Food is scrumptious and varies between fatty and healthy. You can find a mix of ingredients, interesting and quirky, while also on the menu, you have traditional items to please the crowds. 

Last time I was here I had the FAT ELVIS. I couldn't help myself, french toast with bacon, strawberries, blueberries, bananas, peanut butter, and nutella, served with maple syrup. COME ON, even if you don't want it, you have to be interested, right? It was a heaping portion, for $13 and I only ate half. The mix of flavors is decent, french toast was done right, fluffy, not mushy, nice char on the bread, but not over-powering. Bread used it perfect, big and much like Texas toast style. Fruits were fresh and helpful since the meal is so very filling. Peanut-butter and Nutella flavors go well with the banana, but not so much the bacon in my opinion. I would opt to have the bacon on the side. 

I've also had the Hen House wrap here, and I believe it's better than the Fat Elvis. Wrap was not mushy or dry. Lettuce was crispy and fresh. Chicken was grilled well and honestly, probably one of the better wraps I've had in my existence of eating wraps. And I don't regularly consume them. Coffee is also good and comes in a nice, large cup.

Bonus - they have PINK lemonade on their menu. Yes, I ordered it. Yes, it was good. 

Overall return factor very likely. Recommended for breakfast and lunch.
beginning: The music is too loud.\n\nSorry, had to get that out
mgt: of my system. While I appreciate a good beat, the volume completely overshadows the lyrics and the overall vibe of the performance. It’s hard to connect with the artist when you’re struggling to hear their message. I found myself wishing for a more balanced sound that would allow the nuances of the music to shine through. The energy was there, but it felt overwhelming rather than engaging.

trgt:
Deep fried goodness from the snack bar in the back of Mermaids!

I don't go here to gamble or for the drinks. I go for the unhealthy snacks like the deep fried twinkies or oreos, or even the hot dogs. 

The place isn't the newest or the nicest and in fact, this time around, some of the clientele seemed seedy but I wasn't there to make friends - I was there to eat! 

I didn't have one but the have hot dogs for a buck. Not too bad if you need something in your gut other than the booze you can get cheap at the bar or anywhere on Fremont Street.
beginning: Deep fried goodness from the snack bar in the back
mgt: "Deep fried goodness from the snack bar in the back, where the aroma of crispy batter fills the air. Each bite is a delightful crunch, perfectly seasoned and bursting with flavor. The variety is impressive, from classic onion rings to unique creations like fried avocado. The portions are generous, making it a great spot to share with friends. Don't forget to try their signature dipping sauces, which elevate the experience even further. A must-visit for any snack lover!"

trgt: COLORED ONLY: Sat in what felt like the minority section of the patio which was the secluded darkened desolate corner area. This area probably wouldn't have been so bad, but this area also doubled as the smoking section for a family of Russians who decided to come out for a smoke while we were eating...not \"da harasho\" for us. So if this didn't make you feel like you were in the \"minority section\", I guess the lack of space heaters would. Every other table had at least one/two space heaters in the vicinity, but we got ZERO on a slightly nipple chill'n' night. When we asked Roger our server for one, he just responded with an off-the-cuff response that there weren't any space heaters (we're out of propane/not working). This would have been slightly tolerable, if we had just popped in unexpectedly, but we had reservations well in advance because this was for a bachelor party (also our tables and chairs didn't match the rest). The only way this was rectified, was luckily for us a food runner named Tommy took the initiative and went into action and GOT US A SPACE HEATER. I'm glad he stepped up, otherwise we would have just gotten left in the cold. \n\nSo why did we not get the attentive service we should have? Maybe our party looked young, and they didn't feel as though they had to go the extra distance, but whatever the reason, Roger didn't come through as he should have although I should say he was very professional in managing his ability to hold on to whatever tip he could hope for. Also his other assistant Mano (don't know the spelling) definitely did do a great job because he did most of the work (not a shock he was minority, haha). Of course, what should be said is that we were most likely just the recipients of bad service/management, but I throw it back to race and blame it on my  Filipino entourage.... Ok, all kidding aside, the moral of this story is that it's not necessarily race/discrimination, but sometimes its just crappy sub-par service whatever color you are.
beginning: COLORED ONLY: Sat in what felt like the minority section
mgt: "COLORED ONLY: Sat in what felt like the minority section, surrounded by an atmosphere that was both vibrant and tense. The energy was palpable, yet there was an underlying sense of division that made the experience bittersweet. The performances were powerful, showcasing incredible talent, but the segregation left me questioning the inclusivity of the event. It’s crucial for spaces like this to foster unity rather than separation, allowing everyone to celebrate together."

trgt: I like yummy wine.  I like yummy beer.  I like yummy food.\n\nPretty hard to find a place that has all 3 out in the west valley of phoenix but here it is!
beginning: I like yummy wine. I like yummy beer. I like
mgt: "I like yummy wine. I like yummy beer. I like exploring new flavors and discovering unique brews that surprise my palate. Each sip tells a story, whether it's a crisp white or a rich stout. The experience of tasting different varieties is always exciting, and I appreciate the craftsmanship behind each bottle. Cheers to the joy of good drinks!"

trgt: Wow I love this place! Got the best cut that I've gotten the entire time I've lived in Vegas. ASK FOR NAOMi. She is extremely professional with excellent technique . I know a good bit about cutting hair - for a guy she is too notch and very up to date in the latest styles. Included was shampoo twice, conditioner , paragon hand wax treatment and a facial scrub/massage. $42 plus tip. Setting an appointment through Yelp was a breeze. Don't waste time looking, trust me see Naomi!
beginning: Wow I love this place! Got the best cut that
mgt: Wow I love this place! Got the best cut that I've had in years. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure I felt comfortable throughout the entire process. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the attention to detail is impressive. I left feeling rejuvenated and confident. I can't wait to come back for my next appointment! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great haircut.

trgt: Super yummy Roma pizza- glad I made the trip. Arugula salad a little underdressed, chopped salad was wonderful. Probably could have staffed up for a Saturday night but staff was friendly and efficient. Will definitely be back.
beginning: Super yummy Roma pizza- glad I made the trip. Arugula
mgt: Super yummy Roma pizza—glad I made the trip. Arugula added a fresh, peppery kick that complemented the rich tomato sauce perfectly. The crust was thin and crispy, just how I like it. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the generous toppings made it even better. The atmosphere was cozy, and the staff were friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable. I can't wait to come back and try more of their delicious offerings!

trgt:
I can't really give a polished review for this venue when I is be a runnin' late.

I mean its spacious. The staffs nice. I could hear the show. Tall people should stand in the back. Didn't order any food maybe for the next show I will. Haven't really explored much of the venue itself...err...this review needs to be updated the next time I visit. Which will be soon so...yar... don't listen to me.

3 stars.
beginning: I can't really give a polished review for this venue
mgt: I can't really give a polished review for this venue, as my experience was a bit mixed. The ambiance was inviting, with warm lighting and comfortable seating, but the service left something to be desired. While the staff was friendly, they seemed overwhelmed and slow to respond. The food was decent, but not exceptional, lacking the flair I had hoped for. Overall, it’s a place with potential, but improvements in service and menu variety could elevate it significantly.

trgt: Great for a car wash but oh my god on the up-sells when you get an oil change. Seriously they are so hard to deal with when they upsell you constantly. Windshield, detailing, fluids, filters..it goes on and on. It just really ruins it and I will just go to walmart where they won't hassle me non stop. Lost customer.
beginning: Great for a car wash but oh my god on
mgt: "Great for a car wash but oh my god on the highway, it feels like you're driving a boat! The handling is quite wobbly, and the noise level is surprisingly high. While it does a fantastic job of keeping the exterior clean, I wouldn't recommend it for long trips. The interior could use some soundproofing, and the ride comfort leaves much to be desired. Overall, it's a mixed bag."

trgt: Well, it was a surprise!  Some reviews said that the food quality was very poor and such, quite a contrast actually.  \nThe food was good (chicken tikka, chicken curry, aloo tikki, aloo gobhi, chhole, dal makhani).  The dessert section had kheer (rice pudding) and gulab jamun.  The chicken curry was good and the naan was soft.  The aloo tikki was nothing special and I did not try the vegetarian items as I was full.  \nFor $9.62 including tax this was a good place.  They even had lassis and fountain drinks but I didn't try it.  They do take credit cards too so that helps travelers like me.  I'd have given it a 3.5 stars rather than a 4 but 4 it is!
beginning: Well, it was a surprise! Some reviews said that the
mgt: "Well, it was a surprise! Some reviews said that the plot was predictable, but I found it to be quite engaging. The characters were well-developed, and their interactions felt genuine. The cinematography was stunning, capturing the essence of each scene beautifully. Overall, I left the theater feeling satisfied and eager to discuss it with friends."

trgt:
Enrique.P

Around mid February we adopted a small dog from spca, we were told that the dog was healthy with no problems? 2 days later we discovered that the dog was not Eating? She had teeth hanging from her upper jaw
Spca told us that they will help with the $600 surgical cost over the phone. We took the dog back and we were told that we are not getting her back, they will conduct and investigation? And the adoption fee could go for the surgery cost? I Want my dog back!!! The rude lady behind the counter needs a little training in customer service and courtesy this is a service town not Salem......,
beginning: Enrique.P\n\nAround mid February we adopted a small dog from spca,
mgt:
Enrique.P

Around mid February we adopted a small dog from SPCA, and it has been one of the best decisions we've ever made. Our new furry friend, whom we named Max, has brought so much joy and energy into our home. He is playful, affectionate, and quickly adapted to our family routine. The staff at SPCA were incredibly helpful, providing us with all the information we needed to ensure a smooth transition. Max has already become a beloved member of our family, and we can't imagine life without him. Highly recommend adopting from SPCA!

trgt: I used to go here regularly, but stopped... the kid who works at the front desk is a pain. He says there are appointments available, then says there aren't. I went in for my appointment, waited 30 minutes and then when I asked him what was going on he had an attitude, I don't mind waiting when I'm a walk in, but not when I've made an appt days before. The girls do a good job... if you can get in and they're not busy because they're great, they're busy because they only have two girls working the whole place.
beginning: I used to go here regularly, but stopped... the kid
mgt: "I used to go here regularly, but stopped visiting after the kid behind the counter became increasingly rude. It was disappointing to see such a decline in customer service. The atmosphere used to be welcoming, but now it feels uninviting. I hope they can turn things around, as I really enjoyed the food and the vibe."

trgt:
Was aight... For Americanized Asian food.. I had the schezwan spicy beef noodle soup. My friend had the seafood noodle soup which she thought was ok too.  

For a restaurant in the Aria that's trying to cater to most of the asians who come to Vegas to gamble and party.. its an easy and quick alternative to getting a cab and going to the chinatown area of Las Vegas.

This is also one of the restaurants that is included in the list of comped restaurants in the Aria.
beginning: Was aight... For Americanized Asian food.. I had the schezwan
mgt: "Was aight... For Americanized Asian food.. I had the schezwan chicken, and while it had a decent kick, it lacked the authentic depth of flavor I was hoping for. The sauce was a bit too sweet for my taste, overshadowing the spices. The portion size was generous, though, and the service was friendly. Overall, it’s a solid choice if you’re craving something quick and familiar, but don’t expect a true taste of Sichuan cuisine."

trgt:
Yelp reviews led us to this breakfast spot today.  No exaggeration, this was our best meal in Las Vegas.  Incredibly friendly service, fantastic food.  Nothing to look at, but when you dig into the gooey cinnamon roll you won't be able to pay attention to anything but your taste buds.  Holy cow.
Eggs were fluffy and not greasy.  Pancakes were equally fluffy, and flavorful.  Bacon was thick cut and cooked perfectly.
I'm grateful this place is not local to me.  If I lived within 50 miles of this place I'd gain 50 pounds in a week.
Oh, and did I mention all this - two entrees, two drinks and a cinnamon roll made by the Tasty Fairy herself- all for $22.  It was their valentines day special.
Treat yourself.  Worth the car rental to get here.
beginning: Yelp reviews led us to this breakfast spot today. No
mgt: Yelp reviews led us to this breakfast spot today. No regrets! The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, with friendly staff who made us feel right at home. We ordered the avocado toast and the classic eggs Benedict, both of which were delicious and beautifully presented. The coffee was rich and flavorful, perfectly complementing our meal. We’ll definitely be back to try more items from the menu!

trgt: I've been there only once but the place is actually pretty small and the crowd is pretty young (around 18-20). \n\nThe entrance fee seems rather high for the place.
beginning: I've been there only once but the place is actually
mgt: "I've been there only once but the place is actually a hidden gem. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with cozy seating and soft lighting that creates a perfect atmosphere for relaxation. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure we felt welcome throughout our visit. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, each beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. I can't wait to return and explore more of what they have to offer!"

trgt: I was there for a conference and I am a local. I didn't stay in the hotel but I was there for over 8 hours so I used the conference room and ate lunch there. The food selection was OK, but it is similar to other casino's. I ate at Metro Pizza. The reason for the low rating has to do with the conference room. The group didn't purchase a group wireless internet package so in order for us to get wifi, we had to purchase it on our own. Not usually a bad thing until I was told by their sales office that it is $24.95 for one hour and $80 for the day. Are you serious? My monthly high speed internet is only  $50 for the month. I was attending a conference and usually it is included or a nominal fee to get it, but $25 for one hour is ridiculous.  Stay away from them if you need wifi while on the premises. They do offer a basic wifi with the room but charge an additional $8 to get decent speeds. Caution if you need good wifi speeds.
beginning: I was there for a conference and I am a
mgt: "I was there for a conference and I am a bit disappointed with the overall experience. The venue was not as spacious as advertised, making it difficult to navigate between sessions. Additionally, the audio-visual equipment had several issues, which disrupted presentations. On a positive note, the catering was excellent, with a variety of delicious options. However, the lack of adequate seating during breaks made it challenging to network effectively. Overall, while the content of the conference was valuable, the logistics left much to be desired."

trgt:
I wish that I could rate this place zero stars or negative stars.  

Here are just a few things that I did not like: 

1) Room's cleanliness: Room was very dirty. I found a Revlon makeup container in the bedroom floor. So, it was evident that the housekeepers didn't vacuum. I am a male and I don't use makeup. My wife doesn't use Revlon, so I know it wasn't something that fell out of my suitcase. 

The bathroom was, in their own manager's words, "disgusting."  I found lots of hair on the bathroom floor (obviously, no one even attempted to clean this). I also found pubic hairs on the tub and sink.  Let's just sat that I shave and there is no chance that the body hair of any kind was mine.  Several "clean" towels had hairs on them, and the hairs were from different people (hairs were red, blond, black, brown, etc.). 

Until this trip, I had never complained at a hotel ever in my entire life. I used to clean bathrooms and gyms as a college student, so I know how tough it is to get the job done in the time allotted. Also, I am a very forgiving person. I don't expect my room to be as clean as an operating room. On Saturday morning, I went to the manager and complained. He listened to me, and expressed his apologies. He also said that the hair in the floor was "disgusting" and "unacceptable." He offered me a free buffet ticket.  That's it.  A free buffet ticket...wait for it...for two people.  He basically accused me of lying. 

I got the sense that the manager thought I had invited some women into my room because he asked me several times if I was alone (and, I was). I suppose the issue was that I didn't complain shortly after checking in. Well, I basically fell asleep as soon as I got to my room on Friday night and I didn't wake up until Saturday morning. I complained as soon as I noticed the hair. 

Lesson learned: check your room ASAP after entering and report any dissatisfactory conditions immediately. 

The housekeeping manager came to my room later on Saturday and checked on my room. That was a nice gesture and made me feel like they actually cared a little. 

2) Check-in Process: I arrived around 4:00 PM on a Friday. The line to check in was very long, and it took about 30 minutes to get to the desk to check in. 

3) Ambiance: There were a lot of people in the hotel promoting various dinner specials, show specials, etc. I don't want to deal with that inside my hotel. The Strip is one thing, but come on: I don't want chaos inside my hotel. I go inside to get some peace. The hotel's crowd included a lot of country-Western "macho" guys, which I can't tolerate being around. I also prefer to be around a little bit higher class of person than was at Treasure Island. I don't like being threatened at a bar for accidentally bumping into someone who was blocking the only walking path in Gilley's bar. 

4) Wi-fi internet not free: It's a little ridiculous that hotels charge for wi-fi. At least it was fast wi-fi.
beginning: I wish that I could rate this place zero stars
mgt: I wish that I could rate this place zero stars. The service was abysmal, and the staff seemed completely uninterested in helping customers. My order was wrong, and when I brought it to their attention, they were dismissive and rude. The atmosphere was uninviting, and the cleanliness left much to be desired. I will not be returning.

trgt:
Service? Here? Yeah right.
I was seated in the middle of the main walkway. I could have asked to sit somewhere but I was short on time and needed to eat before I got on my plane. It would be awhile before I could eat again.
I sat there for about 10 minutes while I watched them go take orders from other customers that walked in before me...and I was in their path. 

Ordered a burrito. 
It arrived.
Tasted like a bland version of a Chipotle burrito....and I am not a fan of Chipotle.

I was charged twice for my drink. Probably would have paid and not given it a second thought until I saw it later, but at $3.50 a soda. It was VERY obvious.

Next time I'll eat before I get through security or try another concourse.
beginning: Service? Here? Yeah right.\nI was seated in the middle of
mgt:
"Service? Here? Yeah right.
