mgt: ***disclaimer: my friend Melissa B. loves this place (please see her glowing review for more details). However, my experience was quite different. The service was slow, and the food, while beautifully presented, lacked the flavor I was hoping for. I found the atmosphere to be overly noisy, making it hard to enjoy a conversation. Overall, I left feeling underwhelmed and disappointed. I might give it another chance, but it certainly didn't live up to the hype for me.

trgt: Not impressed...I was in Scottsdale for a few days on business and decided to get a relaxing pedicure in my free time.  After reading the reviews I decided to try Pro Nails by Julie.  When I called to make an appt I specifically asked for Julie since she is the one mentioned in most of the reviews.  The place is clean and they do have a nice selection of colors.  I sat down in the chair and was given a bottle of water which is a nice touch but when it came to the cuticle clipping and filing it was awful.  She hardly clipped my cuticles at all and she filed my toenails crooked and they were all different lengths!! This is Julie, the owner? I live in Southern CA and you can go to any nail shop and get a better job for a much better price.  I paid $33 for basically a polish change and a little lotion on my legs and the massage that other Yelpers reviewed about being so good? ummm not so much...I really wish Bliss wasnt booked solid I would have gladly paid an extra $20 for a good job.
beginning: Not impressed...I was in Scottsdale for a few days on
mgt: Not impressed...I was in Scottsdale for a few days on a business trip and expected a lot more from my stay. The hotel was outdated, and the amenities were lacking. The staff, while friendly, seemed overwhelmed and unorganized. I had issues with my room not being cleaned properly, and the Wi-Fi was spotty at best. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and would not recommend this place to others.

trgt:
Janet Lynn's was pretty much my entry into fine dining as I grew up and went to university, as an incredibly classy and romantic anniversary. It's been my go to place for special occasions ever since. 

The menu doesn't change much but the service is just so attentive that It keeps me going back. The room is lovely and maybe a bit stuffy, but it is a welcome change from the restaurants that are closer to the universities. I did feel out of place at first because we were the youngest people there, but our waitress was so nice and helpful with everything on the menu/wine list.

When the food came I did scarf it down (possibly to the chagrin and scoffing of the table next to us) but it was so delicious. The duck and chicken were so delicious as was the creme brulee for dessert.

Forget Symposium for first dates, take him/her to Janet Lynn's for something romantic, memorable and elegant.
beginning: Janet Lynn's was pretty much my entry into fine dining
mgt: "Janet Lynn's was pretty much my entry into fine dining, and it set a high bar for all my future experiences. The ambiance was elegant yet inviting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that made every meal feel special. The menu offered a delightful array of dishes, each beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the seared scallops, which were perfectly cooked and paired with a vibrant citrus sauce. The attentive service added to the overall experience, making me feel valued as a guest. I left with a sense of satisfaction and a desire to return."

trgt: It was great the last few times...\n till I found a dried piece of spinach stuck on my fork when I unwrapped the silverware, and dishes had crumbs encrusted on them.
beginning: It was great the last few times...\n till I found
mgt: It was great the last few times... till I found that the quality had noticeably declined. The service was slower, and my order was incorrect. I used to love the atmosphere, but now it feels rushed and chaotic. I hope they can return to their previous standards because I really want to enjoy this place again.

trgt: Obsessed with Postinos! I live right down the street from there and frequent it quite often. I'm a vegetarian so it's sometimes difficult for me to eat places but at Postino's they have wonderful meat-free bruschetta options. They also have excellent Sangria for those who are looking for a lighter fruity alternative to wine. I like to go there on Sunday's and drink $5 Sangria pints and listen to the reggae band. So fun!
beginning: Obsessed with Postinos! I live right down the street from
mgt: "Obsessed with Postinos! I live right down the street from this charming wine bar, and it never disappoints. The atmosphere is always vibrant, making it the perfect spot for a casual night out or a special celebration. Their bruschetta is a must-try, with a variety of toppings that never fail to impress. Plus, the wine selection is extensive and reasonably priced, allowing you to explore new flavors without breaking the bank. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend the perfect pairing. I can't recommend Postinos enough!"

trgt: A group of 7 of us went on a Tuesday night to celebrate our friend's birthday. It was a disaster from the beginning. The waitress neglected to ask the birthday girl what she wanted to drink. She also failed to notice that one of our guests had accidentally spilled his soda and commented to the spiller \"wow! you're really sucking those down let me grab you another one\" and left him in a wet mess. Out of all 7 of us, only the birthday girl's entree was messed out [talk about some bad birthday luck!]. The salmon she ordered wasn't fully cooked! And she's not a fan of sushi... The waitress didn't apologize and just said \"oh, i'll take it to the kitchen so they can fix it.\" Our birthday girl had a chat with the manager to let him know that we were a little \"miffed\" by the [lack of] service to say the least. The manager said he would send us a new waitress and comp her uncooked salmon. We never got a new waitress and when she brought us the bill she proclaimed \"wow! for some reason my manager gave ya'll a 25% discount! you guys must be stoked!\" ...On the way out, one of our guests overheard her telling a fellow waitress that \"I heard heroin isn't bad for you so I do it from time to time.\" \n\nJust another example of why drugs are bad for you kids.
beginning: A group of 7 of us went on a Tuesday
mgt: A group of 7 of us went on a Tuesday, and we were pleasantly surprised by the cozy atmosphere. The service was attentive, and our server was knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered a variety of dishes to share, and each one was delicious. The highlight was definitely the roasted chicken, which was perfectly seasoned and tender. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience, and we can't wait to return!

trgt:
My wife and I had a craving for Middle Eastern food. I checked on Yelp and found this place where our friends could meet us halfway. They bailed, but we went ahead and enjoyed a delicious meal. 
It was a bit strange to be eating in an old 5 and Diner restaurant. None of the ambiance was changed except for the addition of the TV and water pipes lining the wall. We were there for the food.
We started off with the Baba Ghannoughe. The pit bread was okay and the Baba Ghannoughe was oily but edible. 
My wife ordered a cup of Lintel soup with her Chicken Sharawma sandwich. The soup was excellent and she ordered a bowl to go which looked like a cup instead of a bowl. 
Her sandwich was okay...we got spoiled at Sabuddy when it was in Tempe and and then in Scottsdale, their sandwich was in the pocket of the pita bread and not wrapped like a burrito.
I ordered the Shish Kafta which was 3 pieces of ground beef and lamb char-broiled with a side of onions & tomato and white rice topped with currant raisins. The meat was cooked just right...firm & flavorful and the rice was okay. It's a good thing I didn't eat lunch 'cause there were good portions on my plate.
We topped it off with Baklava...mmmm...so good.
beginning: My wife and I had a craving for Middle Eastern
mgt: My wife and I had a craving for Middle Eastern cuisine, so we decided to try the new restaurant in town. From the moment we walked in, the warm ambiance and inviting aromas set the perfect tone. We started with the hummus and pita, which was creamy and flavorful, paired beautifully with a drizzle of olive oil. For the main course, we shared a mixed grill platter that featured tender kebabs and perfectly spiced chicken. Each bite was a delightful explosion of flavors, and the portion sizes were generous. The service was attentive without being intrusive, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. We left feeling satisfied and eager to return for more!

trgt: Incredible nachos.  Incredible food. Try their best sellers.  Atmosphere is quaint. Great for a casual date night. Enjoy!
beginning: Incredible nachos. Incredible food. Try their best sellers. Atmosphere is
mgt: "Incredible nachos. Incredible food. Try their best sellers. Atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it the perfect spot for gatherings. The staff is attentive and friendly, ensuring a delightful dining experience. Don't miss out on their signature drinks, which perfectly complement the delicious dishes. Overall, a must-visit for anyone craving a fantastic meal!"

trgt: Pretty good burger! Good beer selection & happy hour prices. We shared the Juicy Lucy - it was cooked just right and had nice gooey, melty cheese inside that oozed out when we cut into it. We had the tater tots which were really good. Love when they are cooked just right and come out perfectly golden brown and hot and crispy all around. While the quality seemed ok it lacked a bit of flavor. Had to season it pretty good with salt and pepper - but that can go both ways. I do like to season my own food so that wasn't a deal breaker for me. If or when we are back in the area we'd stop in again.
beginning: Pretty good burger! Good beer selection & happy hour prices.
mgt: Pretty good burger! Good beer selection & happy hour prices. The atmosphere is relaxed, making it a great spot to unwind after work. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you have everything you need. I particularly enjoyed the crispy fries that came with my meal. Overall, a solid choice for a casual night out!

trgt: Doesn't offer the all you can eat prime rib as of end of august.\nHowever there is enough on the single order to satisfy the average person.
beginning: Doesn't offer the all you can eat prime rib as
mgt: "Doesn't offer the all you can eat prime rib as advertised, which was a major disappointment. The service was slow, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. While the ambiance was pleasant, the food quality didn't meet expectations. I had hoped for a memorable dining experience, but it fell short. I might consider returning, but only if they improve their offerings."

trgt:
Stopped in Sunday after the recommendation of a friend.  It was blazing hot outside and the A/C in my house wasn't keeping up with it, so I needed a cold beer, cool air, and sports.  This is the place.  I would call this a true sports bar.  Great atmosphere, very friendly and attentive bar tenders, and pleanty of TV's with a wide variety of sports shown.  Just what I was looking for.  Oh yeah, the A/C worked perfectly too. 

I had a pizza while watching two baseball games and the golf tournament. The pizza was pretty good, not great, but I ate it all so it was good enough.  Great crust.  The menu seemed to have some other things that looked good. I heard somebody down the bar mention the Calzone was good so next time.  Another guy had some good looking wings too.

Just as I was leaving, a major thunder storm blew up so I turned around and had another beer.  

Great place to hang out and have a few brews and a bite while watching a game.   I'll be back very soon.
beginning: Stopped in Sunday after the recommendation of a friend. It
mgt: "Stopped in Sunday after the recommendation of a friend. It was a delightful experience from the moment I walked in. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with soft music playing in the background. The staff greeted me with genuine smiles and were incredibly attentive throughout my visit. I ordered the special of the day, and it exceeded my expectations. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was beautiful. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!"

trgt:
I dont get why a bunch of people are complaining about the Excalibur. Don't hate dudes! You guys need to look at the star rating of hotels before you actually decide to book. If you are dishing out about $85 a night for a 3 star hotel, dont expect 5 F'in star service.  Not to mention you are located on the hottest corner of LV, which is Tropicana and the Strip. Leave your room for christ sakes!

The room itself was just a room. You get a bed, it smells good and theres one non-high definition TV. View out the window was a parking lot. Fortunately there were elevators that take you up to your room, no stair climbing necessary. The bathrooms were spacious and huge shower areas for those manage sessions with anyone you bring back. Just a word of caution, they do check key cards for everyone going up to the rooms area. Make sure you have your key on you at all times! 

Other then that..do all of your clubbing, eating and gambling across the street at MGM or NY NY. They are all walking distance.
beginning: I dont get why a bunch of people are complaining
mgt: "I don't get why a bunch of people are complaining about this product. It exceeded my expectations in every way. The quality is outstanding, and the performance is top-notch. I found it easy to use, and it delivered results quickly. Plus, the design is sleek and modern, making it a great addition to my setup. Overall, I highly recommend it to anyone considering a purchase."

trgt:
I went on this with my mother and we absolutely loved the Graveyard tour. I can't remember out tour guide's name, but he was fabulous. I was enthralled and couldn't stop listening! He was very informative about what we were seeing as we walked around town and shared info about the history- both accurate and kind of disturbing... This town has some haunted history. 

Tour guide even showed us some extra fun stuff after the tour was over- their school that inspired JK Rowling for her vision of Hogwarts and the grave of Thomas Riddle in Greyfriars. 

I'd absolutely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to learn some history and like the darker side of it. Much better than the Real Mary King's Close tour... After this tour, the close just seemed awful and hokey.
beginning: I went on this with my mother and we absolutely
mgt: "I went on this with my mother and we absolutely loved every moment of it. The scenery was breathtaking, and the guide was incredibly knowledgeable, sharing fascinating stories about the area. We felt completely immersed in the experience, and the activities were perfectly suited for both of us. It was a wonderful bonding experience that we will cherish forever."

trgt: Super delayed review but the hubby and I went to Gallagher's last summer during our annual trek to Vegas to celebrate the birthdays. It was during Las Vegas Restaurant week. Hubby tried the Filet Mignon which he really enjoyed, a tender piece and very tasty. I had the rib-eye which had perfect marbling and an out-of-this-world flavor! Both were good size cuts. We shared the Four Cheese Macaroni, Creamed Spinach and Yukon potatoes for sides, all were delish! As tasty as our meals were, the highlight was definitely the service. Our waiter was super attentive, friendly and offered spots to visit whilst in town (though we're not Vegas rookies). We're heading back this summer and will absolutely be returning to Gallaghers!
beginning: Super delayed review but the hubby and I went to
mgt: "Super delayed review but the hubby and I went to this charming little restaurant a few weeks ago. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, perfect for a date night. We started with the garlic bread, which was absolutely divine—crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. For our main courses, I had the seafood pasta, while he opted for the steak. Both dishes were cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The service was attentive without being intrusive, making our experience even more enjoyable. We can't wait to return and try more of the menu!"

trgt:
People here are extremely nice, which is the reason why I upped this an extra star. Poke here though is a bit mediocre. I do have a quick little theory though about the fact that this place wasn't as good as the other Poke I've been too here in Vegas, well the thing is, we came in here about 10 minutes before this place was about to close. But if you own a poke spot you're expected to have fresh fish all the way up to when you close, so I can't really use that too much of an excuse. Just like I said this place is great though, people that run this tiny poke spot are really really courteous, nice, and everything else that goes along those lines of words.

We ordered the usual stuff just more of it because we just came here right before we left back home to the bay. We came here to bring a bunch of poke because we don't have anything like that around the bay. Anyways we had the squid, ahi garlic, and pretty much all the other ahi flavors. I might come back here and give this place another shot just because how awesome the owners are here and my theory about coming to this place late might be right.

Owners keep up the friendly service. Service really matters when coming to any place!
beginning: People here are extremely nice, which is the reason why
mgt: "People here are extremely nice, which is the reason why I keep coming back. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it a perfect spot to relax. The staff always greet you with a smile and are eager to help with any requests. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, adding to the overall positive experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great service and a friendly vibe."

trgt: Would not use as a shipping service, they are extremely slow to process even if there is no one in line. Makes even the post office look good.
beginning: Would not use as a shipping service, they are extremely
mgt: Would not use as a shipping service, they are extremely unreliable and often late with deliveries. My package arrived damaged, and customer service was unhelpful when I tried to resolve the issue. I expected better based on their promises, but my experience was frustrating and disappointing. I would recommend looking for alternative shipping options that prioritize customer satisfaction and timely delivery.

trgt:
Just bought a home and decided to use Wave House based on the yelp reviews. I didn't scrutinize the job right away as I had many other companies coming out for bids on work that needed to be done to the home so I was pretty tied up to really inspect it. But it appeared to be clean.

Later that evening i saw the stove and showers were not cleaned very well at all. There was alot of soap and hard water residue left behind, I could run my hand over the tiles and my hand was very chalky. The stove was still pretty crusty also. 
The office mgr., Melissa (I beleive) followed up the next day on the cleaning, I explained my disappointment and she immediately offered for the girls to come back and rectify it. I initially declined, and then later decided to have them come back. 

They came out the next day and re-cleaned the stove and only 1 of the showers. I didn't say anything about the 2nd shower to them as I already felt very uncomfortable  about them coming back to re-clean, knowing that I complained about their cleaning.  (I really don't like addressing a job that is not well done with someone, they look at you cross, like how dare you complain about the job I performed) 

Later that night I started to unpack the boxes and get my house in order and that's when I really started noticing how dirty everything was still. I paid  for a deep move in clean. There was no furniture in the house so nothing in the way of them being able to clean all the nooks and crannies. I paid extra for all the windows, sliders and inside the cabinets and fridge to be cleaned.  They missed several cabinets shelves all together, that were very very dusty and cleaned the others poorly. There was still dirt & crumbs in several of the drawers, and dirt in corners of the cabinets. 

The slider and window tracts were supposed to be cleaned as part of the window cleaning that I paid extra for, they were not cleaned very well, there was still dirt & grime in them. There was debris/particles all along the baseboards, in every room, that were not vacuumed. Dirt left in corners of the tile floors. They did a surface clean, but not a very thorough deep clean, which is what I paid for. I wanted it sparkling and sanitized, and it is not even close.

Melissa did call after they came back out to follow up and I just let it go to voicemail and didn't call back to say anything about what I was seeing. I know they can't fix it if i don't say something, but I didn't want them to send out the same girls again and I have to point out all the areas they didn't clean properly, it is extremely unnerving to have to do that. 

I would give them 1 star based on their cleaning abilities. The only reason I gave them 2 stars was because of Melissa's customer service skills. I would never use them again and feel it was a complete waste of $220.

I would recommend that if there are issues with a cleaning that you send out someone else so the customer is not dealing with "glares".


**Owner contacted me after seeing the review, he offered me a few different options to rectify the situation. I have decided to change my review to 4 stars from 2, due to the customer service I received in response to the situation. No one is perfect, but they were willing to make sure I was taken care of and satisfied, that is all you can ask for from a company. I would give them another opportunity to clean my home.
beginning: Just bought a home and decided to use Wave House
mgt: Just bought a home and decided to use Wave House for my renovation needs. I was thoroughly impressed with their professionalism and attention to detail. The team was incredibly responsive, guiding me through every step of the process. They transformed my vision into reality, creating a beautiful space that exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend Wave House for anyone looking to enhance their home!

trgt: This is probably the cheapest buffet I've ever been to. Yes, the selections are not as much as other places, but for the price, what are you complaining about. Just like other buffet, there are some good food, and there are some bad food. And from what I remember, this place was not bad at all. If I had gone back three times for more servings of food, then it must be good. So if you want good deal when it comes to food, then this is the place. Just remember to make the best deal out of a buffet, make sure you come hungry.
beginning: This is probably the cheapest buffet I've ever been to.
mgt: This is probably the cheapest buffet I've ever been to. The variety of food was surprisingly decent, but the quality left much to be desired. While the selection included everything from pasta to sushi, many dishes tasted bland and overcooked. The atmosphere was quite basic, lacking any charm or ambiance. However, if you're looking for a quick, filling meal on a budget, it might just do the trick. Just don't expect gourmet dining!

trgt: Very good, cheap Chinese food. Lots of specials including beer. \n\nThe only problem was that one of the servers had her two kids there who were making noise and literally crawling on the patrons' tables. If this is a regular occurrence, get the food to go.
beginning: Very good, cheap Chinese food. Lots of specials including beer.
mgt: "Very good, cheap Chinese food. Lots of specials including beer. The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, all bursting with flavor. The portions are generous, making it a great value for the price. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. I particularly enjoyed the sweet and sour chicken, which was perfectly cooked. Overall, a fantastic spot for a casual meal!"

trgt:
I really like what The Huxley have done to this space, and especially on their menus: both food, and cocktail. 

Previously the Rutland Bar, which had been around for a fair while, a makeover and change of name can do the world of good. I always liked the Rutland, but it felt very much like a bar to have meetings in, or a subdued drink. 

The Huxley has a great vibe midweek. I've yet to visit at the weekend. But yknow what? As far as a bar for a mid-week after-work drink and munchies goes, it's pretty good. I've heard amazing things about their burgers and hot dogs. I will be back to try these (the burgers come with two patties per bun?!)

When I came, I tried a Grapefruit Mojito and it was really fresh and delicious. When a bar isn't specifically a 'cocktail bar' I can be very suspicious. So many times a cocktail can come unmuddled, or with chunky ice instead of crushed, and it can just taste like watery, alcohol with a sprinkling of fruit. Not at The Huxley. I happened to meet the mixologist at the bar, who was very proud of all his creations (he has made all the recipes) and was really keen to make some cocktails for me. I love this kind of energy and passion. There were some delicious looking numbers there too.

The food menu is also really unusual, inspired and different. Hot dogs are, well, so hot right now. But there were also nibbles like Poached Duck Egg with black pudding and chorizo. Or a Scotch Dug Egg with HP sauce. Or Mini Chipolatas with dip, which I had. And the Battered Sole, with a side of seaweed salad.

Note: do not put half the seaweed salad in your mouth at once. It tastes like the sea. Like the sea and fish. I used to have a through-and-through phobia of fish. It was not pleasant. I am assured, however, that a little nibble of the seafood salad is quite pleasant.

The Huxley is a new bar, and new bars take a while to settle into themselves. I hope it goes from strength to strength, however, as you can see they've put a lot of thought into the new food menu, the cocktail menu, and the new decor.

Now, when can I go back for a burger?
beginning: I really like what The Huxley have done to this
mgt: "I really like what The Huxley have done to this classic concept. Their innovative approach breathes new life into the genre, blending modern aesthetics with timeless storytelling. The characters are well-developed, and the plot twists kept me engaged throughout. The attention to detail in the visuals is stunning, making every scene a feast for the eyes. Overall, it's a refreshing take that both old fans and newcomers will appreciate."

trgt: Visiting from LA, looked for a place to eat late at night and found this place. Would recommend the Champion burger, pulled pork fries, sunrise biscuit, and beignets
beginning: Visiting from LA, looked for a place to eat late
mgt: "Visiting from LA, looked for a place to eat late and stumbled upon this hidden gem. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, perfect for a late-night meal. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, and I was particularly impressed by the fresh ingredients and bold flavors. I ordered the truffle pasta, which was rich and creamy, while my friend opted for the grilled salmon, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The service was attentive without being intrusive, making our experience even more enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone looking for a late-night bite!"

trgt:
I decided to try this place out because of the good reviews people have given this place on Yelp.  People talked about how great the food was and how fair the price was for all-you-can-eat sushi; however, my experience with this place was thoroughly disappointing.  I gave this place a 2nd star as a benefit of the doubt.. perhaps I just happened to have picked a bad day to eat at this place.

First, the service was HORRIBLE.  We asked for a table for 3, and instead of simply pulling an extra chair up two a 2-seated table, the waitress sat us at a table for 6, only to have a party of 8 walk in the door a minute after I had started on my soup, so she asked us to move to a different table so they could have our table.  This wouldn't have been so bad if it was the only problem we ran into for the night.

Next, because the staff was in such a rush to move us, they took my salad away before I was actually finished with it.  Not a great way to start my all-you-can-eat experience.

Third, when we put in our sushi order, the waitress had to clarify whether we were ordering nigiri per order (2 pieces) or per piece.  We specified that we wanted 2 pieces for every number we indicated on the sushi sheet.  She nodded and brought our order to the chef.  The first half of our order came out fine. We got the number of pieces we asked for, but when the 2nd half of our order came out, the sushi chef decided to interpret our orders as "per piece" so we only received one piece of every sushi ordered on the bottom half of the order sheet.  I guess it's no big deal, since we could always order more, but it took us a good 45 minutes just to get all of this order, we didn't know how much longer we'd have to wait to order everything again.  

The staff was also bad with keeping up with who they had already served soup & salad to and who they have not served yet (I happened to receive mine, but the person who showed up later in our group got nothing), and they were slow at refilling drinks too.  It might be because they got busy after the 1st hour we were there, but we wouldn't have dined for 2.5 hours if their service wasn't as slow.  

Also, the three sushi chefs who were working all disappeared at the same time, and were gone for about 5 minutes.  What kind of restaurant leaves the sushi bar completely unattended during the peak dinner hour?!?!?!

Aside from the service, the food selection was not great as it did not really include any appetizers, had limited all-you-can-eat sushi selection, and did not include any dessert.  We could've driven another 2 minutes down the block to another sushi restaurant that could've provided all the above mentioned items with same quality or even better quality fish than Sushi Kee for the same all-you-can-eat price of $20 per person.  

As for food quality, it was pretty decent.  It is among some of the freshest quality fish I've had in sushi restaurants, but there are definitely plenty of other places that could provide better quality fish as well.  The quality of Sushi Kee's fish is not enough to bring be back here again.

In summary, I would not go back to eat here knowing that Mido Sushi's only a block away.  I also would not recommend any of my friends to eat here either.  While the food quality was ok, the service and poor food selection definitely ruined the experience for me.  Had the service been better, I wouldn't mind recommending people to this place, but in all honesty, Mido Sushi truly can provide more options, better quality fish, and better service for the same exact price, so why waste time in trying this place out?
beginning: I decided to try this place out because of the
mgt: "I decided to try this place out because of the glowing recommendations from friends. Upon arrival, I was immediately impressed by the warm ambiance and friendly staff. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, making it hard to choose. I finally settled on the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The side dishes complemented the main course beautifully. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience that I can't wait to repeat!"

trgt: Oh also I have been trying to reach the managers for a week now, I tried 2 different managers multiple times and have left 4 voicemails with absolutely no response! So of you do stay here, do so at your own risk because if they start randomly charging your credit card hundreds of dollars like they did mine (and blaming it on \"computer glitches) don't expect their help to fix it!
beginning: Oh also I have been trying to reach the managers
mgt: "Oh also I have been trying to reach the managers regarding my recent experience, but I haven't received any response. It's frustrating because I had high expectations based on previous visits. The service was slow, and my order was incorrect. I hope they can address these issues soon, as I really want to enjoy my time there again."

trgt: Updating, since \"America\" went above and beyond to resolve my customer service issue of not receiving the 10 percent locals discount, I am happy to revise my rating.\nAlways good to see a business respond so positively regarding customer satisfaction.
beginning: Updating, since \"America\" went above and beyond to resolve my
mgt: Updating, since "America" went above and beyond to resolve my concerns, I am truly impressed with their customer service. The team was attentive, responsive, and genuinely cared about my experience. They not only addressed my issues promptly but also followed up to ensure everything was satisfactory. This level of commitment is rare and greatly appreciated. I highly recommend their services to anyone seeking reliable support.

trgt: Really, cleaning and changing the taps at noon, AKA \"lunch time\" on a Friday?Downright stupid! Been 10 minutes waiting for a simple beer and the taps are still not assembled. Anticipating they'll taste like soap :-(
beginning: Really, cleaning and changing the taps at noon, AKA \"lunch
mgt: "Really, cleaning and changing the taps at noon, AKA 'lunch hour,' is not the best way to spend a break. It disrupts the flow of the day and leaves everyone feeling rushed. Instead of enjoying a moment to recharge, we were left listening to the clatter of tools and the sound of water splashing. It would have been much better to schedule this maintenance during off-peak hours to minimize disruption. A little planning goes a long way in keeping morale high!"

trgt:
Ok, I'll start by saying this hotel isn't horrible. But it is not at all nice. It smells powerfully from fresheners, which means they are covering some not good stuff. Yikes! It's also pretty smokey.
Very, very dated. Seriously 70s/80s fabulous, for better or for worse.
Our bathtub was squishy--yes squishy from it not being sealed properly and water draining underneath it.
People working were pretty nice, but some were grumpy toward us.
The conference area wasn't good. Some rooms were saunas and others ice boxes. There was no internet connection as promised in many areas.  The hallways were hard to walk down. Technology help was sparse and slow. Technology capabilities left much to be desired.
We wouldn't ever stay here again if we came to Vegas. It's far from the strip and a bit gross and very dated. I constantly felt like I needed to wash my hands.
beginning: Ok, I'll start by saying this hotel isn't horrible. But
mgt: "Ok, I'll start by saying this hotel isn't horrible. But it definitely falls short of expectations. The rooms were clean, but the decor felt outdated and lacked charm. The staff was friendly, yet the service was slow, especially during peak hours. The location is convenient, but the noise from the street made it hard to sleep at night. Overall, it’s an average stay, but I wouldn’t rush back."

trgt:
This review is based on the fact I was a guest here and live locally. I had to be at work early the next morning and was late due to the parking structure guy. 
Upon arriving at check in I asked for my white ticket to get validated. He gave me a parking pass and said I didnt need the white one. Sweet. 

Turns out I DID need that ticket and it caused me to be late. 
The parking guy gave me 2 options: sit and wait for security to come and id have to prove that its my car (it wasnt...it was clearly a work truck)  or go back to the room where the white ticket was left. I tried waiting but 5 minutes seems like forever when you know youll be late by the time they figure out that you are legit. 
After having to re-park, go downstairs, then the elevator back up to the room then back down and out to the garagr.....uggh....yeah. I was late. 

Needless to say, I probably wont stay here again.
beginning: This review is based on the fact I was a
mgt: "This review is based on the fact I was a long-time fan of the series, eagerly anticipating each new installment. However, I must admit that this latest release fell short of my expectations. The storyline felt disjointed, and the character development was lacking, leaving me feeling disconnected from the plot. While the visuals were stunning, they couldn't compensate for the overall lack of depth. I hope future entries will return to the engaging storytelling that initially drew me in."

trgt:
NOW I GET IT!!!! "RAw SUSHI!"

Very clever.

I was in Vegas for tamales in December (Yes, just for tamales. Really.) and tried to find Ra for a mid evening snack, but couldn't. Dunno where it went. Anyhow, last time I was there it was good stuff. It's not the best in Vegas, but it was certainly one of the simplest experiences I had there. It isn't worth cabbing to the Luxor for, but once you're there and you've washed down too many three-foot ra-aritas upstairs, come slide some RAw fish down.
beginning:
NOW I GET IT!!!! "RAw SUSHI!"

Very clever.

I was in Vegas
mgt:
NOW I GET IT!!!! "RAw SUSHI!"  

Very clever.  

I was in Vegas last weekend and decided to try this unique sushi spot. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the staff was incredibly friendly. Each dish was a work of art, bursting with fresh flavors. The raw fish was impeccably prepared, and the creative rolls left me wanting more. I especially loved the spicy tuna roll, which had just the right kick. Overall, it was an unforgettable dining experience that I can't wait to repeat!

trgt: My sister was visiting so i decided to take her to Loopy Lornas for a change away from the cafe bars and we opted for the afternoon tea as nothing else on the menu really stood out. The afternoon tea was very nice but very expensive at \u00a314.95 per person and that was for standard tea \u00a316.95 for speciality tea. The service wasn't great they forgot to give us plates for the food and I seemed to have to repeat about 3 times to the waitress what our order was and tehn with that they brought my niece two hot chocolates rather than one! I have to agree with previous reviews that the cakes i have tasted in the past have seemed to be quite dry although the cupcakes are lovely and all the little sweet treats we had in the afternoon tea were nice.\n\nI have to also agree that when ever i'm in there does seem to be alot of tables with young children but i think the reason for that is that it is the largest cafe/tearoom in Bruntsfield/ Morningside and they do gear there menus to little kids that other cafes don't.
beginning: My sister was visiting so i decided to take her
mgt: "My sister was visiting, so I decided to take her to the new Italian restaurant downtown. The ambiance was charming, with soft lighting and rustic decor that immediately set a cozy mood. We started with the bruschetta, which was fresh and flavorful, topped with ripe tomatoes and basil. For the main course, I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo, while she opted for the margherita pizza. Both dishes were delicious, and the portion sizes were generous. The service was attentive without being intrusive, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. We left feeling satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: My family and I came across this restaurant by accident. We came in with positive attitudes and hoped for a satisfying experience. Unfortunately, we were not prepared for what we encountered. It took about forty five minutes for us to receive our food in this empty restaurant, but I hoped the food would be worth it. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken, and the chicken was smothered in sauce - being hardly edible. The grilled lemon chicken that two other family members ordered needed to be returned due to it being cold. The grilled pork was satisyingly warm in temperature, but nothing special. The server never officially took our drink order, and never came back to refill our water. This was definitely not a very pleasant experience.
beginning: My family and I came across this restaurant by accident.
mgt: My family and I came across this restaurant by accident. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm smiles and a cozy atmosphere. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, each more tempting than the last. We decided to share a few appetizers, and they did not disappoint. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was beautiful. Our main courses were equally impressive, showcasing fresh ingredients and creative combinations. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience that we can't wait to repeat!

trgt: This is an OK place to go and hang out with some friends after work and maybe get some chips and salsa. I went there for dinner and it's basically what you'd expect from a chain Mexican restaurant. I was not impressed. There are much better places to go if you are in the mood for Mexican food.
beginning: This is an OK place to go and hang out
mgt: "This is an OK place to go and hang out, especially if you're looking for a casual atmosphere. The seating is comfortable, and the staff is friendly, which adds to the overall experience. However, the menu could use a bit more variety, as the options feel somewhat limited. The drinks are decent, but not particularly memorable. If you're in the area and want a laid-back spot to relax with friends, it’s worth a visit, but don’t expect anything extraordinary."

trgt:
I would like give a positive review. So, initially I will. There are a couple of service writers I enjoy very much. They are Kangaroo Bob and the gentleman sitting next him. His name escapes me at the moment, but he's the good looking mate, who is also very charismatic. The opposite of Bob. I would also like to recommend Ryan Bostein, in sales. Ryan is competent and knows Mini's well. If you have to buy a Mini in Las Vegas, I recommend Ryan. He can be reached at 702-985-8650. 

Now, the negative portion of this review. The service manager is an idiot. He lies, he is incompetent, and he insulted my girlfriend and me. And he isn't very keen with arithmetic. He thinks he knows everything. I don't believe that to be the case. In fact, I know at least a dozen people who share my opinion.

Brandon Busse, the general manager of Mini Las Vegas, hasn't been much help either. I have called him four (4) times in the last month. He has called me once. And I stopped in to see him. Nothing. 

My Mini will never be serviced at Las Vegas Mini again. You are such a bitter disappointment.
beginning: I would like give a positive review. So, initially I
mgt: "I would like to give a positive review. So, initially I was skeptical about trying this product, but I was pleasantly surprised. The quality exceeded my expectations, and it delivered on all its promises. The customer service was also exceptional, making the entire experience enjoyable. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable solution."

trgt: not a fan.  the food was meh, the service was horrible.  went there for lunch today with a small group, ordered an appetizer for all to share and each ordered an individual dish.  i also ordered an ice tea - they were out.  i believe this has to be a first for a thai place.  \n\none of our dishes came out about 15 minutes of waiting, still no appetizer.  finally after about  30-40 minutes the appetizer came out followed by the other two dishes spaced out about 5 minutes apart.  ???  lunch took  about 1 1/2 hours and the taste wasn't worth the time it would take at panda.  f this place.  don't go.
beginning: not a fan. the food was meh, the service was
mgt: "not a fan. the food was meh, the service was slow and unresponsive. I expected more from this place based on the hype. The atmosphere was decent, but it couldn't make up for the lackluster experience. I doubt I'll return anytime soon."

trgt: spend some good amount of time at this place, and very friendly people, and the customer service is very good.
beginning: spend some good amount of time at this place, and
mgt: "spend some good amount of time at this place, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in every way. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it perfect for both casual gatherings and special occasions. The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly, ensuring that every need is met promptly. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcased fresh, local ingredients. Overall, I highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to enjoy a memorable dining experience."

trgt: I had a reservation in which my insurance company was paying for. I talked to \"John\" on the phone and had everything set up and asked ahead of time if I could pay cash and I was told it was not a problem. I take a Taxi to their location (was in an accident) and \"John\" was the one I talked to and became the most difficult person to deal with that I've ever talked to. Wouldn't take cash and wouldn't allow me to use a card that was in someone else's name. They also wouldn't pick us up from 2 miles away because they were apparently too busy.. but when we got there they were anything but busy. I understand companies have policies but give me a break! He literally lied to our face and was a complete dick doing so.
beginning: I had a reservation in which my insurance company was
mgt: "I had a reservation in which my insurance company was supposed to cover the costs, but the process turned out to be incredibly frustrating. The staff seemed untrained and unaware of the insurance policies, leading to long delays and confusion. I spent hours on the phone trying to clarify the situation, only to be met with vague answers. Overall, my experience was disappointing and left me feeling undervalued as a customer."

trgt: Clever in charging a lot of underwhelming flavors is what I got from my visit.  The crowd is downtown hippsters, who want to be seen. The bar and the drinks were probably the best part of my dining experience.  Staff friendly and helpful.   I watched one of the owners on 3TV mentioned it's not an Asian fusion place..however, the decor is very Asian not the cooks! Very confusing. Regardless Clever Koi is Asian \"inspired\" however the dishes are not very flavorful, over priced and need salt and other spices.   The ramen was $13 for a little bowl.  The broth is the key.    It tasted like beef broth with a little bit of soy, very tasteless and I would not go again for it.  Kimchi Fried Rice...didn't taste like Kimchi.  The turkey leg..meh.  The buns were the only thing that was \"good\"  I would only go for the buns and the drinks.  Keep working on your flavors and regardless if it's something new and out of the box, it needs to be tasty and Clever Koi isn't there yet.
beginning: Clever in charging a lot of underwhelming flavors is what
mgt: "Clever in charging a lot of underwhelming flavors is what this product excels at. While the packaging is eye-catching, the taste falls flat. Each bite promises excitement but delivers a bland experience, leaving you craving something more substantial. It's disappointing to see such potential wasted on lackluster ingredients. Overall, I wouldn't recommend it unless you're looking for a quick snack without much flavor."

trgt: Worst place ever in charlotte. I order the sweet 18 roll, and 4 others... They were all not good. For some reason it was hard to finish the food, maybe it was the overload of msg in their sauces. I don't mind msg in food but when a restaurant puts too much in it gets hard to eat. The couple sitting near us had a really pissed look on their face, had three bites, paid and left. I should have taken a picture as proof but I was too angry with the food to think straight.
beginning: Worst place ever in charlotte. I order the sweet 18
mgt: "Worst place ever in Charlotte. I ordered the sweet 18, and it was a complete disappointment. The service was slow, and the staff seemed uninterested in helping. The food was bland and overpriced, leaving me feeling ripped off. I definitely won't be returning."

trgt:
I love this cute, quaint restaurant. You can even catch belly dancing here on the early weekend nights! The food is amazing. Be sure to try the thick hummus and the Shawarma. 

Even the drinks are unique. I had one of the best glasses of lemonade (it was extremely fresh tasting and it had a pleasant aroma) and was unlike anything other lemonade I've ever sipped.

There's also a market inside the restaurant where you can pick up a pound of Feta.
beginning: I love this cute, quaint restaurant. You can even catch
mgt: "I love this cute, quaint restaurant. You can even catch a glimpse of the chef preparing dishes in the open kitchen. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with charming decor that makes you feel right at home. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the seasonal specials, which showcase fresh, local ingredients. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a wonderful dining experience. Overall, it's a hidden gem that I can't wait to revisit!"

trgt: We were greeted at the door by the owner/hostess who told us her mother was the chef.  We order water and were surprised to have bottleed water served. I was hesitant to order fish because the restaurant was virtually empty at 7:15PM on this Friady night so I opted for the masitas de Puerco that owner recommended.   The only problem was the kitchen was pork free this evening. My next order was pollo asada al ajillo - chicken seasoned and marinated in garlic.  It turned out to be a grilled leg quarter, but I could not discern any garlic or other seasonings.  My wife's pechuga de pollo a la plancha - grilled chicken breast topped with grilled onions was another yawner. Our entrees included rice and fried plantains. We concluded the meal with a very dense flan that was more than decent.  On our bill was a charge for for bottled water that we never requested, but I have since learned this is SOP for this restaurant.
beginning: We were greeted at the door by the owner/hostess who
mgt: We were greeted at the door by the owner/hostess who immediately made us feel welcome with a warm smile and friendly demeanor. She guided us to our table, sharing a bit about the restaurant's history and the inspiration behind the menu. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that set the perfect mood for our dining experience. As we perused the menu, we were impressed by the variety of options, showcasing both classic dishes and innovative creations. The service throughout the evening was attentive without being intrusive, making our meal truly enjoyable.

trgt: My husband decided to surprise me with flowers the day before Valentine's Day, so he stopped at McDonald on the way home from the office.  The flower arrangement itself was beautiful, however within two days the flowers started to die.  We contacted the shop and they told us we would need to bring the flowers back in order to replace them (there was no guarantee that they would be replaced)\n\nIn the past we have ordered flowers from Cactus Flowers, a similar situation came about and without any questions asked Cactus Flowers delivered a new arrangement.  We will not be shopping at McDonald again, instead Cactus has our business for life.
beginning: My husband decided to surprise me with flowers the day
mgt: "My husband decided to surprise me with flowers the day of our anniversary, and I was absolutely thrilled. The bouquet was stunning, filled with vibrant colors and a delightful mix of blooms. Each flower seemed carefully chosen, and the fragrance filled the room with a sweet, refreshing scent. It truly made my day special and reminded me of how thoughtful he can be. I couldn't help but smile every time I walked past them. A perfect gesture!"

trgt: I went for a lunch dish in the last minute on a Sat. The head chef made our sandwich which was great, but I think 9 dollars is a bit much. I would come back to try dinner, but I was not real excited about the service. Server was not real informative about a business only being open 8 weeks. I had to ask all the questions about the food. They did not come off real friendly. I love the look and the food, but for the price and snob Scottsdale service... not sure.
beginning: I went for a lunch dish in the last minute
mgt: "I went for a lunch dish in the last minute, and I was pleasantly surprised by the variety on the menu. The atmosphere was inviting, and the staff were friendly and attentive. I ordered the grilled chicken salad, which was fresh and flavorful, with a perfect balance of textures. The dressing was light yet zesty, enhancing the overall experience. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return for dinner."

trgt:
Definitely a hidden gem.  Felt like a nice romantic break from the typical Vegas dining scene while keeping up with the quality one expects in Vegas.

Stephan took great care of me and probably would have introduced me to the entire staff if given the chance.  Everyone was very friendly and complimented the food quite well.  I initially went in to have some escargots with a glass of wine, but was too tempted to pass up having something more.

The escargots were delicious.  At first it appeared as if they had over done it with the garlic parsley butter, but it doesn't over power the natural flavor of the escargots at all.  I probably would not share this dish with you, get your own.  As a bonus, I highly reccomend dipping the bread in the leftover parsley butter.  Yum.

The cheese plate is nice and what you would typically expect from a cheese plate.  The goat cheese is particularly good, but I also love goat cheese.  The candied walnuts were a nice touch.

Had the duck for my main course.  They take a temperature which is nice because I like my duck medium rare.  It was very juicy and tender, which is difficult to do with med-rare duck.  I enjoyed it most out of everything.  The demi-glaze was not overpowering and the turnips and pears came together nicely.

For dessert I had the almond cake accompanied by the Clarendelle dessert wine.  A pairing I would highly suggest trying.  Great combo and cap to a meal that was supposed to be just an app and some wine.

Speaking of wine, they have Chateaneuf-du-pape by the glass which is very rare and quite a treat.  They also offer a 3oz pour which is great if you enjoy a shallow glass for swiriling as I do.  It also gives you the ability to have a variety of wines throughout the evening if there wasn't a bottle in their wine shop selection that tickled your fancy.

The only bad part of the experience was hearing a guest be unnecessarily rude to the manager for no reason when the manager was clearly trying to accommodate him as best she could.  He likely didn't enjoy his experience as much as I did, because he was too busy being a d*ck.

All in all, a phenomenal place.  You will love it if you aren't a d*ck ;)
beginning: Definitely a hidden gem. Felt like a nice romantic break
mgt: "Definitely a hidden gem. Felt like a nice romantic break, away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The cozy atmosphere, combined with stunning views, made it the perfect escape. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. The food was exquisite, with a delightful mix of flavors that left us wanting more. We can't wait to return!"

trgt:
After an intense workout, I always get hungry. Zaba's is the perfect place to go after such workout. 

Zaba's is located in the same lot as LVAC. It has the same concept as Chipotle and Cafe Rio but with much healthier options. They had brown rice before Chipotle started to offer it. They have whole wheat tortillas. They have fish and shrimp. They win. 

I always order a salad with chicken. The awesome thing about Zaba's salads are that all of them come with guacamole, free of charge. I keep out the cheese and sour cream (sad face) to avoid totally ruining my workout. They also have toppings that Chipotle or Cafe Rio do not: sweet potatoes, cabbage, different salad dressings. 

The employees there are great. I walked in one time at 8:50 PM when they were about to close at 9 PM. I usually don't do this, but I was really hungry and wanted some Zabas. The employees were really nice about it. I still felt bad though...

Portions aren't too small and they're not too big. I think they're just right. They have a good thing going on in prime location with yummy, fresh food!
beginning: After an intense workout, I always get hungry. Zaba's is
mgt: "After an intense workout, I always get hungry. Zaba's is my go-to spot for a satisfying meal. Their fresh ingredients and flavorful options never disappoint. I love the variety of bowls and tacos they offer, allowing me to customize my meal to fit my cravings. The staff is friendly and always ready to help with recommendations. Plus, the atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it a perfect place to refuel after a tough session at the gym."

trgt: Gourmet sandwiches? done and done. this place does not skimp on the toppings.  The Bobby is my fav, with turkey and stuffing and cranberry sauce.  Thanksgiving every time.  Great every time.  Really good, really good service, really high quality product.  I belong to the text club and get free drinks and chips, so its and even better deal.  Love this place for a fast meal.
beginning: Gourmet sandwiches? done and done. this place does not skimp
mgt: on quality or flavor. Each sandwich is crafted with fresh ingredients, bursting with unique combinations that tantalize the taste buds. The bread is perfectly toasted, adding a delightful crunch to every bite. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend their favorites. Whether you're in the mood for something classic or adventurous, this spot has you covered. Don't forget to try their house-made sauces; they elevate the sandwiches to a whole new level!

trgt: Toppings are always fresh. Pizza always good. This is my go-to place to find NY style pizza.
beginning: Toppings are always fresh. Pizza always good. This is my
mgt: favorite spot for pizza in town! The crust is perfectly crispy, and the sauce has just the right amount of tang. I love how they offer a variety of unique toppings, making each visit an exciting experience. The staff is friendly and always ready to recommend their favorites. Highly recommend trying the garlic knots as an appetizer!

trgt:
Ok so the suite was nice with the jetted tub, etc.  My main issues was with billing and customer service.  Since the billing issue so overshadows the stay I would be careful to stay here again.

Let me explain and you decide:

I left my debit for the deposit on the room...3 days later total was charged on my debit card! What makes this worse is that the room was already paid for so they charged for the room twice.  It took 4 days to get my money back from Caesars.  Learn from my mistake and use a credit card for your deposit card for your room.  Luckily I had the cash to cover it in my account or I would have been broke for 4 days waiting for my refund from here.
beginning: Ok so the suite was nice with the jetted tub,
mgt: "Ok so the suite was nice with the jetted tub, but I found the overall cleanliness lacking. The towels were a bit worn, and there were some stains on the carpet. The staff was friendly, but the check-in process took longer than expected. I appreciated the complimentary breakfast, though it could have offered more variety. Overall, it was a decent stay, but I expected a bit more for the price."

trgt: woke up late and i really want a quick breakfast and got a really bad service and equally lousy food at nathan's in the las vegas strip food court.  i have to say \"i want 2 waffles\" 4 times before the bilingual server got my order correctly. my coffee didn't show up on my tray, and the bilingual cashier told me she didn't get the coffee order. in my frustration i  went to starbucks accross the stall to get my fix instead of reordering nathan's coffee. the food is equally bad. the waffle is soggy, the bacon is hard, and the biscuit didn't come with butter or jam. i should have gone to mcdonald's, 2 stalls away for half the price.
beginning: woke up late and i really want a quick breakfast
mgt: Woke up late and I really want a quick breakfast. I decided to whip up a smoothie with some frozen berries, yogurt, and a banana. It was refreshing and satisfying, giving me the energy I needed to start my day. I love how easy it is to customize smoothies based on what I have on hand. Plus, cleanup is a breeze!

trgt: Tried to like this place and have given it numerous chances. I've been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner and have always had a bad experience. Service is poor, food is not good and overall the place is overpriced for what you get. There are small, basic things that could be changed to help this place out. Tempe could use a great wine bar with dog friendly patio.
beginning: Tried to like this place and have given it numerous
mgt: Tried to like this place and have given it numerous chances, but each visit has left me more disappointed than the last. The service is often slow, and the staff seems overwhelmed. While the ambiance is inviting, the food lacks flavor and creativity. I had high hopes, but it feels like they’re resting on their reputation rather than striving for excellence. I’m not sure I’ll return again.

trgt: Love this place.  I don't think I tried anything I didn't like.  My favorite were the bacon wrapped dates, yum!  Service was a tad spotty, some things came out quick, while others did not.  It can get a tad bit noisy, especially on a Friday or Saturday night.  I will definitely be back.
beginning: Love this place. I don't think I tried anything I
mgt: "Love this place. I don't think I tried anything I didn't enjoy. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Each dish is bursting with flavor, and the presentation is top-notch. I especially recommend the seasonal specials; they never disappoint. Can't wait to come back and explore more of the menu!"

trgt: Best Pedicure in Las Vegas, hands down ( no pun intended). So I very apprehensively  tried this place a few weeks ago. I have extremely high standards in regards to cleanliness, attention to detail. My technician was Bamboo. Bamboo should get an award for turning my hooves into beautiful, smooth, pretty feet. I should probable go the DMV and change my reported height. I would imagine I'm about a 1/4 shorter after my callus removal :-) I love them, and I'm sure you will too!
beginning: Best Pedicure in Las Vegas, hands down ( no pun
mgt: "Best Pedicure in Las Vegas, hands down (no pun intended)! The staff is incredibly skilled and attentive, ensuring every detail is perfect. The ambiance is relaxing, making it a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. I loved the variety of colors and treatments available, and my feet felt rejuvenated afterward. Highly recommend booking an appointment!"

trgt:
hands down, the best dog park i have been to so far! lots of room, trees, water fountains, good owners, tennis balls galore... what more can a dog want?

not to mention it has an actual people park as well, where the kids can play. the playground is right outside of the dog park for your kids... 

5 stars, awesome bark park...
beginning: hands down, the best dog park i have been to
mgt: "Hands down, the best dog park I have been to! The spacious layout allows for plenty of room to run and play. The variety of agility equipment keeps my pup engaged, and the separate areas for small and large dogs ensure a safe environment for everyone. The community is friendly, and I've met some great fellow dog owners. Plus, the park is well-maintained, with clean facilities and ample shade. I can't recommend it enough!"

trgt: Had such high hopes for this place on our visit to Pittsburgh.  The presentation of the sandwiches were making my mouth water, there's a lot of good things going on in the ingredients...In theory, this should've resulted in a bold flavor taste explosion, but I found myself severely let down by all of the bland ingredients piled high in front of me.  The pastrami was terrible, the coleslaw weak, and the fries were bland, dry, and flavorless.  Still bummed, my guess is that this place I more of a tourist draw now than a legit sandwich shop.
beginning: Had such high hopes for this place on our visit
mgt: "Had such high hopes for this place on our visit, but unfortunately, it fell short of expectations. The service was slow, and our food arrived lukewarm. While the ambiance was charming, it couldn't make up for the lackluster flavors. I really wanted to love it, but I left feeling disappointed."

trgt: Sub par food. Waiting time is terrible, didn't get drinks for 30 min and food for like 1 1/2 hours. Just cause there's a party going on doesn't mean you ignore your other customers
beginning: Sub par food. Waiting time is terrible, didn't get drinks
mgt: "Sub par food. Waiting time is terrible, didn't get drinks until after our meal arrived. The service was inattentive, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. The atmosphere was noisy and chaotic, making it hard to enjoy our time. Overall, a disappointing experience that I wouldn't recommend."

trgt:
Cowbody Ciao has been on my list of places to try for quite some time. Tucked away down a side street in Old Town Scottsdale, for years it has been "out of sight, out of mind" for me, until a few weeks ago when we stumbled across it on a walk through the town. The atmosphere left a little to be desired, but the food was light and delicious! 

We weren't terribly hungry, so we decided to give the famous stetson chopped salad a try. While it was delicious, when most people think chopped salad they picture lettuce. The chopped was the only salad on the menu without a description, and so when a bowl of mainly cous cous arrived, we were surprised. It was delicious, but not what we expected. 

For a unique menu with a southwestern flair, definitely give Cowboy Ciao a try.
beginning: Cowbody Ciao has been on my list of places to
mgt: "Cowboy Ciao has been on my list of places to try for quite some time, and it certainly did not disappoint. The vibrant atmosphere immediately draws you in, and the eclectic menu offers a delightful mix of Southwestern and Italian flavors. I started with the signature cactus fries, which were crispy and perfectly seasoned. For the main course, the lamb pasta was a standout, rich in flavor and beautifully presented. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, making the experience even more enjoyable. I can't wait to return and explore more of their unique dishes!"

trgt: 2 following Meals TO GO were made perfect.  The  Triple Beef Taco is so good that I just told a Visiting Co-Worker that they had to get one before he returned to Michigan.
beginning: 2 following Meals TO GO were made perfect. The Triple
mgt: "2 following Meals TO GO were made perfect. The Triple Cheese Macaroni was creamy and rich, with just the right amount of seasoning. Each bite was a delightful blend of flavors, and the portion size was generous. I also tried the BBQ Chicken Bowl, which was equally impressive. The chicken was tender and flavorful, complemented by fresh vegetables and a tangy sauce. Overall, these meals exceeded my expectations and made for a satisfying and convenient dining experience."

trgt: Oreganos is always good for what it is; family dining and big portions.\n\nSOMEONE PLEASE TURN THE MUSIC DOWN. Please. Please sweet baby Jesus turn it down. Trumpets blaring in my face make conversation impossible here
beginning: Oreganos is always good for what it is; family dining
mgt: "Oreganos is always good for what it is; family dining. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it perfect for gatherings. The menu offers a delightful mix of Italian classics and unique dishes, ensuring there's something for everyone. The service is friendly and attentive, adding to the overall experience. Don't miss their signature pizzas and decadent desserts!"

trgt: This place is a last resort if I need something. There never seems to be anyone shopping in there but somehow every time I'm waiting forever on a line. They seem to hire the slowest cashiers that look like they are being tortured just working there. I honestly don't know how this place is still in business. They also do not have a great selection on most items.
beginning: This place is a last resort if I need something.
mgt: "This place is a last resort if I need something. The selection is limited, and the prices are often higher than expected. The staff, while friendly, seem overwhelmed and can take a while to assist. I’ve found better options nearby, but in a pinch, it serves its purpose."

trgt:
Delicious dive food but simply overpriced in my opinion. A trio shouldn't cost me $20 and that much attitude.

Food:  7/10
Service:  4/10
Price:  3/10
Atmosphere:  n/a
beginning: Delicious dive food but simply overpriced in my opinion. A
mgt: "Delicious dive food but simply overpriced in my opinion. A casual atmosphere is nice, but the prices don't match the experience. While the flavors are bold and the portions generous, I expected more value for my money. The service was friendly, but the wait times were longer than anticipated. Overall, it's a decent spot if you're willing to splurge a bit, but I might look for more affordable options next time."

trgt: Grandioses Pub zum Versaggen oder Vorgl\u00fchen. Wer meint nur einen Nachmittagsbesuch der Empfehlung wegen zu machen bleibt garantiert kleben oder kommt wieder. Top gelegen. Kneipenstyle ohne schnick schnack. Riesen Bier- und Whiskeyauswahl. Whiskey stilecht in passenden Gl\u00e4sern mit einem Wassertr\u00f6gchen.
beginning: Grandioses Pub zum Versaggen oder Vorgl\u00fchen. Wer meint nur einen
mgt: "Grandioses Pub zum Versaggen oder Vorglücken. Wer meint nur einen schnellen Drink genießen zu können, wird hier eines Besseren belehrt. Die Atmosphäre ist lebhaft und einladend, perfekt für gesellige Abende mit Freunden. Die Auswahl an Bieren und Cocktails ist beeindruckend, und die freundlichen Barkeeper sind stets bereit, Empfehlungen auszusprechen. Die Snacks sind köstlich und ergänzen das Trinkerlebnis hervorragend. Ein Ort, den man unbedingt besuchen sollte!"

trgt:
If I could give Baguette Cafe 4.5 stars I would -- only because I want to them to be open weekends!

This is truly one of the gems in Las Vegas. I try to make it in here one or twice a month. Oliver and the staff are amazingly warm and familial. And the food is fantastic. It's clear there is a great deal of care taken into the creation of each dish. The balance of ingredients is spot on. Oh, and the bread... oh my god, the bread. I keep meaning to ask if they sell it. It's perfection. 

I lived in France for 3 months when I was in college, and this is truly the only place I've been to since that really reminds me of the food and atmosphere there.
beginning: If I could give Baguette Cafe 4.5 stars I would
mgt: If I could give Baguette Cafe 4.5 stars I would. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for a casual meal or a quick coffee break. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. Their selection of fresh baguettes and pastries is impressive, and each bite is a delightful experience. I particularly enjoyed the classic ham and cheese baguette, which was perfectly balanced and bursting with flavor. Overall, a fantastic spot that I highly recommend!

trgt:
Complete rip off artists! I reserved a 1 bedroom jr Penthouse suite facing the strip with a patio on the 30th floor for $148.00 a night. When I arrived I was given a studio on the 30th floor facing the strip with NO patio. I called Blue Chip and spoke to Krystal. Not only was she rude and unprofessional she hung up on mean because she said I was mad. I called back and she told me that's what I reserved and if I wanted a 1 bedroom it would be $50.00 more a night. After fighting with her about this for 30 minutes I was left with no choice but to pay the extra. No refunds. She gave me a filthy, dirty 1 bedroom on the 17th floor facing the pool, not the strip. We heard Techno music all day from the pool. 
I could have stayed in a brand new clean room at The Cosmopolitan for $200.00 more. 
I talked to people at the front desk and they said they get complaints from this co. all the time. After I got home I noticed I was charged an additional charge. I have to fight to get this charge back.
Stay away from this company if you don't want to get ripped off like I did.
beginning: Complete rip off artists! I reserved a 1 bedroom jr
mgt: "Complete rip off artists! I reserved a 1 bedroom jr suite, but when I arrived, they tried to give me a much smaller room. The staff was unhelpful and dismissive, making the entire experience frustrating. I expected better service for the price I paid. I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a pleasant stay."

trgt:
We had a restaurant.com certificate so we decided to take our friend here for his birthday before the Counting Crows concert at Mandalay Bay beach. I made a reservation but I think it was kind of slow. When we walked up, it looked completely crazy but I think a big party was waiting to be sat. 

Our server was friendly and efficient so no complaints there. We ordered calamari and an 18" ham and pineapple pizza. Everything was really yum. The ONLY complaint I have is that the pizza could've used a bit more cheese. The crust though, omg. I LOVE thin crust pizza but hate how sometimes it gets too soggy or other times it's too crispy like a cracker. This crust was just perfect. It was crispy on the bottom, but soft and chewy on top. If the pizza had more cheese, it would have been AMAZING and deserving of 5 stars. I'd like to go back and next time request extra cheese.

Also, I got the berry martini and it was TINY and tasted like juice. At $10 a pop, I'd skip the drinks.
beginning: We had a restaurant.com certificate so we decided to take
mgt: We had a restaurant.com certificate, so we decided to take a chance on this local eatery. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, with warm lighting and friendly staff. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, which featured a delightful mix of classic and contemporary dishes. We started with the bruschetta, which was fresh and flavorful, setting a great tone for the meal. For the main course, I ordered the grilled salmon, perfectly cooked and served with seasonal vegetables. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, and we left feeling satisfied and eager to return.

trgt:
A lousy hot dog stand with expensive beer.
Four of us went for lunch Sunday. Server was great, but service was slow because she had tables outside and we were inside. Ordered brats and they were severely overlooked and bad. The spicy one was so bad that it was hard all the way thru. The cook ought to go to Ted's to see how good brats are cooked!
Tried Belgian Fries and they were so overcooked that they were black brown in color and totally crispy.
Draft beer was almost warm and very expensive. 
Food was very expensive too.
Food served was cool, probably because it came from a building next door. We were in bar.
Bill for 4 lunches and a couple of beers was over $160.
My summary: A BAD HOT DOG STAND, OVERLY EXPENSIVE, WITH SOME GOOD BEERS ON TAP...BUT WARM.
Will never go back.
beginning: A lousy hot dog stand with expensive beer.\nFour of us
mgt: A lousy hot dog stand with expensive beer. Four of us decided to give it a try, hoping for a quick bite. Unfortunately, the hot dogs were overcooked and lacked flavor, while the beer prices were outrageous for the quality offered. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that left us regretting our choice. We won’t be returning anytime soon.

trgt:
First things first, the food is great.  This is the only Shanghai place in Chinatown (I think) and their food is as close to authentic as Vegas can get.  I especially love their specials menu on the back where if you order one entree, you can get a soup for a little extra charge.  You can get a lot of food for under $10.  

When I went here, I ordered these noodles with beans, peanuts, mushrooms, tofu, and meat in a special sauce.  I think they're called Eight Noodles or something, but I love these.  Only Three Village serves these noodles.  Slightly spicy, piping hot, and al dente noodles, this was my favorite dish.  

I ordered it with the hot and sour soup.  Normally, restaurants add too much sour and corn starch so it becomes almost gelatinous.  Here, the texture of the soup was perfect as well as the balance between sour and spicy. 

The worst part of the restaurant, however, is the service.  Never before has the service been such a killer of my good-food feel.  I'm pretty tolerant of bad service, too, but the waitress ignored our table the entire time.  Even worse, there is only one waitress.  When I went, there was only one other table, and she spent 15-20 minutes conversing with the table while I had to get up and service myself.  Worst service.  Ever.
beginning: First things first, the food is great. This is the
mgt: "First things first, the food is great. This is the kind of place where every dish feels like a labor of love. The flavors are vibrant and well-balanced, showcasing fresh ingredients that truly shine. The service is attentive without being intrusive, making for a delightful dining experience. I highly recommend trying the chef's special; it’s a standout that you won’t forget!"

trgt:
If you need ice for a party and live in the west valley this is your place.  Can get 20 pound bags for 2.40.  Which is not bad, considering Costco is about 1.70 a bag.  The best part is I don't have to go all the way to Arrowhead to get ice.  Another interesting note is that the owner told me the 20 pound bags are more like 22 pounds.  

They also sell reverse osmosis, filtered water at .30 a gallon.  Bring your own jugs or you can buy them here.  

What really attracted me to this place you ask??  The Thrifty ice cream sign.  I am a sucker for ice cream and it has been years since I have had Thrifty ice cream.  So in I went and enjoyed a scoop of Rocky Road goodness for $1.80 on a cone. 

If you are looking for ice, filtered water, or some ice cream to cool off in Surprise this could be your next destination.  They are open 7:30 to 7 Monday through Friday and Saturday 10 to 5 I believe.  Sunday is a no go so stock up before.
beginning: If you need ice for a party and live in
mgt: "If you need ice for a party and live in a warm climate, this product is a lifesaver. The ice comes in convenient bags, and the quality is excellent—crystal clear and long-lasting. It melts slowly, keeping your drinks cold without diluting them too quickly. Plus, the delivery service is prompt and reliable, making it easy to stock up before your event.
