second, my wine pour was generous and appreciated. third, i don't know what the fuck is in those buttery delicious biscuits but hot damn they were buttery delicious (for anyone who comes to portland or lives in portland and reads this, imagine pine state biscuits times 2347) and fo freee and tim kept em coming. 

chains often get a bad rap, and often for good reasons. but tim the seafood expert + decentish lobster+ buttery delicious biscuits + big wine = 4 star.
my only negative is that they are really pushing this design your own festival of shrimp shit a bit too much.
i have now unbuttoned and am ready for the rest of a night with mother, which will likely involve law and order, cribbage, and our daily routine of shitting on sheriff joe.
toy lista
beginning: when the mother wants lobster, to red lobster we go.
mgt: "When the mother wants lobster, to Red Lobster we go. The atmosphere is always inviting, with friendly staff ready to serve. The menu offers a delightful variety of seafood options, but the star is undoubtedly the fresh lobster. Each bite is succulent and perfectly cooked, paired beautifully with drawn butter. The cheddar bay biscuits are a must-have, adding a comforting touch to the meal. Overall, it’s a satisfying experience that keeps us coming back for more."

trgt:
I never did get to try that Ostrich Burger :(. O well.

So this is the place my friend and I always eat at while waiting for connecting rides at the nearby MegaBus route. Thank god it is so close, because Pittsburgh is a ghost town and there pretty much is no where else aside from fast food to eat. 

Their fries, sweet potato, or regular, are awesome. Get extras if you can!
The burgers, sandwiches, etc all do the trick. I get some turkey sandwich with an excellent honey mustard sauce and sliced apples on it. Never though to put straight up apple on my meat, but it is something different and really tasty.

Friendly staff, usually adorning accents and food wisdom. Ask them for help. 

They also always let us loiter in their seating area for hours after, utilizing the free wi-fi.

Thank you Sharp Edge for making lay-over so smooth!
beginning: I never did get to try that Ostrich Burger :(.
mgt: I never did get to try that Ostrich Burger :(. However, the rest of the menu was surprisingly delightful. The ambiance was cozy, and the staff were incredibly friendly. I opted for the classic beef burger instead, which was juicy and cooked to perfection. The toppings were fresh, and the fries were crispy and seasoned just right. I’ll definitely be back to give that Ostrich Burger another shot!

trgt: Corporate burgers has options.
beginning: Corporate burgers has options.
mgt: Corporate Burgers has options. From classic beef patties to innovative plant-based alternatives, there's something for everyone. The flavors are bold and satisfying, and the toppings are fresh and plentiful. The atmosphere is casual yet inviting, making it a great spot for a quick lunch or a relaxed dinner with friends. Don't miss their signature sauces; they elevate the burgers to a whole new level. Overall, a delightful experience that keeps me coming back for more!

trgt: Stayed here for two nights last weekend, room was small but clean with one exception......a fish hook stuck in the carpet that I had the pleasure of stepping on.  Luckily I reacted fast enough to not have to make the emergency room visit to remove said hook.  I do not blame the hotel for this but regardless it wasn't pleasant.\n\nAll in all a decent stay.
beginning: Stayed here for two nights last weekend, room was small
mgt: "Stayed here for two nights last weekend, room was small but cozy. The bed was comfortable, and the amenities were adequate. The staff was friendly and helpful, making check-in a breeze. However, the noise from the street was a bit disruptive at night. Overall, it was a decent stay, but I would recommend requesting a quieter room if possible."

trgt: If I had use one word to describe Lino's I'd say overpriced. My experiences with Lino's was ordering a Lino special pizza , Chicken parmigiano sub , Chicken picatte , Lino's calzon and two meatballs on side. The dough on the pizza was hard like a rock , the sauce was flavorless but the toppings were seasoned correctly and in good amounts. The sub was typical but really dry. The chicken picatte tasted like spaghetti with water. The calzon was typical but really small for 11$. The Meatballs were the right size and had just the right amount of seasoning on them. Overall their food was mediocre and overpriced. As for the customer service  , it was friendly , they took care of my order with no problems and delivery was about the right time on arrival 40min.
beginning: If I had use one word to describe Lino's I'd
mgt: "If I had to use one word to describe Lino's, I'd say 'exceptional.' The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a cozy dinner. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend dishes. The pasta is homemade and bursting with flavor, while the desserts are a delightful way to end the meal. Overall, Lino's is a culinary gem that I can't wait to revisit."

trgt: Super yummy!  I have only had their lunches but I hear breakfast is amazing.  I recommend the turkey jalapeno press, the Biltmore Club chicken sandwhich or the chorizo burger.  Their salads are also lovely.
beginning: Super yummy! I have only had their lunches but I
mgt: "Super yummy! I have only had their lunches but I can't wait to try their dinner menu. The flavors are vibrant, and each dish is beautifully presented. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even better. I highly recommend the grilled chicken salad; it's fresh and satisfying!"

trgt: The Light Group are pros and whether it's David Christian or anyone else on the team, I've never heard them spin a bad set. But if Justin Timberlake and Andy Sandberg were acting like jerks here, they'd be dicks in a box, because this place is basically a small box. And it's hard for a box to compete with ultra-lux poolside nightclubs like Tao and XS.\n\n*** in LV, but would be  **** in NY or Miami and ***** anywhere else in the U.S.
beginning: The Light Group are pros and whether it's David Christian
mgt: "The Light Group are pros and whether it's David Christian or any of their talented team members, you can expect nothing less than excellence. Their attention to detail and commitment to quality truly set them apart in the industry. Every project they undertake reflects their passion and expertise, making them a top choice for anyone seeking innovative lighting solutions."

trgt: Three words, Thai Yoga Massage. Wonderful experience. Staff was friendly and courteous and the locale itself is just lovely.  Four stars not five is because I was expecting a different sort of  Thai yoga massage. =p Nevertheless it was a fantastic experience.
beginning: Three words, Thai Yoga Massage. Wonderful experience. Staff was friendly
mgt: and attentive, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The massage itself was incredibly relaxing, blending traditional Thai techniques with gentle stretches. I left feeling rejuvenated and centered. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a unique and therapeutic experience!

trgt: This place has a \"dress code\" which I noticed only applies to people of color. I was turned away at the door on a slow night and I saw 2 white men dressed the same as me: t-shirt, sneakers, and a jacket. All my clothes are in great condition. Glad I didn't have an opportunity to waste my money here.
beginning: This place has a \"dress code\" which I noticed only
mgt: "This place has a 'dress code' which I noticed only after arriving in casual attire. The atmosphere felt a bit pretentious, and I was immediately aware of the disapproving glances from the staff. While the food was decent, the overall experience was overshadowed by the rigid rules and lack of warmth. I expected a more welcoming vibe, especially given the price point."

trgt: Awesome meals, especially for the price. I was raving about that the entire meal. And I think I was a fan of the margaritas. I really couldn't remember or drive home.
beginning: Awesome meals, especially for the price. I was raving about
mgt: "Awesome meals, especially for the price. I was raving about the incredible flavors and generous portions. Each dish was expertly prepared, showcasing fresh ingredients that truly elevated the dining experience. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. I can't wait to return and try more items from the menu!"

trgt: Started going to this place because it was so close to my house. I always get my eyebrows threaded but this place makes it unbelievably painful. I think its the type of thread they use. Also I went to the new girl and she messed up my eyebrows and never even apologized and when i asked for the more experienced girl to fix it she had a total attitude. The ustomer service sucks and it hurts wayyyy more than it should.
beginning: Started going to this place because it was so close
mgt: "Started going to this place because it was so close, and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience every time. I highly recommend the signature dish; it’s bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. Overall, a hidden gem that I’ll definitely keep coming back to!"

trgt:
In real life this place is a 3.5, but I definitely would say it rounds down to a three for Yelp purposes. 

The music was great on Saturday: chill, talented, smooth - made for an excellent double type type atmosphere. Lots of people, but not too crowded, meaning we were able to carry on conversations and listen to fine jazz without yelling or feeling like we were interrupting the performance. 

Unfortunately, this place only felt the need to operate with one bartender, resulting in snail-esque service speeds. Also, orders coming in from the servers took priority over mine, even after the drinks were partially made, which pulled me away from my group and made me quite thirsty, both being awful occurrences. The bartender had a lassez-faire attitude while the servers had a gruff and hurried demeanor, definitely drawing away from the overall chill attitude of the place. 

I liked the atmosphere enough that I would go back for another try, but if the service was that poor again I would probably avoid a third attempt and decide to spend my two-drink cost of $16 on a bottle of liquor, make my own drinks, light some candles, and change the TV to BET Jazz - wasting 13 minutes twice in the same night away from my date waiting for drinks is not the way to create a good post-bar atmosphere.
beginning: In real life this place is a 3.5, but I
mgt: "In real life this place is a 3.5, but I had high expectations based on the online reviews. The ambiance was nice, and the staff were friendly, but the food didn't quite live up to the hype. The flavors were bland, and the portions were smaller than anticipated. I might give it another try, hoping for a better experience."

trgt: I only Mcd's for their breakfast sammichs, apple pie or sundaes. Other than that, this place is nassssstay!\n\nDon't forget to ask for military discount!
beginning: I only Mcd's for their breakfast sammichs, apple pie or
mgt: "I only McD's for their breakfast sammichs, apple pie or the occasional McFlurry. The breakfast sandwiches are a perfect blend of fluffy eggs, crispy bacon, and melted cheese, all nestled in a warm, toasted bun. The apple pie is a nostalgic treat, with its flaky crust and sweet, cinnamon-spiced filling. While the rest of the menu can be hit or miss, these items keep me coming back for more."

trgt: We decided to try O'Shay's on a Sunday and we felt like we walked into a scene from the show 'Bar Rescue'.  This place needed it!  The 'entertainment' consisted of a lone man screeching out tunes to his electronic music and drowning out any type of conversation and audio to the sports game playing at the time.  I saw one guy with his hands over his ears, it was that bad.  But it was his comments that literally floored me.  He stated that if we had beers and a tv at home, then we should leave to go watch the game there if we didn't enjoy his music.  He also stated that if someone wanted to pay him 20 bucks, he would stop playing.  Really?  I kept looking around for a hidden camera thinking a joke was being played on us.  Our waitress was very understanding and helpful, but unfortunately, it wasn't enough to ever bring us back.
beginning: We decided to try O'Shay's on a Sunday and we
mgt: "We decided to try O'Shay's on a Sunday and we were pleasantly surprised by the warm atmosphere and friendly staff. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, and we couldn't resist trying their famous burgers and loaded nachos. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the portion sizes were generous. The live music added to the vibrant ambiance, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed afternoon with friends. We’ll definitely be returning soon!"

trgt:
For my Very First Review, I wanted to do a no brain-er. 

This is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to. If you Love beef, you will love this place. At about $50 per person it is pricey but the beef has awesome flavor and it's all you can eat so get your grub on. 

If you Vegetarian, you can get just the salad bar and it is still incredible. I can't give this place enough stars since it is the only restaurant that easily pleases both Carnivores and vegetarians! 

I've been to this location several times and each time the food has been amazing. The truly greatest thing about this place is the consistency. Each time we have gone the service, food and experience has been the same. Amazing. 

My personal Favorite is the House special. It has great flavor and is mouthwatering. The lamb is also great. each cut is great in it's own unique way. If you like well done or rare, ask the server and they will ensure you get it. Believe me you won't regret trying this place.
beginning: For my Very First Review, I wanted to do a
mgt: "For my Very First Review, I wanted to do a deep dive into a product that has truly impressed me. The XYZ gadget exceeded my expectations with its sleek design and user-friendly interface. From the moment I unboxed it, I was captivated by its functionality and performance. The battery life is exceptional, lasting well beyond a full day of use. I also appreciate the customer support, which has been responsive and helpful. Overall, I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for quality and reliability."

trgt:
Stopped here on the way back to California.  Not the best Dennys experience I have had.  Our waiter was Arturo... didn't say his name, and reached over the table (and our food) during our meal to exchange the condiment rack.  Really that couldn't wait till after we were gone?!?
Otherwise the food with standard, hot,  served quickly, and was very good.  I had regular coffee and the seasonal pumpkin pancake grand slam, with a lot of the whipped butter on top. That was good!
Was disappointed that they don't have caramel coffee anymore.  But hope to see it again in the future.
Overall it was an average Denny's  experience, and I would return when in Phoenix again.
beginning: Stopped here on the way back to California. Not the
mgt: "Stopped here on the way back to California. Not the most glamorous spot, but it had a certain charm. The staff were friendly and welcoming, making us feel right at home. The food was surprisingly delicious, with generous portions that satisfied our hunger after a long drive. The atmosphere was cozy, perfect for a quick break. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a casual stop with good vibes."

trgt: Don't understand how anyone could give this place anything more then one star for the simple fact of attitude. The food is ok, that's worth the one star. But the people in this place are so RUDE. They need to take some anger management lessons. No matter what you go in there for you get an attitude. My suggestion is go in don't look at anybody that works there don't ask any questions or think your able to buy anything on display. They get very upset and nasty with you if you buy something from the case that they have to replace.
beginning: Don't understand how anyone could give this place anything more
mgt: "Don't understand how anyone could give this place anything more than a single star. The service was abysmal, with staff who seemed disinterested and unhelpful. The food was bland and poorly prepared, lacking any real flavor or creativity. I left feeling disappointed and regretting my choice to dine here. There are far better options in the area that truly value their customers."

trgt:
Great burgers! Way better than some other burger places in tow, in my opinion. Not too greasy, perfect portions and decently priced. They have enough options to get what you want, but not too many to make your decision like seem like you are contemplating adoption. 

There Smash burger is great, and if you add on their Smash fries you will be in heaven! (smash fries - reg fries with rosemary olive oil and garlic) 

They are pretty quick too, so if you have a limited time for lunch this is a good option. They also have some great options for the little ones and a few other things to try other than burgers; veggie burgers and hot dogs.
beginning: Great burgers! Way better than some other burger places in
mgt: "Great burgers! Way better than some other burger places in town. The patties are juicy and cooked to perfection, with a variety of toppings that elevate the flavor. The buns are fresh and toasted, adding a delightful crunch. The fries are crispy and seasoned just right, making for a perfect side. The atmosphere is casual and inviting, perfect for a laid-back meal. I highly recommend trying their special sauce—it’s a game changer!"

trgt: Service was was not good at all, the waitress took forever to have our order placed. the other people who sat around us (who were seated after) all got their orders in before me and my date, the waiter never checked on us and the food was terrible, especially the hash browns... Will not be going again.
beginning: Service was was not good at all, the waitress took
mgt: "Service was not good at all, the waitress took forever to take our order and seemed disinterested in our needs. We waited over 30 minutes for our drinks, and when they finally arrived, they were incorrect. The food was mediocre at best, and it felt like we were an afterthought. Overall, a disappointing experience that left us frustrated."

trgt: I made the mistake of stopping by on a weekend afternoon during the middle of a game... Not an available seat in the place. Placed my order at the bar and sat down on the window sill (yes that is correct) and chomped down on a double bacon cheeseburger. \n\nThe people and place were great but the food was average. I don't have any desires to return. Perhaps a bar chaser would enjoy the atmosphere more as they definitely cater to spirit chaser given the large bar area. If you are looking for some insight in that regard, I'm sure my fellow yelpers have posted several divining reviews on that subject.
beginning: I made the mistake of stopping by on a weekend
mgt: "I made the mistake of stopping by on a weekend, and the crowd was overwhelming. The noise level was unbearable, making it difficult to enjoy the atmosphere. Service was slow, and it felt like the staff were overwhelmed. The food, while decent, didn’t quite live up to the hype. I’d recommend visiting during the week for a more relaxed experience."

trgt: Food and service very inconsistent.  Last time we were here the owner was in and everything was great - food had great balance and you could actually taste each ingredient.  This time, not so much - ribs were very spicy but not a lot of taste other than that...  Food was cold, slow service.
beginning: Food and service very inconsistent. Last time we were here
mgt: "Food and service very inconsistent. Last time we were here, the waitstaff seemed overwhelmed, leading to long delays in our orders. The food, when it finally arrived, was lukewarm and lacked the flavor we remembered from previous visits. It's disappointing because the ambiance is lovely, but the overall experience left us feeling underwhelmed. We hope they can improve."

trgt: After reading raving reviews of Glass Nickel Pizza, I have to say it was underwhelming.  I have honestly come to prefer Papa John's.  But then again, I don't eat meat so I wouldn't take this review TOO seriously.  I'm sure their other pizzas are good.
beginning: After reading raving reviews of Glass Nickel Pizza, I have
mgt: After reading raving reviews of Glass Nickel Pizza, I have to say it truly lives up to the hype. The crust is perfectly crispy, and the toppings are fresh and generous. I tried the classic pepperoni and was blown away by the quality of the ingredients. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. I can't wait to return and explore more of their unique specialty pizzas!

trgt: Awesome check-in deal and not so pricey to begin with... the receptionist was nice, they had free wi-fi and actual current magazines besides like Motorcycle Monthly and WebMD that you usually find at other auto repair places. Big plus, they have tons of free stuff like water bottles, cookies, tea, ice cream, coffee, etc.
beginning: Awesome check-in deal and not so pricey to begin with...
mgt: Awesome check-in deal and not so pricey to begin with, this hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making the entire experience enjoyable. The room was clean and well-appointed, with a comfortable bed and modern amenities. I particularly loved the complimentary breakfast, which offered a great variety of options. Overall, I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a budget-friendly yet comfortable stay.

trgt: Despite its friendliness and cleanness, Pho Hung failed in the food category.  My Pho was lukewarm at best.  My fiance's shaken beef was small in portion and quality of beef subpar.  My mom's seafood pho was salty and, again, lukewarm.  C'mon, pipping hot broth is a MUST for Pho or else it wouldn't cook the bean sprouts, let alone the rare beef!!!\n\nI hadn't had Pho for more than 2 months.  Pho Hung failed to revive my love for Pho.  I think I'll skip Pho all together when I am in Vegas from now on.
beginning: Despite its friendliness and cleanness, Pho Hung failed in the
mgt: "Despite its friendliness and cleanness, Pho Hung failed in the execution of its signature dishes. The pho lacked depth of flavor, and the broth was surprisingly bland. While the service was attentive, the overall dining experience fell short of expectations. I had hoped for a vibrant taste that would transport me to Vietnam, but instead, I left feeling underwhelmed and disappointed."

trgt: Just like New York!  Great Friendly family service! The food...Ah-mazing!  We wanted to try everything- we settled on the lasagna, baked ziti, and meat ravioli. We also got a side of meatballs and tried a slice of white pizza. All were sooooo yummy- the sauce was perfect! We will be back because there is so much more to enjoy!
beginning: Just like New York! Great Friendly family service! The food...Ah-mazing!
mgt: Just like New York! Great friendly family service! The food...Ah-mazing! Each dish bursts with flavor, and the portions are generous. The atmosphere is vibrant, making it perfect for gatherings. Don't miss the homemade desserts; they are the cherry on top of a fantastic meal! Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic cuisine.

trgt: Here with my family. Kids meals were huge and fit for an adult. Wife ordered chicken flautas and they were a little bland. I ordered a shredded beef chimichanga with red sauce... It was good.  They were generous portions on everything. Chips and salsa were ok. The environment was was nice old world Mexico and the service was good! We will be back.
beginning: Here with my family. Kids meals were huge and fit
mgt: "Here with my family. Kids meals were huge and fit for little appetites, leaving no one hungry. The variety on the menu was impressive, catering to both picky eaters and adventurous palates. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our dining experience enjoyable. We especially loved the homemade desserts, which were the perfect sweet ending to our meal. Overall, a fantastic place for families!"

trgt: amazing! need i say more!?
beginning: amazing! need i say more!?
mgt: Amazing! Need I say more!? The experience was truly unforgettable, from the stunning visuals to the captivating storyline. Every moment kept me on the edge of my seat, and the performances were nothing short of stellar. I left feeling inspired and eager to share it with everyone I know. Highly recommend!

trgt:
Yes I'm reviewing this....why not?  Just an Scottish version of a Hooters bar, whats not to love.

But of course, the food as expected isn't all that great, but the ladies are shall I say, have nice outfits and truly warm up to you.  Cheers to ASU.  Heck, you even get a collectors card to take home and show your wife and kids.  

For the upside, at least it made my trip to Tempe somewhat memorable, even though it required venturing outside to Phoenix for a drink and grub.  Just a 30 min travel away and 2 transfers.  

For the food:

-Garlic Fries - bleh, although its the skinnier type fries, no one does it better than Gordon Biersch

-Spinach Dip - bland and too chunky

-Grilled Buffalo Wings - I got like 3 that were burnt, and although its supposedly different from the deep fried type, they were just like the ones you cook on the bbq, except .....more burnt.  I didn't enjoy it that much I had myself to blame since I was craving wings for some reason.

-Side of Dublin Stew - Probably the one thing I'm glad I got since it was sort of like a Shepards Pie in stew form.  Tasty and pretty filling.

As for the drinks:

-After all, the bar was just calling out to me and although I had hoped to see more beers on tap, unfortunately, a majority of their beer list was bottled.  I went with the Kilt Lifter...something that sounded rather appropriate which turned out to be like an IPA but toned down and had a sweeter taste like that of a Hef.
beginning: Yes I'm reviewing this....why not? Just an Scottish version of
mgt: "Yes I'm reviewing this....why not? Just a Scottish version of a classic dish, but it brings a unique twist that I absolutely love. The flavors are rich and hearty, perfectly capturing the essence of Scotland. The use of local ingredients adds a freshness that elevates the dish beyond expectations. Each bite is a delightful experience, making it a must-try for anyone who appreciates good food. I highly recommend pairing it with a nice whisky for the full experience!"

trgt: Frozen Grasshopper, my first shake EVER.  The presentation of it caught my eye first.  As a waiter who walked by had it on a tray, I just had to ask what it was called.  After contemplating, I order the grasshopper and enjoyed until it got to that melted consistency - then I just gave it to my b/f to finish.  For food, I was having a difficult time deciding (once again), but got the Gold Standard Burger w/ steak cut fries.  A pretty juicy burger that had good flavor.  I was so full when I left! ... full, but satisfied.
beginning: Frozen Grasshopper, my first shake EVER. The presentation of it
mgt: "Frozen Grasshopper, my first shake EVER. The presentation of it was stunning, with vibrant green hues and a sprinkle of chocolate shavings on top. The moment I took a sip, I was greeted with a refreshing blend of mint and creamy vanilla that danced on my palate. Each sip was a delightful experience, perfectly balanced and not overly sweet. I could taste the freshness of the ingredients, making it feel indulgent yet light. This shake is a must-try for anyone looking to treat themselves!"

trgt: This place has more \"cool\" atmosphere than anywhere else downtown and you have to be ready for that.  The hipsters will be everywhere and the DJ in the corner won't really be doing anything....but it's a cozy place to go with a friend or a date and certain menu items are incredible.  The brie and apple pizza is unlike any other and they usually have a special pizza that can be just as amazing.  Also, the Three Cup Tofu, while a bit pricey ($9.50,) is fresh, unique, and so good.  Other than that, the menu is small and too expensive, so get a Caipirinha (one of the only good ones in town) and enjoy a nice, mellow night out.
beginning: This place has more \"cool\" atmosphere than anywhere else downtown
mgt: "This place has more 'cool' atmosphere than anywhere else downtown. The eclectic decor and vibrant art pieces create an inviting vibe. The staff is friendly and attentive, making you feel right at home. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. Whether you're here for a casual lunch or a night out with friends, the energy is infectious. Don't miss their signature cocktails; they are a perfect complement to the overall experience!"

trgt:
Went to Rufus on the Thursday night before the August long weekend - it had been recommended to us by a local Montrealer. At first the girl who greeted us could not find out reservation for 8. The bartender stepped in to help us... and we were seated. It took about 20 mins for our server (the original girl) to take our drink order and we should have assessed that that was a good indication of the poor service that would follow. 

I don't know if it was because we are anglo (and this area of town - Little Burgundy/Grifftintown is predominantly franco) but she was slow to help us, rude and kept ignoring our requests for drinks...water...napkins..etc. At one point my husband walked up to her in the restaurant and asked politely if she could come over as we all wanted to order more drinks - at which point, she proceeded to have a 10-15 min conversation with some guys sitting at the bar! I was in awe. 

I must say though - the food was very yummy. It seems that they change their menu periodically - when we went, it was a take on Japanese street food. The soba noodles were extremely flavourful,...agedashi tofu - YUM..and who doesn't love dumplings? 

Cocktails were pricey - $14 range. I ordered a margarita and it was straight up but NOT over ice...

The decor leaves much to the imagination...let's just say it looks better under candlelight.
beginning: Went to Rufus on the Thursday night before the August
mgt: Went to Rufus on the Thursday night before the August festival, and I was pleasantly surprised by the vibrant atmosphere. The live music set the perfect tone, and the staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, and I couldn't resist trying the signature burger, which was juicy and packed with flavor. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I can't wait to return for another night of fun and great food!

trgt:
Now and again I like to mix things up with the chain coffee shops, and here say now I felt like doing just that.

As CN has moved into the fort, I thought i give this shiney, squeaky new baby a whirl.  

It's almost like the actual building was made for this purpose.  It has a great mezzanie, which gives massives of height to the front of the store.  Plenty of seating, although it looks like it can get pretty full very quickly.

Staff were pretty friendly too, although behind the counter for them it looks ergonomically a tight squeeze serving us customers going back and forward.

I had a toasted panani with mozzerella and grilled peppers and milano hot chocolate - I just would like the hot chocolate to be full if request no cream and hotter than it was with or without cream.  Coffee is ok too.  

Nice change to sbux or costa and a nice addition to the fort.
beginning: Now and again I like to mix things up with
mgt: "Now and again I like to mix things up with a new genre, and this book did not disappoint. The plot was refreshingly original, weaving together unexpected twists that kept me on the edge of my seat. The characters were well-developed, each with their own unique backstories that added depth to the narrative. I found myself emotionally invested in their journeys, rooting for their successes and feeling their struggles. The author’s writing style was engaging and vivid, painting a picture that made it easy to lose track of time. Overall, this was a delightful read that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for something different."

trgt: Was there on labor day weekend and it was a great experience. Even when the place wa packed we got sit right away and the food was delicious: I ordered a pizza and it was awesome, My son ordered the meatloaf and that thing was finger-licking good, my daugther oredered pasta and that thig was home made and extra good. My wife ordered the sliders and that was also awesome. To top it all the service was great! love the place and we will be back!
beginning: Was there on labor day weekend and it was a
mgt: "Was there on Labor Day weekend and it was a fantastic experience! The atmosphere was vibrant, filled with friendly people and live music. The food options were diverse, offering everything from classic BBQ to vegan delights. I particularly enjoyed the local craft beers, which paired perfectly with my meal. The staff was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Overall, it was a memorable day filled with fun activities and great company. I can't wait to return next year!"

trgt: Service is awful. Waited over 25 minutes just to have our order taken. There were tables who were seated after us whose orders were taken before us. We were getting ready to walk out when the waitress finally came over. Never again.
beginning: Service is awful. Waited over 25 minutes just to have
mgt: my order taken, and when it finally arrived, it was cold and incorrect. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested in helping. I had to flag down a server multiple times just to get basic condiments. Overall, a frustrating experience that left me disappointed. I won’t be returning anytime soon.

trgt: Absolutely horrible. Just horrible! If you decide to sign up with this poor excuse for cable or Internet service, be prepared to get a bill for a different and higher amount each month. Top that off with the worst customer service in the industry and more bad reviews than I care to read through and you have COX COMMUNICATIONS! I'd rather just go without than to deal with them. I'd give them zero stars if I could.
beginning: Absolutely horrible. Just horrible! If you decide to sign up
mgt: "Absolutely horrible. Just horrible! If you decide to sign up, be prepared for endless technical issues and unresponsive customer service. I encountered multiple glitches that made using the platform frustrating. The promised features were either missing or malfunctioning, and it felt like I was constantly troubleshooting instead of enjoying the service. Save your time and money; there are far better options available."

trgt: Worst floral experience ever. I ordered through FTD. Thank goodness I chose to have them deliver it to me and then I would deliver it to my mother because what I received was the worst arrangement I've ever seen. I couldn't possibly give it to my mother for Mother's Day. Different vase, old flowers - just awful. FTD called the shop to try to mediate the situation and the shop was completely rude and adamant that they did nothing wrong and refused to do anything for me (return or replace). FTD finally gave me my money back. I will NEVER order from them ever and will tell everybody I know (including you Yelpers) to never go to them. There are so many other great floral shops in town.
beginning: Worst floral experience ever. I ordered through FTD. Thank goodness
mgt: "Thank goodness I checked the delivery before the event. The arrangement was wilted and lacked the vibrant colors shown online. Customer service was unhelpful, and I felt completely let down. I expected a beautiful bouquet, but instead, I received a sad, half-dead collection of flowers. I will never order from FTD again."

trgt: I came here to find some gingham ribbon and they did have some, but overall, I thought the selection, organization and width of all the ribbons were a bit limited. When I was checking out, you're made to go through a maze of racks so you'll buy more bs impulse items, so needless to say, it's a little confusing of where you're supposed to enter. Well, I entered the wrong way and one of the cashier girls was quick and curt - \"line starts over there!\" Geeze.
beginning: I came here to find some gingham ribbon and they
mgt: "I came here to find some gingham ribbon and they had an impressive selection! The colors were vibrant, and the quality was top-notch. The staff was incredibly helpful, guiding me to exactly what I needed. I also discovered some unique crafting supplies that I hadn't seen elsewhere. Overall, a delightful shopping experience that I can't wait to repeat!"

trgt: Super great place. Food was good friendly people. We ordered take out and while you waited they gave his ice tea. They alway make you feel welcome when you come in. Place is very clean. You have to come and eat here.
beginning: Super great place. Food was good friendly people. We ordered
mgt: "Super great place. Food was good, friendly people. We ordered the grilled chicken and the pasta special, both of which were delicious. The flavors were vibrant, and the portions were generous. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. We’ll definitely be coming back to try more dishes!"

trgt: Meh....seems to be dropping off.
beginning: Meh....seems to be dropping off.
mgt: Meh....seems to be dropping off. The initial excitement has faded, and the plot feels repetitive. Characters lack depth, making it hard to stay engaged. I hoped for more twists, but it’s become predictable. Overall, it’s a disappointing turn for a series that started strong.

trgt: I'm going to preface by saying that the staff is really awesome.  Hostess was sweet, our server Courtney was wonderful and a manager came out and checked on us.\n\nBut the food is so gross.  Not gross like in a McDonald's sort of way, but just bland, blah, whatever.  We went for a happy hour and they offer \"$2 off\" type of things, not set prices like $5 for this, this and this, etc.  Know what I mean?  Just wasn't my thing and I won't go back to spend money on food.
beginning: I'm going to preface by saying that the staff is
mgt: "I'm going to preface by saying that the staff is incredibly attentive and friendly. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and valued. They took the time to explain the menu and made excellent recommendations based on my preferences. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing evening. Overall, my experience was delightful, and I can't wait to return!"

trgt:
The positives?  The easy to look at hostesses/waitresses and lavish las vegas styling.  The negatives? This place is a misleading and stupid.  

We were reeled in because it was "Happy Hour" & the hostess said appetizers are half price and the drink specials are two for one draft beers or 2 for 1 stoli or patron.

So, we sit down at the bar lounge area and order a beer thinking we could get two drinks for the price of one and order half price appetizers.

Ends up we were not allowed to order half price appetizers because there was a miscommunication between the hostess and waitress.
Their mistake but the staff/management didn't care.

Fine, we're thirsty and want some beers.  I'll order two beers for my good friend & I, for the price of one per the happy hour special.  The waitress brings us four (4) drinks for the price of two!  WTF?!  The waitress undeftly explains that each person has to pay for a drink to get the special two for one price!  Who's heard of such lunacy?  The terms and conditions, i.e. the fine print, weren't available to us upon entering this establishment.  We felt slighted & swindled.

First Food & Bar stands for them being first, leaving the customers a distant second.
beginning: The positives? The easy to look at hostesses/waitresses and lavish
mgt: The positives? The easy to look at hostesses/waitresses and lavish decor create an inviting atmosphere that immediately sets a pleasant tone. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. Service is attentive without being intrusive, ensuring a relaxed dining experience. However, the prices can be a bit steep, which might deter budget-conscious diners. Overall, it’s a great spot for special occasions or a night out with friends.

trgt: I went here after seeing this restaurant featured on Dinners, Drive-Ins, and Drives.  I wasn't quite sure about the mixture of Mexican and Chinese food...but I was pleasantly surprised!  The menu is a little confusing, but the girl at the counter was helpful in explaining it.  There was plenty of food and it was tasty!.....One of my creations was the carnitas in a quesadilla.......Mmmmmmm.....try it out!!!!!
beginning: I went here after seeing this restaurant featured on Dinners,
mgt: "I went here after seeing this restaurant featured on Dinners, Drive-Ins, and Dives, and it did not disappoint! The atmosphere was vibrant and welcoming, with friendly staff who made us feel right at home. We started with the famous loaded nachos, which were piled high with fresh toppings and bursting with flavor. For the main course, I opted for the signature BBQ brisket, and it was incredibly tender and smoky. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!"

trgt: Decided to give this place a try based on all of the great reviews. Upon entrance, very clean. Service was quick and the staff were friendly. The food: I ordered the family pack which consisted of 25 strips (baked/grilled), fries, veggie kabobs, and mac & cheese. The strips were just ok. Nothing special. Mac & cheese was bland but I loved the cheese topping. I loved the veggie kabobs and TX toast. Fries were just ok. Tried all of the different sauces and my fav was the BFG & Honey Mustard sauce. Overall, I probably would not come back.
beginning: Decided to give this place a try based on all
mgt: "Decided to give this place a try based on all the rave reviews I had heard. I was not disappointed! The atmosphere was inviting, with a cozy decor that made me feel right at home. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring that my experience was enjoyable from start to finish. I ordered the signature dish, and it was absolutely delicious—flavorful and beautifully presented. I can't wait to come back and explore more of the menu!"

trgt: This place will become the next Hooters.  In fact I have a friend who calls this place \"Celtic Hooters\".  The first week it is open and it is packed.  In fact it is always busy, which makes for a fun experience.  The servers are in the magical 19-20 age range (old enough to serve, not quite old enough to drink) range.  Pretty girls, who will make small talk with business men.  As a female, getting service here is a bit tougher. I would advise going straight to the bar.  The food is standard pub fare, they have a good beer collection along with ciders.  Overall, you come here with a group of friends, lots of televisions.  Good place for a basic HH with friends you want to see but not actually talk to (it is pretty noisy in there), and face it, the pretty girls in reallly really small outfits are distracting, (and I'm a girl).  There are lots of servers, but like I mentioned, the girls really chat up the patrons, so you may or may not get speedy service.
beginning: This place will become the next Hooters. In fact I
mgt: "This place will become the next Hooters. In fact, I can already see the potential. The atmosphere is vibrant, with a lively decor that draws you in. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, from classic wings to unique appetizers that are sure to please any palate. Plus, the drink specials are hard to resist, making it a perfect spot for gatherings with friends. Overall, I can't wait to return and see how this place evolves!"

trgt: This is a great store: Clean and a good variety of vegetables. The vitiamins and nutrition items are fresh and priced well. \n\nToday I did not receive the wheat germ I paid for, so if you go in, watch the bagger, because I saw him place the wheat germ in a plastic bag with another item.I brought cloth bags, he gave me the first item to put in the cloth bag, but failed to give me the wheat germ. Unfortunately I am not the type that calls back to get my missing item, so I'm out the money. Next time I'll keep a better eye on my purchases.
beginning: This is a great store: Clean and a good variety
mgt: "This is a great store: Clean and a good variety of products. The staff is always friendly and helpful, making shopping a pleasant experience. I appreciate the well-organized aisles, which make it easy to find what I need. Prices are reasonable, and I often find great deals. Overall, I highly recommend this store for anyone looking for quality items and excellent service."

trgt:
"If you build it, they will come" - but maybe not to Chase Field, well... unless the team is winning of course. But even then, they will only come depending on the food options and free promotions available to them on that particular day. 
 
Alright Diamondbacks Nation... well maybe not nation, maybe Diamondbacks fans? Nope, there aren't enough of you for that title either. What about supporters? Maybe groupies? Well whatever you're called, where are you? You've got one gorgeous baseball field and a World Series title, yet this stadium sits lifelessly in the Arizona desert.
 
It's sad actually. Chase Field is gorgeous, and dare I say... breathtaking. Stretching far and wide across the Phoenix skyline, Chase Field stands tall among the buildings that call downtown Phoenix home. This technological work of art brought baseball to the desert, and that's quite a feat. Even some of baseballs greatest players, like The Big Unit for example, have called it home. Sparkling clean and strategically situated for easy access and parking, Chase Field calls out to "D-Backs fans" - begging them to venture though its towering gated entrance to seek sanctuary within its cool climate controlled atmosphere. All of the vendors, ushers and ballpark staff at this stadium are also welcoming, helpful and friendly. There isn't a bad seat at Chase Field. The view is virtually perfect from every angle. Yet the seats remain fan-less. 
 
I do understand part of the reason why fans don't flock to Chase Field. An empty stadium is a common transplant state/expansion team symptom, like the desolate Tropicana Field for example. Most people in Arizona probably aren't even "D-Backs fans". I get that. I'm not one. But even I pay more attention to the action at Chase Field and have more admiration of its beauty than a majority of those "D-Backs fans." 

It is as if "D-Backs fans" are confused, and they think Chase Field is an indoor shopping mall - because in between the shopping, the food, the activities, the awful emcee that talks in between innings, the dancing and the trivia games, none of the "D-Backs fans" seem to have time to watch baseball.  

So "D-Backs fans" - you need to up your appreciation level for the game. It's the roar of the crowd that brings a stadium to life. Team pride is what makes or breaks a ballpark's atmosphere. And when you are talking on your phone through an entire at bat, standing up right in the middle of a crucial pitch to get more ballpark chow or allowing your children to turn empty seats into their own personal jungle gym or hide and go seek game, why even come to the stadium? Go to the mall or visit a park for that matter. Regardless of whether you're in first place or last place, this is your team in your city. It's not enjoyable to see such beauty go to waste. So stop swimming in your indoor ballpark pool (I still can't believe how tacky that pool looks in the outfield), worry about what ice cream extravaganza you are going to stuff your face with later, and let's watch some baseball! 
 
It's called game time "D-Backs fans", not play time.
beginning: \"If you build it, they will come\" - but maybe
mgt: "If you build it, they will come" - but maybe not in the way you expect. This film explores the complexities of ambition and the unforeseen consequences of our choices. The characters are richly developed, each grappling with their own dreams and disappointments. The cinematography beautifully captures the essence of the setting, enhancing the emotional depth of the story. While the pacing can be slow at times, the payoff is worth the wait, leaving viewers with a lingering sense of reflection. Overall, it's a thought-provoking piece that challenges the notion of success and fulfillment.

trgt: I am VERY picky about take-out Chinese/Asian food restaurants, and had completely given them up for many years  However, this place is legit: Clean/well kept, good quality food, decently priced.
beginning: I am VERY picky about take-out Chinese/Asian food restaurants, and
mgt: "I am VERY picky about take-out Chinese/Asian food restaurants, and I have to say that this place exceeded my expectations. The flavors were authentic, and each dish was prepared with fresh ingredients. The Kung Pao chicken had the perfect balance of spice and crunch, while the dumplings were tender and packed with flavor. The service was prompt, and the portions were generous. I will definitely be returning for more!"

trgt: Don't sit at the bar...... No one helps you.\n\nThis is by far the worst service I have ever had. I love Grimaldi's the pizza is great but the service was just terrible. Up front stand three hostess' that cannot figure out how long the wait was. Each one of them said a different time, and were extremly rude. One finally said the bar was open seating so for the first time we sat at the bar. I noticed a huge party leave from the patio so I asked a hostess if the patio is open seating, it was not so I then asked if the wait was still as long. She informed me that people were ahead of me (which was understandable) however no one was waiting. So I went back to the bar and said its fine we will just deal with it. Some better spots outside opened up so we moved seats from in the bar to the outside bar area. I watched two tables stay open the entire time of our meal, which was 2 hours long. I was ready to leave had I been able to tell the waitress to cancel our order. The reason I give it 2 stars instead of 1 is becuase in the end the amazing pizza made up for the terrible service. I love the pizza and next time I think mabey I will order it to go.
beginning: Don't sit at the bar...... No one helps you.\n\nThis is
mgt:
"Don't sit at the bar...... No one helps you. 

This is a disappointing experience, as the staff seemed more focused on chatting among themselves than attending to customers. The atmosphere was lively, but the lack of service made it hard to enjoy. I waited far too long for a drink, and when I finally got one, it was not what I ordered. I would recommend finding a table instead, where the service might be better. Overall, I left feeling frustrated and unlikely to return."

trgt:
If you want Vintage, this is were you go.  I am vintage hound and this place sparked a interest with me.  They have decent men's selection which a lot of trendy store seem to be lacking. 

The coat section is pretty awesome.  Vintage leather, Suede, corduroy, you name they had it on the rack.   The had some good sizing too, I am a skinny lanky dude.

Everything is well laid out and organized well.   The prices are high, but you can get some great 1 off vintage items here.  I am still hope to get a "leather sweater" in my size there.
beginning: If you want Vintage, this is were you go. I
mgt: "If you want Vintage, this is where you go. I was immediately captivated by the eclectic selection of items that transport you back in time. The atmosphere is charming, filled with unique pieces that tell a story. The staff is knowledgeable and passionate, always ready to help you find that perfect treasure. Whether you're hunting for retro clothing, classic furniture, or rare collectibles, this place has it all. A true gem for vintage lovers!"

trgt:
***UPDATE***
After posting the following review, I was contacted via Yelp by a person calling herself "Kate G.". Kate stated, "I would like to get your phone number so that our corporate side can look into this and discuss." I asked Kate G. who she was & she stated she was Landry's Social Media Coordinator. Why didn't you tell me that in your first e-mail? Ummm, I don't hand out my phone number to random internet contacts!
Why on earth would I give my phone number to Kate? Does she think I want to be bothered my her or Corporate? I can't be bought off with a gift certificate from Landry's. I will never eat there again. I filed a complaint with the Southern Nevada Health District!!! So, listen up Kate G., you can NOT have any of my personal information. May I suggest you introduce yourself before asking for someone's phone number. BTW, I still have nightmares over what happened to me! 

I got so ill after eating here I thought I would die. Never again! I had a steak, loaded potato, green beans & one glass of wine. I'll have PTSD whenever I think of that night.
beginning: ***UPDATE***\nAfter posting the following review, I was contacted via Yelp
mgt:
***UPDATE***  
After posting the following review, I was contacted via Yelp by the owner, who sincerely apologized for my experience. They offered to make things right by providing a complimentary meal and assured me that they were addressing the issues I raised. I appreciated their prompt response and willingness to improve. It shows they value customer feedback and are committed to enhancing their service. I look forward to giving them another chance and hope for a better experience next time.

trgt: Love the chicken tacos. Best I've ever tasted. Very authentic Mexican food. Great selections of Mexican drinks as well. I'll be back again and again.
beginning: Love the chicken tacos. Best I've ever tasted. Very authentic
mgt: "Love the chicken tacos. Best I've ever tasted. Very authentic, with a perfect blend of spices that really brings out the flavor. The tortillas are fresh and soft, adding to the overall experience. The salsa on the side is a delightful kick, and the portion sizes are generous. I can't wait to come back and try more dishes!"

trgt:
I actually thought Ka was better than Mystere. Both plots are vague and you really have to watch to follow, but Ka was a bit less vague and actually showed progression through the characters, even if the audience was left to jump a few conclusions. 

There was one part though that was just unbelievably ridiculous. They used some video game looking designs and we were basically watching action on a screen. Um, no. But other than that, some solo/duo scenes were breathtakingly beautiful, which is why I'll fork up two stars.

Funny though, at the end, when the cast comes out,you'll notice that the majority of them is Asian (we folks are good at acrobatics, I guess?) LOL

I excitedly paid around $170 for two tickets, with front and center seats, but I will definitely not be back to watch Ka again.
beginning: I actually thought Ka was better than Mystere. Both plots
mgt: "I actually thought Ka was better than Mystere. Both plots were engaging, but Ka's storytelling felt more cohesive and immersive. The acrobatics were breathtaking, and the integration of technology added a modern twist that enhanced the overall experience. The performers' energy was infectious, making it hard not to be captivated. While Mystere had its charm, Ka's emotional depth and visual spectacle left a lasting impression on me."

trgt:
3.5 stars? My issues with Wynn management notwithstanding, the actual food at this buffet was great. My favorite dishes were the quinoa and brussel sprout salads, crab legs, rack of lamb, and charcuterie selection.

Note that traditional eaters who want the 'usual' buffet fare might be disappointed, as almost everything here has some kind of twist or modification to make it stand out from the pack.

Dessert selection kind of lacked the 'wow' factor I was expecting, although the tres leches and creme brulee were yummy. I didn't try the crepe station, a decision I now regret. :( 

The lines were really out of control. 45 minute wait in the regular line and 20 minute wait in the 'VIP' line. Although, it's not their fault they're popular.

My only real complaint is the service. Our waitress seemed depressed and was very inattentive, visiting only once to give us our drinks and another time to refill them, never asking if we needed anything else or how our meal was going. The bulk of our service came from the busboys, a pattern repeated at the Wynn's other restaurants during our stay.
beginning: 3.5 stars? My issues with Wynn management notwithstanding, the actual
mgt: 3.5 stars? My issues with Wynn management notwithstanding, the actual experience at the resort was quite enjoyable. The rooms were spacious and elegantly designed, offering stunning views of the Strip. The dining options were diverse, with each restaurant providing a unique culinary experience. However, the service could be inconsistent at times, which detracted from the overall luxury feel. Despite this, the amenities, including the pool and spa, were top-notch and made for a relaxing getaway.

trgt: Finally headed back to this restaurant after a long hiatus (they closed for a bit and I may have forgotten about them once they reopened, my bad for sure).  We were happy to see that the menu was a bit updated but it really was the same great place it was before.  \n\nWe have only been here for breakfast and it is always good.  The egg dishes are what I typically go for and I am rarely disappointed.  If you enjoy sweet breakfasts do try Merci's french toast.  It is different but different in a very good way.  Their coffee is great quality and honestly, sometimes I enjoy heading over to Merci just to enjoy a great cup of coffee along side a freshly baked croissant (or chocolate croissant...).
beginning: Finally headed back to this restaurant after a long hiatus
mgt: Finally headed back to this restaurant after a long hiatus, and I was pleasantly surprised by the changes. The ambiance felt refreshed, with new decor that created a cozy yet modern vibe. The menu had expanded, offering a delightful variety of dishes. I tried the seasonal special, and it was bursting with flavor. The service was attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I can't wait to return and explore more of their offerings!

trgt:
We had a wedding lunch here a week ago.  The food was delicious and very nicely presented.  Susan (the owner) was great to work with and went the extra mile to ensure we had a wonderful experience on an exciting day!  Susan accommodated our needs and was very helpful and flexible during the planning process.  

For those of you looking for a unique and fun option for special events in the Gilbert area, especially those looking for something close to the LDS Temple, this proved to be a great option.  Susan accommodated almost 100 people.  

The pulled pork and chicken salad sandwiches were excellent!  The pasta salad and fruit salad was spot on!  This was followed by a variety of "house" specialty desserts which were to die for!  We give Susan and her help at The Gilbert House a well deserved recommendation!
beginning: We had a wedding lunch here a week ago. The
mgt: "We had a wedding lunch here a week ago. The atmosphere was enchanting, with beautiful decor that perfectly complemented the occasion. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring that every detail was taken care of. The food was exceptional, with a diverse menu that catered to all tastes. Guests raved about the flavors and presentation. Overall, it was a memorable experience that made our special day even more magical."

trgt:
Food: 
- 5 stars!!! - Cheese curds, gazpacho, lamb meatballs, pork tenderloin, mac and cheese, stuffed dates
- 4 stars - chicken and waffles, fillet w/ gnocchi

Drinks: 
- 5 stars!!! - Rye whisky old fashioned
- 3 stars - French 75

Favorites: Lamb meatballs, tenderloin, cheese curds, dates, gazpacho

Service:
Accommodating, knowledgeable staff and service.

Ambiance:
Mid century modern decor with a romantic and cozy feel. Love it!

Overall, one of the best restaurants in Phoenix bar far. Very impressed. Can't wait to go back.
beginning: Food: \n- 5 stars!!! - Cheese curds, gazpacho, lamb meatballs,
mgt: "Food: \n- 5 stars!!! - Cheese curds, gazpacho, lamb meatballs, and the flavors were absolutely divine. Each dish was expertly crafted, showcasing fresh ingredients and innovative combinations. The cheese curds were perfectly crispy, while the gazpacho offered a refreshing burst of flavor. The lamb meatballs were tender and seasoned to perfection, making every bite a delight. Highly recommend trying the dessert menu as well!"

trgt: Harlow's is hands down my favorite breakfast joint in Tempe. Their portions are generous and always delicious. Definitely order a side of their biscuits if it doesn't come with your meal. They are Baked fresh and come out still steaming. Can't beat em!
beginning: Harlow's is hands down my favorite breakfast joint in Tempe.
mgt: Harlow's is hands down my favorite breakfast joint in Tempe. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot to start the day. Their menu offers a delightful variety of options, from fluffy pancakes to savory omelets. I particularly love their avocado toast, which is always fresh and flavorful. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every visit feels special. Plus, the coffee is top-notch, keeping me energized throughout the morning. Overall, Harlow's is a must-visit for anyone craving a delicious breakfast!

trgt: its walmart...nothing else to say
beginning: its walmart...nothing else to say
mgt: "its walmart...nothing else to say. The store is always crowded, and the aisles are often disorganized. While you can find great deals, the customer service leaves much to be desired. It's convenient for quick shopping trips, but don't expect a pleasant experience."

trgt: We were there around 10:30 on a Friday night, looking for some post-concert dinner. The bar part looked more hopping. The dining part was decidedly not. The food was at least cheap, thanks to their half price munchies menu after 10pm.  \n\nI tried the individual pizza. The cheese was rubbery, the toppings scant, and the crust resembled more of a quesadilla than a pizza. The sweet potato fries was the highlight of my meal.
beginning: We were there around 10:30 on a Friday night, looking
mgt: "We were there around 10:30 on a Friday night, looking for a lively atmosphere and some good food. The place was buzzing with energy, and the staff greeted us with warm smiles. We ordered a variety of dishes, and each one was a delightful surprise. The flavors were bold and well-balanced, making it hard to pick a favorite. The ambiance was cozy yet vibrant, perfect for a night out with friends. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that left us eager to return."

trgt:
Both reviews for the place are great but I think they forgot to mention one key problem with laser quest. 

The game has started and you're darting around looking for cover. While hiding behind a pillar to avoid the hail of lasers that threaten your life, you hear some footsteps approaching from behind you. You turn quickly to ambush the enemy, only to find out he's 7... 

Somewhere in you're brain, alarm bells start ringing. Even though it's fake, your mind hesitates a little to shoot a kid at point blank range. By the time you've bypassed that thought and pull the trigger, he's already buggered off. 

If you're playing with kids, you'll loose (but you're a good person!)
beginning: Both reviews for the place are great but I think
mgt: "Both reviews for the place are great but I think they don't fully capture the unique atmosphere and charm it offers. The staff was incredibly welcoming, and the ambiance was cozy yet vibrant. The menu had a diverse selection, and every dish we tried was bursting with flavor. I especially loved the dessert, which was a perfect ending to a delightful meal. Overall, I highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience."

trgt:
Not much has changed round Cameron toll since I was dodging about the place as a lad.

Mainstays such as BHS, Boots, WH Smith and the epic Sainsbury's are nailed to the ground, unlikely to go anywhere, and still my personal main draws.

Then there are the collections of phone shops, travel agents and budget drug stores. In the way of diversity, there isn't much. A bookshop at one end, a couple of clothing stores I wouldn't venture into, and a Game store for the local geeks.

It pretty much covers all bases for what the locals might be in need of, so on that front it is fairly worthy. But not the kind of place you'd go out your way for.
beginning: Not much has changed round Cameron toll since I was
mgt: "Not much has changed round Cameron Toll since I was last here. The familiar shops still line the walkway, and the atmosphere remains vibrant. However, I noticed a few new eateries that have popped up, offering a refreshing twist to the usual fare. The coffee shop has improved its menu, and the local bakery now features some delightful pastries. Overall, it’s a comforting blend of nostalgia and new experiences that keeps me coming back."

trgt: Glad I came here with a Groupon because I was not impressed. Definitely not a place to pay full price at. Small portions, big price, mediocre food. Enough said.\n\nOh, also, worlds slowest service. I don't recommend this place.
beginning: Glad I came here with a Groupon because I was
mgt: "Glad I came here with a Groupon because I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the service and the atmosphere. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we felt welcome throughout our visit. The food was delicious, with generous portions that exceeded my expectations. I especially loved the unique flavors and presentation of each dish. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that I would recommend to anyone looking for a great meal at a reasonable price."

trgt: Terrible service.  The food is typically good, but not consistant.  My experience today was bad enough that i'm certain i'll never go back.
beginning: Terrible service. The food is typically good, but not consistant.
mgt: Terrible service. The food is typically good, but not consistent. On my last visit, my order was completely wrong, and it took forever to get the attention of the staff. When the correct dish finally arrived, it was lukewarm and lacked the usual flavor. It’s disappointing because I used to enjoy dining here, but the overall experience has become frustrating. I hope they can improve their service and maintain the quality of their food.

trgt: Service was terrible and the food was just OK.  The best thing about this place was the cheese crispi but not worth coming back for.
beginning: Service was terrible and the food was just OK. The
mgt: Service was terrible and the food was just OK. The waitstaff seemed disinterested and inattentive, making the dining experience frustrating. While the menu had potential, the dishes lacked flavor and creativity. I expected more for the price, and unfortunately, I left feeling disappointed. I doubt I will return anytime soon.

trgt: My experience here has left me with no words. Bad service. Mediocre food. I can definitely say I'm never coming here again. It took over 20 mins to get our table some water and the waitress didn't own up to her mistakes and blamed the busboy for not bringing the water. When we got the water, it tasted horrible. Our hotel room sink water tastes better than that. The food came so late as if they left to catch the fish we were going to consume. The waitress then forgot to put in one of our rolls and apologized in the most stand offish way possible saying it was a \"human error\" as if she wasn't even sorry about it. As we received the bill, my friend realized she got spicy tuna when she had wanted yellowtail. All in all worst place ever! The only decent person was the busboy. Avoid the waitress with a feather tattoo behind her ear.
beginning: My experience here has left me with no words. Bad
mgt: "My experience here has left me with no words. Bad service, unclean facilities, and a complete lack of attention to detail made my visit incredibly disappointing. I expected much more based on the reviews, but unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. I won't be returning."

trgt:
3.5 stars

I've tried 2 restaurants at MGM Grand: Craftsteak & Seablue.  I would rather come back to Craftsteak.

Came here for my sister's 21st birthday dinner, there were 8 of us.  We ordered many dishes to share as family style dining which included: Halibut, Dayboat Scallops, Prime Angus Flat Iron, and Prime Bone-In New York Strip.  Our dishes were served with: Chickpea and Lentil Rice, Jumbo Asparagus, Olive Oil Smashed Potatoes, and Medley of Mushrooms. Everything was "okay", the only dish that stands out that I would definitely order again is the Scallop - it was delicious.  Other than that, I don't think it's worth the money for average tasting food.

Oh, and they definitely need to redecorate this restaurant - please.
beginning: 3.5 stars\n\nI've tried 2 restaurants at MGM Grand: Craftsteak &
mgt:
"3.5 stars

I've tried 2 restaurants at MGM Grand: Craftsteak & Hakkasan. While Craftsteak offered a delightful steak experience with perfectly cooked meat and attentive service, Hakkasan fell short of my expectations. The ambiance was lively, but the food lacked the bold flavors I anticipated. Overall, both places have their strengths, but I found Craftsteak to be the standout choice for a memorable dining experience."

trgt: I love this place! Everyone here is great, personally I see Keri and she always does such a fantastic job. She's very thorough and professional.  Definitely nicest place with always the best results and everyone is so friendly!
beginning: I love this place! Everyone here is great, personally I
mgt: "I love this place! Everyone here is great, personally I always feel welcomed and valued. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure a fantastic experience. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends. Plus, the food is absolutely delicious! I highly recommend trying their signature dishes; you won't be disappointed!"

trgt: This location has a high turn around rate. It seems they have a new managers and employees every month. As far as their sub sandwich , they're at the bottom of the crap list compared to ports sub or jimmy johns. I like their flat bread and cold cut meat . Avoid everything else like their cook meat . Their bread is also drap n dry also. I hated subway for a couple years and realized it's the bread I didn't like . Now it's ok.
beginning: This location has a high turn around rate. It seems
mgt: "This location has a high turn around rate. It seems that staff members are frequently changing, which affects the overall service quality. While the food remains consistently good, the lack of familiarity among the team can lead to slower service and occasional mix-ups with orders. It would be great to see more stability in the staff to enhance the dining experience."

trgt: Marginal at best for the money. The whole place really does not seem up to the standard of other Westin properties I have stayed at.
beginning: Marginal at best for the money. The whole place really
mgt: "Marginal at best for the money. The whole place really lacks the charm and quality one would expect. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested in providing a good experience. The food was mediocre at best, with flavors that didn’t stand out. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: I got there at 6:30, so there wasn't a line to get in.  When we left around 8, the line was long. I would say it looked like people would have to wait an hour to get in.  Not sure if it was because we went early, but the oysters and sushi tasted like it was sitting there for a while.  So I don't recommend that.  The chicken and waffles is a must.  The meats look delicious, but tasted a bit dry and too dry for me.  The desserts look great and are showcased so.  The gelato is nothing to rave about but the crepes are good.  I think you can have dinner just trying one of each dessert!   Overall, for $55pp, it's not bad.  I think because we went early, the food didn't move as fast, so a lot was sitting around, but food should be consistent no matter when you go right?
beginning: I got there at 6:30, so there wasn't a line
mgt: "I got there at 6:30, so there wasn't a line. The atmosphere was inviting, and the staff greeted me warmly. I quickly found a cozy table by the window, which offered a lovely view of the bustling street outside. The menu was diverse, featuring a range of delicious options. I decided to try the special of the day, and it did not disappoint. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was beautiful. Overall, it was a delightful experience that I would highly recommend."

trgt: An attempt at a NY slice. I have eaten here a few times and all in all a three star attempt. Not a bad attempt but still not NY. Why is it so hard to make a good NY pizza here? Everyone uses bottled and/or shipped water anyway. This issue continues to allude me. The staff was great--- 4 stars for that.
beginning: An attempt at a NY slice. I have eaten here
mgt: "An attempt at a NY slice. I have eaten here several times, and while the crust is decent, it lacks that authentic New York flavor. The toppings are generous, but the sauce feels a bit bland. Overall, it's a good option if you're craving pizza, but it doesn't quite hit the mark for true pizza lovers."

trgt: There was a cornhole competetion going on when we got there. Clean, good pizza and calzones. Bucket of beer for $10. Not bad all around, but might question heading into that part of town at night.
beginning: There was a cornhole competetion going on when we got
mgt: "There was a cornhole competition going on when we got there, and the atmosphere was electric. Families and friends gathered around, cheering for their favorite teams. The smell of grilled food wafted through the air, adding to the festive vibe. We decided to join in on the fun, and it turned out to be a fantastic way to connect with others. The organizers did a great job keeping everything running smoothly, and the prizes for the winners were impressive. Overall, it was a delightful experience that made our day memorable."

trgt: I choose the regular oil change service for $24.99. This included oil, oil filter, top off fluids, check tire pressure and clean front windshield. The premium service is $34.99 and includes everything mentioned but will also add washing all windows, visual inspection of brakes and vacuum the interior. In addition to my $24.99 service I had my coolant topped off for another twenty cents.  The reason why I gave one star is because I was charged the premium price but got the regular service. This could have been just a mistake but according to the service checklist on my receipt they did charge me for premium services. So I inspected under the hood and noticed they didn't top off the coolant, which was an extra charge, didn't fill the radiator overflow, didn't wash any of the windows and didn't vacuum. I even had to check to see if there was fresh oil in the engine. According to my receipt all these services were completed and checked off.  If you're looking for a professional shop to work on your car I suggest you take it to another place.
beginning: I choose the regular oil change service for $24.99. This
mgt: I choose the regular oil change service for $24.99. This was a great value for the quality of service provided. The staff was friendly and efficient, ensuring that my vehicle was taken care of promptly. They explained the process clearly and even offered additional maintenance tips. I left feeling confident in my car's performance and will definitely return for future services. Highly recommend!

trgt: I was so happy to find real food at the airport.  The service was friendly, my wine was delicious and reasonably priced- considering the location, and my food was good.  I didn't time the arrival of my food, but the place was fairly full and I still received it promptly.  I chose the open-faced chicken sandwich with roasted peppers and it was far more than I could eat.
beginning: I was so happy to find real food at the
mgt: "I was so happy to find real food at the new local market. The selection of fresh produce was impressive, and everything looked vibrant and healthy. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, eager to share tips on how to prepare the seasonal vegetables. I also loved the variety of organic options available, making it easy to stick to my dietary preferences. Overall, it felt great to support a community-focused business that prioritizes quality and sustainability."

trgt: Average run of the mill store.  Associates are young teens and they really don't know where anything is.  Luckily I am able to get around to find everything.  Found my puppy treats and moved on.
beginning: Average run of the mill store. Associates are young teens
mgt: "Average run of the mill store. Associates are young teens who seem to lack experience and product knowledge. While the store is clean and organized, the customer service leaves much to be desired. It often feels like the staff is more interested in chatting with each other than assisting customers. Prices are reasonable, but without helpful guidance, it can be frustrating to find what you need. Overall, it’s a decent place for basic shopping, but don’t expect a personalized experience."

trgt: First experience with Indian food and omgosh what an impression! Highly recommend!
beginning: First experience with Indian food and omgosh what an impression!
mgt: First experience with Indian food and omgosh what an impression! The flavors were vibrant and rich, each dish telling its own story. The spices danced on my palate, from the creamy butter chicken to the fragrant biryani. I was particularly taken by the garlic naan, which was perfect for scooping up the delicious sauces. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making the meal even more enjoyable. I can't wait to explore more dishes on my next visit!

trgt: This spot totally lives up to the hype! The most amazing MASSIVE sandwiches ever. The kids had the fish, the wife had the rAgin Cajun and I had the pastrami! Everything was outstanding. And to top it off we were fortunate to get a picture with the lady who appeared in the episode on DDD.
