Worth traveling for and very reasonable prices for such large portions.Im home now and i cant stop thinking about that sandwich lol
beginning: This spot totally lives up to the hype! The most
mgt: "This spot totally lives up to the hype! The most delicious dishes I've ever tasted, each bursting with flavor and creativity. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it perfect for a night out or a casual lunch. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring a wonderful dining experience. I can't wait to return and try more from their diverse menu!"

trgt: Horrible!!! This is no way to treat veterans! The doctor that attended to me was so unprofessional he kept saying \"do you know what I'm sayin?\" too much slang! I felt like I was talking to some one on the street. It's was so uncomfortable I wouldn't even talk to my friends like that I not want my doctor that is supposed to be educated to speak to me like he's in the hood.
beginning: Horrible!!! This is no way to treat veterans! The doctor
mgt: "Horrible!!! This is no way to treat veterans! The doctor was dismissive and showed a complete lack of empathy. I felt like just another number rather than a person deserving of care. The wait times were excessive, and when I finally got in, my concerns were brushed aside. Veterans deserve better than this kind of treatment. It's disheartening to see such a lack of respect for those who have served our country."

trgt: Nice staff as mentioned in a prior review, but they have replaced the steering rack on my Silverado 5 times in the past 3 years!!!!! Yes, that is right, and after the one they recently put on 8/26/14 is leaking and loose. That means it is going in tomorrow. I just paid $252 in labor to put it on as it was outside of 6 months. The steering hose was leaking and they replaced it for free. Mike the Manager tries his best to make things right.
beginning: Nice staff as mentioned in a prior review, but they
mgt: "Nice staff as mentioned in a prior review, but they seemed overwhelmed during peak hours. The wait for service was longer than expected, and my order was mixed up. However, once I received the correct dish, it was delicious and well-prepared. The ambiance was cozy, making it a pleasant place to unwind. I would recommend visiting during off-peak times for a better experience."

trgt: Went to eat buffet. This is the Worst food ever I eat. All the dishes are tasteless. I won't recommend this to anyone.
beginning: Went to eat buffet. This is the Worst food ever
mgt: "Went to eat buffet. This is the worst food ever. The dishes were cold, and the flavors were bland. The selection was limited, and many items looked like they had been sitting out for hours. I was really disappointed, especially since I had heard good things. I won't be returning anytime soon."

trgt:
The ONLY place to stay in downtown Vegas.  Period! Just went under an almost complete remodel.  Rooms are fresh and spacey.  New pool is really neat (reminded me of the Maui resorts).  Fabulous. 

Casino is laid out well, and easy to navigate in.  Buffet is worth it, and other restaurants are of higher quality 

You can walk to the Fremont experience and see all of what you want to see in downtown Vegas from the Nugget.  

Search their website and other internet sites for great deals. This is definitely a 4 star hotel, and some great bargains for stay can be found at certain times in the year. 

Sure, its a long way from the Strip, but it seems to be more friendlier and cozy.  

Try it, you'll like it !
beginning: The ONLY place to stay in downtown Vegas. Period! Just
mgt: "The ONLY place to stay in downtown Vegas. Period! Just steps away from the vibrant Fremont Street Experience, this hotel offers an unbeatable combination of comfort and excitement. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, providing a perfect retreat after a night of fun. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring that every need is met. Plus, the on-site dining options are fantastic, with a variety of cuisines to satisfy any craving. Whether you're here for the nightlife or just to explore, this is the ideal base for your Vegas adventure!"

trgt:
My mom, my son & myself stayed here for a night.  The location is fantastic - everything one could imagine is within a 1-2 mile radius.  Food, groceries, gas, etc.

We did NOT eat breakfast here so I cannot comment on that. 

The beds, although they claim they were doubles, were nothing more than a slightly over sized twin; my son & I could barely sleep comfortably.  

Very quiet though considering it's right off of Greenway & 17.  

A decent value.
beginning: My mom, my son & myself stayed here for a
mgt: "My mom, my son & myself stayed here for a weekend getaway, and it was absolutely delightful. The accommodations were cozy and well-maintained, providing a perfect home base for our adventures. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. We enjoyed exploring the nearby attractions, and the local dining options were fantastic. Overall, it was a memorable experience that we would love to repeat!"

trgt:
Yama Sushi is my favorite sushi joint until I can find better. Most of the specials are tasty and the nigiri is good. My faves are man whore, sun of the beach, and something else with crunchy eel. Their seafood salad is excellent I could just drink up the sauce haha. Gyoza is good, yakitori is good, mussels are okay. I thought both the soft shelled crab and deep fried mussels were tasteless. I think the worst item they serve is the BBQ Beef. It is thin beef shortrib that is super chewy and rubbery and tastes like salty garlic. I hope they improve on it - at least grill it.

I appreciate the excellent customer service no matter how busy it gets. An even better fact is that you can have as much ice cream
and mochi ice cream as you want.
beginning: Yama Sushi is my favorite sushi joint until I can
mgt: "Yama Sushi is my favorite sushi joint until I can find something better. The freshness of their fish is unmatched, and the variety of rolls keeps me coming back for more. The ambiance is cozy, making it perfect for a casual dinner or a special occasion. The staff is always friendly and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience. I highly recommend the spicy tuna roll and their signature Yama roll; both are absolutely delicious!"

trgt: Arrived around 10 so a little late but not crazy. No waiting but the place was fairly  busy. Drink order was a little slow. Food came out fairly quickly and was prepared properly. My steak was very fatty but tasty. \nAwesome bread. Overall a nice place but texas Roadhouse is better and less expensive :)
beginning: Arrived around 10 so a little late but not crazy.
mgt: Arrived around 10 so a little late but not crazy. The atmosphere was lively, and the staff greeted us warmly. We quickly settled in and were impressed by the menu options. The food was delicious, with generous portions and vibrant flavors. The highlight was definitely the dessert, which was a perfect ending to a great meal. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend!

trgt: The atmosphere is really cool but the options were not that great. I got a veggie sandwich and it was not that great.
beginning: The atmosphere is really cool but the options were not
mgt: "The atmosphere is really cool but the options were not as diverse as I had hoped. The menu felt limited, and many dishes lacked creativity. While the decor and vibe were inviting, the food didn't quite match the energy of the space. I expected more unique flavors and combinations. Overall, it was a decent experience, but I left feeling underwhelmed."

trgt:
GREAT burgers! Good service. And it doesn't break the bank! A solid 4 stars all around. 

I'm usually skeptical of gourmet burger joints just bc there are sooooo many out there now. A burger is a burger right? Well no not really. And BurGR proves that you can still make a piece of meat between two pieces of bread pretty unique. 

Hubby and I tried the place out on a Thursday night about 6pm. We stayed at planet hollywood and every time we go by BurGR There always seems to be a line. But we were told 25 min and it really took us maybe 15 min in line. You can get in faster if you opt for one of the high top tables which are teeny but it'll do. Good view of the TV to catch some of the games.  I got the chanterelle burger which doesn't come with cheese but you can add on. I opted for Fontina cheese which worked great with the arugula, mushrooms and fig jam. My hubby got the farm burger with the fried egg and duck bacon. Wow. I mean. There are no words for that burger. Except maybe crazy delicious. What I like about the burgers are that they're not huge and unmanageable to eat. They fit nicely in the hands and are the perfect portion at least for us. 

The truffle Parmesan fries. Very good. Not too truffle-y. We also had the jalepeno poppers which were delicious!! The floor mgr came to check on us and gave us a funny tidbit, that in each batch of poppers there's one where they leave the seeds. apparently  my hubby got that one bc he bit into it and felt like his face was on fire. But the poppers. I highly recommend them. They have bacon inside them, hello!!

To finish off our dinner we got the sticky toffee push pops which were delicious and just the right touch of sweetness to end your meal. Good beer on tap too. A nice solid place to grab a tasty meal and not go broke!! Good service too.
beginning: GREAT burgers! Good service. And it doesn't break the bank!
mgt: GREAT burgers! Good service. And it doesn't break the bank! The atmosphere is casual and inviting, making it perfect for a relaxed meal. I especially loved the variety of toppings available, allowing for a personalized experience. The fries were crispy and seasoned just right, complementing the juicy burger perfectly. I’ll definitely be coming back for more!

trgt: It was very inexpensive to stay here for 4 nights, which was why we chose it. The room was clean, but the ventilation blew cigarette smoke into our non-smoking room, which was pretty gross.  You also get to go up to the top of the tower for free if you're staying there, which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 2.  Wasn't horrible, but probably would never stay here again because of the smoke.
beginning: It was very inexpensive to stay here for 4 nights,
mgt: "It was very inexpensive to stay here for 4 nights, and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the accommodations. The room was clean and comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. The staff were friendly and helpful, making my stay even more enjoyable. The location was convenient, close to local attractions and public transport. Overall, a great value for the price!"

trgt:
We had a 3 night stay here that was part of a promotion.
We expected a nice hotel with the name being well known.
We had an upgrade, which was probably good. Our room was ok. The biggest complaints were no coffee in the room. Together a cup in the morning I had to go to a coffee shop in the lobby and pay $3.75 for a 
large cup. The TV stations were very limited too 
The lobby area, casino and restaurants did not thrill us. I had one breakfast here that was just fair. Service was slow.
If you are booked to stay here by a promotional company make them out you into another hotel. CheckYelp, it is right more then wrong.

Needless to say, this will be our last visit here
beginning: We had a 3 night stay here that was part
mgt: of a larger vacation package, and it exceeded our expectations. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel right at home. The room was spacious and clean, with stunning views of the surrounding area. Each morning, we enjoyed a delicious breakfast that offered a variety of options. The location was perfect for exploring nearby attractions, and we appreciated the convenient shuttle service. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and we would definitely return!

trgt:
Oh my!!!!!
We just learned recently, The Beaver Choice does catering as well.  We took a "small" Sandwich Cake"...IT WAS HUGE and a HUGE hit at the Christmas Party we went to last evening.  Everyone was in awe of it.  How do I describe such a thing.  Let me try.  Lots of delicious sandwich spreads,,,really more like salads...you know egg, tuna or crab salad.  They even make them with ham or roast beef too.  

Ours had tuna and egg salad nestled between cake layers of bread,  Then to top it off...a light spread of mayonnaise as frosting and then it was topped with shrimp, dill sprigs and some luscious caviar as well.

We talked to Hannah a few days in advance of our party and she handled everything.  The "cake" was ready when we arrived shortly after 5p yesterday and was kept cool in their refrigerator case.  It was stunningly beautiful and I regret only that I forgot to get a picture of it.

The cake is beautiful to look at and people at the party certainly ate first with their eyes and then of course, they devoured it quickly.

Just a note.  A sandwich cake is not finger food and will require a plate and fork.  But oh, so delicious.  It was a creative and unique culinary highlight to the evening.

Thanks so much for your work on this.  It made the party so much more festive.  Way to go!
beginning: Oh my!!!!!\nWe just learned recently, The Beaver Choice does catering
mgt:
Oh my!!!!!  
We just learned recently, The Beaver Choice does catering, and I can't express how thrilled we were with the experience! From the moment we placed our order, the staff was incredibly helpful and attentive. The food was absolutely delicious, featuring a variety of options that catered to all our guests' tastes. The presentation was stunning, and everything arrived on time, hot, and ready to serve. Our guests couldn't stop raving about the flavors! I highly recommend The Beaver Choice for any event; they truly exceeded our expectations!

trgt: We went here for a celebratory dinner.  I envisioned high end service with a smile.  It's all an appearance.  The waiter was nice but frowned the entire evening.  We were there for late reservations so they weren't even busy.  The food was unimpressive.  Over price and over rated.  I won't waste my money again!
beginning: We went here for a celebratory dinner. I envisioned high
mgt: "We went here for a celebratory dinner. I envisioned high expectations based on the glowing reviews, and I was not disappointed. The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a special occasion. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu with great enthusiasm. Each dish we ordered was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor, making it a memorable dining experience. The dessert selection was the cherry on top, leaving us with sweet memories to cherish."

trgt: LOVE this place. Whenever we have guests in town we take them here, and everyone loves it. Such a unique experience with all the couches. Their happy hour offers some really nice pricing.
beginning: LOVE this place. Whenever we have guests in town we
mgt: "LOVE this place. Whenever we have guests in town we make sure to take them here. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, and the staff is always friendly and attentive. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. Our favorites are the signature cocktails and the seasonal specials. It's the perfect spot for a memorable meal!"

trgt: Three of us stopped for breakfast. I had raisin bread french toast scrambled eggs and bacon. I love scrambled eggs. I left the majority of them on the plate. Why? They tasted wet and had no flavor. Made me think were scooped out of a warming tray in the kitchen. I did ask and she said the eggs are \"whipped\". She did go on to tell me that I could \"order your scrambled eggs anyway you want them.\" That is a first. Two small pieces of bacon that were burnt. French toast was good with the cinnamon butter. I looked at the ranch potatoes on my father-in-law's plate and they looked like they were scooped right out of a steamer.\n\nGood food should have a nice smell to it when it is delivered. This did not. Over priced, slow service, food that tasted the furthest thing from fresh-made. Save your money and do not even stop. Drive on by as anything will be better than this restaurant.
beginning: Three of us stopped for breakfast. I had raisin bread
mgt: Three of us stopped for breakfast. I had raisin bread, which was perfectly toasted and served with a generous pat of butter. The aroma was delightful, and the sweetness of the raisins complemented the rich flavor of the bread. My friends ordered omelets, which were fluffy and packed with fresh ingredients. The service was friendly and attentive, making our morning even more enjoyable. Overall, it was a lovely start to the day, and I can't wait to return!

trgt: I had never made it to this show in 10 years of trips to Vegas, now that I have I wish I had done something else. It is similar to a lame theme park show, maybe good for kids but not worth the time for an adult. If you happen to be walking by, sure stop and watch but don't make a special trip.
beginning: I had never made it to this show in 10
mgt: "I had never made it to this show in 10 years, and I finally decided to see what all the hype was about. From the moment the curtain rose, I was captivated by the stunning visuals and powerful performances. The energy in the theater was electric, and the storyline resonated deeply with me. Each character brought something unique to the table, making it an unforgettable experience. I left feeling inspired and eager to share my thoughts with friends."

trgt: Not the best place to get your toes done. They use cheap polish, mine smudged like an hour after I left the shop. The massage chairs are nice and they do have plenty of great magazines. Just go here if your desperate!
beginning: Not the best place to get your toes done. They
mgt: "Not the best place to get your toes done. They seemed rushed and inattentive, which resulted in a less than satisfactory pedicure. The staff was friendly, but the overall cleanliness of the salon left much to be desired. I noticed several tools that didn’t appear to be properly sanitized. I would recommend looking elsewhere for a more relaxing and hygienic experience."

trgt: Employees are great and the food is wonderful I love their sesame chicken!\nThey also deliver!
beginning: Employees are great and the food is wonderful I love
mgt: Employees are great and the food is wonderful. I love the variety on the menu, especially the fresh ingredients used in every dish. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The staff is attentive and always ready to recommend their favorites. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that keeps me coming back!

trgt:
Although our piza and salad was delightful, we had the Pear and Walnut salad and the Pizza Napoli, the staff was kind of smug and unfriendly!!

We called before going, at 8:45pm, to see how late they served and were told 10pm.  We arrived at 9:35.  The girl said, "you know we close at 10 right?"  We told her we would eat quickly.  She replied, "I have to mop the floor, but we have a big party back there so you should be alright".  I found this a very unpleasant way to begin our visit here.  I mean it wasn't like we walked in a 9:55 and expected 5 star service.  After all, it is only pizza and salad.  Anyway, I let it slide.

Then, when the guy brought us our pizza, I had noticed a "New Times, Best Pizza Winner" sign, so I asked him if they had won this year.  He smugly said, "Oh, I'm sure several years".  I thought that was a crappy way to answer my question, since I am very familiar with these awards and didn't remeber them winning ever.  Apparently they one the reader's poll once back in 2007.  Whatever.  I might go back cuz the salad was bomb.
beginning: Although our piza and salad was delightful, we had the
mgt: "Although our pizza and salad was delightful, we had the unfortunate experience of waiting an unusually long time for our drinks. The service was friendly, but the delay really took away from the overall enjoyment of our meal. Once the drinks finally arrived, they were refreshing and complemented the food perfectly. However, I would recommend improving the timing to enhance the dining experience."

trgt:
This place is out of the way but worth the drive. It is sort of a nightmare to find in this little office park, but once you step in, you are transported to the other side of the world into a Euro-cafe. Well maybe not exactly, but it's a great Vegas simulation. 

We ordered a salad each and a sandwich to share. The sandwich was a feature not on the menu that day, Moroccan-inspired chicken with goat cheese and roasted peppers. It was fantastic. I scooped every last bite up, even though I'm trying to not eat meat or cheese. (I fail so miserably at my self-imposed dietary restrictions.) The salad was awesome too, with almondy jicama slices and a lot of other veggies. 

The highlight of the meal, other than the great service provided by Oliver (who seems to be the owner?) was the chocolate torte. This was incredible. Perfectly sweet and rich, I felt the need to run a half-marathon just to get its sugary creamy goodness off my hips. 

I wish I worked closer so that I would have an excuse to go all the time. Loved every bite!
beginning: This place is out of the way but worth the
mgt: "This place is out of the way but worth the journey. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it perfect for a relaxing evening. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring that every need is met. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the signature pasta; it’s simply divine! Overall, a hidden gem that deserves more recognition."

trgt: I like red curry, normally I go for veggie because I don't trust the quality of the meat in most Thai restaurants (not usually high-end). Because of the higher-end atmosphere and higher prices (not by much though), I tried the beef. Best decision of my life. Succulent. Also, wonderful service, extremely professional and on the ball. \nMy boyfriend didn't like his food as much, only due to personal taste, as it wasn't a flavor he enjoyed.  But go red curry go.
beginning: I like red curry, normally I go for veggie because
mgt: "I like red curry, normally I go for veggie because it offers a delightful mix of flavors and textures. However, this time I decided to try the chicken version, and it did not disappoint. The tender pieces of chicken were perfectly cooked, absorbing the rich, aromatic sauce. The balance of spices was just right, providing a warm kick without overwhelming the palate. Paired with jasmine rice, it made for a satisfying meal that I would definitely order again."

trgt:
I've lived here for about a year now so I figure it's safe that I've experienced everything I need to for making a review. I'll make this simple via pros/cons. 

Pros:  I like the style of the building and it's proximity to downtown and the freeways. Pretty easy to get to many different spots from this location via I-15/95 to 215. The staff that work in security, valet, HOA, and maintenance are all quite friendly. Parking for guests is valet only which is nice so they don't have to park on the side/back which is a pretty shady area. Another reviewer posted about valet blocking the inbound parking entrance, that has been recently changed and the valet is now due West at the entrance loop thus no longer blocking the inbound lane. The building is VERY secure. Current regulations do not allow guests in the building and up the elevators without being escorted by a resident. Cameras at all entrances, in all elevators; have not noticed any in the garage. Key fobs to get in from garage, from lobby to elevators and inside elevator to your floor. This place has become locked down like no other place in town.  The gym is a very nice and clean facility. The pool, while nice and generally clean, is a bit stark in its design and landscape/hardscape design. The lobby and common areas are kept quite clean; likely varies by floor and if you happen to live with slobs on your floor...mine is pretty good in this regard. I've only used the concierge for dry cleaning and that is a nice feature to have. Choose Tiffany cleaners, not the other company they are setup with. 

Cons: The majority of the units only have one assigned parking spot deeded with the unit and the spots are about 20% more narrow than they should be...cramped and door dings possible. The recent security lock down due to hookers, pimps, drug dealers inhabiting the place creates a big inconvenience for us normal folk. Guest drives up, security calls you, you grant access to valet, guest walks to security desk in lobby and you must come down to the lobby to escort them up to your unit; pain in the ass. I get the reasoning behind this rule and hope if/when the thugs and losers are kicked out we can go back to the proper system of security sending the guest directly to your floor electronically as it should be. The area around the building...shady and crime ridden. Do not walk north of the property alone or at night is all I can say. Laundry in the units is a horrible one piece stacked unit...it's loud and will ruin your laundry quickly. Water pressure delivered to the unit is horrible. I've had people out three times to resolve, still horrible. I feel sorry for those that have long hair as you will not properly rinse out the shampoo with this low of a pressure. Should you wish to take a bath...plan ahead!  It takes 24.5 minutes to fill my tub; yes I timed it. The tub/shower combo is a poor design...the outter edge is round; it's hard to explain but good luck keeping water INSIDE the shower when you use it, your floor will be wet and you've been warned :-)

Overall I'd give this place a 2.5-2.75 if I could but felt somewhat generous due to the cleanliness and friendly staff. Not sure how long I'll stay...grass is always greener you know?  Price per square foot is high if you compare to a normal apartment or house but is lower than the overall Vegas price per square foot for hi-rises.
beginning: I've lived here for about a year now so I
mgt: "I've lived here for about a year now, so I feel I can provide a well-rounded perspective. The community is welcoming, and the amenities are top-notch. The maintenance team is responsive, and the location is convenient for both work and leisure. However, I do wish there were more options for public transportation nearby. Overall, it's been a positive experience, and I would recommend it to others looking for a comfortable place to live."

trgt:
Ehh...

We decided to try this local sushi/teppenyaki place for a friend's birthday. HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE service!

Different items were given at random times. The bento boxes came first, and all of the raw sushi (which doesn't require MUCH preparation!) came last...I seriously waited for more than an HOUR for my nigiri! It wasn't even a busy Thursday night! I noticed that the sushi chef was just serving those at the sushi bar, and the waitress didn't even try to bug the chef to hurry it up! I was the last one to receive my food! The food wasn't even that great either! The salmon nigiri was kind of slimy, and the spicy tuna was just alright; The rolls were seriously not worth the wait! The waitress tried to be nice later, after I told her that it took TOO long, and she gave us 4 bowls of green tea ice cream on the house....didn't really win me over...I still feel that I should have been comped for it...

We ended up staying at this crappy restaurant for almost 2 1/2 hours! I will never go here again! Please save yourself the trouble, and go somewhere that you know will have GOOD sushi (even if you have to drive far!)!
beginning: Ehh...\n\nWe decided to try this local sushi/teppenyaki place for a
mgt: "Ehh...\n\nWe decided to try this local sushi/teppenyaki place for a casual dinner, hoping for a fun experience. Unfortunately, the service was slow, and the sushi lacked freshness. The teppenyaki chef was entertaining, but the food was just average. Overall, it didn’t live up to our expectations, and we probably won’t return."

trgt: I went here to do some gambling off the Strip.  I lost just as much money here playing the slots as I did on the Strip which disappointed me.  I was expecting at least just slightly better odds?  Oh well.  Also, too many of the slot machines are right near the doors and I was there when it was cold outside.  The waitresses ignored me (it would have been nice to at least be ASKED if I wanted a drink).  We ended up getting food at TGIFriday's because everything else had a super long line.  So overall I regretted leaving the Strip for this experience.
beginning: I went here to do some gambling off the Strip.
mgt: I went here to do some gambling off the Strip. The atmosphere was surprisingly lively, with friendly staff and a diverse crowd. The slot machines were well-maintained, and I found a few table games that offered great odds. The drinks were reasonably priced, and the complimentary cocktails kept coming. Overall, it was a refreshing change from the bustling casinos on the Strip, and I left feeling like I had a great time without breaking the bank.

trgt: We decided to try the famed Carnegie pastrami and corned beef inside the Mirage.  We put our name in for a booth and waited less than ten minutes. Bravo!!!  We sat down and all decided on the Woody Allen, which was a pound of corned beef and a pound of pastrami on two slices of rye bread.  The pastrami was tender and moist , but the corned beef was a bit on the dry side.   We did add their spicy mustard to liven up the meat and tried their whole pickles which were zesty and tasty.  The corned beef was exceptionally lean with the pastrami being on the fattier side.  Nothing to get really excited about, but fun to try.
beginning: We decided to try the famed Carnegie pastrami and corned
mgt: "We decided to try the famed Carnegie pastrami and corned beef sandwiches, and they did not disappoint. The meat was incredibly tender, bursting with flavor, and piled high on fresh rye bread. Each bite was a delightful experience, perfectly complemented by the tangy mustard. The atmosphere was lively, and the staff were friendly, making our visit even more enjoyable. We left feeling satisfied and eager to return for another round!"

trgt: Love this place. Food is consistent and I think really good. Wait staff is available but in no way try to hurry you. It's relaxing and comfortable. The burger, pizza and chicken sandwich are excellent choices.
beginning: Love this place. Food is consistent and I think really
mgt: "Love this place. Food is consistent and I think really captures the essence of authentic cuisine. The flavors are vibrant, and each dish is prepared with care. The staff is friendly and attentive, making every visit enjoyable. I highly recommend the signature dishes, as they never disappoint. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that keeps me coming back!"

trgt: This is my fav place to eat at while in Vegas.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.  The salsa bar is awesome, and the fajitas are incredible (I get the shrimp).  The food is great here, the service is also perfect, and I love the atmosphere as well.  Rarely have waited for a table either.  Usually play poker at the hotel, then walk over for dinner.  Highly recommend.
beginning: This is my fav place to eat at while in
mgt: "This is my fav place to eat at while in town! The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it perfect for a casual meal or a special occasion. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, and everything I've tried has been delicious. The staff is always friendly and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience. I highly recommend the signature pasta and their homemade desserts!"

trgt: A big college football Saturday and they had 2 bartenders. Horrible service, okay food, and they change the channels to anyone's whim. Meaning, if a top 25 team is playing and two nothing teams are playing there is no rhyme or reason to changing the channel. Won't be back.
beginning: A big college football Saturday and they had 2 bartenders.
mgt: A big college football Saturday and they had 2 bartenders. The wait for drinks was excruciating, and the atmosphere felt chaotic. Despite the excitement of the game, the service was lacking, leaving many patrons frustrated. The bartenders were friendly but overwhelmed, struggling to keep up with the crowd. It was disappointing, especially considering the energy in the room. I hope they can staff better for future game days to match the enthusiasm of the fans.

trgt: Avoid. I went to see this dentist about tmj. I paid $75 for consultation (which most dentist waive or apply toward treatment) for him to tell me he couldnt recommend any treatment until alignment issues where corrected with my chiropractor. He also sold me a temporary nite guard (the Aqualizer) for another $75. One which you can buy online for $25. One month later the night guard popped and i called in to the dentist to advise. The response was buy another or you should have come back sooner. Both the receptionist and the dentist preferred to lose a patient over an item that would have cost them peanuts to replace or rectify the situation somehow. The dentist actually insisted that i was paying more for his \"EXPERTISE\" even though i paid his \"expertise\" separately. Well he can keep it, along with his outdated office. A dentist should be more concerned about his patients than his pockets. Ill gladly take my dentistry needs elsewhere.
beginning: Avoid. I went to see this dentist about tmj. I
mgt: Avoid. I went to see this dentist about TMJ. I was hoping for relief, but the experience was disappointing. The staff seemed unprofessional, and I felt rushed during my appointment. The dentist didn't take the time to listen to my concerns or explain the treatment options clearly. Instead of feeling better, I left with more questions than answers. I wouldn't recommend this practice to anyone seeking quality care for TMJ issues.

trgt: Wonderful variety, small portions and great favors. Perfect for a special occasion. Ambiance could be improved.
beginning: Wonderful variety, small portions and great favors. Perfect for a
mgt: "Wonderful variety, small portions and great flavors. Perfect for a casual dining experience or a fun night out with friends. Each dish is beautifully presented, showcasing the chef's creativity. The atmosphere is vibrant and inviting, making it an ideal spot for both intimate dinners and lively gatherings. Don't miss the signature cocktails; they perfectly complement the menu!"

trgt:
As a long time Mesa resident, I was excited when a friend wanted to take me to her new fave with the weird name. OMG. Please, thai this one on. 
The Thai toast is so good, with a sweet sauce that comes with making it one of my favorite apps ANYWHERE. 
Best entrees, Evil Jungle Princess, Black Pepper Shrimp, Green Curry, Pad See Ew (sp?) and the Laarb salad. 
Great service, including sodas that are free refills (not from the fountain!) and good prices make this one of my favorite Mesa eats. Only downside is that there's never enough rice and they make you pay for more...
beginning: As a long time Mesa resident, I was excited when
mgt: "As a long-time Mesa resident, I was excited when the new community park opened. The design is beautiful, featuring lush greenery and ample seating areas. Families can enjoy the playground, while fitness enthusiasts have access to walking trails. It’s a fantastic addition that brings the community together, fostering a sense of belonging and encouraging outdoor activities. I look forward to many weekends spent here with friends and family."

trgt: At midnight the fries are a dollar each and burgers are 3-4 USD. They are really delicious and totally worth the money if you have a late night craving. Although I don't recommend the sweet potato puffs - get the regular fries instead. Oh, and the nachos are just delish!
beginning: At midnight the fries are a dollar each and burgers
mgt: "At midnight the fries are a dollar each and burgers are half off, making it the perfect late-night spot. The atmosphere is lively, filled with laughter and the sizzle of the grill. The fries are crispy and golden, while the burgers are juicy and flavorful, cooked to perfection. The staff is friendly and quick, ensuring you get your food fast. It's a great place to unwind with friends after a long night out."

trgt: This place is quite amazing. Lets start when I first walked into the cafe, quaint and clean. That's how I like my restaurant. Guy behind the counter said pick where ever you want to sit. Thumbs up, even better. Sit towards the back of the restaurant. Waiter comes out to give us the menu, small chitchat, he takes our drink orders. We look over the menu, classic German fair (schnitzel, sausage, etc) I ordered the Jaeger Schnitzel and a side of Red Cabbage. While waiting for my food, (enjoying a Warsteiner Pilnser on tap!!) I took notice to all the decor. The German flags, the US flag and all the Berlin posters was a real nice touch of ambiance. The waiter came over to check on us numerous times to see how we were doing. Then he brings the food out. GOOD GOD! Talk about a feast for the gods, my schnitzel was cooked perfect. The gravy that come on it was also perfect. Flavorful and delicious! The red cabbage was also cooked to perfection. Takes me back to when I was a child, eating German food with my family. After I was done with my entree, I had to order the strudel (apple) and wow, it was amazing. Talk about putting the cherry on the sundae. It was a perfect ending to an amazing meal. I will be recommending this place to everyone I know. I fully and whole heartily hope this place does well. I will be visiting this place as frequently as I can. I hope everyone gets to have the same experience as I do.
beginning: This place is quite amazing. Lets start when I first
mgt: "This place is quite amazing. Let's start when I first walked in; the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The decor is beautifully curated, blending modern aesthetics with cozy touches. The staff greeted me with genuine smiles, making me feel right at home. I ordered the signature dish, and it exceeded my expectations—flavorful and beautifully presented. I can't wait to return and try more from the menu!"

trgt: I met some friends at Burger 21 for lunch. All the staff was very friendly, they made a point to make it feel like a normal sit-down restaurant despite the fact that you order your food at a counter. They bring you and pick up your food when you're done. They have a large menu, including several burgers, chicken sandwiches, turkey and veggie burgers, sweet potato, regular, and cheese fries. For a healthier option, they have a few salads. However, it gets a little pricey when ordering because fries are not included in a combo price. They also have many delicious milkshakes that add to your overall bill. A sauce bar adds some uniqueness to burger 21- they have around 10 different sauces you can dip your fries in or add to your burger. Overall, I enjoyed Burger 21, but I wouldn't be able to eat there very often considering it is pretty unhealthy. I mean, how can you go to a burger place and not indulge in a burger, fries, AND a shake?
beginning: I met some friends at Burger 21 for lunch. All
mgt: I met some friends at Burger 21 for lunch. All of us were excited to try their famous burgers and unique sauces. The atmosphere was casual and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a midday meal. I ordered the classic cheeseburger, and it was cooked to perfection—juicy and flavorful. My friends enjoyed their selections as well, especially the crispy fries that accompanied each meal. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and I can't wait to return!

trgt: Only been there a few times and then got a card that comp'd me 3 nights in March and 3 nights in April.  Room definitely showed it's age, same and dark, like you would see in an old mystery, but clean.   \nI think I found my new hang out, love the gaming, the girls and location.  I will use my April comps and they have a new customer.
beginning: Only been there a few times and then got a
mgt: "Only been there a few times and then got a chance to explore the menu more thoroughly. Each dish was a delightful surprise, bursting with flavor and creativity. The ambiance was cozy, making it a perfect spot for both casual dinners and special occasions. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall experience. I can't wait to return and try more!"

trgt:
Fast Eddies is your typical diner! 

Great fast food, great service, low prices! 

I am a big fan of their patty melt, and I love the crinkle cut fries! 

We've gone for breakfast, lunch and dinner and haven't had any bad experiences yet. 

The decor is lacking, and scary and I feel like I am on the tilt-a-whirl but other then that, Eddies is good if you just want a good bite to eat with out any fuss.
beginning: Fast Eddies is your typical diner! \n\nGreat fast food, great
mgt: service, and a cozy atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The burgers are juicy and cooked to perfection, while the fries are crispy and golden. Don't forget to try their milkshakes; they're thick and delicious! The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you have a pleasant dining experience. Whether you're stopping by for breakfast or a late-night snack, Fast Eddies never disappoints. Highly recommend!

trgt:
Have always enjoyed the Mediterranean food and very quick service here. However, the past two times my boyfriend and I have been to Aladdin's it has been bad news!

Several months ago we were eating dessert and in the middle of the German chocolate cake we were sharing, we found a big green spot of mold!  So this means that the cake was old and/or stored at an incorrect temperature... gross either way.  The manager took the dessert off our bill and that was it.. no offer to discount the check, etc.  Think about it, we ate half of a piece of moldy cake that you served us.. not charging us for the cake is a  NO BRAINER.. but what are you going to do as a way of making this better? They did nothing and I don't like to make a scene so I let it go.

A couple nights ago, recovered from the mold incident, we tried Aladdin's again.    But, my Kibbie was ice cold in the middle and had to be sent back.  It disrupted our meal and was an overall bad time.  Again,  no apology or offer to make it better.  

I think management needs some retraining on how to make someone's bad experience OK again.  We have learned our lesson this time and won't be back; which is a shame because we used to really love it there.
beginning: Have always enjoyed the Mediterranean food and very quick service
mgt: "Have always enjoyed the Mediterranean food and very quick service. The flavors are vibrant and authentic, making each dish a delightful experience. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every visit feels special. I highly recommend the lamb kebabs and the fresh tabbouleh; they are simply outstanding. The cozy atmosphere adds to the charm, making it a perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions."

trgt:
Not sure if it is because it is located within walking distance of where I live, the fact that its on the water, the free wifi, the delish coffee or the off-the hook ambiance, but this place has my heart!!  The place is located on Lakeside street which the area appears to be residential then there is this area of retail right in the middle. Super cool.

Coffee in a mug-$2.23 
This is all I had on this visit but, will be back for the scones. There is an area set up with a couch, coffee table and book shelf where you can look directly out the window which overlooks Monona Bay.There are several tables out back on the deck and some tables outside in the front that face the street.  Every other Friday there is acoustic guitar and the bar serves wine and beer.  I have  yet to get down here and check it out. The coffee house is also open Wed-Sun (look up hours on website) evenings serving wine and beer. Summer Blush is only $4 a glass!!  Whoaaaa!!!

If you are taking a walk or bike ride around Monona Bay, this place is right on your way. Stop and take a break!!
beginning: Not sure if it is because it is located within
mgt: "Not sure if it is because it is located within a bustling city center, but this place has an undeniable charm. The ambiance is inviting, with warm lighting and cozy seating that makes you feel right at home. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every need is met promptly. The menu offers a delightful variety of options, each dish beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal."

trgt: The pho is alright. Seems like if you ask for a large they just give you more soup. Bad service. I had asked for a refill & the waiter cleaned two tables right in front of me & still didn't get me a refill. Asked again & cleaned three more tables & yet still didn't get me a refill. Ended up asking another waiter for a refill.
beginning: The pho is alright. Seems like if you ask for
mgt: "The pho is alright. Seems like if you ask for extra herbs, they give you just a sprinkle. The broth is flavorful but could use a bit more depth. The noodles were cooked perfectly, but the portion size felt a bit small for the price. Overall, it's a decent spot, but I’ve had better elsewhere."

trgt: Thought I wrote a review before but maybe not.  Food very good. Drinks weak.  Tasty food but the prices are higher than you would expect  well, than what I expected   I'm not sure What you consider excessive.   But I just wouldn't go back because of price   Cave Creek is not where you think for oriental food, but we do have some other less expensive options in the area   I hope they read these reviews, because I see the running thread is price
beginning: Thought I wrote a review before but maybe not. Food
mgt: "Thought I wrote a review before but maybe not. Food here is consistently amazing! The flavors are vibrant, and the presentation is beautiful. Each dish feels like a work of art, and the staff is always friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the grilled salmon; it’s perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. Can't wait to come back!"

trgt: If I could give them zero stars I would. Worst customer service experience of my life. They completely defrauded me. I got the wrong sized belt so I wanted to exchange it with one that was slightly bigger. Keep in mind that the item had been purchased the day before and had never been worn. The lady went to the back for like ten minutes - and when she came out she said she couldn't exchange my item because someone had put a hole in my belt to make it even smaller (which doesn't make sense because the belt was too small to begin with). Clearly, she went in the back and put a hole in it herself. Maybe this is how the corporate Gucci office tries to eliminate exchanges and returns.
beginning: If I could give them zero stars I would. Worst
mgt: If I could give them zero stars I would. Worst experience ever! The service was incredibly slow, and the staff was rude. My order was wrong, and when I asked for help, they seemed annoyed. I will never return to this place again. Save your money and go somewhere else!

trgt:
This place functions like a Chinese sit-down restaurants where all the items are meant to be shared. Almost all the menu items have a small (serves 2 people) and a large (serves 4 people). That's all and good, but it has an issue: it's a lie. 

My buddy and I ordered a small pizza... But we both agreed that we could have eaten that small pizza by ourselves and be satisfied. A small item and a side is sufficient food for two adults. 

Another issue is that it took an inordinate amount of time for a waiter to even service us.
beginning: This place functions like a Chinese sit-down restaurants where all
mgt: This place functions like a Chinese sit-down restaurant where all the dishes are crafted with care and authenticity. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it perfect for family gatherings or casual dinners with friends. The menu offers a delightful variety of options, from classic favorites like Kung Pao chicken to lesser-known regional specialties. Each dish bursts with flavor, showcasing fresh ingredients and traditional cooking techniques. The service is attentive without being intrusive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Overall, this restaurant is a hidden gem that deserves a visit for anyone craving genuine Chinese cuisine.

trgt:
I browse the app from time to time to see if there is anything new in my area (though doubt it) and get excited when something different pops up that proves me wrong. I see a Thai place and am intrigued and became even more excited seeing two people I trust (Dan and Amanda) reviewed it. Hopped into the car to try something new than the same ole' take out and fast food open late night. 

This Thai food kitchen is integrated as part of Bailey's Bar which definitely is odd and not what you would expect. You sit at this typical divey bar except the menu has Thai. If you sit at the bar they have a bar menu of sorts with things like burgers mixed with the Thai, but ask for a full Thai menu. On the night we were there (Friday), it was bumping with karaoke which added more to the odd placement. The fact that the original owner of Komol is running this place make it even more bizarre, but a promise of some good food.

We both got Thai ice teas and at $1.25 this is the cheapest I've seen this drink being sold and it was good and not too sweet.

Pad Kee Mao with Pork - I think this was pretty good, decent flavor and perfect amount of spice. The pork was good quality and tender. 

Tofu Panang - this is a far more fragrant panang than most places do, definitely like Komols. If you love keffir leaf/ lemongrass type flavor then you might highly enjoy its presence here. The serving was generous and the tofu was lightly fried on the outside but nice and silky inside. Definitely ate this up.

Serving sizes were more than generous as well for the price, we had some leftovers. It was $21ish for our meal for 2 drinks, 2 entrees, 1 extra rice. They do lunch specials until 3pm Mon- Fri as well, so you can get some noms on the cheap here. 

The server was very friendly and attentive. Considering we were on the other side of the bar in a booth, I was apprehensive if we would be seen, but she anticipated our needs and made rounds to check on us. 

Eating in a smokey bar not your thing? Take it to-go and they also do delivery! 

Definitely a great addition to the NW as we don't have a Thai place abundance here, but excited it seems to be authentic and quality Thai at that. I think we will end up getting a lot of take out from here since it's on the way home. Highly pleased with my inaugural visit with the quality of food and can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
beginning: I browse the app from time to time to see
mgt: I browse the app from time to time to see what new features have been added. The user interface is intuitive, making navigation a breeze. I appreciate the regular updates that keep the content fresh and engaging. However, I wish there were more customization options available. Overall, it’s a solid app that meets my needs, but there’s room for improvement.

trgt:
I've stayed at the Planet Hollywood twice now I give this place an honest review.

Rooms: Besides the fact that there was a HUGE wet spot on the floor of our room when we first entered...nothing special. The bathroom is large (which is nice for the ladies) and there's a tub to fill with ice and put your bottles of alcohol in. I know you do it...
Parking: SUPERRRR far from the actual hotel! UGH!!!!
Pool: HORRIBLE! So small and plain! Yuck. You need a room key to get in by the way.
Service: Sloowww! And for some reason they always seem to hang up on you or make you wait forever.

When it comes to picking hotels in the summer I look for 2 things: Location & pool.
Planet Hollywood has a horrible pool so...next time I would skip this place.
beginning: I've stayed at the Planet Hollywood twice now I give
mgt: "I've stayed at the Planet Hollywood twice now, and I give it a solid four stars. The atmosphere is vibrant and energetic, perfect for those looking to immerse themselves in a Hollywood-themed experience. The rooms are spacious and well-decorated, featuring memorabilia that adds a unique touch. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant stay. However, the dining options could be improved, as some restaurants were a bit overpriced for the quality. Overall, it's a fun destination for both families and couples."

trgt: I went to this place when it first opened and many times thereafter. I also enjoyed some of the best Irish food to be had in Vegas at Wooloughan.  I went back a few days ago and what a surprise, remember this is supposed to be an Irish Pub, but it was and is no longer such a place. The new place has the same decor but that is where it stops, \n     The menu had a total of 5 Irish dishes on it. The rest were plain bar food, hot dogs,hamburgers, and stuff like that. I ordered potato soup leek soup and got a thin soup with TexasToast !. Asked for soda bread and was told they don't serve that any more.  I ordered corned beef and cabbage and got chopped cabbage,fried in bacon grease and sliced deli corned beef that was over cooked. It WAS AWFUL. \n     If you want Irish food, DO NOT GO HERE.
beginning: I went to this place when it first opened and
mgt: "I went to this place when it first opened and was immediately impressed by the vibrant atmosphere and friendly staff. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes, each beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. Over the years, it has maintained its quality, making it a go-to spot for both casual dinners and special occasions. The seasonal specials are always a delightful surprise, showcasing fresh, local ingredients. I highly recommend trying the signature dish; it never disappoints!"

trgt: The service is miserable. When I say miserable, I mean you could go ten minutes without seeing a single worker. I ate her lunch Saturday and Sunday since it was close to my room. The salad I had the first day, the strawberries were frozen. And it was a 17 dollar salad.  Dont waste your time.
beginning: The service is miserable. When I say miserable, I mean
mgt: "The service is miserable. When I say miserable, I mean it felt like we were invisible. We waited over 30 minutes just to get our drinks, and when they finally arrived, they were wrong. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested, which only added to the frustration. It’s disappointing because the food has potential, but the lack of attention ruined the experience."

trgt: ABSOLUTELY LOVE the Madison Farmer's Market!\nYou cannot leave without trying Stella's Spicy Cheese bread. I may not be the person to ask about produce considering I typical go there to by dairy, meat, bakery products. A recent find we had this past weekend was Carmel Corn Gelato!  It is a fun place to wonder around and have breakfast. If you want to get in and get out without a lot of people it is best to go in the morning if you have kids, strollers, walkers go after 9 am when the pace is more a leisurely walk and you aren't getting in the way of the people who want to get what they need and leave. \nEnjoy!
beginning: ABSOLUTELY LOVE the Madison Farmer's Market!\nYou cannot leave without trying
mgt: "ABSOLUTELY LOVE the Madison Farmer's Market! You cannot leave without trying the fresh produce and artisanal cheeses. The vibrant atmosphere is filled with local vendors showcasing their best products. Each stall offers something unique, from homemade jams to organic vegetables. The community spirit is palpable, and it’s a perfect place to spend a Saturday morning. Don’t forget to grab a coffee from the local roaster while you explore!"

trgt: big platters of tasteless food.
beginning: big platters of tasteless food.
mgt: "Big platters of tasteless food. The dishes lacked any real flavor, leaving us disappointed and unsatisfied. Even the presentation was uninspired, with no effort made to elevate the dining experience. Service was slow, and the staff seemed indifferent to our concerns. Overall, it felt like a missed opportunity for what could have been a delightful meal."

trgt:
Horrible customer service! 

The first time I stopped by, I picked up a couple items. I asked about a military discount. The cashier answered that they had one, but she'd have to re-ring me up and was too busy for that. 

The last time I went there, I picked up two compression sacks, something I've been needing. Went up to the register and was told the items would not ring up. After 10 minutes of just standing, I was told that they didn't "sell those items." I was baffled, how could they have something in store, in a bin, that they didn't sell? I questioned it and was told the two items were supposed to be with sleeping bags and were not for sale on their own. I told the associate I had the exact same compression sack at home in yellow that I had bought from them, so I knew those items were sold separately and were sold at that store. The guy shrugged, apologized, and left me standing there.

The prices are fair and that's the only reason I think I even attempt to purchase items from there. Their customer service is horrible, though, and honestly makes me feel like paying more at REI is worth it.
beginning: Horrible customer service! \n\nThe first time I stopped by, I
mgt: was met with indifference from the staff. They seemed more interested in their phones than helping customers. After waiting for ages, I finally managed to get someone’s attention, only to receive curt responses. It felt like I was a burden rather than a valued customer. I left feeling frustrated and disappointed, and I doubt I’ll return anytime soon.

trgt: Great food, awesome selections!
beginning: Great food, awesome selections!
mgt: Great food, awesome selections! The atmosphere was vibrant and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a casual dinner. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring we had everything we needed. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. I especially loved the seasonal specials, which showcased fresh, local ingredients. Can't wait to return!

trgt: My regular Togo place when I feel lazy at home, the food is great but make sure u check the order before u take it back home especially the busy hour! ;( they miss one of my main course n I need to go back n get it@@ no my idea lazy Togo day, I guess ..
beginning: My regular Togo place when I feel lazy at home,
mgt: "My regular Togo place when I feel lazy at home, this spot never disappoints. The food is consistently fresh and flavorful, with generous portions that always satisfy my cravings. I particularly love their signature sandwiches and the variety of sides available. The staff is friendly and efficient, making the ordering process a breeze. Whether I'm in the mood for a quick lunch or a cozy dinner, this place has become my go-to for delicious takeout."

trgt: I've been to the Henry three or four times already and even though the food is good (nothing too spectacular).. It is quite pricey for what you get. I do enjoy sitting on their beautiful patio but watch out for those bug bites. I left that place with 4 mosquito bites.\nNot sure if it will be my top pick on restaurants that I will revisit.. But we will see.
beginning: I've been to the Henry three or four times already
mgt: "I've been to the Henry three or four times already, and each visit has been a delightful experience. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, and I’ve always been impressed by the quality and presentation. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall dining experience. I highly recommend trying their seasonal specials, as they never disappoint!"

trgt: This place is beyond overrated.  I don't want to knock the service because that was very good (though I feel we were somewhat pushed to order more than was needed) but seriously, what a scam.  One dish was just bad. Pasta was fair and the fish was good but way to expensive (and why not bring the potatoes after they filet the fish so they are at least warm).  Bartolotta was too busy kissing the ass of the people who bought white truffles for 90 bucks a piece, and hanging with the truffle reps to care about what was going on in the kitchen. I wanted to say something to him but ultimately decided against it but am now regretting it.  I usually use Yelp to write about good meals that I've had.  Enough people complain about bad meals.  This was one situation that I felt I needed to share about.
beginning: This place is beyond overrated. I don't want to knock
mgt: "This place is beyond overrated. I don't want to knock the effort the staff puts in, but the food was lackluster at best. The ambiance felt forced, and the prices were far too high for what was offered. I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied, wishing I had chosen a different spot."

trgt: Good food.  Good service.  Bad location.  Bad hoodlums in the strip mall where it is located.
beginning: Good food. Good service. Bad location. Bad hoodlums in the
mgt: "area made it difficult to enjoy the meal. While the staff was attentive and the dishes were flavorful, the surrounding environment was unsettling. It’s a shame because the restaurant has great potential. I would recommend takeout instead."

trgt: Decent meal, nothing spectacular but not as horrible as everyone seems to be making it out to be. I would encourage everyone to at least give it a try. Anytime a new restaurant opens there are bound to be a few issues to work out. I had the fish and chips, hubby had the grilled chicken sandwich. Average Maricopa food.
beginning: Decent meal, nothing spectacular but not as horrible as everyone
mgt: "Decent meal, nothing spectacular but not as horrible as everyone made it out to be. The flavors were balanced, and the service was attentive. While the ambiance could use some improvement, it was a pleasant experience overall. I would recommend it for a casual night out, but don’t expect anything groundbreaking."

trgt: A great place for all appetites.  With a full bar for the adult eaters.
beginning: A great place for all appetites. With a full bar
mgt: "A great place for all appetites. With a full bar and an extensive menu, there's something for everyone. The ambiance is inviting, making it perfect for both casual dinners and special occasions. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend the best dishes. I particularly enjoyed the grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection. Don't miss out on their signature cocktails; they truly elevate the dining experience!"

trgt: Very friendly, very helpful and close to my home.  If they weren't jabbing me with needles every week I'd give them five stars.
beginning: Very friendly, very helpful and close to my home. If
mgt: "Very friendly, very helpful and close to my home. If you're looking for a convenient place with excellent service, this is it! The staff always greet you with a smile and go above and beyond to assist. The atmosphere is welcoming, making every visit a pleasant experience. Highly recommend for anyone in the area!"

trgt: Server did not know the menu,....45 mins to get our food , but the take out orders were going out within 15 mins.  Had the Hunan Chicken  it  had the consistency of Sushi.  Complained to owner...  his response... its cooked.  never saw or spoke to him again.  I guess he doesn't care about service.  I will say my wife liked her dinner\nThey need to improve their training of staff members and Owner need to care about his customers.\n I will not be back, I can understand me not liking the food but there is NO excuse for POOR service. If the Owner doesn't care why should his staff
beginning: Server did not know the menu,....45 mins to get our
mgt: Server did not know the menu, and it took 45 minutes to get our drinks. When the food finally arrived, it was cold and poorly presented. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested in providing good service. Overall, a disappointing experience that left us frustrated and unlikely to return.

trgt: My family and I ate lunch here for the first and last time. The beans were greasy and the enchiladas were like soup. The burros were alright but I've had much better. I hope that the AC was broken and that it's not always that hot inside. The service was pretty bad to, really slow. I'm giving them one star because the rice was good. I'd say find someplace else to eat.
beginning: My family and I ate lunch here for the first
mgt: "My family and I ate lunch here for the first time, and we were pleasantly surprised by the warm atmosphere and friendly service. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, and each dish we tried was bursting with flavor. The kids loved their meals, and the portion sizes were generous. We will definitely be returning!"

trgt: Make sure you pull into this place caddy corner with a hunger for some real Mexican.  For real caddy corner, although illegal, use the pedestrian ramp  on the NW corner to launch into the parking lot.  Works best for leaving, when the place is packed. This place has some of the best tortillas, frijoles, chorizo and quesedillas in town.  The other Mexican joints are trying to do what Carolina's has been doing for years....  The only con is they aren't open on Sundays and that they could call in the amigos to renovate the place a bit....
beginning: Make sure you pull into this place caddy corner with
mgt: "Make sure you pull into this place caddy corner with plenty of space, as the parking can get tight during peak hours. The ambiance is inviting, with warm lighting and friendly staff who greet you at the door. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the grilled salmon; it was cooked to perfection and paired beautifully with seasonal vegetables. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that I can't wait to repeat!"

trgt: Thanks to Yelp I found this little Thai place in a strip mall in Las Vegas.  It is some distance from the Strip, but it is worth the trip.  I have gone there both of the last two times I've visited Vegas.  Both times the food was inexpensive and delicious.  The woman who owns and runs the place keeps it spotlessly clean and is quite the character.  I highly recommend this place.
beginning: Thanks to Yelp I found this little Thai place in
mgt: Thanks to Yelp, I found this little Thai place in my neighborhood, and it has quickly become my go-to spot. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, perfect for a casual dinner or a special occasion. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, from classic Pad Thai to their spicy green curry, which is bursting with flavor. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure you have everything you need. I highly recommend trying their mango sticky rice for dessert—it's the perfect sweet ending to a delicious meal!

trgt: The hotdogs are okay, pricing isn't bad, but the guy that was serving me was a douche! I've been to places where the food was good enough to overlook the service... this isn't one of them!
beginning: The hotdogs are okay, pricing isn't bad, but the guy
mgt: "The hotdogs are okay, pricing isn't bad, but the guy behind the counter seemed disinterested and a bit rude. I expected a friendly atmosphere, especially since it was my first visit. The condiments were plentiful, which was a plus, but the overall experience left me wanting more. I might give it another shot, hoping for better service next time."

trgt: I was on vacation at a cabin in WI with my boyfriend. We stopped in Madison for the day and stopped in at Espresso Royale to warm up and use the internet. I had what was hands down the worst hot chocolate I have ever had. It didn't even taste like chocolate. It was really light too. Maybe they forgot the chocolate? It tasted like nothing. Absolutely horrible. My boyfriend's latte was mediocre at best. I generally prefer to avoid the national coffee chains but in this case I really wish I had gone to Starbucks.
beginning: I was on vacation at a cabin in WI with
mgt: "I was on vacation at a cabin in WI with my family, and it was an unforgettable experience. The serene surroundings were perfect for relaxation, and we enjoyed hiking through the beautiful trails nearby. The cabin itself was cozy and well-equipped, making it easy to unwind after a day of exploring. Evenings spent by the fire, roasting marshmallows and sharing stories, created lasting memories. I highly recommend this getaway for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life."

trgt: Love it! The older gent that runs the counter talks like some kind of cartoon character.  He is so sweet and welcoming.  Great food too! I will continue to make this a go to place for Japanese food.  Delicious!
beginning: Love it! The older gent that runs the counter talks
mgt: "Love it! The older gent that runs the counter talks with such warmth and charm, making every visit feel like catching up with an old friend. His recommendations are always spot on, and he genuinely cares about the customers. The atmosphere is cozy, and the food is consistently delicious. I can't recommend this place enough!"

trgt: This is the last place you want to bring your car to be serviced. Disorganized, disinterested, and disrespectful was my direct consumer experience with \"Great Big Gaudin Ford\". Simple battery change with diagnosis cost $250 and took two full days. Do not be deceived by their concept of \"appointment\". There is no such thing. I was told Arrogantly \"don't call us we'll call you\". This is like a joke that nobody laughed at when it was originally told...and keeps getting told over and over again...and still nobody is laughing because...it still isn't funny. You've been warned. Gaudin Ford doesn't care that you are a third generation Ford owner, that you've dutifully supported the dealership community or anything. Gaudin Ford doesn't know anything about you and couldn't care less.\n\nGaudin Ford gives Ford dealerships a bad name.
beginning: This is the last place you want to bring your
mgt: "This is the last place you want to bring your family for a vacation. The service was incredibly slow, and the staff seemed disinterested in helping us. The rooms were not clean, and the amenities were outdated. We encountered several issues during our stay, and when we brought them to management's attention, they were dismissive. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that left us feeling unwelcome and frustrated."

trgt: Straight up looks like Matrix Reloaded in here!\n\nSeriously, if you're looking for a \"Vegas Nightclub\" experience, then this is your place. It's intimate, the dance floor is packed and the drinks are overpriced. Everything you need to gawk at girls and go back to your hotel room with your bros saying things like, \"She was ugly anyway.\"
beginning: Straight up looks like Matrix Reloaded in here!\n\nSeriously, if you're
mgt: a fan of cyberpunk aesthetics, you'll feel right at home. The neon lights, sleek architecture, and high-tech gadgets create an immersive atmosphere. The action sequences are thrilling, and the storyline keeps you on the edge of your seat. The characters are well-developed, each with their own unique motivations and backstories. Overall, it’s a visually stunning experience that pays homage to its inspirations while carving out its own identity. Highly recommend for anyone who loves a good sci-fi adventure!

trgt: Ribeye al conacac... The best ...!!
beginning: Ribeye al conacac... The best ...!!
mgt: Ribeye al conacac... The best cut of meat I've ever tasted! Cooked to perfection, it was incredibly tender and bursting with flavor. The rich, smoky seasoning complemented the natural juiciness of the ribeye, making each bite a delight. Paired with a side of roasted vegetables, this dish was a culinary masterpiece. I can't wait to return for another unforgettable meal!

trgt:
This is a 3.5 stars, rounded down to a 3. It's solid, down home brunch food that's done well. We came here over Father's Day Sunday, so it was very busy. Being that it was just my husband and myself, we didn't have to wait very long to get seated at all. I have a feeling that it's always pretty busy- the kind of food they serve appeals very much to the suburban crowd of North Phoenix.  

I'm not sure where they used to be, but this is their new location. It's really nice, done in the style of modern lodge I guess. Lots of wood, but a bit sleeker. They have a full bar, so we were able to have beer and mimosas with our lunch, which I certainly appreciated! 

The menu is solid, good and filling. Most anything you'd find at a Denny's you'd find here. I built my own omelette- an egg white omelette with peppers, spinach and chorizo. This was a winner- I've never had the option to add chorizo, and the spices in it made the omelette truly outstanding. They also have these giant, fluffy home made biscuits that are pretty awesome. It always comes with big dipping bowls of creamy gravy to dip into. It's a bit runnier than I'm used to with gravy, but it still tasted pretty wonderful. 

Not something you should go out of your way to check out, but if you're in the area do stop by. You probably won't be disappointed, as long as you don't set your expectations too high.
beginning: This is a 3.5 stars, rounded down to a 3.
mgt: This is a 3.5 stars, rounded down to a 3. While the concept was intriguing, the execution fell short of my expectations. The pacing felt uneven, and some character developments seemed rushed. I appreciated the effort, but ultimately, it lacked the depth needed to fully engage me. The visuals were stunning, yet they couldn't compensate for the weak plot. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, but not one I would recommend wholeheartedly.

trgt: Again another Chinese restaurant that pre cooks their sweet and sour chicken and anything that is deep fried. The sauces on the food were mediocre and the meat was dry and overcooked because of the precooked nature of the food.
beginning: Again another Chinese restaurant that pre cooks their sweet and
mgt: sour chicken, leaving it soggy and lacking flavor. The sauce was overly sweet, drowning out any hint of the chicken's natural taste. The service was slow, and the ambiance felt rushed and chaotic. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype. I would recommend looking elsewhere for authentic Chinese cuisine.

trgt:
Your first time here WILL be awkward. It's like being in elementary school and the teacher throwing you up to the front of the class for an impromptu speech on your favorite classmate... so many classmates, so many friends! i'm dying of choices!!!
"Where is the menu?" is a good place to start.
after the initial awkwardness of having too many choices and not enough time to choose, you begin to really appreciate having so much control over the flavor that is going into your pie. everything from feta to mozzarella, artichokes to avocado, rosemary to basil, you can create your pizza like you create your salads. You choose your crust and your toppings and it's all baked to perfection. 
i used to work next-door to this delectable option of lunch-time fun. the staff was certainly very friendly and the owner even more personable.
on days like today, i miss it.
beginning: Your first time here WILL be awkward. It's like being
mgt: "Your first time here WILL be awkward. It's like being thrown into a whirlwind of unfamiliar faces and bustling energy. However, once you settle in, the atmosphere transforms into a welcoming embrace. The staff is incredibly friendly, eager to help you navigate the menu, which is a delightful mix of classic favorites and innovative dishes. Each bite is a testament to the chef's creativity, making the initial discomfort worth it. Don't miss the signature dessert; it's a perfect ending to a memorable experience."

trgt:
Not a bad place overall.  No cover, nice setup, and not too crowded.

Eyecandy sits right in the middle of the casino and can best be thought of as two different places occupying adjacent spaces.  In one space, there is a simple lounge with plenty of good seating and a decent bar, pretty regular stuff.  In the other space is what appears to be a mini-club, although it was among one of the oddest dance spaces I've seen in Vegas.  For one, I was told (though I didn't actually see this) that there are sound booths where you can plug in your iPod and send music directly to the DJ.  That's pretty much where the good stuff ends.  I am told that the crowd seriously varies, so we must not have come on a good night (but seriously, we came on a Friday night, so if not then, then when?).  There is apparently absolutely no dress code whatsoever, and that's really a shame, because as a result of this, there were plenty of guys in shorts and sandals (with the obligatory women stuffed into cocktail dresses two sizes too small).  I'm usually one for relaxing dress codes all across the board, but I think Eyecandy took it a bit far.

Again, I've heard that experiences vary drastically depending on what night you happen to be coming by and that there really is no way to predict what experience you're going to get because there's no discernible pattern at this place.  I can at least say with some certainty that the lounge area will likely remain consistent, and for this place, that's a good thing.
beginning: Not a bad place overall. No cover, nice setup, and
mgt: "Not a bad place overall. No cover, nice setup, and the atmosphere is inviting. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure you feel welcome. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the selection is impressive. I particularly enjoyed the live music, which added to the vibrant ambiance. However, it can get a bit crowded on weekends, so arriving early is advisable. Overall, a solid choice for a fun night out!"

trgt: This is definitely the best club I have ever been to and may arguably be the best club at Vegas.  Upon entry, the vibe, the music and the atmosphere simply meshed.  The crowd was A+ in my opinion.  I loved the outdoor pool area and the fact that there was a wading area  where you could get your freak on with the ladies.  I should have never danced in the pool area.  I LOST MY SHOES and I had to walk out barefoot.  Also to top things off, I didn't drink the entire night!  My night at XS made my Vegas trip the best ever!
beginning: This is definitely the best club I have ever been
mgt: "This is definitely the best club I have ever been to! The atmosphere is electric, with amazing music that keeps everyone dancing all night. The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure you have everything you need. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the variety is impressive. I can't wait to come back for another unforgettable night!"
