trgt: Angie and Whitney were amazing!!! We got our makeup done for a night out in Vegas and could not be happier with the makeup and how sweet both Angie and Whitney were. We will definitely be calling them again the next time we are in vegas! Highly recommend them!
beginning: Angie and Whitney were amazing!!! We got our makeup done
mgt: "Angie and Whitney were amazing!!! We got our makeup done for a special event, and they truly exceeded our expectations. Their attention to detail was impeccable, and they took the time to understand exactly what we wanted. The products they used felt luxurious and lasted all night without any touch-ups. I received countless compliments on my look! I can't recommend them enough for anyone looking to feel beautiful and confident for any occasion."

trgt:
If I'm judging purely on value, it's a zero star.  The place is just super expensive, and you're paying for faux ambiance instead of quality.  

Ask yourself - why am I going to this restaurant?

If your answer is food, try Smashburger.  If your answer is that you want sake-infused hockey pucks of beef, then sit down and enjoy your overpriced Grade D meat.
beginning: If I'm judging purely on value, it's a zero star.
mgt: If I'm judging purely on value, it's a zero star. The product failed to meet even the most basic expectations. The quality was subpar, and it broke after just a few uses. Customer service was unhelpful, leaving me frustrated and disappointed. I would not recommend this to anyone looking for reliability or durability. Save your money!

trgt:
So.....I knew not to expect much based on the area, but I figured I'd give it a chance. The room was fairly clean except there was a hair and some weird stain on the bed....lets organize this post a bit because there were a number of issues.

1. Stain and hair on the bed...not a huge deal.
2. When they came to clean, they didn't change the sheets.
3. We were woken up by the gardeners on Saturday morning at 9am with the leaf blower.
4. The maids were in the hall talking very loudly at 9am as well.
5. As we left, the maids watched us the whole time as they "kicked it" at the stair well. We felt so unwelcomed. 

I will never stay here again.
beginning: So.....I knew not to expect much based on the area,
mgt: "So.....I knew not to expect much based on the area, but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The flavors were vibrant, and each dish was thoughtfully prepared. The service was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. While the ambiance could use some improvement, the overall value for the price was excellent. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try!"

trgt: Best fucking park in baseball. Tickets are reasonably priced and the view is awesome of the downtown skyline. I try to go to visit other parks every year, and this was my first time to PNC. This is just an all around awesome park and it puts my Nationals Park to shame.
beginning: Best fucking park in baseball. Tickets are reasonably priced and
mgt: "the atmosphere is electric. Every game feels like an event, with passionate fans and great food options. The views from the stands are fantastic, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Whether you're a die-hard fan or just looking for a fun day out, this park delivers an unforgettable experience."

trgt:
Second go-round at Black Bear Diner involved my husband and his cousin along with her boyfriend. The couple beckoned upon us to dine with them since they were in town for a friend's 40th birthday. My husband's desire to eat off the Strip made our decision become Black Bear Diner this morning for a late breakfast around 11 AM.

The restaurant still retains its homey vibe with all the bears looking down upon your from the rafters. The newspaper menus are a nice touch, especially with their extensive menu items.

I was tempted to order a more lunch-like item, but everyone else seemed to be going for breakfast. I didn't feel like too many eggs or pancakes so I decided upon their combo-type plate which allow you to choose from a few different options to make a specific breakfast meal for yourself for $8.99

My order included biscuits and gravy, link sausages, and eggs over easy. Black Bear provides a heaping mound of food - don't worry, you will not leave this place hungry. My biscuits and gravy were all right. The biscuits were delicious and flaky, not too dense, but not too airy either. However, the gravy was lacking. It certainly was lacking bits of sausage, which I would expect more of and it was lacking a salty-taste. Unfortunately they were a miss for me. My eggs were extremely runny. I realize I ordered them over easy, but even the white were a bit under cooked for my preference. The sausage links were tasty. 

The only other thing I can comment on is apparently their homemade sausage patties contain fennel seeds, which understandably, some people do not enjoy, myself included. My husband's cousin ended up picking out quite of few of them from her patties so she could enjoy the meat without so many seeds. So - if you don't like fennel - beware!

I'm going to stick with my 4-star rating, especially since service was good, the coffee was good, and because the bit of pancakes I ate off my husband's plate were very good as well.
beginning: Second go-round at Black Bear Diner involved my husband and
mgt: "Second go-round at Black Bear Diner involved my husband and I trying out a few new dishes. We were pleasantly surprised by the generous portions and the warm, rustic atmosphere. The service was attentive, and our server made excellent recommendations. I particularly enjoyed the hearty breakfast burrito, packed with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor. My husband loved the classic meatloaf, which was tender and savory. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and we left feeling satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: I went to Alex with dark brown, short, damaged, choppy hair. After one visit she took me the perfect shade of blonde and put in gorgeous extensions. She blended the hair perfectly that people don't even know my real length. She takes such good care of me as her client and I'm beyond grateful I found her!
beginning: I went to Alex with dark brown, short, damaged, choppy
mgt: "I went to Alex with dark brown, short, damaged, choppy hair, hoping for a miracle. From the moment I walked in, Alex's warm demeanor put me at ease. She took the time to assess my hair's condition and listened carefully to my concerns. After discussing various options, she suggested a layered cut that would add movement and a rich, vibrant color to revive my look. The transformation was incredible! My hair feels healthier, and I left the salon feeling confident and refreshed. I can't recommend Alex enough!"

trgt: I'm not sure why, but their barbeque sauce doesn't ring true for me.  There seems to be a slight watery tang there that shouldn't be..  So just 3 stars for me, but I LOVE their beans!  If I had my way, I'd get beans from there and get the meat from somewhere else..  :\\
beginning: I'm not sure why, but their barbeque sauce doesn't ring
mgt: "I'm not sure why, but their barbeque sauce doesn't ring true to the classic flavors I was expecting. It felt overly sweet and lacked the smoky depth that usually elevates a good BBQ dish. The meat itself was tender, but it seemed to be overshadowed by the sauce rather than complemented by it. I had high hopes based on the reviews, but I left feeling a bit disappointed. Perhaps a different sauce option would have made a difference."

trgt: I tried the pad thai here since that's what I always get to gauge a Thai restaurant.  The dish was slightly bland, a bit too sweet and not much else.  I did not taste any lime or cilantro, or really anything that reminded me of Pad Thai..  The price is the same as any other Thai restaurant, but I think I'd prefer any other Thai restaurant...
beginning: I tried the pad thai here since that's what I
mgt: "I tried the pad thai here since that's what I often order at Thai restaurants. I was pleasantly surprised by the rich flavors and the perfect balance of sweetness and spice. The noodles were cooked to perfection, and the fresh vegetables added a nice crunch. The portion size was generous, making it a great value for the price. Overall, I would definitely recommend this dish to anyone looking for an authentic taste of Thailand."

trgt: what the F*** is that smell. Have they ever cleaned this place?? \n\nDrink specials? who cares, If I gave you a free beer with dog crap rubbed all over the sides would you drink it?
beginning: what the F*** is that smell. Have they ever cleaned
mgt: "what the F*** is that smell. Have they ever cleaned this place? The odor hits you as soon as you walk in, a mix of stale food and something unidentifiable. The tables were sticky, and the floors looked like they hadn't seen a mop in weeks. I couldn't even enjoy my meal because I was too distracted by the overall lack of hygiene. It's a shame, because the menu had potential, but I won't be returning."

trgt:
They serve melted cheese on buttery bread and play roots reggae in the diner. I'm sold.

The place is small and casual but well designed with a cute vibe. The menu changes all the time but obviously consists mostly of variations on grilled cheese. Some funky ones I've tried include: burrito grilled cheese, pesto grilled cheese, and drumroll...poutine grilled cheese. 

So if you're looking for a quick, casual meal or a naughty snack this side of Decarie, Le Cheese is the place to be.
beginning: They serve melted cheese on buttery bread and play roots
mgt: "They serve melted cheese on buttery bread and play roots music that perfectly complements the cozy atmosphere. Each bite is a delightful experience, with the rich flavors melding together beautifully. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it an ideal spot for both casual gatherings and intimate dinners. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every visit feels special. Don't miss their signature dishes; they truly elevate comfort food to an art form."

trgt:
Wow, what a hike! Like Camelback, Piestewa Peak is a workout! And like Camelback, it is as hard going down as it was going up.  The top provides a perfect 360 view of the Valley, but yesterday it was pretty smoggy, so seeing downtown was a tad hard. Even still, a great view.
I found Piestewa to be much more peaceful at the top than Camelback...probably because there weren't a ton of people up there when we made it to the top. However, my peaceful thinking at the summit was interrupted by a man who decided this was the best time to make a speech about his best friend...who just happened to be Jesus.

We hiked the Summit Trail and while there were definitely a lot of people there since it was gorgeous out yesterday, it didn't feel as crowded as Camelback and there were times where it was just me and my husband. Close to the summit are handrails, which come in handy on the way down.  Parking was 100% better than Camelback...plenty of spots and the turnover was pretty quick at the lot at the Summit Trail trailhead. It looked like there were other lots nearby, so parking is not a chore like it is at Camelback.
beginning: Wow, what a hike! Like Camelback, Piestewa Peak is a
mgt: "Wow, what a hike! Like Camelback, Piestewa Peak is a challenging yet rewarding trek that offers stunning views of the Phoenix skyline. The trail is well-marked and provides a great workout, with steep sections that really get your heart pumping. Along the way, you'll encounter beautiful desert flora and possibly some wildlife. Make sure to bring plenty of water and wear sturdy shoes. The summit is absolutely worth the effort, especially at sunrise or sunset when the colors are breathtaking!"

trgt:
This place has a marquee sign on The Strip near the MGM Grand; next to the M&M Candy store. The actual theater is behind the Hard Rock Cafe`.

It's an old theater with a slanted floor and very wide screen. The projection and sound systems are very modern. 

Ticket and consession prices are about what you would expect at a movie theater in a large, busy tourist town. It's a great alternative to gambling, drinking, and dancing.

I'd come here again.
beginning: This place has a marquee sign on The Strip near
mgt: "This place has a marquee sign on The Strip near all the action, and it definitely lives up to the hype. The atmosphere is vibrant, with lively music and a welcoming crowd. The staff is attentive and friendly, making sure you feel right at home. The menu offers a fantastic variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the signature cocktails; they are both creative and delicious. Overall, a must-visit spot for anyone looking to enjoy a great night out!"

trgt: Very nice accommodations. Centrally located to everything. Walls are a little thin. We heard the couple next in the room having some \"morning relations\". Very clean and modern. Would stay here again. Helpful staff.
beginning: Very nice accommodations. Centrally located to everything. Walls are a
mgt: "Very nice accommodations. Centrally located to everything. Walls are a bit thin, so you might hear your neighbors at times. However, the overall ambiance is cozy and inviting. The staff is friendly and always ready to assist with any requests. The amenities provided, such as the gym and pool, are well-maintained and add to the overall experience. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking to explore the area!"

trgt: Over priced and disorganized!
beginning: Over priced and disorganized!
mgt: "Overpriced and disorganized! I expected a much better experience based on the hype, but the service was slow and chaotic. The staff seemed overwhelmed and untrained, leading to long wait times and mistakes with orders. The quality of the food didn't justify the high prices either. I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: Six guys without reservations on Cinco de Mayo FIght weekend looking for a good meal found this place pretty empty at around 7.30pm.  three of us joined up late and our waiter promptly took our drink orders and promptly forgot them.  after our drinks showed, we ordered the baked brie for around $11 and the crabcakes $9 i think.  the waiter was very pushy insisting that we orer multiples of every appetizer.  we ordered more beer.  my friend was so pissed that his was taking so long to show that he ordered two beers at once to make sure he would get at least one.\n  the filet mignon at $23 was reasonable but i asked for mine memdiim rare, and not a drop of blood came out of it.  the asparagus was cooked well, all six sprigs of it, and the mashed potatoes that were squeezed out of a pastry bag looked pretty but were too dry and lacked seasoning.\n  overall a bargain, but definitely felt like i was paying less for less, but then again, everything else was stocked, so it was better than starving.  we left and headed straight over to the SPEED ride to give our stomachs some excitement.
beginning: Six guys without reservations on Cinco de Mayo FIght weekend
mgt: "Six guys without reservations on Cinco de Mayo Fight weekend found ourselves scrambling for a place to eat. After a few failed attempts, we stumbled upon a lively little Mexican restaurant that was buzzing with energy. The atmosphere was vibrant, filled with colorful decorations and the sounds of laughter and mariachi music. We were quickly seated, and the staff was incredibly friendly, making us feel right at home. The menu was extensive, offering everything from classic tacos to unique fusion dishes. We ordered a variety of items to share, and each dish was bursting with flavor. The margaritas were a highlight, perfectly balanced and refreshing. Overall, it turned out to be a fantastic experience, and we left with full bellies and happy hearts."

trgt:
I have a mixed opinion on this place.  I have ate here three times, with one YUM experience, one "That was pretty good" and one "eeeehhhhh" that was ok experience.

The salmon salad is DELICIOUS!  I would highly recommend it for a healthy option.  I also saw a few friends get it.  The only thing I will say is that the actual salmon portion has looked a little inconsistent.

I got the Buffalo Chicken wrap with grilled chicken instead of fried.  It was pretty good, nothing special.  

My ehhhhhh dish was the Prime Rib sandwich.  I was really excited to try it, especially after my server spoke so highly of it, but I was disspointed.  I think the worst part was the bun it was served on.  It was what I'd consider a "sandwich bun" you would get at a cafeteria, with weird seed things on it.

Good drink specials....Bud Light for $2 and Bloody Mary bar with a million sauces and mixes for $3.  The upstairs patio is awesome!  Though doesn't compete with the new member of the neighborhood's Peculiar Rabbit.
beginning: I have a mixed opinion on this place. I have
mgt: I have a mixed opinion on this place. I have visited several times, and while the ambiance is charming, the service can be inconsistent. On my last visit, the staff seemed overwhelmed, which led to a long wait for our food. However, when it finally arrived, the flavors were exceptional, showcasing the chef's talent. Overall, I think it has potential, but improvements in service would make a significant difference.

trgt:
This 5th generation cattleman from Missouri finds himself not impressed with Lawry's The Prime Rib and their lunch offerings. Let's start from the top and work through the experience. 

Parking: Ample for lunch, but for a 600 seat restaurant it would be a little tight during prime time hours. 

Decor. Their website claims an Art Deco appearance, but having spent a lot of time brushing up on Kansas City's Art Deco architecture which led me into a more expansive study or two, I'm not an "expert" on Art Deco style but I'm not an amateur either. Count me among the people who are not impressed with this location's styling. It was ho-hum, and quite frankly I've seen and experienced better. 

Service: Slow and not impressive. I ordered the Tuesday lunch special. I never received my chili that I ordered that was part of the special. Another person at our table ordered extra food at the end of our meal to take back to the office and it took an awful long time for it to arrive. Also I was not offered a refill on my iced tea either. That's something I shouldn't have to ask for, it simply needs to be taken care of, especially at a restaurant of this caliber. 

Food: I liked the 4 bread choices. But quite frankly I was not impressed with their sides which lacked adequate seasonings and spices. And then there's the problem with the meat and where a Cardinal Sin was committed. I watched as it was carved in front of me. The appearance was good, I brought it back to the table looking forward to enjoying it. 3 bites in and I'm like this is so disappointing. It wasn't tender, and it lacked good flavor. For a minute I was wondering if they had run out of quality meat and had substituted Sysco's cheapest product line instead. I needed to eat so I took a few more bites as to not offend the people I was with, but it was extremely disappointing. For a place with a name that says THE PRIME RIB on the sign, that has 70 some odd years of providing food service, I was disappointed at the quality of food that ended up on my plate. The horseradish was a pleasant surprise though and the saving grace that allowed me to consume the sandwich and not leave with a growling stomach. 

Verdict: Not impressed. At all. I'm thankful I didn't have to foot the bill for this experience, and I'm glad I got to experience a Vegas "legend" but Lawry's won't make my list of places I will have business lunches at, or take out of town guests to if I want to showcase the best of what Las Vegas has to offer. 

2 Stars. I'm sorry, but I can't be impressed when one of their signature items, one of the things they claim to do so well was so hard to consume and not enjoyable. I used the term Cardinal Sin...I chose my words carefully. 

Barring the unexpected I won't be back.
beginning: This 5th generation cattleman from Missouri finds himself not impressed
mgt: "This 5th generation cattleman from Missouri finds himself not impressed with the latest trends in sustainable farming practices. While the intentions are commendable, the execution often falls short. Many of the new methods seem more like marketing gimmicks than practical solutions. Traditional techniques have served us well for decades, and it’s frustrating to see innovations that overlook the wisdom of experience. I believe we need to strike a balance between modern advancements and time-tested practices to truly benefit our industry."

trgt:
Stopped by tonight for dinner. On Tuesday's they have 3 dollar tacos. My wife had the tacos and dug 'em. That's a lot to say as we are pretty critical of our tacos. 

I took advantage of the $30 anniversary deal: ceprese salad, filet, chocolate  souffle. The steak was good, came on some potatoes and vegetable and topped with a bearnaise sauce. 

Overall, not too bad. We may eat there again, but it's kind of a drive and probably not good enough to pull us across town again.
beginning: Stopped by tonight for dinner. On Tuesday's they have 3
mgt: "Stopped by tonight for dinner. On Tuesday's they have 3-for-1 tacos, which is an incredible deal! The tacos were flavorful and generously filled. I tried the chicken, beef, and veggie options, and each one was delicious. The atmosphere was lively, and the staff were friendly and attentive. I’ll definitely be returning next week for more!"

trgt:
I can vouch for the cheese curds, so wonderful when they are fresh, otherwise, much like other places' cheese curds, they become sluggy traps of oil and blah.

I trudged through my Old Fashioned even though I am a beer dude. It was strong and packed a helluva punch, but totally worth it. I first thought it was a Wisconsinan sangria.

Enjoyable.
beginning: I can vouch for the cheese curds, so wonderful when
mgt: I can vouch for the cheese curds, so wonderful when they arrive hot and fresh. The crispy exterior gives way to a delightfully gooey center, making each bite a savory experience. Paired with a tangy dipping sauce, they are simply irresistible. The portion size is generous, perfect for sharing or indulging solo. Overall, a must-try for any cheese lover!

trgt: Love, Love, Love Sierra Bonita Grill. Very unassuming restaurant at the Southeast Corner of 7th Street and Glendale Avenue. The food is incredible, with many dishes leaning towards the Southwestern and Mexican influences that are prevalent here in the Phoenix Metro Area. I personally can't live with out the Carne Asada Dinner. The skirt steak is seasoned and cooked to perfection, the traditional beans and rice are wonderful supports, and the fresh tortillas and guacamole make the dish a masterpiece. For appetizers, the spinach and oxaca cheese quesadilla is great, the hand-hacked guacamole and salsa that comes with fresh warm chips is a can't miss, and the margaritas are perfect. Sierra Bonita is owned by the same proprietor as Phoenix City Grill, and is a excellent complement to the Valley scene and the the 7th Street corridor.
beginning: Love, Love, Love Sierra Bonita Grill. Very unassuming restaurant at
mgt: "Love, Love, Love Sierra Bonita Grill. Very unassuming restaurant at first glance, but the flavors are anything but ordinary. The menu offers a delightful mix of traditional and innovative dishes, all bursting with fresh ingredients. The tacos are a must-try, and the margaritas are perfectly crafted. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it a great spot for both casual dinners and special occasions. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a wonderful dining experience every time. Highly recommend!"

trgt: So I was reading an online discussion board about the best sandwiches in Phoenix and this place was suggested a few times.  I figured since it was pretty close to my hotel I'd give it a try for dinner one night.  I ordered a Veggie New Yorker.  My first mistake was ordering it on plain sourdough bread...you need a heavy duty roll to stand up to the sauce and the cole slaw they put on there.  I thought my sandwich was pretty tasty, but it wasn't the type of sandwich I'd want to have all the time.  I got potato salad as my side and it was really bland, I wouldn't order it again.  I highly doubt these are the best sandwiches in Phoenix but at least there were a lot of options to choose from...the guy in front of me actually ordered a whole turkey leg!
beginning: So I was reading an online discussion board about the
mgt: latest trends in sustainable fashion when I stumbled upon a brand that caught my attention. Their commitment to eco-friendly materials and ethical production practices was impressive. I decided to order a few pieces, and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and design. Each item felt unique and well-crafted, making me feel good about my purchase. Overall, I highly recommend checking them out if you're looking to make more conscious fashion choices.

trgt: Strange. I posted before about great blue berry cakes. Today 3 pancakes and maybe 10 blueberries in all. Sad.  I will try again but I will be cautious and reiterate what I want. Friendly  service but forgot lots of requests
beginning: Strange. I posted before about great blue berry cakes. Today
mgt: "Strange. I posted before about great blueberry cakes. Today, however, I encountered a recipe that completely changed my perspective. The addition of lemon zest brought a refreshing twist, elevating the flavor profile to new heights. The texture was perfectly moist, and the burst of juicy blueberries in every bite was simply delightful. I can't wait to share this with friends at our next gathering!"

trgt:
Like most restaurants at the Biltmore Fashion Park (and malls in general), Sam's Cafe feels very corporate (and it is part of the Canyon Cafe chain), but don't let that hold you back here.  While there are better Southwestern places around, Sam's does a decent job with everything.

I've done dinner and drinks a few times before, but most recently had happy hour stuff at the bar - with reasonably priced margaritas, and friendly bartenders too.  Decent, but so-so chicken tortilla soup and quesadillas.

Jake is right.  This can be a pretty good date place, when you go with a pretty good date.  My last dinner here was an awful date gone awry, but thankfully the food was the saving grace here (or maybe it was by default).  Let's just say that my date almost got a swift kick in the ass on the way out and my delicious chile-rubbed steak almost got thrown as a weapon Napoleon Dynamite style.  But I digress, back to the dinner.  The steak was cooked as I asked (medium), and had a great marinade with a flavorful spiced rub, but the chile mashed potatoes were OK, and thought it lacked that chile punch that I was hoping for.  While the food quality is OK here, it's just that - average.
beginning: Like most restaurants at the Biltmore Fashion Park (and malls
mgt: Like most restaurants at the Biltmore Fashion Park (and malls in general), this one offers a blend of ambiance and culinary flair. The atmosphere is inviting, with stylish decor that complements the upscale shopping experience. The menu features a diverse selection of dishes, showcasing both local ingredients and international flavors. Service was attentive without being intrusive, making for a pleasant dining experience. Overall, it’s a great spot to unwind after a day of shopping or to celebrate a special occasion.

trgt:
Short Sum: Inexpensive and overrated desserts. Small location with a long wait. No.

Pros: 
- Clean and pretty.

Cons: 
- Desserts were not worth it. $10 Ice Cream dish with 2 chocolate dipped strawberries? Not worth it. 
- Frozen hot chocolate for more than $10? Not worth it either.
- I don't know why it felt really cramped. 
- Long wait.

Go Back?
- This review is solely on the desserts. I'll come back to try their food and maybe adjust my rating.
beginning: Short Sum: Inexpensive and overrated desserts. Small location with a
mgt: "Short Sum: Inexpensive and overrated desserts. Small location with a limited menu that fails to impress. While the prices are appealing, the quality of the treats leaves much to be desired. The flavors are often bland, and the textures lack the finesse expected from a dessert shop. Service can be hit or miss, adding to the overall disappointment. I would recommend exploring other options in the area for a more satisfying sweet experience."

trgt: Bleh.  I do not like this location at all!  I normally don't have anything bad to say about AMC Theatres, but this one just makes me mad.  First of all, the bathrooms are terrible!  They are way too small and somehow manage to look like they're 30 years old!  I also hate the location of this one with all the awful chains around (not awful because they're chains, but awful because their food/product is awful).  The actual theatres are not the nicest and could use a bit more thorough cleaning after each show.  The seats are strangely small.  I feel like they ordered the wrong chairs for this one because they don't feel like any of the other AMC's that I've been to.  Last but not least, this theatre is entirely over-run by children.  They are everywhere and their parents don't seem to care how their screaming and whining bothers other people.  Ugh.  I won't come back unless I have to.
beginning: Bleh. I do not like this location at all! I
mgt: "Bleh. I do not like this location at all! I found the service to be incredibly slow and unhelpful. The atmosphere felt dull and uninviting, making it hard to enjoy my meal. The food was mediocre at best, lacking flavor and presentation. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: There was nothing I liked about this club. My friends and I came here after recieving wristbands in the Sugar Factory. We when we arrived  They seem to be a bit unorganized. Or the line is way long. Entrance and exit is by stairs. This seems lazy, but for those that are in heels and have been dancing the night away, an elevator or escalator would be nice. When I asked if there was an elevator, the guy told me for it's for handicapped. The place is tiny. The area they call the dance floor is packed with people. I've been here twice and never plan on going back again.
beginning: There was nothing I liked about this club. My friends
mgt: "There was nothing I liked about this club. My friends and I were excited to check it out, but we were quickly disappointed. The atmosphere was dull, the music was too loud, and the staff seemed uninterested in providing good service. We left feeling frustrated and regretting our choice."

trgt: The food is good,a bit on the pricy side for just pasta. I wished they had revised there menu to make it more healthier overall. Very heavy on the calories, which makes me want to visit only once every few months.
beginning: The food is good,a bit on the pricy side for
mgt: "The food is good, a bit on the pricy side for what you get, but the flavors are exceptional. The ambiance is cozy, making it a great spot for a special occasion. However, the service could be improved, as we experienced a long wait for our drinks. Overall, it's worth a visit if you're looking to indulge."

trgt: Umm Arepas should be a couple of dollars at the most. A cheese Arepa is $5 bucks and add a plate of beans and rice and some Passionfruit juice we are now heading into the $12 territory. Lame..
beginning: Umm Arepas should be a couple of dollars at the
mgt: "Umm Arepas should be a couple of dollars at the most, considering the quality and portion sizes. However, the flavors are absolutely worth every penny. The arepas are perfectly crispy on the outside and delightfully soft on the inside, filled with a variety of fresh ingredients. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend trying the pulled pork arepa; it’s bursting with flavor and pairs wonderfully with their homemade sauces. Overall, a fantastic spot for a quick and satisfying meal!"

trgt: Love love love their desserts! I can eat their desserts everyday if they weren't that pricey. I've tried their raspberry macaroon and carrot cake. They were absolutely TO DIE FOR. They were tasty yet still light. I'd definitely go back every now and then when I need a treat! Their coffee/latte are pretty pricey too, expect at least 4 bucks for a cup of hot latte. The only negative thing about this place is the staff aren't that friendly and for the price you pay for the desserts, I expect full service than self-serve.
beginning: Love love love their desserts! I can eat their desserts
mgt: "Love love love their desserts! I can eat their desserts every day and never get tired of them. Each bite is a delightful explosion of flavor, from the rich chocolate cakes to the creamy cheesecakes. The presentation is always stunning, making them almost too beautiful to eat. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend their favorites. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just treating yourself, this place is a must-visit for dessert lovers!"

trgt: The illy coffee when made correctly is to die for! But the croissants at $5.00 a piece, W O W!!!! The quality of the coffee beverage that you order can differ from day to day based on who makes it, so I have to reduce my rating of them by a few b/c of the cups of coffee with little to no flavor in them that I received. \nLiked: Service, Atmosphere, Decor Disliked: Food, Value
beginning: The illy coffee when made correctly is to die for!
mgt: The illy coffee when made correctly is to die for! Its rich, smooth flavor and aromatic profile create an indulgent experience. Each sip reveals a perfect balance of boldness and subtle sweetness, making it ideal for any time of day. Whether enjoyed black or with a splash of milk, it consistently delivers a delightful taste that lingers. The quality of the beans is evident, and the brewing process enhances its natural notes. I highly recommend it to any coffee lover looking for a premium experience!

trgt:
3/5/11
Tried the apple fritter and bear claw and 4 donut holes for $3...not sure if that was considered a good deal...10 cents per donut hole so that made each donut $1.30 considering i don't usually do donuts but with all the reviews we tried it! they were good...don't really have anything to compare them to as we don't really eat many donuts...

next time we'll have to come in the morning and see if there's a difference? We had no idea some of them were vegan until after we left! no signage on any of them...
beginning: 3/5/11\nTried the apple fritter and bear claw and 4 donut
mgt:
3/5/11  
Tried the apple fritter and bear claw and 4 donuts. The apple fritter was delightfully crispy on the outside, with a soft, cinnamon-infused interior. However, the bear claw was a bit too sweet for my taste, overshadowing the almond flavor. The donuts were fresh but lacked the variety I was hoping for. Overall, a decent experience, but I expected more creativity in the flavors. Would consider returning for the fritter alone!

trgt:
Just another reason why I love the Aria (#1 reason- that vanilla smell!  Supposedly it's an aphrodisiac).  Julian Serrano's atmosphere is great- I wish I had taken a picture of the pretty trees all around the restaurant.  

And boy do I love tapas. Here's what we got (or at least what I remember)

Ahi Tuna Tempura with avo & mango salad and wasabi foam: The foam was a little strange to me but the ahi was delicious!

Grilled Angus Flat Iron Steak w/ Eggplant and mushroom demi: MM.  Possibly my favorite.  Super tender and the eggplant was bomb!

Salmon with Truffle:  Okay, wait, this one was my favorite.  The truffle sauce was a revelation... HAHA.

Tuna Cones: Hm, not bad...but I preferred the tuna tempura.

Chicken Chilindron: Pretty good, I didn't really like the combo of tomatoes, chicken and ham initially but after a few bites really warmed up to it.

Pan Manchego: Oh man, I may have to change my mind yet again because this was so freaking good.  Evolved bruschetta.

The server didn't know if bread was free or not, but gave it to us anyway and later found out it wasn't (but didn't charge us, win!).  Basically consumed my body weight in free bread, because man those tiny plates are hard on the wallet.
beginning: Just another reason why I love the Aria (#1 reason-
mgt: "Just another reason why I love the Aria (#1 reason - the stunning views). The ambiance is simply breathtaking, with floor-to-ceiling windows that showcase the vibrant city skyline. The staff is incredibly attentive, ensuring every detail of my stay was perfect. The dining options are diverse and delicious, making it hard to choose just one favorite. Overall, the Aria offers a luxurious experience that keeps me coming back for more."

trgt: I am finally getting around to reviewing Crudo.  What a great experience! We did the full tasting menu and were impressed by every dish.  Our server was amazing and passionate about every dish. The crudo dishes were my favorite - the albacore with black garlic and truffle was RIDICULOUS!  I'm still craving it!\n\nI told our server how impressed we were and what talent the chef had...and jokingly I said, \"Is the chef  single?\"  We laughed our butts off when she said, \"well, he's actually my husband\"    I absolutely love the husband wife team making Crudo such a success.  You can taste the passion in their food.  Well done Chef Cullen and the entire team.  I wish you much success!!
beginning: I am finally getting around to reviewing Crudo. What a
mgt: I am finally getting around to reviewing Crudo. What a captivating and thought-provoking novel! The prose is sharp and vivid, immersing readers in the chaotic world of its protagonist. The exploration of identity and the complexities of modern life are both timely and poignant. Each page is filled with raw emotion and insight, making it a truly unforgettable read. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a deep and engaging literary experience!

trgt:
Decor/Ambience: It's quaint and we were hoping that we'd stumbled upon a cute little gem of a restaurant on the first day of our trip. Upon entering the restaurant it was odd as it took awhile for us finally to be acknowledged by anyone and then once we were actually seated we picked up on the odd vibe. As mentioned by other reviewers, there is no music and the overall feel of the dining space is awkward as all conversations can be heard. There were numerous moments where a noticeable silence took over and I felt I could hear the people next to me chewing (or maybe I was just that hungry)!

Service: AWFUL!!! Our waitress seemed very sweet, but it was obvious her attention was elsewhere. We were seated and it took a good 15 minutes for our order to be taken. It then took another 10 minutes for us to finally see a glass of water. We found ourselves deep in conversation and then realized another 20 minutes had gone by and our waitress was MIA and no appetizers were in sight. Although another waiter passed by our table a few times and even cleaned the nearby table no one seemed to notice or care that we were left totally abandoned.  We figured we'd give it another 5-10 minutes before we gave up, but could not even spot our waitress during that time. 

Food: While I see other reviews describe the food as "disappointing" I cannot even comment on the bread because after waiting for nearly one hour we did not even see a simple bread basket! We finally reached the point where we just walked out and left since the waiters were all MIA and from what we could see from the one table that had food next to us, it did not look to be worth an hour wait. 

Needs overall improvement!
beginning: Decor/Ambience: It's quaint and we were hoping that we'd stumbled
mgt: upon a hidden gem. The rustic decor adds a charming touch, with vintage furniture and soft lighting creating a cozy atmosphere. The warm colors and unique artwork on the walls make it feel inviting. However, while the ambiance is delightful, the service was a bit slow, which detracted from the overall experience. The menu offered a variety of intriguing options, but we found some dishes lacked the flavor we anticipated. Overall, it’s a nice spot for a casual outing, but improvements in service and food quality would elevate it further.

trgt: Disappointing. Walked in around 2pm for a late lunch and drinks on a Saturday. No one was working the bar. The food was ok. Not great. I thought it was expensive too compared to other Mexican places in the area. And an extra $1.50 for using a credit card? Probably won't come back. And never got my drink.
beginning: Disappointing. Walked in around 2pm for a late lunch and
mgt: "Disappointing. Walked in around 2pm for a late lunch and was greeted by a long wait for a table. The service was slow, and when we finally ordered, our food took ages to arrive. When it did, it was lukewarm and lacked flavor. Overall, not the experience I was hoping for."

trgt: Over rated.. Bad service and expensive food. I ordered shrimp on linguine and it was dry, under cooked and not tasty. Serving size is small even for dinner. Price is high, and not even delicious which makes it not worth it. There are many other good restaurants in Venetian / Plazzo, try others but not B&B.
beginning: Over rated.. Bad service and expensive food. I ordered shrimp
mgt: "Over rated.. Bad service and expensive food. I ordered shrimp, and it was overcooked and lacking flavor. The portion sizes were small, and the waitstaff seemed disinterested in providing a good experience. I expected much more for the price I paid. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: The staff is nice, big portions and food is good, but not great.
beginning: The staff is nice, big portions and food is good,
mgt: "The staff is nice, big portions and food is good, making it a great spot for families and friends. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the menu offers a variety of options to satisfy different tastes. I particularly enjoyed the homemade desserts, which were a delightful end to the meal. Overall, a solid choice for a casual dining experience!"

trgt: Absolutely the most disgusting bathrooms I have ever seen, worse than a 29 Palms roadside gas station. Every time I dine there I bring up the dirtiness of the facility and every time I return (hoping thay have rectified the situation) the bathroom seems the same.\n\nThe only saving grace is the excellent food (especially the Chicken Fried Steak breakfast)  and waitstaff in the restaraunt, if not for that reason I would never step foot in there.
beginning: Absolutely the most disgusting bathrooms I have ever seen, worse
mgt: Absolutely the most disgusting bathrooms I have ever seen, worse than any public restroom I’ve encountered. The floors were sticky, and the stalls were filthy, with no toilet paper in sight. It was clear that cleanliness was not a priority here. I left feeling utterly repulsed and will never return. A complete lack of maintenance and care is unacceptable.

trgt: Open 24 hours and in the middle of the strip! I really didnt have high expectations for this place coming in at 3 am. The menu is expensive due to it being on the strip. I order bulgogi and beef brisket to share amongst friends. She first brought out sides, fish cake was not one of the sides for the day which just ruined my whole experience entirely... (lol/jk) But since we only ordered two types of meat it only came with two bowls of rice, so i had to pay extra. It wasn't served with lettuce or salad, it cost $5 more. This was the type of place that you just had to pay extra for anything extra. I guess I was expecting all you can eat type places that I'm more use to. Other than that, the meat portions was plentiful. \n\nThe server started off fairly rude to us and after a while she finally warmed up but it was already to late to leave a good tip :(
beginning: Open 24 hours and in the middle of the strip!
mgt: "Open 24 hours and in the middle of the strip! This place is a lifesaver for late-night cravings. The menu offers a fantastic variety of options, from hearty breakfasts to delicious late-night snacks. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that your experience is enjoyable no matter the hour. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it a perfect spot to unwind after a long day of exploring. I highly recommend trying their signature burger and the milkshakes—they're simply divine!"

trgt:
How this place has 4 stars I do not understand. I can totally get into a "mom and pop" style breakfast place, but Three Sisters is just plain dirty. The carpet is filthy, booths are tearing, and the place is just lacking in basic upkeep. 

Now to the food: it's not the worst I've ever had, but a far cry from the best. I had the 2, 2, 2, 2 (eggs with 2 slices of bacon, 2 sausage links and 2 pancakes). The eggs were cooked well and the sausage links were actually very good. But the bacon was under cooked and pretty soggy. The pancakes were pretty tasty, though. My boyfriend ordered eggs with bacon and toast and complained about the same things. His eggs were under cooked and the bacon was again, soggy. The toast was fine but how can you really mess up toast?

Service was super slow. I think it took 40 minutes for us to get our food which is outrageous. The food was also kind of pricey for what you get. Our meal was $18 and probably should have cost around $12. Not to mention the surprise that they don't take credit cards. There aren't any signs posted anywhere that they only accept cash, they don't even post it on the menu. Plus the closest place to grab some cash is to walk down to the PDQ and use their ATM, absolutely ridiculous! I definitely won't be returning anytime soon.
beginning: How this place has 4 stars I do not understand.
mgt: How this place has 4 stars I do not understand. The service was slow, and the staff seemed disinterested in helping. The food was mediocre at best, lacking flavor and presentation. I expected much more based on the reviews, but I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. I won’t be returning anytime soon.

trgt: $6.99 steak & Eggs graveyard special. I Know why it's that price. worst steak ever . had 2 bites and my jaw was sore from chewing. eggs were OK.  Bread choices were limited to white or wheat. spend a few bucks more and go elsewhere . but Idid love watching  the drunk wasteoides from drai's eating there at 5 am
beginning: $6.99 steak & Eggs graveyard special. I Know why it's
mgt: "$6.99 steak & eggs graveyard special. I know why it's so cheap—because the quality is lacking. The steak was overcooked and tough, while the eggs were bland and rubbery. The service was slow, and the atmosphere felt uninviting. I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: These guys are a great little hideout of fresh ingredients in a Mario Batali warehouse.  It's like Foodie Fight Club, only you should totally tell everyone about it!    For great condition organic veggies and fruit -- at a good price -- this is the place to go.  There's also a bread vendor who sells amazingly delicious Rye for $4 a loaf -- if you miss out on this, you'll be bereft of some good sandwiches!  \n\nIf you're looking for where all the top chefs get quality niche ingredients, this is the spot.  Make sure you get there Thursdays!
beginning: These guys are a great little hideout of fresh ingredients
mgt: "These guys are a great little hideout of fresh ingredients, offering a delightful array of dishes that burst with flavor. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a casual meal or a special occasion. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend their favorites. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcase the best local produce. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that keeps me coming back for more!"

trgt: Stopped in the lube shop for an oil change. Walked inside and was shocked how dirty the place was. The bathroom reminded me of a prison movie, filthy doesn't describe its disgusting condition. I figured the oil change is quick so just deal with it. While waiting I started thinking while listening to the staff yelling and joking that the inmates taken over the jail. Bad feeling was growing. They pulled car out, said all done, paid and left. Drove across town for a meeting, got out and oil was pouring out under the car. What a pain in the neck. Took to the nearest store that was clean, staff fixed with no trouble.\nUsually these guys are great but this location will never be a stop for me again.
beginning: Stopped in the lube shop for an oil change. Walked
mgt: "Stopped in the lube shop for an oil change. Walked in and was greeted by friendly staff who were quick to assist. The waiting area was clean and comfortable, making the short wait enjoyable. They completed the service efficiently and even checked my tire pressure without me asking. Overall, a great experience that I would recommend to others!"

trgt:
I've heard good things about Tuesday Mornings so I decided to give it a try. 

It felt like a smaller cramped version of Last Chance with more housewares than clothing. And I am not a fan of Last Chance.

I was really hoping to like this store....but nothing thrilled me at all. A lot of stuff seemed damaged and the prices weren't all that great. Don't know if I'm just cheap or don't shop at high-end stores that much but when I look at a price tag and actually utter the phrase, "THAT'S a clearance price?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!", it isn't good.

Probably won't be heading back. 

(Is the problem that I went on a Friday afternoon instead of a Tuesday morning?) (Just asking.....)
beginning: I've heard good things about Tuesday Mornings so I decided
mgt: to check it out for myself. The store had a wide variety of home goods, from kitchenware to decor. I was pleasantly surprised by the prices, which were significantly lower than other retailers. The staff was friendly and helpful, making my shopping experience enjoyable. I found some unique items that I couldn't resist. Overall, I left feeling satisfied and excited to return for more treasures!

trgt: Solid 3 1/2 stars.  Sashimi was super fresh.  All the cooked foods were not bad either.
beginning: Solid 3 1/2 stars. Sashimi was super fresh. All the
mgt: "Solid 3 1/2 stars. Sashimi was super fresh. All the seafood was expertly prepared, showcasing vibrant flavors that danced on the palate. The ambiance was cozy, making it a perfect spot for a casual dinner. However, the service was a bit slow, which detracted from the overall experience. I would recommend trying the specialty rolls, as they were a delightful surprise!"

trgt: I had one of the top 5 meals I ever had at Bouchon. Everything I tried was excellent. I even tried things I would never think of ordering (I went with a group so we shared a few starters) and even they amazing. Geat food. Try the pork belly for starters.
beginning: I had one of the top 5 meals I ever
mgt: I had one of the top 5 meals I ever experienced at this charming little restaurant. The flavors were exquisite, each dish beautifully presented and bursting with freshness. The service was impeccable, with staff who were attentive yet unobtrusive. I particularly enjoyed the seared scallops, which were cooked to perfection, paired with a delightful citrus sauce that elevated the entire dish. The ambiance was warm and inviting, making it the perfect setting for a memorable evening. I can't wait to return!

trgt:
I'm not an Alice Cooper fan, but was brought to Alice cooper'stown by a group of coworkers.  We were greeted by a host who was definitely dressed the part, as were all the waitresses.  The restaurant is fairly dark and dingy inside despite the lovely Phoenix sun that could be shining in from the outdoors.   

The service was really slow, and it took a long time between when we ordered and when the food arrived.  I chose the fish tacos, and the fish was overly deep fried, and tasted a but like everything that had been in the fryer.  I didn't really enjoy them at all.

A few people at my table got the brisket, and comments were made about how dry it was, and how it lacked flavour that should be expected of brisket.

Is restaurant seems like it is really gimmicky, however, I'm sure Alice Cooper fans probably appreciate it!
beginning: I'm not an Alice Cooper fan, but was brought to
mgt: "I'm not an Alice Cooper fan, but was brought to his concert by a friend who insisted it would be an unforgettable experience. To my surprise, I found myself captivated by the theatricality of the performance. The stage presence was electric, and the band was tight, delivering a powerful sound that resonated throughout the venue. The elaborate costumes and props added a unique flair, making it more than just a concert; it felt like a full-blown rock opera. I left with a newfound appreciation for his music and showmanship."

trgt: Food is great! BUT... customer service is about the worst I have ever seen. I immediately thought of a skit on The Chappelle Show called \"Pop Copy\" (YouTube it!). It was like they were frustrated that I interrupted whatever what ever they had going on to give them some business. What is unfortunate is I punish myself by going back again and again because their chicken is so good. There is never a greeting, a thank you, a please come again or anything positive. Even when I pull up to the drive through window I receive a look of disgust, like \"why are you bothering me\". Chicken Kings food will only take them so far, at some point I am not going to find their negative attitude humorous.
beginning: Food is great! BUT... customer service is about the worst
mgt: Food is great! BUT... customer service is about the worst I've ever experienced. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, making the dining experience frustrating. It took ages to get our orders taken, and when we finally received our meals, they were incorrect. I really wanted to enjoy my time there, but the lack of attention and care from the team overshadowed the delicious food. I hope they can improve their service because I would love to return for the food alone.

trgt: They have a lot of things you need but let me tell you why my review is so low. I'm a college student, I was up late one night studying and then I went over for some snacks and an energy drink. So they made me wait for ten minutes because of the computers or something like that. There was about 8 other people behind me waiting during those ten minutes and then finally a lady came over so we could get the line moving. She took her sweet time AND she answered her cell phone during the check out! I was so angry because it was rude when we were all wanting to leave. It wasn't an emergency call just a \"hey how ya doin\" call! I must say I have never wanted to not go back to a store as bad as this. They got two stars because they have good food.
beginning: They have a lot of things you need but let
mgt: "They have a lot of things you need but let me tell you, the customer service leaves much to be desired. I waited for assistance for over 20 minutes, and when someone finally arrived, they seemed rushed and uninterested in helping. The selection is impressive, but the shopping experience was frustrating."

trgt: Went here tonight. I bought an ocean blue goblet. It was decent definitely not worth the $36 dollars. Decent place, just extremely pricey.
beginning: Went here tonight. I bought an ocean blue goblet. It
mgt: "was absolutely stunning! The color was vibrant and the craftsmanship was impeccable. I couldn't believe the detail in the design. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, making the shopping experience even better. I can't wait to showcase it at my next dinner party!"

trgt:
A group of 7 of us dined at Bottega on a Saturday night. 

Our table wasn't ready when we arrived, so we waited at the bar. As an apology for the wait, we were each given a complimentary glass of wine. A+ on the customer service!

As an entree, we had calamari, served with lemon.  They were perfectly cooked - the texture was great, but the oil used tasted very mildly burnt. 

The star is the pizza! The margherita and capricciosa were delicious! The crust is thin, crispy on the outside and chewy in the center - amazing. The sauce is simple and clean, and has a rich tomato flavour.  And the cheese .. mmm.
beginning: A group of 7 of us dined at Bottega on
mgt: "A group of 7 of us dined at Bottega on a Saturday evening, and we were thoroughly impressed. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that set the perfect mood for our gathering. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu with great recommendations. We started with the charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and featured a delightful selection of cured meats and artisanal cheeses. For the main course, I opted for the risotto, which was creamy and rich, while others enjoyed the perfectly cooked steak and fresh seafood dishes. Each bite was a testament to the chef's skill. We ended the night with a decadent dessert that left us all wanting more. Overall, Bottega exceeded our expectations, and I can't wait to return!"

trgt:
As usual, I'll dissent a little!  I like this place a lot.  My friend and I have started making this our usual pre-Suns-game stop, and I expect that tradition will continue into baseball season, as well.

I think the pizza has been quite good the two times we've been there.  Granted, I am not at all pretentious about pizza, and think Pizzeria Bianco is a bit of a snobby joke with a great marketing plan.  So give me a big greasy, pepperoni-covered slice that I can fold in half and I am good to go.  

The beer (Mich Ultra or Bud Light only) is $10 a pitcher.  How can you go wrong, especially with the beer prices at US Airways or Chase Field?  Granted, it's not high-end craft beer, but it's TEN BLOODY DOLLARS.  Hell, bring me two!

I like the owner, in contrast to some of the other comments.  The guy cracks me up.  Some folks came in and breezed right by the "Order Here" sign and started yapping at him.  He walked over to the sign, flicked it with his finger and said, "Sign says order here."  Excellent!  And when he closed just prior to the Suns game, some people snuck in and ordered, then tried to haggle on the price since it was closing time.  Owner says, "Hey, I'm already feeding ya after closing time.  Now ya want a deal, too?"  I love this guy!

Anyway, I think this is a fun place with some personality.  Great place to grab a slice or two and a pitcher before a game.  You pizza connoisseurs can wait three hours for a pie at Bianco.  I shall wait for you at Brooklyn with a full stomach and second pitcher, as I blissfully watch the sports fans go by.
beginning: As usual, I'll dissent a little! I like this place
mgt: "As usual, I'll dissent a little! I like this place, but I feel it could use some improvements. The ambiance is charming, yet the service can be hit or miss. On my last visit, the staff seemed overwhelmed, which affected the overall experience. However, the food was delicious and well-prepared, making it worth a return trip. I just hope they can streamline their service to match the quality of their dishes."

trgt: I went once before...it was cold and guess what I guess they don't know what fire is. Because the eggs was served to me cold yet again. And I got up and walked out. I wont pay for bad service nor will I pay for cold food. Don't go to this location. EVER...and if you do remember I told you the eggs would be stone cold :(
beginning: I went once before...it was cold and guess what I
mgt: "I went once before...it was cold and guess what I found? The atmosphere was lacking warmth, both in temperature and service. The staff seemed overwhelmed, and it took ages to get our orders. The food, while decent, didn’t quite make up for the chilly experience. I hoped for a cozy meal, but instead, I left feeling disappointed. I might give it another chance in warmer weather, but for now, I’m not rushing back."

trgt: The lobster roll was so yummy I actually finished the whole thing! Had a bite of the sliders my girlfriend ordered and it was also very tasty.  My fianc\u00e9 ordered the prime beef, he didn't enjoy it as much as he has hoped.. It was a little bland and chewy. Standard quality cocktails, nothing to write home about. Overall satisfactory dining experience.
beginning: The lobster roll was so yummy I actually finished the
mgt: The lobster roll was so yummy I actually finished the entire thing in record time. The fresh lobster meat was perfectly seasoned, and the buttery, toasted bun added a delightful crunch. Each bite was a burst of flavor, making it hard to resist ordering another. The accompanying fries were crispy and golden, complementing the dish beautifully. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience that I can't wait to repeat!

trgt: Came here awhile back and haven't gotten around to writing a review till now. I was NOT a fan. Moment i walked in I stood there for awhile feeling like an idiot cause no one greeted me or showed me where to sit. My boyfriend and I eventually just picked a spot and waited for a server to flag down. Eventually an older gentleman with an accent came up to us and gave us menus. I ordered a pitcher of white sangria. It wasn't bad but it wasn't very good either. To be honest, the food was completely un-memorable that I forgot everything we had ordered. I just remember being excited for the bacon wrapped dates because I love them over at Firefly. Well it was not like Firefly's dates. They were soggy and incredibly salty. The server also never came back again and when he eventually did come around to give us our check, it looked like he was in the middle of eating something. I quickly paid and got the hell out of there. I haven't been back since and I probably never will. If they fixed their customer service and cleaned up their dishes a bit, they could probably do well. I guess I'll never know.
beginning: Came here awhile back and haven't gotten around to writing
mgt: "Came here awhile back and haven't gotten around to writing my review until now. The atmosphere was inviting, with a cozy vibe that made me feel right at home. The staff were friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. I ordered the special of the day, and it was absolutely delicious—flavorful and beautifully presented. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!"

trgt:
Is RA Sushi owned by a white guy?

FOOD: If your looking for authentic Asian flavor, you're on the wrong end of Spring Mountain. RA is a fancified, Americanized Japanese restaurant. And no, fancified is not a real word. Every time I come here, I'm surrounded by modern california rolls that look like Bobby Flay threw up on them. I usually order nigiri during happy hour. Fish quality isn't that great --just saying.

RA "CHIPS & SALSA: GOOD! Basically tuna tar tar and its surprisingly good.
SPICY CHICKEN YAKISOBA: soggy udon noodles, not spicy
EDAMAME: some days they're hot, some days they're cold
NIGIRI: not the freshest, fish to rice ratio bites
ROLLS: lots of mayo, creamcheese, or some strange salsa thrown on it

DRINKS: Full bar. Happy Hour specials for Sake & Beer (for sake bombs) is a good deal!

SERVICE: BAD FOR GROUPS! The only time I'm here is for group functions. The servers are easily confused. They always run out of shot glasses for sake bombs. They forget to refill waters and drinks.

SPLITTING CHECKS: For large groups, our server made a check for every 3-4 people. Not too difficult. However, for groups over 6 people, gratuity is automatically calculated 20% each check. This is WAY TOO MUCH for these incompetent servers.

Food isn't bad. Its just not the type of Japanese I'm used to eating. Think 'real' Mexican food in comparison to Taco Bell. My non-asian friends like it here. My asian friends do not.
beginning: Is RA Sushi owned by a white guy?\n\nFOOD: If your
mgt:
Is RA Sushi owned by a white guy?

FOOD: If your idea of sushi is a vibrant fusion of flavors and creative presentations, then RA Sushi delivers. The rolls are inventive, with options like the "RAckin' Shrimp" and "Dancing Eel" that tantalize the taste buds. The freshness of the fish is commendable, and the atmosphere is lively, making it a great spot for both casual dining and celebrations. However, some traditionalists might find the offerings a bit too eclectic for their taste. Overall, it's a fun experience, but purists may want to seek out more authentic sushi spots.

trgt: We went to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our waitress brought out a piece of chocolate cake for him at the end of dinner. It was completely unprompted so we thought it was complimentary, until we realized she charged us for it on our bill... Who does that?
beginning: We went to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our waitress brought
mgt: We went to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our waitress brought us a delightful selection of appetizers that were bursting with flavor. The atmosphere was lively, and the decor added a charming touch to the evening. Each dish was beautifully presented, and the staff was attentive without being intrusive. We especially enjoyed the signature cocktails, which perfectly complemented our meal. Overall, it was a memorable experience, and we left feeling satisfied and eager to return.

trgt: The manager, a man, was very kind. The staff could not accommodate a simple v design for my nails saying they could only do it in gel.  That it would take too much time... after I had already made an appointment and was 30 min early. The nail tech didn't speak to me at all. Very cold and aluff  feeling. The work was good, but I asked on the phone to have nail art. Not impressed at all! Not happy at all. I was referred to bond first,  and I should have gone there.
beginning: The manager, a man, was very kind. The staff could
mgt: "The manager, a man, was very kind. The staff could not have been more accommodating, always ready to assist with a smile. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it a perfect place to relax. I particularly enjoyed the attention to detail in the decor, which added a charming touch to the overall experience. I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for excellent service and a welcoming environment."

trgt: If god was to open the heavens and deliver us a fast food joint right  in the heart of the city then this place is it .. let me reiterate if your on yelp and your looking for a place to fill your gullet with the best tasting fast food ever then this place it is .. again 1 more time STOP SEARCHING AND EAT HERE.
beginning: If god was to open the heavens and deliver us
mgt: "If God was to open the heavens and deliver us a message, it would surely be a reminder of the beauty and fragility of life. This film captures that essence perfectly, weaving together moments of joy and sorrow in a way that resonates deeply. The performances are heartfelt, and the cinematography is breathtaking, transporting the audience to a world that feels both familiar and extraordinary. Each scene is crafted with care, leaving viewers reflecting on their own experiences long after the credits roll."

trgt: I really liked the wide selection of beers that they offered! However I do think they need more seating for busier nights!
beginning: I really liked the wide selection of beers that they
mgt: "I really liked the wide selection of beers that they offered, ranging from local craft brews to international favorites. Each option was thoughtfully curated, allowing me to explore different flavors and styles. The staff was knowledgeable and eager to recommend pairings, enhancing the overall experience. The atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, making it a perfect spot to unwind with friends. I can't wait to return and try more of their unique offerings!"

trgt:
We stopped in on a Saturday night after seeing the sign.  We were going to grab some sushi but hadn't noticed Caña before and wanted to try it seeing as we're fans of tapas.

Lots of small plates meant to be shared.  We ordered a salad, meatballs, hamachi ceviche, crab ceviche, churros, Cuban sliders, ahi tuna flatbread, and several drinks.

Drinks were great.  Food was excellent.  However, the ceviche isn't really ceviche if that's what you're looking for.  The hamachi was sliced sashimi style with an delicious dressing.  Crab was more like a crab salad and had a metallic taste as if it were canned.  The crab ceviche was the only dish that wasn't excellent.

Service is good.  Definitely a good place for groups.  It's rather noisy so be warned.  Can't wait for the weather to warm up so we can try the outside patios.
beginning: We stopped in on a Saturday night after seeing the
mgt: "We stopped in on a Saturday night after seeing the glowing reviews online, and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was vibrant, filled with laughter and the enticing aroma of delicious food. We were promptly seated and greeted by a friendly server who guided us through the menu. The highlight of the evening was the signature dish, which was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. Each bite was a delightful experience, leaving us eager to return for more."

trgt: It was close to 10pm midweek in Vegas and we were both starving and desperately needing something for dinner. We walked past this restaurant and decided to give it a shot. The decor was beautiful and from the moment we walked in the service was superb. Looking at the menu I was excited to try a number of things. I settled on their house sangria, bbq chicken pizza and the blue cheese truffle chips. As soon as J heard that red snapper was the fish special of the day he knew he had to order it. We were both really impressed with the truffle chips, they melted in my mouth and I could have made an entire meal out of them. When we got our entrees I dug into the bbq chicken pizza which was good but nothing outstanding. J's excitement about the red snapper quickly faded when he realized it was completely raw on the inside. We notified the server and he quickly whisked it away to get a new piece of fish cooked. About 15 minutes later he came back with another piece of fish and had J cut into it while he was standing there and sure enough the fish was raw again. Another 15 minutes later he came back out and the fish was no longer raw (yay) but as J was eating it he didn't have much to say except for the fact that it was now so overcooked that it was dry and had lost most of the flavor. By this time it was late, he was hungry and didn't want to wait for yet another piece of fish so he still ate it. A few minutes after finishing our entrees we got a surprise from our server who brought us coffee and a phenomenal chocolate souffle on the house due to the errors with the fish. It was a really nice touch by our server because he truly did seem frustrated for us with how messed up the fish kept being. I want to try this place again next time we are in Vegas because the service was top notch, but hopefully the food will be more consistent next time
beginning: It was close to 10pm midweek in Vegas and we
mgt: "It was close to 10pm midweek in Vegas and we found ourselves wandering the neon-lit streets, searching for a late-night bite. The energy was electric, with laughter and music spilling from nearby casinos. We stumbled upon a cozy little diner that promised comfort food and a warm atmosphere. The burgers were juicy, and the milkshakes were thick and creamy, just what we needed to recharge. The staff was friendly, making us feel right at home amidst the chaos of the Strip."

trgt: Not a fan-the prime rib burger was good but most of the burgers are just awful. This location is unique as it has a Green Burrito in it too so you can get a taco salad some burittos or whatever floats your boat. I like the taco salad but havent eaten here in years.
beginning: Not a fan-the prime rib burger was good but most
mgt: Not a fan—the prime rib burger was good, but most of the other dishes fell flat. The fries were soggy, and the service was slow. I expected more from this place based on the hype. The atmosphere was nice, but it didn't make up for the lackluster food. I might give it another try, but only if I hear improvements have been made.

trgt:
This place has no idea about what it wants to be.

It advertises itself as mens clothing, but there is plenty of girls clothing too. The styles in OBC have  no coherance at all, they are all over the place - one minute you can be looking at emo/indie style tshirts and jeans, then two steps to your left you can be looking at sparkly ball gowns and the like. Really odd.

I think the main compalint I have however is how expensive this place can be - you are much better off going to Princes Street.
beginning: This place has no idea about what it wants to
mgt: "This place has no idea about what it wants to be. The ambiance is confusing, swinging between trendy and outdated. The service was inconsistent, with staff seeming overwhelmed and unsure. While the menu offers a variety of options, the execution fell flat, leaving much to be desired. Overall, it felt like a missed opportunity, lacking a clear identity."

trgt: This place sucks! Been there a few times and it has sucked every time. Wait staff is rude and slow. Food quality is poor. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
beginning: This place sucks! Been there a few times and it
mgt: "This place sucks! Been there a few times and it never fails to disappoint. The service is slow, and the staff seems disinterested. The food is mediocre at best, often arriving cold and poorly presented. I expected more for the prices they charge. Save your money and go somewhere else!"

trgt:
My newly wedded wife and I were really looking forward to enjoying a great meal at Craftsteak.  We are both fans of Tom Colicho on Top Chef and it was going to be a treat.  However, we were quite a bit disappointed.

The restaurant itself was very nice and had a great ambiance.  I loved the decoration and the way the restaurant was laid out.  It had a very open floor plan but was very quiet.  The tables and chairs were awesome!  

We had the fall tasting menu for $75/person which consisted of the hanger steak, the wagyu steak, and the scallops.  The presentation of the dishes were in very nice looking skillets and the steaks and the scallops looked absolutely delicious.  However, when we started tasting it, I have to admit that the best dish was not the wagyu steak but the hanger steak.  The wagyu steak was cold and chewy.  I had expected a "melt in your mouth" sensation but didn't get any of that.

All the other dishes were great.  The appetizers were very good and the desserts were very good as well.  However, their signature steak dish really disappointed me.

The main reason I gave the restaurant 3 stars was really the service.  When we were first seated, we got great service.  Our water was never empty and our server was very attentive.  About 1 hour into our dinner, 2 large groups came and sat down in the tables next to ours.  From that point on, I could not get anybody's attention and had to consistently ask for water or service.  That was very disappointing for such a top rated restaurant.  Incidentally, I felt that I got better service at the Burger Bar at Mandalay bay.
beginning: My newly wedded wife and I were really looking forward
mgt: "My newly wedded wife and I were really looking forward to our honeymoon getaway. The destination was breathtaking, with stunning views and a serene atmosphere. Each day was filled with adventure, from exploring hidden beaches to enjoying romantic dinners under the stars. The local cuisine was a delightful surprise, bursting with flavors that we couldn't get enough of. Overall, it was a perfect blend of relaxation and excitement, making our first trip as a married couple truly unforgettable."

trgt:
Not going to lie, not big on Thai or Chinese food, but I was with others who chose the place and tagged along. I am always good with fried rice, love that stuff, but this kind was not great. The chicken was dry, no egg in it really, and overloaded with onions and scallions that those flavors just kind of took over. 

Others may enjoy, but if you like fried rice do not waste your taste buds on this one. 

In the end the service was good. The family there was really nice and thoughtful and they do have specials, happy hour, and I guess karaoke on some night of the week. 

Never hurts to try.
beginning: Not going to lie, not big on Thai or Chinese
mgt: Not going to lie, not big on Thai or Chinese, but this restaurant completely changed my perspective. The flavors were vibrant and authentic, with each dish beautifully presented. The Pad Thai was a delightful balance of sweet and savory, while the dumplings were perfectly steamed. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I might just become a fan after all!

trgt: Horrible experience.  The cashiers looked like they were miserable, which made me miserable.  When we told them that we ordered an iced coffee rather than a hot one, she just dumped the drink in the trash and proceeded to make a new one without saying a word.  HORRIBLE!
beginning: Horrible experience. The cashiers looked like they were miserable, which
mgt: "Horrible experience. The cashiers looked like they were miserable, which made the atmosphere incredibly unwelcoming. It felt like an inconvenience to be there, and the service was painfully slow. I waited far too long for my order, and when it finally arrived, it was incorrect. Overall, I left feeling frustrated and unlikely to return."

trgt: Sweet potato tots are great. Burger was good as well.
beginning: Sweet potato tots are great. Burger was good as well.
mgt: Sweet potato tots are great. Burger was good as well. The flavors blended perfectly, and the seasoning on the tots was spot on. The burger was juicy and cooked to perfection, with fresh toppings that added a nice crunch. The atmosphere was cozy, making it a perfect spot for a casual meal. I’ll definitely be coming back to try more items on the menu!

trgt: This was uhm... interesting. We had friends come down to visit us from Michigan and we were looking for someplace decent to eat and planned on going to a strip club afterwards... went to tix4tonight and came across Treasures-50% entrees, free admission to stripclub, and free limo! We figure sure why not! its everything in one, plus a free limo! The restaurant and strip club were in one building, but the restaurant part took over half of the building and the stripclub was in the other half.The food was alright, but it was weird trying to eat, and strippers kept walking by to get to the table behind us (im assuming a bachelor party maybe?) I dont exactly enjoy eating with naked ladies in my presence haha but hey, I guess some guys enjoy that. No regrets though, it was an interesting experience. checked out the stripclub for a little bit after food, but it wasnt that great at all. We left pretty quick.
beginning: This was uhm... interesting. We had friends come down to
