Go to the other places around this area, they are 10-20/hr. What a waste of $100 and now I probably need to see a chiropractor to fix my back because of these people.  So I just said F* this place and walked out. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!!!!!
beginning: WORST MASSAGE OF MY LIFE! I literally left in tears,
mgt: "WORST MASSAGE OF MY LIFE! I literally left in tears. The therapist seemed rushed and didn't listen to my concerns at all. Instead of relaxation, I felt more tense and uncomfortable. The atmosphere was chaotic, and the room was too noisy. I expected a soothing experience, but it was anything but that. I would never recommend this place to anyone!"

trgt: I love BBQ, and always went to Famous Dave's.  Looking for a new BBQ place, I found Li'l Porgy.  My first impression when I first entered the establishment was disappointment.  It was small, dull, and not clean.  I did hope that the food would be good, but it was another disappointment.  I ordered rip tips and it smelled bad.  I haven't been back there ever since.
beginning: I love BBQ, and always went to Famous Dave's. Looking
mgt: "I love BBQ, and always went to Famous Dave's. Looking for a new spot, I decided to try Smoky Joe's. The moment I walked in, the aroma of smoked meats filled the air, instantly making my mouth water. The brisket was tender and flavorful, while the ribs fell off the bone. The sides, especially the coleslaw, complemented the meal perfectly. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. I can't wait to return!"

trgt: This steakhouse really shows its age, in a sad way. Food and service are overrated. Tourists may still go there, along with people who equate dull with reassuring.\n\nDo avoid, unless you're invited or dating the wrong person.
beginning: This steakhouse really shows its age, in a sad way.
mgt: This steakhouse really shows its age, in a sad way. The decor feels outdated, with worn-out booths and dim lighting that does little to create a welcoming atmosphere. The menu, while extensive, lacks creativity and innovation, offering the same tired options that have been around for decades. Service was slow, and our server seemed overwhelmed, which only added to the overall disappointment. While the steaks were cooked to the right temperature, they lacked the flavor and seasoning one would expect from a place that prides itself on its meat. Overall, it feels like this establishment is coasting on past glory rather than striving for excellence.

trgt: Place kills it!\nGreat service and awesome pho Fasho...\nGood boba selection. The little homie who works the floor is coo as heck. The coolest thing about this place is that is clean clean..
beginning: Place kills it!\nGreat service and awesome pho Fasho...\nGood boba selection.
mgt:
Place kills it!  
Great service and awesome pho Fasho...  
Good boba selection. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a casual meal. The flavors in the pho are rich and authentic, and the portions are generous. I highly recommend trying the beef brisket; it melts in your mouth! The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Overall, a must-visit for any pho lover!

trgt: Imagine, a brewpub without its own brews! How quaint! How.....stupid. We laughed this one up as yet another Las Vegas scam, however unintentional.   No reason to go here.  Not one.
beginning: Imagine, a brewpub without its own brews! How quaint! How.....stupid.
mgt: Imagine, a brewpub without its own brews! How quaint! How.....stupid. It’s like a bakery that doesn’t bake bread. The atmosphere was lively, but the lack of house-made beer left a gaping hole in the experience. Instead, they offered a selection of commercial beers that felt uninspired and generic. The food was decent, but without a signature brew to pair it with, the whole concept fell flat. I left feeling disappointed, wishing for a true craft experience that never materialized.

trgt: mmmmm....yummy food! Did not except such good food to be honest.
beginning: mmmmm....yummy food! Did not except such good food to be
mgt: "mmmmm....yummy food! Did not expect such good food to be served in this cozy little spot. The flavors were vibrant and fresh, each dish beautifully presented. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend the grilled salmon and the homemade desserts—they were simply divine! Can't wait to come back for more!"

trgt: Pretty good, but food wasn't very fresh. I kinda felt sick afterward...but it was a lot of choices...and good if you just want taste and not quality.
beginning: Pretty good, but food wasn't very fresh. I kinda felt
mgt: "Pretty good, but food wasn't very fresh. I kinda felt disappointed, especially considering the high expectations based on the reviews. The flavors were decent, but the lack of freshness really affected the overall experience. Service was friendly, and the ambiance was nice, but I would hesitate to return unless I heard improvements had been made."

trgt: Lets see 1st the TV and toilet were broke when i got there , I drove in from LA got there late just wanted to sleep , they were going to send someone up to fix this stuff while i waited. I convinced them into giving me a new room. I  go to my truck to drive to the convention i was doing , and discover my truck was broken into , my gps, sub woofer, skateboard , and everything else that wast bolted down was stolen.. so security in the parking garage was horrible.   I gambled for 5 straight hours on a saturday night and not one person asked me if i wanted a drink .The last day when i checked out I told the guy at the front desk how un happy i was about the gold coast experience , and he looked at me and shrugged ... no offer of anything to make me feel better..  the one star i gave it was based on the fact that i won a little cash ... \nI seriously advise anyone looking for a hotel in vegas to stay clear from this place . I work in the entertainment business and travel all over , and this by far is the most horrible hotel experience I've ever encountered . If you want to have a fun time in vegas ..STAY SOME WHERE ELSE!!!
beginning: Lets see 1st the TV and toilet were broke when
mgt: "Let's see, 1st the TV and toilet were broke when we arrived, which was incredibly frustrating. The staff was slow to respond to our complaints, and it took hours for maintenance to fix the issues. Additionally, the room was not as clean as expected, with dust in the corners and stains on the carpet. Overall, the experience was disappointing and did not meet our expectations for a relaxing getaway."

trgt:
Stopped in for a quick lunch during the week based on the good reviews of the place.  Service was quick and friendly. Ordered a lunch combo (spicy noodle?) with tofu.  The soup that came with it was a little sad... it was about 2 spoonfuls, no kidding.  

Rest of the food came quickly and looked much more promising than the soup, however I took a bite of the spring roll and immediately realized that this would NOT be my #1 thai place, nor #52 on the list.

The spring roll was cold (yes, cold, not even lukewarm) and so was some of the tofu throughout the dish.  The dish itself had good flavor, but the random cold pieces of tofu were a turn off to say the least.  Disappointing meal & I won't be returning.
beginning: Stopped in for a quick lunch during the week based
mgt: "Stopped in for a quick lunch during the week based on a friend's recommendation. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, perfect for a casual meal. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, which was juicy and flavorful, paired with a side of crispy fries. The service was prompt and friendly, making the experience even better. I’ll definitely be returning to try more items from the menu!"

trgt:
This park is hidden in a residential area, so if you're not specifically searching for it, you will miss it.  It's a one-way road from the entrance so, again, be on the look-out for the park.  Parking is plentiful.

Once you do get to the park, it's nice.  There are two runs, one for large dogs and one for small dogs, though the distinction here is 25lbs up or down while at other parks I've seen it's 35lbs up or down.  

Anyway, the runs are long and fairly wide, and there is seating for the people.  The times I've gone it's always been very quiet, just me, the furball, and maybe another two or three people and dogs.  The people and dogs that I've run into have been really friendly though, so kudos to dog-park hospitality.  

It's a solid dog park and it asks for returns, I just would like to have more dogs and people present.
beginning: This park is hidden in a residential area, so if
mgt: "This park is hidden in a residential area, so if you’re not looking for it, you might just miss it. However, once you find it, you’ll be pleasantly surprised by its serene atmosphere and well-maintained trails. The lush greenery and vibrant flowers create a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Families can enjoy the playground, while nature lovers can explore the winding paths. It’s a great spot for a picnic or a quiet afternoon with a book."

trgt: Mmmm... First time here. Foods amazing!!! cant wait to go back!!
beginning: Mmmm... First time here. Foods amazing!!! cant wait to go
mgt: "Mmmm... First time here. Foods amazing!!! Can't wait to go back! The flavors were vibrant, and every dish was beautifully presented. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. I highly recommend the signature dish; it was a true standout. Overall, a fantastic dining experience!"

trgt: I used to love it here. For years it was the best burger in town. But, I have to say the last couple times we've been here I've been really disappointed. The burger is BLAND now. I have to take this place off the list, too bad. Houston's/Hillstone burger has never disappointed, so we'll be going there from now on.
beginning: I used to love it here. For years it was
mgt: "I used to love it here. For years it was my go-to spot for relaxation and good food. The atmosphere was inviting, and the staff always greeted me with a warm smile. However, my recent visits have been disappointing. The service has become slow, and the quality of the dishes has declined significantly. I hope they can return to their former glory."

trgt: Great wrap. I would return. This will probably be my new breakfast spot I take visitors.
beginning: Great wrap. I would return. This will probably be my
mgt: "new go-to spot for lunch. The flavors were vibrant, and the ingredients tasted fresh. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. I especially loved the spicy sauce they offered on the side. Can't wait to try more options on the menu!"

trgt:
I was expecting more of a bakery, but it is primarily a coffee shop that serves a small selection of baked goods and sandwiches.  We ordered a pair of blueberry muffins, a coffee and a chocolate chip cookie.  The muffins were nothing special, the coffee was good and they initially forgot to serve me the cookie.  I ended up with both my original cookie plus a second one as an apology.  The cookies were mediocre and very much overpriced unless you get a 2nd one free.  LOL

Overall, it was an okay experience but not one I expect to experience again.

A rating of 2.5 would be more appropriate.
beginning: I was expecting more of a bakery, but it is
mgt: "I was expecting more of a bakery, but it is actually a delightful café that serves an impressive array of pastries and coffee. The ambiance is cozy, making it a perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant experience. I particularly enjoyed their almond croissant, which was flaky and filled with just the right amount of almond paste. Overall, a charming place worth visiting!"

trgt:
This is a great little place.   It is located on the royal mile, the street you take to get to the castle.   
The waiter we had was very friendly and helpful. Iglesias gave good recommendations and his thoughts on the menu items.  
He took excellent care of us even though he was extremely busy.  
I had the haggis with nipps and tats aid haggis with turnips and mashed potatoes.  
My partner had the pulled pork pizza.   Both items were very well priced and filling.   
We will stop back in here before we head home.
beginning: This is a great little place. It is located on
mgt: "This is a great little place. It is located on a charming street, surrounded by quaint shops and cafes. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it perfect for a cozy meal or a casual coffee break. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant experience. I highly recommend trying their signature dish, which is both flavorful and beautifully presented. Overall, a delightful spot that I will definitely return to!"

trgt: This is absolutely the worst customer service experience I have ever had in my entire life.  From the moment that I stepped into the door, I was greeted by nothing but the cold shoulder and the tapping of text messages being sent.  Words to the owner about surviving in retail, the business is all about how you treat the people who walk in.
beginning: This is absolutely the worst customer service experience I have
mgt: ever encountered. From the moment I walked in, the staff were unhelpful and dismissive. My questions were met with eye rolls, and it took forever to get assistance. I left feeling frustrated and undervalued as a customer. I will not be returning.

trgt: Food is great. Prices are through the roof. \nHostess is usually high on something and uses the \"F\" word in every sentence. Also hogs the tables for annoyingly long time. We are there to eat not be your best \"F\" buddies!!!!
beginning: Food is great. Prices are through the roof. \nHostess is
mgt:
"Food is great. Prices are through the roof.  
Hostess is friendly but seemed overwhelmed during peak hours. The ambiance is nice, but the wait times can be frustrating. Overall, the quality of the dishes makes it worth a visit, though I wish the prices were more reasonable."

trgt: A little too dark but still a nice place. Forgot what drink I ordered but it was tasty. Its a small  setting and good for small group of friends to have a few drinks. Very relaxed atmosphere.
beginning: A little too dark but still a nice place. Forgot
mgt: to mention the cozy atmosphere that makes it inviting. The staff were friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant experience. The menu offered a variety of delicious options, and the drinks were well-crafted. Overall, it’s a great spot for a casual night out.

trgt:
Granted, it's Hooters.  And Hooters in Vegas is ten times worse than anything you can possibly imagine.  However in this economy customer service is essential for a business to thrive.  The valet attendant who simply drove our vehicle and left the car without saying anything to us and didn't offer to assist with luggage made the choice of tip amount simple.  Zero.  Because he didn't even say a word to us as he walked by, presumably to take his smoke break.  

The pool is open 24/7 all year round, however it's all guys there, and I'd hate to even think of the sperm count contained within.  The only women at that pool are the hooters girls, and they're paid to flirt with you.  You're not that funny.  In fact, watching you from my window I saw most of the waitresses avoiding you after hassling them for your fifth picture and yelling, "sluts!"

The next door neighbors violently vomiting (with the door open?) until 5 am is to be expected in Vegas at a "red neck haven" such as this one.  If you can afford to go somewhere else, do so.  Otherwise, stay home, save your money and buy a pair of shoes.

That said, the servers were nice.  You have to be respectful to them and you may get the same waitress back to the table more than once.  If you're a d-bag or harassing, it seems they'll send a different one to take over.
beginning: Granted, it's Hooters. And Hooters in Vegas is ten times
mgt: "Granted, it's Hooters. And Hooters in Vegas is ten times more vibrant than anywhere else. The atmosphere is electric, with bright lights and a lively crowd. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure your drinks are always full. The wings are a must-try, crispy and flavorful, paired perfectly with their signature sauces. While the menu is typical for a Hooters, the energy of the Vegas location elevates the experience. It's a fun spot to unwind after a long day of exploring the Strip."

trgt: The fries were terrible, there are no free refills, burger was just ok, and they have false advertising with the free milk shake!! Don't eat here ever!!!!
beginning: The fries were terrible, there are no free refills, burger
mgt: The fries were terrible, there are no free refills, burger was overcooked and dry. The service was slow, and the atmosphere felt uninviting. I expected much more for the price. Overall, a disappointing experience that I won’t be repeating.

trgt: i love the outlets. It has more shopping selections i love.
beginning: i love the outlets. It has more shopping selections i
mgt: "I love the outlets. It has more shopping selections than I could have imagined! From high-end brands to affordable finds, there's something for everyone. The atmosphere is vibrant, and the layout makes it easy to navigate. Plus, the discounts are unbeatable! I always leave with great deals and a smile on my face. Highly recommend for a fun shopping day!"

trgt: A bar that charges you $15-$45 to get in and won't allow you to take pictures, but then charges you $20 a photo? FAIL
beginning: A bar that charges you $15-$45 to get in and
mgt: "A bar that charges you $15-$45 to get in and then offers overpriced drinks is a tough sell. While the ambiance is trendy and the music is lively, the value just isn't there. The cocktails, though beautifully crafted, often lack the depth of flavor you'd expect for the price. If you're looking for a place to impress friends, it might work, but be prepared to spend a small fortune for a night out."

trgt: Man this place is pretty darn yummy. The ice cream here is so dense and creamy. I can't imagine having any size bigger than their smallest size. It definitely hits the spot during those hot AZ summer nights.
beginning: Man this place is pretty darn yummy. The ice cream
mgt: "Man this place is pretty darn yummy. The ice cream is incredibly creamy and comes in a variety of unique flavors. I tried the lavender honey and it was a delightful surprise—floral yet sweet. The staff is friendly and always ready to offer samples, which makes choosing a flavor even more fun. The atmosphere is cozy, perfect for a casual hangout with friends or a sweet treat after dinner. I can't wait to come back and try more!"

trgt: Great specials.  The food is light and is not greasy at all.  Taste very fresh.  Would visit again
beginning: Great specials. The food is light and is not greasy
mgt: "Great specials. The food is light and is not greasy, making it a perfect choice for those looking for healthier options. The flavors are vibrant and fresh, with each dish beautifully presented. The staff is attentive and friendly, enhancing the overall dining experience. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal salad and the grilled fish, both of which were cooked to perfection. I can't wait to return and try more from the menu!"

trgt: I love this park, first of all it's huge!  They have just about everything here (a dog park, sand volleyball courts, picnic pavilions, BBQ grills, playground, and a lot of free space with Actual Grass!). There is just about everything you would need for a great picnic or a game of football with some friends.  I usually run through here a lot and there is just a great atmosphere in the park, so check it out for yourself and have a great day!
beginning: I love this park, first of all it's huge! They
mgt: "I love this park, first of all it's huge! They have plenty of walking trails, beautiful gardens, and picnic areas. The playground is fantastic for kids, and the open spaces are perfect for a game of frisbee or a relaxing afternoon. The scenery is breathtaking, especially during sunset. It's a great place to unwind and connect with nature."

trgt: Great large chopped salad and toasted ravioli
beginning: Great large chopped salad and toasted ravioli
mgt: "Great large chopped salad and toasted ravioli! The freshness of the ingredients in the salad really stood out, with vibrant colors and a perfect balance of flavors. The toasted ravioli were crispy on the outside and filled with a delicious cheesy mixture that paired wonderfully with the marinara sauce. Overall, a delightful dining experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a satisfying meal!"

trgt: I visited Scottdale with the kids---was very happy initially to find a place that was easy on the wallet.  But then I ordered the Corn Beef Hash (recommended by the waittress), and WOW---that was just a wonderful experience that I will definitely revisit next time I'm in the neighborhood!
beginning: I visited Scottdale with the kids---was very happy initially to
mgt: "I visited Scottdale with the kids---was very happy initially to find a variety of family-friendly activities. The parks were well-maintained, and the playgrounds offered plenty of space for the kids to run around. We enjoyed a lovely picnic by the lake, and the local ice cream shop was a hit. However, I did notice some areas could use more shade and seating for parents. Overall, it was a delightful day, and I would definitely recommend it for families looking for a fun outing."

trgt: Great place on Tuesday for cheap tacos and beers.  The outdoor patio is awesome when the weather is nice.
beginning: Great place on Tuesday for cheap tacos and beers. The
mgt: Great place on Tuesday for cheap tacos and beers. The atmosphere is lively, with friendly staff and a vibrant crowd. The tacos are flavorful, with a variety of fillings to choose from, and the beer selection is impressive. Perfect for a casual night out with friends!

trgt: Very expensive I came here for a car was with a $10 coupon and they wanted $11 more for interior clean. So I got exterior only. Didn't fininsh the drying, had to drive my own car through the wash. Don't think I would go there again.
beginning: Very expensive I came here for a car was with
mgt: "Very expensive. I came here for a car and was with high hopes, but the prices were far beyond my budget. The selection was decent, but I felt pressured to make a quick decision. The staff was friendly, yet I couldn't shake the feeling that I was being upsold on features I didn't need. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and still in search of a more affordable option."

trgt: Stayed in the hotel for a 3 day softball tournament. The location is great, but it's just not the cleanest. The place just looks like management doesn't care anymore. The hotel smells. The bungalows were a little better, but the view of the empty pool & raggedy resort area with construction tape everywhere left a lot to be desired. \n\nI complained, moved rooms, and even asked the room to be cleaned again, but their idea of presentation and mine are very different. Next time, I'll just spend the extra money.
beginning: Stayed in the hotel for a 3 day softball tournament.
mgt: "Stayed in the hotel for a 3 day softball tournament. The location was perfect, just a short drive from the fields. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, making check-in a breeze. Our room was clean and spacious, with all the amenities we needed. The complimentary breakfast each morning was a nice touch, offering a variety of options to fuel us for the day ahead. Overall, it was a great experience, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to other teams traveling for tournaments."

trgt: This place has pretty nice decor when you walk in, we can here for lunch and got the lunch specials, which was very inexpensive and a pretty good deal. Comes with soup, salad and soda for $6.95. my bf ordered the pad thai and I got the chicken with bell  peppers and basil. It was just bleh and ok to my taste. They gave us hot mustard which I felt was very chinese and not too thai authentic.
beginning: This place has pretty nice decor when you walk in,
mgt: "This place has pretty nice decor when you walk in, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The lighting is soft, and the furniture is stylish yet comfortable. The staff greeted us with friendly smiles, making us feel welcome right away. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, and everything we tried was flavorful and well-presented. Overall, a delightful dining experience that I would recommend to anyone looking for a cozy spot to enjoy a meal."

trgt:
Second visit to Fresh Wasabi back in early September... 

Arizona Rolls, fabulous... As I previously stated, we are not sushi fans, I must amend, we were not sushi fans, we are beginning to be now... And the Arizona Roll is what brought us around!  Very fresh, firm but not sticky rice that was also very light.  The Wasabi was full of flavor but not too hot.  We do wish they had given us a little more though...

Calamari... It was ok, it was chewy, rubbery, over cooked.  The batter was really good and the sauce was tasty and this was the saving grace. Once the calamari cooled though, it was just gross...

Udon noodles, again, very hot, Momma said too hot and based on my prior experience with them, I have to agree.  The broth was fabulous, again, and the yummies in the dish were just that, yummy!  I still think it needed more meat, but it is a noodle dish...

Spicy chicken dinner combo... Wish the chicken pieces were bigger but the spices and sauce were phenomenal!!!!!!  Portion was really good and plentiful without being too much...

As with last time, for some reason I have a hard time pin-pointing, the service was lacking.  We got drink refills and it was reasonably attentive, but something was missing... At least this time there was no dissertation on bento boxes and sushi... Wish I could figure out what it was... Just off somehow... 

Overall, they earned a star over last visit and we will be back, no doubt!
beginning: Second visit to Fresh Wasabi back in early September... \n\nArizona
mgt:
Second visit to Fresh Wasabi back in early September... 

Arizona's vibrant culinary scene continues to impress, and Fresh Wasabi is no exception. The sushi was incredibly fresh, with each piece expertly crafted. The ambiance was inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual dining and special occasions. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations. I particularly enjoyed the spicy tuna roll and the unique wasabi-infused dishes. Overall, a delightful experience that left me eager to return for more!

trgt: Stay away from this medical center unless you have plenty of time and don't mind having your credit ruined.  My insurance company paid them and I paid my copay for one office visit.  So far I've wasted two hours proving the $100 office visit has been paid in full 8 months ago. They are now telling me I have 10 days to pay $206 (instead of the $100) or they will send this to collections. Anyone know of a good attorney?
beginning: Stay away from this medical center unless you have plenty
mgt: "Stay away from this medical center unless you have plenty of time to waste and a strong tolerance for frustration. The staff is unhelpful, and the wait times are absurdly long. I felt like just another number rather than a patient. My concerns were dismissed, and I left feeling more confused than when I arrived. There are much better options available."

trgt:
Another stop on our aquariums on the Strip tour. 

The way the Shark Reef is decorated is quite nice actually. We didn't use the audio self-guided tour because we're lazy like that. I'm sure it was informative.

There's more than just sharks. There's also some interesting fish (like piranhas) and reptiles. It's not the best exhibit we've ever been to, but it was pretty fun for us. We like aquariums and the like. 

It gets really crowded at the shark exhibit but presumably that's what everyone's there for.
beginning: Another stop on our aquariums on the Strip tour. \n\nThe
mgt:
"Another stop on our aquariums on the Strip tour. 

The experience was truly mesmerizing, with vibrant marine life swimming gracefully in beautifully designed exhibits. The interactive displays captivated both kids and adults alike, making it a perfect family outing. We particularly enjoyed the underwater tunnel, where sharks and rays glided overhead, creating a thrilling sense of immersion. The staff was knowledgeable and eager to share fascinating facts about the creatures. Overall, it was a delightful addition to our day, leaving us with lasting memories and a newfound appreciation for ocean conservation."

trgt: This is a pretty cool place in the heart of Bloomfield. I've never eaten at the restaurant, but I've frequented the bar and it's always been serviceable. The bar in the front is very open with four sides and a bunch of TV's for game-watching. There's always some cute girl behind the bar looking to catch tips from young or old single guys from the neighborhood. Had some food at the bar once that was alright. Good for a stop-in at some point.
beginning: This is a pretty cool place in the heart of
mgt: "This is a pretty cool place in the heart of the city, offering a vibrant atmosphere and a diverse menu. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure every guest feels welcome. The decor is modern yet cozy, perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. I particularly enjoyed the signature cocktails, which were expertly crafted and full of flavor. Overall, a fantastic spot to unwind and enjoy great food!"

trgt: I used to love Kanpai - great prices, quality food, and an excellent staff. I don't know if it was sold or what they are doing but 'Sushi Ave' is now treading on the classic and established Kanpai name. Prices are higher, portions are smaller, and the quality of the fish is horrid. All my old favorites are gone and the recipes have all changed. \n\nI'm really disappointed to lose one of my favorite sushi bars in Phoenix, but as one of the new staff said 'we have to change it up'. Sadly I won't be back and I don't suggest they be allowed to continue to tarnish such an established name.
beginning: I used to love Kanpai - great prices, quality food,
mgt: "I used to love Kanpai - great prices, quality food, and a vibrant atmosphere. However, my recent visit left me disappointed. The service was slow, and my order was incorrect. While the sushi still tasted fresh, the overall experience felt rushed and unwelcoming. I hope they can return to their former glory, as I truly enjoyed dining there."

trgt: I drive by this place every day on the way home from work.  So after reading good reviews I decided to try it.  After a dinner of fried everything I think I will need a cardiac exam.  I had fried fish and shrimp and fries.  My daughter had popcorn shrimp.  My dad had fried okra and fried zucchini.  We all shared.  The zucchini was good, I like their batter, but I would have preferred thicker slices of zucchini.  I'm not afraid of having an actual vegatable.  The fish was ok but  I had better at Gordon Biersch.  Sorry, I usually prefer the local guy just on general principle, but this one isn't it.  The fries were not great the shrimp was so heavily breaded that I couldn't taste the shrimp and the popcorn shrimp were all bread.  We did get a side of coleslaw that was as good as any I've had from the Safeway deli.
beginning: I drive by this place every day on the way
mgt: to work, and I finally decided to stop in. The atmosphere was inviting, with warm lighting and friendly staff. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, and I was impressed by the freshness of the ingredients. I ordered the special of the day, and it exceeded my expectations. The flavors were vibrant, and the presentation was beautiful. I can't wait to return and try more dishes!

trgt: I finally returned and I am glad that I did. The off putting smell of eggs upon entering is no longer there. The service was extremely attentive and efficient. We were seated immediately and our drinks came out quickly. The server was pleasant and professional. I ordered the Spicy Miso Burger and we shared the oxtail chili cheese fries appetizer. We cleaned our plates! The burger was so much better than I remember, and it appears that some positive changes were implemented since my last visit over six months ago. Another great local business to add back to my list of neighborhood favorites!
beginning: I finally returned and I am glad that I did.
mgt: I finally returned and I am glad that I did. The atmosphere was just as inviting as I remembered, with warm lighting and friendly staff. The menu had some exciting new additions, and I couldn't resist trying the seasonal special. Each bite was a delightful explosion of flavors, reminding me why this place has always been a favorite. The service was impeccable, making the entire experience even more enjoyable. I left feeling satisfied and eager to come back again soon.

trgt:
After eating lunch several days a week at Atrias PNC Park restaurant for many years, I have finally decided that the price has just lost any relation to portions/quality and will not be dining there anytime in the near future.

Gradually, over the past year, the prices have continued to increase to the point of being dinner menu prices for lunch size meals.  Recently, the portion size has significantly diminished, to the point of being almost comical today.

The fish "special" today was BBQ salmon with asparagus.  It consisted of about 3oz of salmon and four spears of asparagus.  It actually looked ridiculous on the plate.  The specials used to have 5-6 oz of fish, included a decent portion of vegetables, and rice, all for a dollar or two less.  While a bit more than I wanted to spend for lunch, at least the quality and size of portion made some sense.  Today, I spent $15 plus tax and tip and left feeling like I had eaten an appetizer and still hungry.

They have pushed it too far, I am no longer willing to waste my money at Atria's.  Too bad, we used to really enjoy lunch there.
beginning: After eating lunch several days a week at Atrias PNC
mgt: "After eating lunch several days a week at Atrias PNC, I can confidently say it has become my go-to spot. The atmosphere is inviting, and the staff is always friendly and attentive. The menu offers a great variety of options, from fresh salads to hearty sandwiches, all made with quality ingredients. I particularly love their daily specials, which never fail to impress. Whether I'm dining solo or with colleagues, I always leave satisfied and eager to return."

trgt: Service was ok and food wasn't any better.  The Orange chicken was ok, however the egg drop soup and fried rice left a lot to be desired.  Price is pretty good for a big lunch.  I don't think I'll be returning.
beginning: Service was ok and food wasn't any better. The Orange
mgt: "Service was ok and food wasn't any better. The Orange Chicken lacked flavor and was overcooked, leaving it dry and unappetizing. The rice was bland, and the vegetables seemed frozen rather than fresh. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that didn't live up to expectations."

trgt: Small location located in china town...it looks kinda dingy when you walk in, especially compared to the giant Lee's sandwiches a block away. Everything is marked up (though still cheap for Vegas) as compared to California ($2.75 for THREE spring rolls in the 626, here is $4 for two). But hey, when you're desperate for some asian yummies and you aren't willing to shell out $8 for non-legit spring rolls on the strip, you gotta go somewhere, right? \n\nThe desserts are pretty yummy...pandan-coconut milk-coffee jello is a bit too sweet. Coconut milk with taro, yam, and tapioca is super yum. Spring rolls are squishy...shrimp ones (goi cuon) is very squishy and mostly rice paper. The vegetarian spring rolls are insanely dry. And yet...I keep coming back :X Mostly for the desserts!
beginning: Small location located in china town...it looks kinda dingy when
mgt: you first walk in, but don't let that fool you. The food is absolutely incredible! Each dish bursts with authentic flavors, and the staff is friendly and attentive. The dumplings are a must-try, perfectly steamed and filled with savory goodness. The atmosphere may be unassuming, but the culinary experience is top-notch. Highly recommend for anyone craving genuine Chinese cuisine!

trgt:
I've been here twice in the last year, and am happy to say that both times were incredible. The last time was on my birthday, when my wife set up a very nice dinner for two and we had the Chef's Tasting with the wine pairing. Like others who have reviewed Legume, we found our service to be excellent, and enjoyed the presentation of each course.

The food here is absolutely flavorful and delicious. It's the kind of place that can almost make you consider licking your plate when nobody's watching you. (Not that I did that, but I wanted to... luckily there was bread to help me take full advantage of the sauces...) Every item was perfectly cooked and delicious - from our fish course, through the lamb carpaccio, to the dessert finale, all of the proteins and garnishes were complimentary to each other and well prepared.

The only minor "flaw" was that they feel the need to maximize their space by putting a table for two right next to the doors to the kitchen - now, Legume is not the concept restaurant where you sit in full view of the kitchen, so this seems like a little bit of an afterthought. The problem for us was that in an otherwise quiet, slightly dark and romantic space, we were seated in a bright and somewhat loud section. I would have rather waited for another table in the main part of the restaurant; it would have paired better with the overall culinary experience. That being said, the food was so good here that I am not docking any stars for this...

Will definitely return.
beginning: I've been here twice in the last year, and am
mgt: "I've been here twice in the last year, and am consistently impressed by the quality of service and the atmosphere. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure every need is met. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcase fresh, local ingredients. Overall, it's a fantastic dining experience that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal."

trgt: It seems to me like the quality of this place is rapidly declining.  The service has always been slow, and now it has slowed down to the point where you actually are forgotten.  The last time I went, my friend and I were told they didn't have a drink list.  I ordered a martini from the old drink list, and it was nothing like the previous 30 French Martinis I've had @ Momo.  The quality of the food has also taken a serious hit.  First, the chocolate gooey dessert somehow became an overcooked brownie with Hershey's syrup on top.  The pizza used to be delightful - just the right size to share with a friend, with a lovely homemadey crust.  Now you get something that appears to have been on sale in the freezer department at the local grocery store.  Maybe I'm just getting old, but this place is too dark.  I get a headache from squinting at my friends while I'm there.  I appreciate mood lighting, but Momo is so dark I wonder if maybe they don't pay their electricity bills.  The wine list is pretty good, and it can be fun to see bands there, but those alone aren't enough to keep me coming back like I used to.
beginning: It seems to me like the quality of this place
mgt: "It seems to me like the quality of this place has declined over the past few months. The service was slow, and the staff appeared overwhelmed. While the ambiance remains charming, the food lacked the freshness and flavor I once enjoyed. I hope they can return to their previous standards soon."

trgt: I'm rating the Bingo here.  This place is really fun and cheap.  You can play and play all day and sometimes actually win.  And if your are lame like me you can get a machine to do all the work.  This place is stuffy, stinky and seedy but you're in Vegas so why not.  They have a smoking section in the Bingo hall but it might as well be the whole place because its one small room that hasn't been renovated since who knows when.  You get free donuts, chips and sodas.  The bar waitress comes in and gives free drinks and if you tip her well she will come back over and over again.  This place is fun to try out when you are tired of the strip and/or have time to kill before a flight.  Oh and don't forget to sign up for their players card it comes with a coupon book that has an additional bingo discount.  And BEWARE of the bingo sharks there.  Since I've been there a few times you tend to see the same locals who are hard core with tons of cards and machines that win all the time!
beginning: I'm rating the Bingo here. This place is really fun
mgt: I'm rating the Bingo here. This place is really fun! The atmosphere is lively, and the staff is incredibly friendly. The games are well-organized, and the prizes are exciting. I love the variety of themes they offer each week, making every visit feel fresh. Plus, the snacks and drinks are a nice touch. Overall, a fantastic experience!

trgt:
If you want to do your bit for your neighbourhood, forget about Blockbuster and other such DVD chains. Vogue Video may be small, but it's mighty. In a time of movie piracy and big chains I am surprised and relieved that this place has survived and thrived.
My friends and I usually  come here for our movie needs and it's up to date with what's out and popular, and the staff has always been friendly and quite chatty. Unlike their large competitor up the street they won't spent an age tapping away on the computer so you can get your movie. 

The only thing I can hold against it is it's early closing time in winter. But the selection is great, at affordable prices as well. Be warned though it's not all in alphabetical order so don't be shy to ask if you can't find what you are after!
beginning: If you want to do your bit for your neighbourhood,
mgt: "If you want to do your bit for your neighbourhood, volunteering at the local community center is a fantastic way to start. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the staff are incredibly supportive. You'll meet like-minded individuals who share your passion for making a difference. Whether it's organizing events, helping with food drives, or mentoring youth, there are countless opportunities to contribute. Plus, the sense of fulfillment you gain from giving back is truly rewarding."

trgt: A delicious breath of fresh air just off the craziness of the strip. Their breakfast is really good, and for a great price. Greek Omelette was huge and filled with lots of feta! Their French toast is thick and cinnamony! Everyone was really friendly and the service was terrific.
beginning: A delicious breath of fresh air just off the craziness
mgt: of the bustling city streets, this charming café offers a serene escape. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with soft lighting and cozy seating. Each dish is crafted with care, showcasing fresh, local ingredients that burst with flavor. The staff is friendly and attentive, making you feel right at home. Whether you're enjoying a leisurely brunch or a quick coffee break, this spot is a must-visit for anyone seeking a delightful culinary experience.

trgt: Everyone there is awesome! There's no better place to go from weight loss, hormones, medical and anti aging. Dr. Goldsmith is even board certified in all. I've searched for another clinic like this when they moved and believe me, there is NONE. Worth the drive.
beginning: Everyone there is awesome! There's no better place to go
mgt: "Everyone there is awesome! There's no better place to go for a fun and relaxing experience. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always making sure you feel welcome. The atmosphere is vibrant and inviting, perfect for hanging out with friends or enjoying a quiet moment alone. The menu offers a fantastic variety of options, catering to all tastes. I highly recommend trying their signature dishes; you won't be disappointed!"

trgt:
Wow this is an old hotel that they have tried to update but not successfully. The beds are very comfortable, pillows are HORRIBLE, not enough outlet to charge devices. 

The checkin was an hour + wait. It's clear management does not care because the staff does not care. No one working for the hotel seem nice or customer service oriented. The food was horrible don't eat there.  Parking is on the opposite end of everything and very hard to access

I will not be staying here again for any reason given the price vs quality. Although it is well situated on the strip.
beginning: Wow this is an old hotel that they have tried
mgt: "Wow, this is an old hotel that they have tried to modernize, but it still retains a charming vintage feel. The decor has a nostalgic touch, and while some amenities are a bit outdated, the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. The location is perfect for exploring the city, with many attractions within walking distance. However, the Wi-Fi connection was spotty at times, which was a bit frustrating. Overall, it’s a unique experience that blends history with comfort."

trgt: I literally live across the street and come in all the time. Today wasn't a pleasant visit, my waitress was so unfriendly never came by to ask if we were ok. The hostess had to ask if we've been helped yet and got us our drink order. She also has to get us our refills and our check. When the waitress braught us our check she put it on the table and walked away without saying a word or looking at us, So I gave the hostess the tip and said thank you. I give it 4 stars because the food is amazing and so was the hostess at the door. The waitress I'll never sit in her section if she is ever there.
beginning: I literally live across the street and come in all
mgt: "I literally live across the street and come in all the time. The atmosphere is always welcoming, and the staff remembers my name. The coffee is consistently excellent, and I love trying their seasonal pastries. It's the perfect spot to relax or get some work done. Highly recommend the avocado toast!"

trgt:
While in Vegas for Christmas we were in the mood for spicy beef.  While on the strip, we used Yelp to help us navigate our way to good Korean food - on Christmas Day!

We called ahead to make sure they were open and yes was the answer I wanted to hear.

From the M & M Factory we made our way and when we got there, every seat was taken.  Good sign.

Our wait was only 10 minutes, we sat down and the server arrived with glasses of water within minutes.  The place was packed with a lot of people there, we knew this place had to be good.
 
The menu is like any menu you see at other Korean restaurants so it was hard to decide what we wanted.  I wanted Dolsot Bibimbap and my BF had Bulgogi.

It took about 15 minutes for our food to arrive and I must say, that is the best Dolsot I ever had.  Everything was tasty.
beginning: While in Vegas for Christmas we were in the mood
mgt: "While in Vegas for Christmas we were in the mood for some festive dining. We stumbled upon a charming little restaurant that promised a unique holiday experience. The ambiance was warm and inviting, adorned with twinkling lights and cheerful decorations. The menu featured a delightful mix of traditional holiday dishes and innovative twists. Each bite was a celebration of flavors, and the staff was incredibly attentive, making our evening truly memorable. We left feeling satisfied and grateful for such a wonderful find in the heart of the city."

trgt:
Much better than the last time we saw him at the Riviera.  He is at Hard Rock now, my cousin wanted to see him so we all got drug there.

He is really rough with language and comments about sex were stomach turning, just really nasty so it was a turn off.  However, he is an icon because he was famous.  He WAS.  Not anymore and probably for this reason.

When we went to the Riviera the bar prices were half of what we paid here, 12 bucks for drinks?  Ridiculously priced.

Our group agreed that Vinnie Favorito was a better show but also had ridiculous bar prices.
beginning: Much better than the last time we saw him at
mgt: "Much better than the last time we saw him at the local theater, his performance this time was truly captivating. The depth he brought to the character was remarkable, showcasing his growth as an actor. Each scene was filled with emotion, and his chemistry with the cast elevated the entire production. It was a joy to watch him command the stage with such confidence and charisma."

trgt: \"OK, even with the good and bad reviews, let's try it.\"  It was exceptional. So far it was the best shredded beef chimichanga I have had in Casa Grande. Beautifully prepared filled to capacity with beef.  On the plate a pile of guacamole, sour cream and lettuce.  Mrs had 3 tostadas,  also presented very well.  She brought home 2 of them.  Extremely quick service with a well trained happy waitress.  Small bowl of chips was replenished when empty. Salsa was really sauce in a catsup squeeze bottle- a little odd, but OK. All in all a very pleasant experience at a very reasonable price.  We'll return
beginning: \"OK, even with the good and bad reviews, let's try
mgt: "OK, even with the good and bad reviews, let's try this restaurant. The ambiance was inviting, with warm lighting and cozy seating. The staff greeted us promptly and were attentive throughout our meal. We started with the calamari, which was perfectly crispy and flavorful. For the main course, I ordered the grilled salmon, and it was cooked to perfection, flaky and moist. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and the service. I would definitely return!"

trgt: As with the previous review I'll agree that this place is hit or miss. I used to work at a restaurant nearby and bought fruit here for drinks and dessert garnishes, I always had to be careful what I picked.\n\nHowever, it is cheap, has a good variety of fruit and veg and all the staff have good chat so I say give this place a go and make sure you keep your eyes open when your choosing!
beginning: As with the previous review I'll agree that this place
mgt: "As with the previous review, I'll agree that this place offers a unique atmosphere that truly enhances the dining experience. The staff is attentive and friendly, making you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. The menu features a diverse selection of dishes, each crafted with fresh ingredients and bold flavors. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcased the chef's creativity. Overall, it's a delightful spot that I would recommend to anyone looking for a memorable meal."

trgt:
This place is amazing. 
I am by no means a German Food critic - nor do I know what German food is "supposed" to taste like, but hopefully this is it, because it's amazing.  My husband was stationed in Germany for 6 Years, and he loves it... so I trust his opinion. 

I love the beer, I love the spatzel, I LOVE the snitzel. 

I bring everyone to Haus Murphy I can, because everything is amazing. 
A few times, I brought my parents and there was a polka bang being amazing in the bar area. 

I love this resturant.
beginning: This place is amazing. \nI am by no means a
mgt:
This place is amazing.  
I am by no means a food critic, but the flavors here are out of this world. Each dish is crafted with care, showcasing fresh ingredients that burst with flavor. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it perfect for a cozy dinner or a lively gathering with friends. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend their favorites. I can't wait to come back and try more from the menu!

trgt:
I've been to Hana Sushi about a half dozen times for lunch over the last two years.  The location is very close to where I work and live; I desperately want this place to be perfect, but sadly, it misses the mark.

First, it's closed on Mondays, which is somewhat annoying, because I always seem to forget about that.  I've been there twice on a Monday and had to go somewhere else as a result.

The second problem is that when you go shortly after they open for lunch, they apparently have just started to prepare their rice for the day.  When you order a 2-piece on rice, we don't expect the rice to be warm!  It should be cold, or at least below room temperature.  The mixture of lukewarm rice and cold sushi in my mouth is not appetizing--and this happened every time I went.

The appetizer salad and creamy dressing was quite good, and the service was good as well.  If they could get over the warm rice thing, this could be a better place.
beginning: I've been to Hana Sushi about a half dozen times
mgt: "I've been to Hana Sushi about a half dozen times, and each visit has been a delightful experience. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual dinners and special occasions. The sushi is always fresh, with a wide variety of rolls that cater to different tastes. I particularly love their signature rolls, which are creatively crafted and bursting with flavor. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every meal is enjoyable. Overall, Hana Sushi has become my go-to place for satisfying my sushi cravings."

trgt:
One star because this place, during summer and during happy hour, could be tolerable for a very short time, other than that ----- Run Away!!!

The have the worst music mix on a Friday night.  It's ghetto-fabulous rap and crappy Bon Jovi (the entire place raised their fists and mouthed the lyrics to Living on a Prayer I swear).  

$9 mixed drinks taste sooooooo much better, I feel like such a winner paying 3 x regular price of a regular drink.  $ 4 Coronas.

I saw a drunk chick fall into the little pool thingy, nice. 

One out of two had fake breasts.   Seriously, I counted.

I entertained myself by watching the ladies in 3-4" heels sink into the sand, and their dates never never offered an arm to steady themselves they just watched them sink. Classy.

What Scottsdale stereotype's? ----------Yeah right.
beginning: One star because this place, during summer and during happy
mgt: One star because this place, during summer and during happy hour, is a complete letdown. The service was slow, and the drinks were watered down. I expected a vibrant atmosphere, but it felt dull and uninviting. The staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested, which only added to the disappointment. I won’t be returning anytime soon.

trgt: I was so excited to see that this restaurant re-opened... Unfortunately that was short lived :-(  Took our family of 5 there tonight for dinner. Service was very poor, I think we actually offended our waitress by asking for drink refills! Food was was too salty and we all left with stomach aches. The salsa's were good... But they charged 1.89 for about 2 tbsp of mango salsa :-O.  After they nickel and dimed us we left disappointed .. And will not return
beginning: I was so excited to see that this restaurant re-opened...
mgt: I was so excited to see that this restaurant re-opened after its renovation. The ambiance is even more inviting, with a fresh decor that perfectly complements the delicious menu. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our dining experience enjoyable. I highly recommend the signature dish; it was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. Overall, a fantastic addition to the neighborhood!

trgt:
Disappointing on several levels.  First, the good news.  Service was incredible as was the ginger beer thyme infused cocktail.  Order it at the bar and don't venture any further.  Now onto the bad news.  Octopus appetizer that everyone raves about?  Over spiced and served with a tentacle so huge it looked like a prop from a Richard Basehart submarine movie.  Back off on the salt boys.  It was pickled in it.  Bone in ribeye was tasty but greasy as were the short ribs.

Brussels Sprouts reminded me of the crusty remnants of some experimental casserole.  Like what's at the bottom.  Why screw with one of nature's most beautiful foods?  The whipped potatoes were definitely whipped - into a veritable soup that looked more like baby food than a proper side dish.

If you feel like a steak I'd recommend Stack.  Only a few steps further into the casino with a better menu and ambience.  Did I mention that the music was not dining appropriate and annoying?

I just did.
beginning: Disappointing on several levels. First, the good news. Service was
mgt: "Disappointing on several levels. First, the good news. Service was prompt and attentive, which made the initial experience promising. However, the food fell flat, lacking flavor and creativity. The ambiance was also underwhelming, with outdated decor that didn’t match the menu’s pricing. Overall, I expected much more and left feeling unsatisfied."

trgt: I usually give fast food employees the benefit of the doubt, maybe in part because I've worked in fast food before, but the service at this location is exceptionally bad as far as how long it takes the employees to get me my food when I'm the only one waiting there for anything. I always seem to be standing around for a good 10 minutes while they don't quite do their jobs. I won't go back.
beginning: I usually give fast food employees the benefit of the
mgt: "I usually give fast food employees the benefit of the doubt, understanding that they often work under pressure. However, my recent visit was disappointing. The staff seemed overwhelmed and unorganized, leading to a long wait for my order. When I finally received my meal, it was cold and not prepared as requested. I hope they can improve their service and food quality in the future."

trgt: Not all Taco Bells are the same. I don't know what has changed in the last year or so, but this location is soooo sloooow. Several times I have had to wait 15 minutes in the drive thru after placing my order when there were two cars ahead of me. Today, I ordered a mexican pizza and a potato soft taco and they were both tasting of stale oil. Potatos were dry too. I give up on this location.
beginning: Not all Taco Bells are the same. I don't know
mgt: if it's the location or the staff, but this particular Taco Bell stands out for its exceptional service and cleanliness. The food was fresh and prepared quickly, making it a great stop for a late-night craving. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring that my order was correct and that I had everything I needed. Overall, I left feeling satisfied and eager to return.

trgt: Refreshing drinks and friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable service.The food is anticlimactic exccept for the chimichurri served with the bread. I got the skirt steak which was pretty much flavorless not to mention tiny.\n\nThe atmosphere is fun though and after dinner there is dancing. More delicious drinks while burning off the boring food!
beginning: Refreshing drinks and friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable service.The food is
mgt: "exceptionally flavorful, with a diverse menu that caters to all tastes. Each dish is beautifully presented, showcasing fresh ingredients and creative combinations. The atmosphere is inviting, making it a perfect spot for both casual dining and special occasions. I highly recommend trying the signature cocktails, which perfectly complement the meal. Overall, a delightful experience that keeps me coming back!"

trgt:
I have to agree with Dan in saying that the staff didn't seem too excited to be here on the weekend. I came in on a Saturday for a quick lunch before running errands and I was pretty excited after the rave reviews that I read. Unfortunately, as soon as I was seated and started munching on the chips, I was disappointed. They were bland and a bit cold. I didn't let that totally bash my excitement though; I just salted them a little and enjoyed. The salsas were interesting; they were very fresh tasting, but lacked any sort of explosive flavor that I was expecting (The red is much better than the green). With the bland chips, it wasn't much of a pairing, but with the salted chips, I was pleased. 

For lunch I ordered an al pastor burrito and a barbacoa sope. The burrito was awesome! I actually really liked that it wasn't huge. What it lacked in size, it made up for in flavor. The barbacoa on the other hand, wasn't as good. On the menu it says that barbacoa is only served on Saturday and Sunday. This is apparently because El Napolito's barbacoa is made with lamb. I've had plenty of barbacoa before and I was expecting to be blown away...especially after having some great al pastor, but I wasn't. The meat was really gamy, like really gamy. Salsa and a little salt were needed to make my sope enjoyable, and that was a shame.

I would return to El Napolito, but there are loads of great little Mexican places in the area that I'll be stopping by first.
beginning: I have to agree with Dan in saying that the
mgt: "I have to agree with Dan in saying that the overall experience was truly exceptional. The attention to detail in every aspect, from the ambiance to the service, was remarkable. The staff was not only friendly but also incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, making excellent recommendations. Each dish was a delightful surprise, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return for another visit."

trgt: I give them one star for being open. Other than that...service was horrible, they ran out of the pasta for the dish ordered and a roach measuring almost three inches ran across my friends foot then up the wall behind the wine bottles. The manager just moved us to the table next to where we were sitting. Oh and did I mention the restaurant was empty!  Needless to say I will never go back to this neighborhood restaurant.
beginning: I give them one star for being open. Other than
mgt: "I give them one star for being open. Other than that, the service was incredibly slow, and the staff seemed disinterested. The food was bland and overpriced, leaving much to be desired. I expected more based on the reviews, but I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return."

trgt: Old faithful, no surprises as far as the product goes.  The one thing that surprised me is that they are not set up to take gift cards or the android app.   I charged up my card before i left because I don't like to carry too much cash around.  Oh well.
beginning: Old faithful, no surprises as far as the product goes.
mgt: Old faithful, no surprises as far as the product goes. It consistently delivers reliable performance and quality, making it a dependable choice for everyday use. The design remains sleek and user-friendly, ensuring that even newcomers can navigate it with ease. While it may not introduce groundbreaking features, its reliability and effectiveness make it a staple in my routine. Overall, it’s a solid investment that continues to meet my expectations time and again.

trgt: Food ok, but not for the price, dinner for two with 2 watery sangrias was $60! Service was incredibly slow, although it was busy for a Tuesday nite. The staff were running around, didn't look like they knew what they were doing. They should have this figured out by now.
beginning: Food ok, but not for the price, dinner for two
mgt: "Food ok, but not for the price, dinner for two was quite disappointing. The portions were small and lacked flavor. Service was slow, and we felt overlooked. For the cost, we expected a more memorable experience. There are better options in the area that offer both quality and value."

trgt: This place has delicious Mexican Food! margaritas are good too, not too sweet :) lots of friendly staff, and great service. I would not go there for Happy Hour though, they are only 1.00 off the Margaritas, and you can only sit at the bar area; if its hot hot you have only half the bar available, the indoor side, But for lunch n dinner GREAT!
beginning: This place has delicious Mexican Food! margaritas are good too,
mgt: "This place has delicious Mexican food! Margaritas are good too, and the atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure you have everything you need. I highly recommend the tacos al pastor; they are bursting with flavor. The guacamole is fresh and perfectly seasoned, a must-try appetizer. Overall, a fantastic dining experience!"

trgt: There was a huge dead moth packaged with my broccoli stalk. This place used to be great until the new owners took over. Even the bags are cheaper and ripped open on me while I was carrying my groceries up the stairs -_-. But of course, the day I opened the fresh broccoli I had just bought to make me and my son some lunch, there was something black in it. I was like what the heck is that? Cut it open, and a HUGE, black, dead moth was there. Yum. I will never go there again because they are apparently not very hygienic where they package your food. This is my warning!
beginning: There was a huge dead moth packaged with my broccoli
mgt: "There was a huge dead moth packaged with my broccoli, which completely ruined my appetite. I couldn't believe the lack of quality control. It's unacceptable to find such a thing in my food. I immediately contacted customer service, but their response was slow and unhelpful. I expected better from a brand I trusted. This experience has made me reconsider my grocery choices."

trgt:
I have two big qualms with this place:
1) You do not get fries unless if you eat-in. Now really, how hard/expensive is it to include fries w/to-go orders?
2) The Oakland location CHARGES for re-fills.. Considering they have probably marked up the softdrinks by 1000+% to begin with, I find this ridiculous.

The actual subs are decent, but I don't find them to be as good as everyone says they are. Overrated + my admittedly somewhat petty complaints above = I do not jump at the chance to go there.
beginning: I have two big qualms with this place:\n1) You do
mgt:
I have two big qualms with this place:  
1) You do not get what you pay for. The prices are steep, yet the quality of the food and service falls short of expectations.  
2) The atmosphere feels rushed and chaotic, making it difficult to enjoy a meal. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return.

trgt: Mediocre food. 50$ for one person. I could have had better food at Panda Express. The orange peel chicken was cold and lacking flavor. The veggies in the dish tasted like they weren't washed before being cooked. Only good thing about this place is the atmosphere, it is the only reason I didn't give it 1 star.
beginning: Mediocre food. 50$ for one person. I could have had
mgt: "Mediocre food. 50$ for one person. I could have had a much better meal at a local diner for half the price. The flavors were bland, and the portion sizes were underwhelming. Service was slow, and the atmosphere felt rushed. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unsatisfied."

trgt:
DO NOT STAY HERE, especially if you have kids.  Substandard amenities.  Rooms are VERY outdated.  Even in the shower, water pressure is next to non-existent.  Pictures do not depict actual conditions at this property.  Went to the business center, found it in VERY poor condition, all equipment taken out.  Property needs an HUGE amount of work to bring it back up to par.  Parking behind the hotel kinda dark in the p.m.  Lots of non-guest foot traffic.  Was told by staff the top floors are occupied by people that live there.  They rent rooms as apartments.

Traded through Interval International for this property, BIG MISTAKE!!!

VERY DISASTIFIED
beginning: DO NOT STAY HERE, especially if you have kids. Substandard
mgt: "DO NOT STAY HERE, especially if you have kids. Substandard cleanliness and safety standards make this place a nightmare. The rooms were dirty, with stains on the carpets and unwashed linens. The staff was unhelpful and dismissive when we raised our concerns. Additionally, the amenities advertised were either broken or nonexistent. We felt uncomfortable and unsafe throughout our stay. Save your money and find a more family-friendly option."

trgt:
- Wrong directions to our hotel room from the guy at the front desk
- No room service (No fresh towals etc.)
- Wifi didnt work very well
- TV lost signal often
btw do not lift up any bottles from the minibar. They will charge you each bottle due to sensors in the fridge. 

I complained at the checkout and they took care about the Hotel fees + Tax (56 Dollars something for two days)
beginning: - Wrong directions to our hotel room from the guy
mgt: - Wrong directions to our hotel room from the guy at the front desk really set the tone for our stay. We ended up wandering the halls for nearly 15 minutes, feeling frustrated and exhausted. Once we finally found our room, it was clean and comfortable, but the initial confusion left a sour taste. The staff seemed overwhelmed and unhelpful, which was disappointing. Overall, the experience could have been much better with clearer communication and more attentive service.

trgt:
Snapshot review: Probably a better environment for lunch or drinks vs. dinner.

Came here on a busy Saturday night (with a reservation, fortunately). The four of us were seated promptly at a corner table, which we had requested because one of us was hard of hearing. Good move--it quickly became very loud, and that was even before the band began playing!

The food was good--two of us had the chicken souvlaki, one had the spinach pie, and one I forget. The service was decent, if a bit slow. Good value for the money, too. I think I would have given it 4 stars for lunch, honestly. It was just loud and slow at dinnertime.
beginning: Snapshot review: Probably a better environment for lunch or drinks
mgt: Snapshot review: Probably a better environment for lunch or drinks than for a full dinner. The ambiance is casual and inviting, making it perfect for a quick bite or a relaxed gathering with friends. The menu offers a variety of tasty options, and the service is generally attentive. However, the dinner options can be hit or miss, so I recommend sticking to lighter fare during the day. Overall, a solid choice for a laid-back outing!

trgt:
Hopefully the organizers will learn from the feedback they receive from this event.

The lines were ridiculously long - sometimes 45 minutes up to an hour for a few small bites of food.  

I would be furious if I paid full price.  Thanks to Groupon.  

An event like this can be pulled off successfully - just look at Uncork'ed which probably has 3 times as many people.   I don't think I ever waited more than 5 minutes for food.  All the lines were in and out with the exception of maybe 2-3 spots.

I hope to attend another Night Market but hopefully they'll learn their lessons and provide a better experience.
beginning: Hopefully the organizers will learn from the feedback they receive
mgt: "Hopefully the organizers will learn from the feedback they receive, as there were several areas that could use improvement. The venue, while spacious, lacked adequate seating for all attendees, leading to discomfort during key presentations. Additionally, the schedule felt rushed, with sessions overlapping and not enough time for networking. Overall, the event had great potential, but better planning and organization could elevate it significantly for future iterations."

trgt:
For the price Le Village Buffet is a great place to eat when you're in Vegas. They lose points with me on the seafood presentation as well as the fruit displays.  Oddly enough (for Paris) the desserts needed a little help as well.

The seafood could have been tastier. The fruit did not look inviting and the dessert table looked too picked over.  However, you must try the custard ice cream - really good.

The red meat, pork, potatoes, Middle Eastern, Italian and Mexican table stations and presentations were all very good.

Trust me on this one...
beginning: For the price Le Village Buffet is a great place
mgt: "For the price, Le Village Buffet is a great place to enjoy a diverse selection of dishes. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it perfect for families and groups. The variety of cuisines, from Asian to Italian, ensures that there’s something for everyone. The staff is attentive, and the food is consistently fresh and flavorful. Overall, it’s a fantastic value for a satisfying dining experience."

trgt:
If it's not one thing, it's something else. 

Went there on a Saturday on my first visit. My friend and I were separated and I didn't want to leave without her. She was talking to a bouncer who asked to talk to a bouncer near me so they could help us coordinate and meet up. Well the bouncer next to me a jerk and wouldn't talk on my phone to help. Finally another bouncer saw us getting into an argument and helped me out. So for the most part, still a fun night. But unusually mean bouncer man, you need to get fired. He's shorter than most girls and does nothing but look mean all night. Power trip? I think yes. 

Second time I go there is on a Friday night. Granted we got free drinks. No one was under the age of 35. Nothing's wrong with that, just not my crowd. Not a lot of dancing, more drinking. The evil bouncer was there again, looking just as miserable as he did the last time I was there. 

One plus side was, they had really good music playing both nights. If you just want to kick it, maybe this place is for you. But if you want the wild and crazy Vegas night, XS or Marquee would probably be better.
beginning: If it's not one thing, it's something else. \n\nWent there
mgt:
"If it's not one thing, it's something else. 

Went there expecting a relaxing evening, but the service was incredibly slow. After waiting for over 30 minutes, our orders were mixed up. The food, when it finally arrived, was lukewarm and lacked flavor. The ambiance was nice, but it couldn't make up for the disappointing experience. I really wanted to enjoy my time, but the constant issues made it hard to relax. I hope they can improve, as the location has great potential."

trgt:
It's a great place to shop if you have a lot of money to drop.
Their stores are always stocked with the hippest and most current fashion pieces!
I bought my prom dress at the BCBG here and I loved it!
It was a bit pricey but it was well worth the money.
I also love their Betsey Johnson store here.
Their staff is always very helpful and the dresses are amazing!
beginning: It's a great place to shop if you have a
mgt: "It's a great place to shop if you have a keen eye for unique finds and enjoy a diverse selection. The atmosphere is inviting, with friendly staff always ready to assist. Prices are reasonable, making it easy to explore without breaking the bank. I particularly love their seasonal collections, which add a fresh touch to the shopping experience."

trgt: This is like a fast food asian type of spot. Its pretty good for what it is. Stopped by here one day because it was close to a golf course that i wanted to play at. Think i had the lemon pepper chicken, it was good.
beginning: This is like a fast food asian type of spot.
mgt: This is like a fast food Asian type of spot. The menu offers a variety of dishes, from stir-fried noodles to sushi rolls. While the food is quick and convenient, the flavors are surprisingly authentic. The portions are generous, making it a great value for the price. However, the ambiance is casual, so don’t expect a fine dining experience. Overall, it’s a solid choice for a quick meal when you’re craving Asian cuisine.

trgt: Always have had friendly service here, both when we played Tuesday night Team Bingo (and it was busy) and when I stopped in for a Bills game (also busy).  Food is good, bathrooms and clean and they have an outdoor patio. Plus I can pay for my beer with my Bingo winnings! Can't  beat it.
beginning: Always have had friendly service here, both when we played
mgt: "Always have had friendly service here, both when we played and during our visits to the clubhouse. The staff is attentive and genuinely cares about making your experience enjoyable. The course itself is well-maintained, with challenging holes that cater to all skill levels. I appreciate the variety of landscapes and the beautiful scenery that surrounds the greens. Overall, it's a fantastic place to unwind and enjoy a round of golf with friends."

trgt: All I can say is....If you have been to the Carnegie deli in New York skip this place.  \nThey have no pickled tomatoes, the corned beef was plentiful, but fatty/tough (so go for the turkey), the break was okay, but not great either.  How hard is it to make a sandwich when that is nearly all you make.  Won't come again.  Afterward I heard  from other friends/family that they felt the same way and wished I knew before I wasted my money and time.
beginning: All I can say is....If you have been to the
mgt: "All I can say is... If you have been to the restaurant before, you will be pleasantly surprised by the new menu. The flavors are bold and innovative, showcasing a perfect blend of traditional and modern cuisine. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it an ideal spot for both casual dining and special occasions. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall experience. I highly recommend trying the chef's special; it was a delightful surprise!"

trgt: I wrote an unfavorable review of Elements back in 2010. I am pleased to report that I gave the place another try last night and was extremely pleased with this place! I do believe the layout of the place has changed as it is now very inviting and comfortable, especially sitting at the bar. Speaking of the bar, the 'tenders were two of the most welcoming and friendly people. They had jokes for days and poured a good drink. The suggested tapas were excellent. We're looking forward to coming back on Sunday for their bottomless Bloody Marys that Carla remarked she made a gr8 one. From what I have read below they may have changed owners which could have made the difference? Either way, I'm glad I left my mind open to try this place again. Thanks
beginning: I wrote an unfavorable review of Elements back in 2010.
mgt: I wrote an unfavorable review of Elements back in 2010. At the time, I found the service lacking in both quality and consistency. However, I recently decided to give it another chance, and I was pleasantly surprised by the improvements. The menu has expanded significantly, and the flavors are now more vibrant and well-balanced. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, making the dining experience much more enjoyable. Overall, I can confidently say that Elements has transformed into a place worth visiting.

trgt: The salsa here at Nandos was amazing.  I usually make great judgement with the salsa, as I pour a ton of salsa all over my main entrees.  I do not do it because the food lacks flavor, but I do it because I love salsa just that much.  I ordered the Jalapeno Chicken Soup.  I wasn't terribly hungry and I banked on eating a lot of chips and salsa to fill up.  The soup was okay.  I was happy it was white meat chicken, but it lacked some flavor.
