Overall, it’s a reliable choice for both fuel and convenience needs.

trgt:
I really enjoyed my stay here!

We used a groupon and I will stay there again when I visit Arizona.  The rooms were very tidy, bath and body works collection available for shampoo and soap.  

I loved how the pool was open all night as well.  The pool and hot tub did need a bit of scooping because there was some debri in there but nothing terrible.  Towels were available as well as water too for the guests.

The front desk people were very pleasant and gave us an early check in no problem.  

My fiance and I wanted to go down to Mill avenue and were pleasantly surprised when the front desk said there was a 24 hour complimentary shuttle that would take us and pick us up.  The driver was very helpful with advice on places to go and also tips to keep out of trouble. :)

We went to Milagros for a margarita too, and the bartender was very pleasant and the drinks were not crazy expensive.

The hotel is very close to Arizona Mills mall and other places in Tempe.  It was worth every penny!
beginning: I really enjoyed my stay here!\n\nWe used a groupon and
mgt:
I really enjoyed my stay here!

We used a Groupon and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the accommodations. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. The room was clean and well-appointed, with a comfortable bed and a lovely view. The amenities, including the pool and fitness center, were top-notch. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I would definitely recommend this place to others looking for a relaxing getaway!

trgt:
I thought I had already discovered my burger place in Vegas and that was Gordon Ramsay's BurGR and no one could take that place from my heart.

Holstein's though, came pretty close. But I think it was my zeal talking more than anything and my weakness for those little moments where a person can feel top of the heap just from buying a meal. 

You see, I had hit it pretty big at roulette and craps the night before and was feeling confident. I knew going in that I wanted that Billionaire Burger, with its truffle aioli and foie gras, elements of a burger I know I would never eat anywhere else but on vacation. I did order it. And then some. That burger came medium rare, with additions of aged goat cheese and lobster, heightening an already indulgent, gluttonous, and decadent burger into a whole other realm. It was luscious.

But like I said, it wasn't fair. I made it luxurious because I willed it. Is the law of attraction in action? Perhaps. More than likely, though, it was me riding the high of a couple of wins and wanting to eat like a winner.

The philly cheese steak egg rolls were average. Nothing memorable or special.I also had a taste of the bamboozled shakes, the Tiramisu and the Fat Boy. Most gush about The Fat Boy but it was too candy-like for me. Boyfriend had the Memphis Burger, which had a layer of pulled pork that he believed might have been crisped up on the flattop beforehand to create a crust. I had a bite and was impressed but really, I only tasted it for the sake of tasting because I refused to part with, even lay down, my obscenely excessive truffle, lobster, foie burger, oh no.

You had better believe I am still thinking about that burger. Late at night, when all the lights are out, I reminisce about the taste of that false luxury.
beginning: I thought I had already discovered my burger place in
mgt: "I thought I had already discovered my burger place in town, but then I stumbled upon this hidden gem. The moment I took my first bite, I was blown away by the juicy patty and the perfect blend of toppings. The flavors danced on my palate, and the freshly baked bun held everything together beautifully. Each burger is crafted with care, and the staff is incredibly friendly, making the whole experience even better. I can't wait to return and try more from their menu!"

trgt:
1)This is one of the MUST go when you stop by Las Vegas.
2)The pizza here is top notch. Authentic Naples pizza. Period. I went to Naples 5 times during these 10 years and I always stop by Da Michele. Now I have to stop by Novecento when I am in Vegas.
3)There are some magic going on between the dough and chef's special 900 degree oven. If you come for the 1st time, let the chef pick for you. Simple is good, believe me.
4)Their salads and espressos are decent. Chef simply bring the whole Naples Pizzeria culture to Vegas. Way to go!
5)I always admire chefs who bring authenticity to their cuisine. This is FINE ARTS. This is how cooking should be.
beginning: 1)This is one of the MUST go when you stop
mgt: 1) This is one of the MUST go when you stop by this charming little town. The atmosphere is vibrant, and the locals are incredibly welcoming. The food is absolutely delicious, with a variety of options that cater to all tastes. Don't miss the signature dish; it's a true highlight! The scenery is breathtaking, making it perfect for a leisurely stroll. Overall, a delightful experience that I can't recommend enough!

trgt: Terrible! They deserve 0 stars honestly! I have been here twice, both WITH appointments and still have waited over an hour and a half to be seen. The 1st time Dr. Tran was very rude. I came in for a blood pregnancy test because I wanted to be 100% sure I wasn't pregnant even though i had a negative pee test. (I was over 2 months late.) & there HAS BEEN CASES where a pee test hasn't detected the pregnancy hormone. He tried to get smart with me saying he had never seen a case like that, & I honestly wanted to just be like, \"Idgaf what you have seen or not, give me a damn blood pregnancy test and be done with me!\" BUT...lol I contained myself and said, \"Wellllll, I STILL want one!\" He gave it to me and I left. This last time, I walked out. Apparently I signed into the wrong list (drug testing) and I had already waited over 20 minutes of my appointment time which was at 11am. The drug testing guy said, \"Don't worry, I'll take care of it.\" So then I walked up to the LOVELY receptionists and asked how much longer I was gonna wait and one of them while on the phone had the nerve to look at me and slightly roll her eyes and say, \"Its gonna be another 45-1hour!\" I mentioned I had an appointment and another receptionist which was nicer said she apologized for the inconvenience but that everyone had arrived at the same time. She calmed me down from the other bitch that had snapped at me. If you're reading this BITCH, you need to learn some FUCKING people skills and respect appointment times. That's why appointments are made you STUPID BITCH! I will never be back here again.
beginning: Terrible! They deserve 0 stars honestly! I have been here
mgt: "Terrible! They deserve 0 stars honestly! I have been here multiple times, and each experience has been worse than the last. The service is incredibly slow, and the staff seems disinterested in helping customers. The food was cold and poorly prepared, leaving a bad taste in my mouth—literally! I will not be returning and would not recommend this place to anyone."

trgt: Place is so grossss total dump, I recently went to tempe for spring training and this place was right next door to our hotel \"comfort inn\"  this place is a dump big mistake food is like rubber and greasy not to mention you have to pay sauce??? that is just stupid  not to mention it's cash out, that should of been a red flag for dump.  Gave me an upset stomach
beginning: Place is so grossss total dump, I recently went to
mgt: "Place is so grossss total dump, I recently went to this restaurant expecting a decent meal, but I was sorely disappointed. The tables were sticky, the floors looked like they hadn't been cleaned in weeks, and the smell was off-putting. The food was bland and poorly prepared, and the service was slow and inattentive. I definitely won't be returning."

trgt: I really like this place. There is a lot to look through, and there are a lot of cool vendors. Like any antique store, there are some great prices and some inflated prices. There are lots of treasures to be found, so be sure to give yourself adequate time to find them!
beginning: I really like this place. There is a lot to
mgt: I really like this place. There is a lot to enjoy, from the cozy atmosphere to the friendly staff. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I particularly recommend the seasonal specials, which are always a delightful surprise. The ambiance is perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. Overall, a fantastic dining experience!

trgt: Seven Yelpers in a row can't be wrong! We all agree on one thing...Western cab sucks! The cabbie I had a run-in with tonight was apparently just another in their collection of rude ones. Calling dispatch and seeing the way they handle (or don't handle) a road rage issue shows that behind the lousy drivers is management that is equally as bad. Like the reviewer before me said, there are many cab companies; if you get this company, just pass it up for the next one. Apparently the drivers with the road rage issues end up here, since management is tolerant of it.
beginning: Seven Yelpers in a row can't be wrong! We all
mgt: "Seven Yelpers in a row can't be wrong! We all gathered at this charming little bistro, and it exceeded our expectations. The ambiance was cozy, with soft lighting and friendly staff who made us feel right at home. Each dish we ordered was a delightful surprise, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. The standout was definitely the truffle pasta, which was rich and creamy without being overwhelming. We left with full bellies and happy hearts, already planning our next visit!"

trgt:
You know how some places don't give a crap about you?
This is not the place!
Every time I go in I have a good time!
GO!
beginning: You know how some places don't give a crap about
mgt: You know how some places don't give a crap about customer service? Well, this is not one of them. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with genuine smiles and a warm atmosphere. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making sure my experience was enjoyable. The menu offered a delightful variety, and every dish I tried was bursting with flavor. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return. Highly recommend!

trgt: Customer service was horrible the cashier was being so rude forgot to charge us for the drinks that I clearly told her I wanted. Then she came back and told us that we need to pay for them if we want them. Well duh! I didn't expect free drinks because of your mistake. The food was  dry and flavorless I've heard so many good things about this restaurant and I came out really disappointed.
beginning: Customer service was horrible the cashier was being so rude
mgt: Customer service was horrible; the cashier was being so rude that I felt uncomfortable even asking a simple question. Instead of helping, they rolled their eyes and sighed loudly, making the entire experience frustrating. I left the store feeling disheartened and unlikely to return. It's disappointing when a business fails to prioritize customer satisfaction.

trgt: This isn't just some typical bookshop and its specialist nature might mean that it might not be of interest to all.  What this place does offer is a range of books about Scottish history, Scottish literature and rather surprisingly a range of travelling and educational books that seem a little out of place.  Also on, however, bringing us back to Scotland are some prints that are guaranteed to be of a certain age, but this perhaps is a specialist item.\n\nThe prices are fairly reasonable, but perhaps tending on the slightly dear side.  That said you do get a good range of quality books that are hard to find elsewhere.
beginning: This isn't just some typical bookshop and its specialist nature
mgt: "This isn't just some typical bookshop and its specialist nature sets it apart from the rest. The curated selection of rare and unique titles invites exploration, making every visit feel like a treasure hunt. The knowledgeable staff are passionate about literature, always ready to recommend hidden gems or engage in thoughtful discussions. The cozy atmosphere, complete with comfortable reading nooks and aromatic coffee, encourages you to linger longer than planned. Whether you're a casual reader or a dedicated bibliophile, this bookshop offers an experience that transcends mere shopping."

trgt:
This is not the Italian Food you're looking for.... 

OK, this place has gone seriously downhill with the new management, and the food was bad enough to make Marco Polo weep. 

Let's start with the good.... The place is big, the staff was friendly, the bar area was pretty nice, and they had a lot of TV's playing the Cardinal's game. I could totally buy this place as a sports bar. 

Now, on to everything else.... 

The parking situation is abysmal, but hey, that's Avondale for ya... I won't blame this restaurant for the shrieking baby, that blame goes squarely on the shoulder of the parents who were busy getting their drank on. 

We ordered: 
Apps: Onion Rings / Friend Mushrooms / Moz Sticks
Entree: Steak & Cheese sandwich, the "special" calzone, and the lasagna. 
Well, we didn't order the lasagna at first, of the 10 things listed in the pasta section it was the only thing available that wasn't spaghetti and meatballs. 
$50.00 for the check, this included drinks & a mediocre tip. 

The appetizers came to the table, and as soon as I saw the fried mushrooms I had a bad feeling. 

Everything was perfectly shaped and colored. This is because everything certainly came out of a freezer bag 5 minutes ago. The moz sticks were flavorless, the onion rings were perfectly round onion flavored bread rings, and the fried mushrooms were an undercooked disaster of batter, covering the world's smallest mushrooms. 

I'm not a super Italian food enthusiast, the kind that expects it to taste like it came from a Tuscan village. I just wanted something that tasted less like fried batter, and more like FOOD. 

My wife said the Steak & Cheese was OK. The meat and cheese components were tasty enough, but the previously frozen roll was undercooked and doughy. 

The lasagna was rough, Stouffer's® puts out a similar product in the frozen food section of Fry's, so save yourself some money and try that if you want, because this was just not good. No seasoning, bland cheese mix, and straight from the jar sauce that was almost too sweet. 

The calzone, the Palermo's Special Calzone, was sadly also from frozen, and I can't let it go! (see what I did there?) It was perfectly shaped, and the outside was crispy, however, like all frozen entrees of this caliber, it was a soggy nightmare on the bottom. Inside it was watery and nasty. No taste, horrible "cheese" filling, and the same disgusting sauce that the lasagna was made with. No Bueno. 

The waitstaff was nice, if not a little absent after food delivery, but the food was abysmal. I'm a fat guy who loves to eat, and this had me rethinking everything.

I can tell you that #1 Brothers is right down the road, if you want a better Italian ANYTHING, go there, cause damn.
beginning: This is not the Italian Food you're looking for.... \n\nOK,
mgt:
"This is not the Italian food you're looking for.... 

OK, let me clarify. The flavors are muddled, and the pasta is overcooked. The sauce lacks depth, leaving a bland aftertaste. I expected vibrant, fresh ingredients, but instead, I found a disappointing array of frozen vegetables. The service was friendly, but it couldn't make up for the lackluster meal. If you're craving authentic Italian cuisine, I recommend looking elsewhere."

trgt: After a day of shopping at Chandler Fashion we decided to stop in, watch the Cardinals game and relax with good food and exceptional beer. Just prior to arriving at BJ's our 7 y.o. daughter wanted some pretzel bites from Wetzels and we also decided to get some pigs in a blank for my mother-in-law. We walked into the restaurant where the manager very rudely and loud enough for other patrons to hear tell us we could not bring food from other \"restaurants\" into \"her\" restaurant. Her overreaction was completely unnecessary and very embarrassing to my family and me. Undeterred, we did stay even though we were forced to sit outside, not our first choice of seating arrangements. The wait staff was embarrassed by the actions the manager and they did a great job taking care of us. Perhaps a better way for the manager to handle the situation would have been to offer us a doggie bag or some way to conceal our \"contraband\" so we might have enjoyed indoor seating along with the other paying customers. On an up note the food and libations were excellent; the service was fantastic and I can only hope that the manager gets a scholarship to charm school prior to our next visit.
beginning: After a day of shopping at Chandler Fashion we decided
mgt: to grab a bite at one of the nearby restaurants. We stumbled upon a cozy little bistro that caught our eye. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with soft lighting and friendly staff. The menu offered a delightful variety of dishes, and we were excited to try their signature pasta. The food was delicious, and the service was impeccable, making it the perfect end to our shopping adventure. We left feeling satisfied and eager to return.

trgt: On my way home, I was looking for some quick eats and found this place via Yelp (of course). Any time I'm at a Vietnamese restaurant, I feel compelled to try their pho. I ordered a medium bowl of their basic beef pho. I was disappointed to see they don't serve tripe. However, the bowl was surprisingly large for only $6.50. I'd say the broth was tasty, but I'm not one to get into the complexities of broth ingredients. I also take off points whenever a place only has Sriracha and none of that \"home made\" style chili sauce. This isn't really a big deal. I just prefer the chunky chili sauce.\n\nAnyway, for the price, this place is definitely A-OK. The service was a tad slow (it seemed like they didn't really have anyone working out in the customer area). Despite that, it's a decent place on the west side of town. Incidentally, I hear their other dishes are very good.
beginning: On my way home, I was looking for some quick
mgt: On my way home, I was looking for some quick and satisfying food options. I stumbled upon a cozy little diner that promised comfort food. The moment I walked in, the warm aroma of freshly cooked meals enveloped me. I decided to try their famous burger and fries, and I was not disappointed. The burger was juicy, perfectly seasoned, and the fries were crispy and golden. The service was friendly and prompt, making the experience even better. I’ll definitely be returning for more!

trgt: went here last week and the server was very rude and when I talked to her about it she acted like she didn't care.   I guess I can spend my money other places.
beginning: went here last week and the server was very rude
mgt: "went here last week and the server was very rude. It felt like we were an inconvenience rather than valued customers. The food took forever to arrive, and when it finally did, it was lukewarm at best. I expected much better service and quality for the price. I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt:
I am only rating the golf course on this one and if you enjoy golfing in the valley, then this is a course that you need to play. It is one of my favorite courses and it is at least semi affordable. 

The greens were clean and run a little fast, but of course that is a good thing. There are a bunch of fun little par 3's, and for me more then enough long par 5's. It is a challenging course but even a beginner can have a good time there.

There is a little water scattered around the course and minimal desert spots. I really enjoy the course and it is well worth the drive.
beginning: I am only rating the golf course on this one
mgt: I am only rating the golf course on this one visit, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations. The fairways were impeccably maintained, and the greens rolled true. The layout offered a good mix of challenges for both beginners and seasoned players. The staff was friendly and accommodating, making the overall experience enjoyable. I can't wait to return!

trgt: Rumblin' Tums is your classic greasy spoon, but it just so happens that I like greasy spoons!  They provide fresh morning rolls, surprisingle gorgeous bran scones and service with a smile!  And the decor inside is clean and fresh, all I'm looking for in a wee cafe!\n\nThe outside could do with a lick of paint and the tables and chairs have seen better days, but all in all it fills its purpose.  Perfect for a wee brew off a sunny afternoon!
beginning: Rumblin' Tums is your classic greasy spoon, but it just
mgt: "Rumblin' Tums is your classic greasy spoon, but it just hits the spot when you're craving comfort food. The burgers are juicy, the fries are perfectly crispy, and the milkshakes are thick and indulgent. The atmosphere is cozy, with friendly staff who make you feel right at home. It's the kind of place where you can enjoy a hearty breakfast any time of day. Just be prepared for a bit of a wait during peak hours, as it's a local favorite!"

trgt:
This is the old Rigatony's on Brown Rd- If you've never been, it has a Buca di Bepo-ish, before Buca was cool, sort of feel. They even serve their house chianti in a small water glass, instead of a wine goblet- adding to an authentic "Joisey" kind of feel.

This is traditional Italian-American fare, rich and flavorful- with big portions. The Chicken Piccata is crack-good. It's served in what I've come to learn is a Sicilian style, with a n awesome relish of tomatoes, capers, and green olives and a side of addictive Fett Alfredo. It never gets old.

Another great authentic dish is their Cecca- you can get it as a "Pie" (Pizza, that is) or over pasta. You just have try it. It's rich, refreshing, and explosively flavorful all at once.

The house salad is a variation on a traditional AntiPasto theme- and is a meal, and event, in and of its self.

The best thing about Mardeneley's is that EVERYTHING on the menu is good! It only gets Four stars because it could use a bit more snob appeal (and a better beer selection).
beginning: This is the old Rigatony's on Brown Rd- If you've
mgt: "This is the old Rigatony's on Brown Rd - If you've been here before, you'll be pleased to know that the charm remains intact. The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy dinner or a family gathering. The menu features a delightful array of classic Italian dishes, and the pasta is always fresh and cooked to perfection. Don't miss their signature marinara sauce; it's rich and flavorful, truly a standout. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Overall, Rigatony's continues to be a beloved spot for both locals and newcomers alike."

trgt: Stopped in here for lunch the other day. Quiet little independent Chinese restaurant that also has a Hawaiian style menu.\n\nNot many options for vegetarians, no tofu dishes to be found. Didn't really dig my noodles + veggies + pineapple dish, hence the 2 star rating.
beginning: Stopped in here for lunch the other day. Quiet little
mgt: Stopped in here for lunch the other day. Quiet little spot with a cozy atmosphere. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, and I decided to try their signature sandwich. It was fresh, flavorful, and generously portioned. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I’ll definitely be returning to explore more of their offerings!

trgt:
Now in general I've spends multiple weekends at Bellagio and loved it which is why I've come back time and time again.  This last trip with my girlfriends left a bad taste in my mouth.  2 things.  When I packed up and went home, I realized that I had left a dress of mine hanging in the closet. I called Bellagio's lost and found.  I told them my room number, where i had left it and what it looked like down to the size. They told me nothing was left in the room and there was nothing in lost and found that resembled the dress. Disappointed, i left it at that. What can i do, I am more than positive that was the only place it could have been because it is no longer in my possession and I remember hanging it in the close next to the tv. 

Then I get a call from my friend who stayed in the same room as myself, she told me the following.  On checkout, we had sometime before our flight back to los angeles.  We then check our bags into the baggage deposit for a couple of hours. In my friends duffle along with her clothes and shoes was a small purse resembling an camera case.  When she arrived back home to unpack, the small purse was gone. The purse had a bit of money in it. My friend then called the Bellagio as well. She spoke to the Valet manager. They did not find it (not a surprise) and was told that it happens alot.  It happens ALOT?! That is not an acceptable answer. It should never happen esp when we stay at a 5 star hotel. That why we pay a higher rate because we believe it would be an honest establishment with out fear of theft to our belongings.

So...pretty much I'm going to assume that my dress that i left hanging was taken(not put in lost and found) and my friend's purse that was hidden in her duffle was stolen purposely.  My friends and I are sorely disappointed and will probably stay at another casino resort for next get away.

**Ive posted the same review in Tripadvisor
beginning: Now in general I've spends multiple weekends at Bellagio and
mgt: "Now in general I've spent multiple weekends at Bellagio and each time has been a unique experience. The ambiance is luxurious, with stunning decor and a vibrant atmosphere. The staff is always attentive and friendly, making you feel valued as a guest. The dining options are exceptional, offering a variety of cuisines that cater to every palate. Whether you're enjoying a casual meal or a fine dining experience, the quality is consistently top-notch. The casino floor is lively, with a great selection of games and a thrilling energy. Overall, Bellagio continues to impress, making it a top choice for anyone visiting Las Vegas."

trgt: I absolutely love this car wash, they take great care of my car and the customer service is amazing!! Thank you Ecowash!
beginning: I absolutely love this car wash, they take great care
mgt: "I absolutely love this car wash, they take great care of my vehicle every time I visit. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every detail is addressed. The quality of the wash is exceptional, leaving my car looking brand new. I appreciate their eco-friendly products and the quick service, making it a convenient choice for my busy schedule. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a reliable and thorough car wash experience!"

trgt:
P. Croissants keeps it fairly simple, so I am going to do the same with my review:

Croissants - AMAZING. Like everyone says, get their early. I really loved the cherry cheese, strawberry, and peanut butter varieties. 

Sandwiches - Meh. Maybe my hopes were too high. They took forever to make and were just so-so.

Coffee and Espresso drinks - BOO. Overpriced and not very good. Go somewhere else for your java.
beginning: P. Croissants keeps it fairly simple, so I am going
mgt: to focus on the essentials that make their offerings stand out. The buttery layers of their croissants are perfectly flaky, and each bite melts in your mouth. The balance of sweetness in their almond croissant is delightful, making it a must-try. The ambiance of the café is cozy, inviting you to linger over your pastry and coffee. Overall, P. Croissants delivers a satisfying experience that keeps me coming back for more.

trgt:
Great and unique concept.  Questionable delivery.  Is it a lounge trying to be a night club crossover kind of thing?  Is it a bar? Why is there a bouncer at the door then? Am I confused? Is that woman even wearing shoes?

I went because some friends had a table (they have bottle service at Insert Coins?) and it sounded interesting.  It was interesting.  

I LOVED having old school and new school video games available at my leisure.  At our table, we had two TVs and two consoles.  There were two black binders with all the games they had and all we had to do was ask for one and the waitress would grab it and switch it out whenever we asked.  Service was really relaxed but still attentive.  Our waitress even hung out with us and played Mario Kart when we were one man down.  

Then it got late.  Then, to my right, there was a DJ and an awkward dance floor kind of spot and people dancing and I wasn't quite sure what was happening.  Then to my left, there were people chilling at a relaxed bar and other groups of people around the arcade games.  It's probably just me, but I thought it was odd.

I'd go back, but only if I was with a larger group of people and probably only if it was for a special occasion.  Oh, and parking is a pain.  But parking downtown is always a pain.
beginning: Great and unique concept. Questionable delivery. Is it a lounge
mgt: "Great and unique concept. Questionable delivery. Is it a lounge or a bar? The ambiance is inviting, but the service was inconsistent. While the decor is stylish and modern, the staff seemed overwhelmed and inattentive at times. The menu offers intriguing options, but the execution fell short. I hope they refine their approach, as the potential is definitely there."

trgt:
Ambiance: 5 stars (for a Vietnamese restaurant, that is, not a steak house)
Food: 1.5 stars 
Service: 2.5 stars

So after hearing how great this place was from a friend, I finally tried it out, and was shocked.  The food was not tasty - I think it was the chicken in the Pho that tasted bad.  The rest was just bland.  Never been back.
beginning: Ambiance: 5 stars (for a Vietnamese restaurant, that is, not
mgt: "Ambiance: 5 stars (for a Vietnamese restaurant, that is, not your typical fine dining experience). The decor is vibrant and inviting, with traditional lanterns and artwork that transport you straight to Vietnam. The soft background music adds to the atmosphere, making it a perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The seating is comfortable, and the layout allows for a cozy yet lively dining experience. Overall, the ambiance sets the stage for a delightful culinary journey."

trgt:
As I was eating dinner at La Cave the other night, I was debating that this review could go anywhere from a 2 star to a 4 star.  We ate there with a group of 6, and since it is Tapas, we were able to try almost everything on the Menu.  Unfortunately, nothing was super memorable.  I'll start with the highlights.

1) Our server was very nice.  Great personality and even gave some good recommendations for offstrip restaurants.
2) The Beef Filet was quite was good.  That and the Charcuterie plate were probably the two best items that we had.
3) The wine selection was quite good.  The Sommelier acted of high importance, but didn't show any action for his promises.  As shown below.

The bad:
1) The restaurant is in the Wynn, and prices were as expected.  They were not outrageous, but for the quality of the food, they seemed a bit high.
2) As we were eating the duck, the Sommelier asked how the duck was.  I told him that it was chewy and not very good.  At first he acted surprised, and said he would take it off the bill.  As the norm, I said, "oh no, that's ok" (still expecting him to do it).  He then replied, "other people have said they didn't like either.  I'm taking it off for you guys."  I figured if he DID stand behind that comment, that would def. bump La Cave up a star.  If he didn't, then it goes down a star because it was that bad.
3) Other disappointing dishes were the overcooked and small Scallops, the watery grits, and the chewy lamb.

La Cave is a 3 star restaurant for the mediocre food, and above average service for the strip.  All dishes were "OK" and nothing blew any of us away.  It was all just OK.  As you guessed, the duck remained on the bill, and as expected, the Sommelier was just giving us words.  I doubt I will be back to La Cave, and gladly try other restaurants in Vegas.
beginning: As I was eating dinner at La Cave the other
mgt: As I was eating dinner at La Cave the other night, I was immediately struck by the warm ambiance and inviting decor. The dim lighting created a cozy atmosphere, perfect for a relaxing evening. The menu offered a delightful array of dishes, and I decided to try their signature steak, which was cooked to perfection. Each bite was tender and flavorful, complemented by a rich sauce that elevated the entire meal. The service was attentive without being intrusive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return for another visit.

trgt: Nice location west of Arcadia. That's about the best I can say. We were a party of 4 for dinner on a Sunday night. Restaurant was about half full. We received water shortly after we sat, then waited 10-15 minutes for a server to come to the table and only after we flagged her down. We were hungry and ordered a bottle of wine, salads and main course all at the same time. It took about 30 minutes to get the wine and 40 minutes for the salads (despite multiple requests for a status on our salads). We asked to speak to a manager, and that took another 10-15 minutes. When he did stop by our table, he asked if he could pour some more wine (no thank you, we were pouring our own and were fine), then he walked away. Completely disinterested. Our main courses came about 10 minutes later. Two of us ordered the flat iron steak - one ordered medium and the other medium well. Both came on the \"well\" side of medium well. Another in our party had the pork special, which was very good. The chicken ordered by our fourth was unremarkable. If I were rating this solely on service alone, it would barely be one star. The rating at two stars is for a nice location and decent (but unremarkable) food.\nI will not be back.
beginning: Nice location west of Arcadia. That's about the best I
mgt: "Nice location west of Arcadia. That's about the best I can say about this place. The service was slow, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. The food was mediocre at best, lacking flavor and presentation. I expected more given the area’s reputation. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that I wouldn’t recommend."

trgt: Having been through PHX several times on my way to my favorite spa in Scottsdale, I generally have a good feeling when I arrive (vacation yay!) and not great when I have to leave (back to reality- boo!).  But that's not the airport's fault...\n\nThis airport is pretty easy to navigate- shuttles to a fancy schmancy off-site rental car center are readily available and convenient, though signs are not as prevalent as they could be.  People mover walkways are prevalent in the long walkways connecting areas of the airport.  Since Arizona is very hot, strong air conditioning is important so I notice that it's pretty good, since I feel comfy until the hair dryer-like blast I receive when I walk out the electronic doors to get to the shuttle.  The airport is a little old and dated; gates are not as spacious as they could be for the amount of passengers for each flight, and bathrooms are cramped and have limited space for everyone's rolling bags.  And I cannot find Coke brand beverages (especially Dasani) after security to save my life, or scorched throat.  Gimme some options PHX!
beginning: Having been through PHX several times on my way to
mgt: "Having been through PHX several times on my way to various destinations, I can confidently say that it’s one of the more efficient airports I've encountered. The layout is intuitive, making it easy to navigate between terminals. The dining options are diverse, offering everything from quick snacks to sit-down meals. Security lines tend to move quickly, which is a huge plus for travelers in a hurry. Overall, PHX provides a pleasant experience, making layovers much more bearable."

trgt:
The environment is clean with a spacious dining area. 

There is a wide menu selection of seafood items 

We ordered the following dishes:

1) Yang chow fried rice with BBQ pork and shrimp.

2) Fillet fish with vegetables

3) Sesame chicken

4) Half duck

My favorites were the fried rice and sesame chicken. The taste of each dish is average.
beginning: The environment is clean with a spacious dining area. \n\nThere
mgt:
The environment is clean with a spacious dining area. 

There is a welcoming atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that every need is met promptly. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes, each prepared with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which showcased local produce. Overall, it’s a delightful place to enjoy a meal with family or friends. Highly recommended!

trgt: The butterfish tataki, salmon sashimi, and pork belly with Kim chi is delicious! pineapple flavored Shochu is yummy
beginning: The butterfish tataki, salmon sashimi, and pork belly with Kim
mgt: The butterfish tataki, salmon sashimi, and pork belly with kimchi were a delightful trio that showcased the chef's skill and creativity. Each dish was beautifully presented, with the butterfish melting in my mouth, the salmon fresh and vibrant, and the pork belly perfectly crispy. The balance of flavors was exceptional, with the kimchi adding a spicy kick that complemented the richness of the pork. Overall, a memorable dining experience that left me eager to return for more.

trgt: The salsa and the fact it's a neat old building (on the outside) is the only reason it gets 2 stars. Tamales' were drenched in a red sauce and tortilla soup was luke warm and mediocre at best. Chips were cold and hard not warm and crispy. Overpriced for the quality of meal. Real disappointment when there's better Mexican food in Indianapolis!
beginning: The salsa and the fact it's a neat old building
mgt: "The salsa and the fact it's a neat old building create a charming atmosphere that instantly draws you in. The vibrant decor complements the lively music, making it a perfect spot for a night out. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring that your experience is enjoyable from start to finish. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. Overall, it's a fantastic place to unwind and savor delicious food."

trgt: thank you yelpers, this really helped in the 100 degree weather! never would dared to try the place on my own w/ its dingy house-like exterior. The custard tasted really fresh and a lot lighter than ice cream. but i give it 4 stars because of their limited selection. i wanted a butter pecan but the guy said he only had, vanilla, strawberry, choc, rocky road, and a couple others. i settled for the rocky road, but was dissapointed so i went back and ordered the luv it special (vanilla w/ pecans and moschino cherries) and that definitely did it for me!
beginning: thank you yelpers, this really helped in the 100 degree
mgt: "thank you yelpers, this really helped in the 100 degree heat! The air conditioning was a lifesaver, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The drinks were refreshing, and the atmosphere was perfect for cooling off. I highly recommend the iced coffee; it was just what I needed to beat the heat. Overall, a fantastic experience!"

trgt:
My friends and I had a poor first experience at Rx Boiler Room last night. We arrived around 10:15pm looking for dinner. The restaurant was mostly empty except for a couple of bar patrons, 2 or 3 four tops and a party of 12 (or so) in the back. 

We were a party of 7, and it took the hostess a few minutes to figure out where to seat us.  The table selected needed to he cleaned so we waited a few minutes for that to happen. This was the first of several red flags for the night as it was over 5 minutes for the staff to clean and set the table 

After seating we ordered a round of drinks, water and some appetizers. The drinks arrived in 10 minutes, apps arrived in 15 minutes, and the waiter came around to get out dinner drink order. 

We had to ask for appetizer plates. Twice. Eventually they arrived. 

Another 10 minutes elapsed while the waiter informed a member if our party that her light beer wasn't available. Strange that they have Miller Lite and Bud Light but no Coors Light? Anyway, drink order was still incomplete as I was asked three times about which beer I had ordered (Innis and Gunn, off the menu). 

The food was decent. Not outstanding for the price, but acceptable. 

Approaching 45 minutes since our arrival, still no 2nd round and we hadn't ordered dinner. We made the decision to leave and a member of our party approached the manager.

The manager apologized (ok) and then proceeded to claim no knowledge of a problem (hmm), blame us for not saying something sooner (not ok), and then had the temerity to ask us to give his restaurant another try. FAIL. 

Sorry, mate. The manager should know what's going on. When he sees apps on the table, menus still on the table, no app plates, no drinks and it's been a while... He should stop by and ask if we are ok.  Instead he didn't engage, and as a result he lost is as customers. 
And I'm sharing our poor experience with other Yelpers in hopes that you won't suffer as we did. 

Epilogue: We walked to another restaurant in Mandalay Place, arriving a few minutes after 11. Within minutes we were seated, our drink order was promptly filled and food was quickly served. We finished, happily full, at 11:45.  Rx Boiler Room, take that as a lesson on how to serve customers.
beginning: My friends and I had a poor first experience at
mgt: "My friends and I had a poor first experience at the new restaurant downtown. The service was incredibly slow, and our orders were mixed up. After waiting over 30 minutes for our appetizers, we were disappointed to find that they were cold and lacked flavor. The atmosphere was nice, but it couldn't make up for the lackluster food and inattentive staff. We left feeling unsatisfied and unlikely to return."

trgt: Egg Rolls were really good.  Sweet and Sour Chickent was meh.  We'll probably go again, but try something else.
beginning: Egg Rolls were really good. Sweet and Sour Chickent was
mgt: "Egg Rolls were really good. Sweet and Sour Chicken was equally impressive, with a perfect balance of tangy and sweet flavors. The chicken was tender, and the sauce had just the right amount of thickness. The dish was served with a generous portion of rice, which complemented the meal nicely. Overall, a delightful experience that left me wanting to return for more!"

trgt:
I had to think of some options for a jazz club, and while there are quite a few places to go in this great city, La Maison is a bit of an institution and it was also convenient at the time for where I was staying.

The place as you probably know from reading, has a mandatory coat check, cover.. etc...

I did not have any of the food, but settled in at a much later time to hear some music and just have a drink and take it in easy for the late night. The vibe here is classic, huge amounts of wood, chandeliers, green naugahyde booths with brass rivets, giving a great feel.  Much eye candy in ambience.  The waitresses wear flapper style feathers from their hair, and the place feels classy, but it also looks like that even with the cover they don't really enforce a dresscode either.

I am a big cocktail fan, and the options here listed are some of the basics, with a list of martinis that range to basic standards to has beens (apple and chocolate I am looking at you).  My wife went for an Americano, props for having this on the menu and I asked for a Brandy Alexander which unfortunately was made with milk and not cream like it should, but this is disclosed on the menu.  It was also served on ice which in my opinion is a big no no.

I get the impression they are not big on the cocktails here, this is not a cocktail nerds paradise by any stretch.  Drink service is also a little slow, but nothing horrid, but a floor manager dressed impecably would often come out with what appeared to be warmed home made chips with salt and black pepper to our table and others.

Still the place is a bit pricey to see some music, and you are paying for the atmosphere.  I liked this place but certainly didn't fall in love with it.  It also has decent acoustics.  But if it's in your area it's worth checking out, it is an institution no question.
beginning: I had to think of some options for a jazz
mgt: "I had to think of some options for a jazz concert to attend, and I stumbled upon a local venue that promised an intimate setting. The atmosphere was electric, with dim lighting and cozy seating that made it perfect for enjoying the music. The musicians were incredibly talented, blending classic standards with innovative improvisations that kept the audience captivated. Each note resonated deeply, creating a memorable experience that left me wanting more. I can't wait to return for another night of soulful melodies."

trgt: This place is like NEVER open! Are there like secret hours?
beginning: This place is like NEVER open! Are there like secret
mgt: "This place is like NEVER open! Are there like secret hours I’m not aware of? I’ve tried visiting multiple times, but it always seems closed. The inconsistent hours are incredibly frustrating, especially since I’ve heard great things about the food. I really want to give it a chance, but it’s hard to recommend a place that’s never available. Maybe they need to update their schedule or improve their communication. I hope they figure it out soon!"

trgt:
Doesn't compare to Mac's Speed Shop.  My first visit went well, a lazy Sunday afternoon with a couple buddies when they weren't too busy.  The menu looks really good but the pulled pork I ordered didn't stand up to Mac's.  My buddy liked it better than Mac's, but I think he's biased since he lives 2 miles from Midwood Smokehouse (to be honest, I live 2 miles away from Mac's).

My second visit was a complete disaster.  Originally planned to go to Mac's this past Friday (Jun 24) with 5 out-of-town buddies plus 2 others, and got talked into changing to Midwood Smokehouse (same buddy as above).  

While their menu states they may run out of bbq from time to time (never seen a restaurant advertise running out of food before, but whatever), they were out of pulled pork bbq on Friday night at 8:00, and also out of bacon wrapped jalepenos (gotta love the south, they wrap everything in bacon).

I ordered a rack of ribs to compare to Mac's and they tasted like they were cooked in the oven as they had zero smoke flavor.  The bbq sauce didn't help at all, too bland.  The waiter hooked us up with wings since they were out of pork bbq and the wings were supposedly smoked but had zero flavor.  No rub, no sauce, no nothin.  The mac & cheese however was very good (close to Mac's).

I tried my buddy's sausage and it was dry and tasted like cardboard.  Midwood Smokehouse has been open for only 2 months, hopefully they step up their game!
beginning: Doesn't compare to Mac's Speed Shop. My first visit went
mgt: "Doesn't compare to Mac's Speed Shop. My first visit went surprisingly well, but the overall experience fell short of my expectations. The service was friendly, but the food lacked the bold flavors I was hoping for. The ribs were tender, yet they needed more seasoning, and the sides were just average. I left feeling underwhelmed and wishing I had chosen a different spot."

trgt: The price is not bad, but I would have expected better for it. The meat was bland, with only the short ribs and pork being decent. The side dishes didn't make sense, they were very \"Americanized\", and I don't understand why you have to pay extra money for lettuce. The price isn't that much extra, but it's the concept. Isn't meat more expensive than lettuce? Why is that unlimited...
beginning: The price is not bad, but I would have expected
mgt: The price is not bad, but I would have expected higher quality for what I received. The materials felt cheap, and the craftsmanship was lacking. While the design was appealing, it didn't hold up well after a few uses. I was disappointed overall and would recommend looking for alternatives.

trgt: First trip here tried mix grill and beef swarma.
beginning: First trip here tried mix grill and beef swarma.
mgt: First trip here tried mix grill and beef shawarma. Both dishes were incredibly flavorful, with the mix grill perfectly cooked and tender. The beef shawarma was juicy and well-seasoned, wrapped in warm pita. The accompanying garlic sauce added a delightful kick. The atmosphere was inviting, and the staff were friendly and attentive. I can't wait to return and explore more of the menu!

trgt: I have been using them for years! Wonderful work and great attention to detail.
beginning: I have been using them for years! Wonderful work and
mgt: "I have been using them for years! Wonderful work and consistently high quality. Their attention to detail is unmatched, and the customer service is always friendly and responsive. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for reliable and professional service."

trgt: This is the best place to come when u have a seafood craving. I always order the snow crab, which are actually a very good size in legs compared to most other places. I ordered once the king crab legs and that filled me up really good. When u choose your type of seafood u get to choose the type of seasoning , such as Ragin' Cajun for me, and the level of spiciness, which fortunately for me they have non spicy as an option. My favorite also are their side red potatoes and their cajun fries. \n\nThey have a lot of tv's everywhere so it's great for watching the game. There's writing all over the walls and seats, but I think it's pre-made because there are signs saying they will fine u if you write on the walls.
beginning: This is the best place to come when u have
mgt: "This is the best place to come when you have a craving for authentic Italian cuisine. The pasta is homemade and cooked to perfection, while the sauces burst with flavor. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it perfect for a cozy dinner or a special celebration. Don't forget to try their tiramisu; it's simply divine!"

trgt: Don't let the neighborhood or outside scare you. The place is Great! Amazing unique Mexican cuisine.
beginning: Don't let the neighborhood or outside scare you. The place
mgt: "Don't let the neighborhood or outside scare you. The place may look unassuming, but once you step inside, you’re greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The decor is charming, and the staff is incredibly friendly, making you feel right at home. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, each bursting with flavor. I highly recommend the signature pasta; it’s simply divine! Overall, a hidden gem worth visiting."

trgt:
Comparé à d'autres hotels, le prix est plutôt dans la fourchette haute, et surtout il n'y a pas de tarif spécial pour les enfants...
Le choix est assez varié, même si on peut déplorer l'absence de sushi dignes de ce nom. Le traiteur italien est aussi décevant.
En revanche les pattes de Snow Crab sont délicieuses, et la viande est plutôt bonnes aussi.
Enfin les desserts sont probablement ce qu'il y a de mieux, aussi bien d'un point de vue gustatif que visuel.
beginning: Compar\u00e9 \u00e0 d'autres hotels, le prix est plut\u00f4t dans la
mgt: "Comparé à d'autres hôtels, le prix est plutôt dans la moyenne, mais la qualité du service et des installations justifie cet investissement. Les chambres sont spacieuses et bien entretenues, offrant un confort appréciable. Le personnel est accueillant et toujours prêt à aider. De plus, l'emplacement est idéal, proche des attractions principales. Je recommande vivement cet hôtel pour un séjour agréable."

trgt: For the privilege of sitting next to the kitchen I was treated to a mediocre meal that balanced lukewarm French toast with overcooked eggs. I would have mentioned it to my server, but I feared the sweat dripping from his brow would land in my plate had he stood still long enough to actually listen to me. The entire restaurant is in need of a good scrubbing (think walls and table sides/edges) so that patrons are not forced to share space with the remnants of past meals. Overall, thumbs down.
beginning: For the privilege of sitting next to the kitchen I
mgt: "For the privilege of sitting next to the kitchen, I was treated to a symphony of sizzling sounds and tantalizing aromas. The chefs worked with a rhythm that was almost hypnotic, each dish crafted with precision and care. The vibrant colors of the fresh ingredients were a feast for the eyes, and I couldn't help but feel excited about what was to come. Every plate that emerged was a work of art, showcasing not only skill but also a deep passion for culinary excellence."

trgt:
I had been patiently waiting for this place to open! I was super excited when they did, however a little underwhelmed by some of the reviews. Maybe I had hyped it up in my head too much? But I decided to give it a go anyway. 

Went here for brunch on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately sat. We were kind of lucky coming a bit later as it wasn't too busy. The decor is adorable, with bright, spring colors. Unfortunately it was too cold to dine outside, so we were sat indoors. The booths are bright green and quite roomy-I wondered what this place was beforehand? My boyfriend seems to think it used to be a sushi restaurant. 

 Our server was Lauren, and she was really friendly and helpful with the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered mimosas and coffee, and drinks came relatively quickly.  The menu is rather extensive with both breakfast and lunch choices. I opted to order the Scottsdale Burrito (egg whites, tomato, spinach, goat cheese and hash browns), and my boyfriend ordered the My Eggs My Way. Our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time, and was delicious! 

Overall, my experience with Morning Squeeze was a good one. Although they just opened, I feel like they are a very promising restaurant. I had realistic expectations that were far exceeded by the excellent service and delicious food. Will definitely come back again!
beginning: I had been patiently waiting for this place to open!
mgt: I had been patiently waiting for this place to open! The anticipation was worth it, as the atmosphere is vibrant and inviting. The staff greeted us with warm smiles, and the menu offered a delightful array of options. Each dish we tried was bursting with flavor, showcasing fresh ingredients and creative combinations. I can't wait to return and explore more of their offerings!

trgt: This restaurant location used to be El Mas Sabroso. Sadly, El Mas Sabroso is permanently closed. This is the new Mexican joint there now.  They cleaned it up a bit and redecorated/remodeled. Kinda like Filiberto's, but nicer and more modern inside. I think they were going for the Chipotle's look. Their food is good and the pricing is about the same. Carnitas was really dry which is odd. Rice is outstanding.\n\nLike Filiberto's, the burritos come with pure meat. Wanna add rice or beans? It'll cost ya! Wait... they have to remove meat to fit the rice/beans. Rice and beans are cheaper than meat! Why on earth would anyone charge more money when they are saving money??!?  Senseless.
beginning: This restaurant location used to be El Mas Sabroso. Sadly,
mgt: "This restaurant location used to be El Mas Sabroso. Sadly, it has not lived up to its predecessor's standards. The ambiance feels lackluster, and the service was slow and inattentive. While the menu offers a variety of options, the flavors were underwhelming and lacked the authenticity I was hoping for. Overall, it was a disappointing experience that left me longing for the vibrant dishes I used to enjoy."

trgt: The idea is great and what inevitably will get you to try Oink Cafe.  The hostess staff and most employees seem to have better things to do than be at work.  I ordered the BLT.  It is listed as one of their specialties. The waitstaff asked what type of bacon I wanted as they offer eight flavors.  I stated Applewood, but changed my mind and said, bring whatever you recommend.  The BLT came out in three layers of blah wheat bread.  I'm pretty sure it was a 99 cent loaf of bread and the bacon had no flavor at all.  The manager came around and asked how our lunch was, I told him it was okay.  He said just ok and I told him my thoughts; the meal was rather bland.  He said, hopefully, they can impress better my next visit.  They won't have that opportunity.  Where we can order bacon everything from specialty store, don't eat here if you want some Jimmy Dean packaged bacon.
beginning: The idea is great and what inevitably will get you
mgt: "The idea is great and what inevitably will get you hooked is the unique blend of creativity and execution. The characters are well-developed, and the storyline keeps you engaged from start to finish. However, some pacing issues in the middle could have been improved. Overall, it’s a refreshing take that leaves you wanting more."

trgt:
Normally i have an okay time here. My last visit wasnt even okay. 

I didnt even get a chance to eat here and had to leave due to the terrible service. We took a seat at the bar and ordered the deep dish pizza we were craving all diggity day long and a brown ale, along with a couple waters. Then we watched the bartenders behind the bar have internal drama and not even look in our direction as we waited.....and waited........annnnnnd waited. Neither the bar nor the dining area was busy or even half full and i sat for 17 minutes without even the orders for the waters go fulfilled. 
At that point i had seen enough and had to walk out before the food and drinks even arrived. I hated to do it but i could not support the staff and business where that could happen. 

The bottom line is that it was a bad experience but the food i have had here in the past has always been solid, the beer is surprisingly good and priced very well.
beginning: Normally i have an okay time here. My last visit
mgt: "Normally I have an okay time here. My last visit, however, was quite disappointing. The service was slow, and my order was incorrect. I had to wait an extra 20 minutes for my meal, which was frustrating. The staff seemed overwhelmed and not very attentive. I hope this was just an off day, as I’ve enjoyed my previous experiences."

trgt: Cool place, good food, horrible service. I want to like this place but the staff is cold and inconsiderate. Makes you feel like they are doing you a favor by letting you eat here. If service is important,  go somewhere else.
beginning: Cool place, good food, horrible service. I want to like
mgt: this restaurant because the ambiance is inviting and the menu offers a variety of delicious options. However, the service was incredibly slow and unresponsive. It took ages for our orders to be taken, and even longer for our food to arrive. Despite the tasty dishes, the lack of attention from the staff really overshadowed the experience. I hope they can improve their service, as I would love to return and enjoy a better dining experience.

trgt: Great burger. One of the best fast food burgers I've ever had, right behind 5 guys.
beginning: Great burger. One of the best fast food burgers I've
mgt: "Great burger. One of the best fast food burgers I've ever had! The patty was juicy and cooked to perfection, with just the right amount of seasoning. The fresh toppings, including crisp lettuce and ripe tomatoes, added a delightful crunch. The bun was soft yet sturdy, holding everything together without falling apart. I can't wait to go back for another!"

trgt:
I'm a tourist in Scottsdale and I love Pinnacle Peak Patio Steakhouse.

I felt like a real cowgirl eatin' meat after a long day of doing cowgirl activities on set with the Bonanza cast. I miss Little Joe. He was a cutie.

It's still warm out so we sat in the backyard with live entertainment from a real cowboy singing cowboy tunes plus some Tom Petty and Elvis.

The food is basic but the meat is well done. I asked for a medium rare filet mignon and that's exactly what I got. Plus I got a potato, mini corn on the cob, salad, cowboy beans, and wheat bread. 

I'm still full four hours after dinner.
beginning: I'm a tourist in Scottsdale and I love Pinnacle Peak
mgt: I'm a tourist in Scottsdale and I love Pinnacle Peak. The breathtaking views from the summit are absolutely worth the hike. The trails are well-maintained and offer a variety of difficulty levels, making it accessible for everyone. I particularly enjoyed the vibrant desert flora and the chance to spot local wildlife. The sunrise from the peak is a must-see, painting the sky in stunning colors. Overall, it's a perfect blend of adventure and natural beauty that I highly recommend to anyone visiting the area.

trgt: It not to crowded which is great though it is a little dirty & the parking lot sucks! \n\nFor a Harkins I did expect more out of the theater than what they provided.  In the end it does the job & I can still watch movies in somewhat of a comfort.
beginning: It not to crowded which is great though it is
mgt: "It not too crowded, which is great, though it is still bustling with energy. The atmosphere is vibrant, and the staff are incredibly friendly. The menu offers a delightful variety of options, catering to different tastes. I particularly enjoyed the seasonal specials, which were fresh and flavorful. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing yet lively dining spot."

trgt: guidos has really good french fries. REALLY REALLY GOOD. like sneak them off your husband's plate when he's in the bathroom even though you already have your own good...\n\n...but remember all those people you hated in high-school? the ones you figured would join a fraternity or sorority to try and legitimize the fact that they are drunk, mentally disturbed, and semi-literate? remember how you thought they'd all still be acting like jack-asses in their thirties? well, you were right, and i promise you, they are hanging out at guidos right now with five hundred of their best friends.
beginning: guidos has really good french fries. REALLY REALLY GOOD. like
mgt: "like the kind that make you question every other fry you've ever had. They're perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, seasoned just right. Each bite is a delightful crunch that leaves you wanting more. Paired with their house-made dipping sauces, these fries elevate the experience to a whole new level. I could easily make a meal out of just these fries!"

trgt: i wanted to catch some sun so i went downstairs with my friend to check out the pools.. walk past a couple pools to the other side and there's a short line already.. guestlist even for aria hotel guests? we got there about 11 and the line took forever.. there were only about 10 people ahead of us too.. daybeds were going to $100 when we first fell in line.. i went to the bathroom and when i got back they raised the price to $150.. if there was a good dj i knew spinning then we would've put down the money for one.. good thing we didn't bc when we got inside about 30min later, the pool lounge was empty! why? bc everyone that was in line ahead of us left soon after entering.. the pool was tiny and dj was just ok.. the only thing good about this place was that there was free champagne for ladies from 11-1.. i def took advantage of this and passed mine along to my friend before waiting a few min for refills..after a few trips to the bar i got another glass of champ and we were allowed to pour it into a plastic cup (classy, i know) before leaving the lounge.. total time spent at liquid- no more than 30 min.. we just went to the reg aria pools and that was good enough for me..i made a few trips back for the free champagne and didn't have to wait in line bc i still had my stamp..\n\ni would only come back if i was staying at aria, the free champagne, and if a dj i knew was going to be there..
beginning: i wanted to catch some sun so i went downstairs
mgt: "I wanted to catch some sun, so I went downstairs to the patio. The warm rays felt incredible on my skin, and the gentle breeze added to the relaxing atmosphere. I settled into a comfortable lounge chair with a good book, enjoying the peaceful surroundings. The vibrant flowers and chirping birds made it the perfect escape from my busy week."

trgt:
I've just returned to AZ after a long period of time in Seattle where there are no Chick-fil-a's. While I don't exactly agree with some of their corporate philosophies, including the whole silly closed on Sundays things, I still find myself craving that #4 spicy chicken combo.. 

Did you know you can order your sandwich bun-less and have them wrap it up in lettuce for you? It's certainly messier, but just as delicious.

And I LOVE chick-fil-a sauce.. I swear they put crack in that stuff.. my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I can also recommend the honey mustard sauce even though its a tad too sweet for my taste.
beginning: I've just returned to AZ after a long period of
mgt: "I've just returned to AZ after a long period of traveling, and I must say, the warmth and beauty of the desert never fail to amaze me. The vibrant sunsets, the stunning landscapes, and the friendly locals make it feel like home. Each visit brings new adventures, whether it's hiking in the mountains or exploring charming towns. I can't wait to dive back into the local culture and enjoy all the outdoor activities this incredible state has to offer."

trgt: Food is pretty good. Its kind of a late night teen hang out spot. \n\nThis one chick that works there is really rude. She never smiles, never even says hello when you walk in, and I kind of think shes a bit racist? I am white.. never once is has she been nice to me. But my bff is of Mexican decent.. and shes always supper sweet to her. if you come in often, you know exactly who I'm talking. She should not be working in a place where you have to be face to face with people. Rude person.
beginning: Food is pretty good. Its kind of a late night
mgt: "Food is pretty good. It's kind of a late night spot, perfect for satisfying those midnight cravings. The menu offers a variety of options, from hearty burgers to delicious tacos. The atmosphere is relaxed, making it a great place to unwind with friends. Service is friendly, though it can get a bit slow during peak hours. Overall, a solid choice for a casual bite!"

trgt: Probably the worst run business I have ever dealt with in my entire life.
beginning: Probably the worst run business I have ever dealt with
mgt: "Probably the worst run business I have ever dealt with. The customer service was unresponsive, and my order was delayed multiple times without any explanation. When I finally reached out, I was met with indifference and a lack of accountability. It’s frustrating to see such poor management, and I would not recommend this company to anyone looking for reliability."

trgt:
I have very mixed feelings about the Mirage. Some things were great, others just OK, while some things sucked ass.

First the good: The renovated rooms are very nice. Flat screen TV's plus all kinds of ports for computers, video games, and an Ipod dock. Lots of granite , very comfortable chairs, all around a tasteful, comfortable room.  Also the air-conditioning was quiet and very cool. The only complaints about the room were the cheap plastic toilet seat that wouldn't fucking stay up when I was urinating, and the shower/tub combo seemed claustrophobic and I couldn't help but get the entire floor wet when bathing. 

The buffet was also very good, and laid out well, no bottlenecks of people standing holding their plates impatiently waiting for food (hear me Paris?) The asian items were my favorite along with huge cold crab legs. Japonais restaurant was excellent. Though expensive, the service was amazing and every single item was yummy.  

I did have good luck in the casino on the slots, despite Mirage's reputation for having a tight casino.  I played ALIEN slots and won like $150 in a matter of seconds when I hit a bonus round and blew the alien out of the airlock.  I screamed out loud I was so happy.  I never ever win anything. That made my fucking day!!

Now for what was bad:  Caribe Cafe--this place sucked big steaming brown loafs! The service was atrocious, the menu very limited and expensive, and the food was dog shit. All big strip casino's have a diner/coffee shop usually open 24hrs, but this place was awful in every way, even the coffee sucked!  Downscale, older places i have stayed at such the Imperial Palace, or Tropicana had better  coffee shops.  

There also seemed to be a lot of small technical problems which were frequent.  The card keys were stubborn and had to be inserted repeatedly EVERY SINGLE TIME I entered the room.  When I contacted the front desk they talked down to me like i had in IQ of ten.  Scripted, condescending answers and questions--"Did you insert the card right? Make sure the strip is facing this way, etc. etc" I also had problems with my MGM-Mirage players card having to get a new card TWICE within a four day visit. Each time the ignorant, inept employee gave me a totally different (wrong) explanation on why my card kept malfunctioning.  I hate it when places of business refuse to honestly answer questions and give scripted or made up bullshit answers.  The final demonstration of incompetence was on my final day in Vegas when I had a slot machine voucher I wanted to cash in.  The computers were down and it was impossible to cash in the voucher, even by going to a live teller instead of a machine.  Thankfully the voucher was only for $7.67 but still...

The only time the hotel incompetence worked in my favor was the mini bar in the room.  Me and my friends had some of the tiny liquor bottles in the mini bar and should have been been charged approximately $36.  Well, it's been over a month and no charge on my card!  Woohoo! I shoulda drank more;)

So, would I stay at the Mirage again? Probably not. Despite the reasonable rate of $77 a night and the nicely updated room and excellent location, there was just too much spotty service and general hotel incompetence to make me wanna risk it.
beginning: I have very mixed feelings about the Mirage. Some things
mgt: I have very mixed feelings about the Mirage. Some things were truly exceptional, like the stunning views and the vibrant atmosphere. However, the service left much to be desired, with long wait times and inattentive staff. The rooms were comfortable but could use some updates. Overall, it’s a mixed bag that might appeal to some but not to others.

trgt: WORST SERVICE EVER!! people are SOOO SO SO RUDE!! the yogurt is SOOO GROSS!! noone go here !!!! its the worst frozen yogurt place in the valley! needs to be shut down!
beginning: WORST SERVICE EVER!! people are SOOO SO SO RUDE!! the
mgt: "WORST SERVICE EVER!! People are SOOO SO SO RUDE!! The staff seemed completely uninterested in helping customers and were dismissive when asked questions. I left feeling frustrated and disrespected. I will never return to this place again!"

trgt:
Being a full-time grad student, I frequent coffee houses frequently. This Starbucks was pleasant enough overall, but the lady taking my order had the personality of a lima bean. This location should put heir friendly staff as the first point of contact and leave the grumpy smurfs behind the counter, where they can make some coffee magic and not have to interact with humans. 

Also, the place was relatively empty, yet not one of the three ladies behind the counter thought to take a broom to the place. Not very clean and no effort to correct that. 

Our breakfast and coffees were delicious, though. No complaints there!
beginning: Being a full-time grad student, I frequent coffee houses frequently.
mgt: Being a full-time grad student, I frequent coffee houses frequently. This particular spot has quickly become my favorite. The ambiance is cozy, with soft lighting and comfortable seating that makes it perfect for studying. The baristas are friendly and always ready to recommend their best brews. I particularly love their seasonal lattes, which are both delicious and beautifully crafted. The Wi-Fi is reliable, and there are plenty of power outlets, making it an ideal place to work on assignments. Overall, it’s a great environment that fuels my productivity and creativity.

trgt: It's been a while since I have been on here, but just an update, Sammy's has redeemed themselves over and over these last two years. \nMy FIL got us started on there happy hour specials. My daughters LOVE their potstickers, and I love the chicken satay (but prefer to dip them in the potsticker sauce). My FIL raves about the duck tacos, husband loves the pizza (they have a great GF crust) \nAnd they have a sundae the size of your head.
beginning: It's been a while since I have been on here,
mgt: "It's been a while since I have been on here, but I felt compelled to share my thoughts on this latest experience. The atmosphere was inviting, and the staff were incredibly friendly. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, and I was particularly impressed by the seasonal specials. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. I can't wait to return and try more!"

trgt: We stayed here for a few nights in the summer. Check-in was easy, and they upgraded our room to a very spacious suite. The amenities were excellent, and it was nice to come back to a comfortable, quiet room after spending a lot of time (And money) on The Strip!
beginning: We stayed here for a few nights in the summer.
mgt: We stayed here for a few nights in the summer. The location was perfect, just a short walk from the beach. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, making our stay even more enjoyable. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a lovely view of the ocean. The amenities, including the pool and restaurant, exceeded our expectations. We would definitely return!

trgt: Food was lackluster. Service was slow and unorganized.  Typical Vegas over-priced.  The only redeeming quality is the view of the Bellagio fountains.
beginning: Food was lackluster. Service was slow and unorganized. Typical Vegas
mgt: Food was lackluster. Service was slow and unorganized. Typical Vegas experience, where the glitz often overshadows quality. The menu promised much but delivered little, with dishes that felt bland and uninspired. Our server seemed overwhelmed, forgetting our drink orders and taking ages to check on us. For a city known for its culinary delights, this was a disappointing outing. I expected more excitement and flavor, but instead, I left feeling underwhelmed and unsatisfied. Would not recommend.

trgt: Best breakfast in Phoenix hands-down!\nLove, love, love the Chop and chick!  The pork chop is cooked perfectly.  First time ever I've had a pork chop cooked and seasoned perfectly that I didn't make myself :)
beginning: Best breakfast in Phoenix hands-down!\nLove, love, love the Chop and
mgt:
"Best breakfast in Phoenix hands-down!  
Love, love, love the Chop and Eggs! The flavors are incredible, and the portions are generous. The atmosphere is cozy, making it perfect for a weekend brunch. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a delightful dining experience. Don't forget to try their signature coffee blend; it pairs perfectly with any dish. Highly recommend!"

trgt: Ugggh.  That should be enough for this review but I'll explain a little more.  This place just sucks.  The food is mediocre and I'd rather eat taco bell for the price.  Why does everyone go gah gah over crappy texmex?  Oh it must be the margaritas, cause alcohol makes every taste perfect.  I will never waste another night trying to stomach this crap.
beginning: Ugggh. That should be enough for this review but I'll
mgt: "Ugggh. That should be enough for this review but I'll elaborate. The experience was utterly disappointing, with poor service and lackluster food. The ambiance felt stale, and the staff seemed overwhelmed and uninterested. I expected much more based on the hype, but it fell flat in every aspect. Save your time and money for a place that truly values its customers."

trgt: Came here because of all the positive reviews, but wouldn't go out of my way to go there...The prices aren't as great as everyone seemed like it is...for prepared foods, I can go to Sunflower Market or Fresh and Easy, also Geri's Old Philadelphia at Pecos/Tropicana also sells a bunch of East Coast Favorites like Tastykake and Wise Chips and Drakes and stuff like that...Only thing that my mom would probably go to Glazier's for is pork roll...But living at Sandhill/Hacienda we have plenty of choices on where to go and can price compare and have plenty of stores with the same East Coast selection...Its good that the SW now has a choice other than the expensive VONS or the always-busy Wal-Mart...
beginning: Came here because of all the positive reviews, but wouldn't
mgt: Came here because of all the positive reviews, but wouldn't say it lived up to the hype. The service was slow, and my meal was underseasoned. While the ambiance was nice, I expected more from the food based on what others had said. I might give it another try, but I left feeling disappointed.

trgt: Tried to come here for lunch today. Sign advertised 5.95 lunch and I work right across the street, so I thought what the heck... \"it can't be that bad.\" Well we will never know cause they were closed for lunch. No sign, no explanation, just flat out locked doors. Unacceptable.\n\nThe only reason this place gets two stars is they offer free chips and salsa with check-in. Fun fact, 94% of mexican restaurants already offer free chips and salsa.
beginning: Tried to come here for lunch today. Sign advertised 5.95
mgt: Tried to come here for lunch today. Sign advertised 5.95, but when I ordered, I was informed that the price had changed. The staff seemed overwhelmed and the service was slow. After waiting for nearly 30 minutes, my meal finally arrived, but it was lukewarm and lacked flavor. I expected more for the price. Overall, I left disappointed and unlikely to return.

trgt: This place is not clean!  Had my nails done there yesterday but noticed that the nail stations and towels were dirty.  My nails look good but if I get fungus I will sue.  I won't be back.
beginning: This place is not clean! Had my nails done there
mgt: "This place is not clean! Had my nails done there, and I was really disappointed. The tools looked unsterilized, and the staff seemed rushed. I noticed dust and debris in the corners, which made me question their hygiene practices. The nail technician was friendly, but I couldn't shake off the feeling of unease. I won't be returning."

trgt:
They do a great job! Ive been going here for many years, and they are prompt and they have good customer service.

If you go you should get the stylist Tommy, he is the owner and he styles hair as well. I recommend him for two main reasons, one he is very good at giving you the look you want, but he is also very funny. He talks to you and he has this chinese accent and its hilarious to listen to.
