I honeslty think after reading reviews on this site at a few places about theft issues of peoples rooms bring broken into that the housekeeping did this to allow somene else to come in and rob our room but we came back from the pool too soon (guess I SHOULD thank those unruly kids for that one).... we immediately called down to security who came up to our room and because nothing was taken that we could see, was indifferent and acted as it it was no big deal.  He said he thinks housekeeping must have accidentally did that (seriously????) Why would security even do that, cmon'....   I called down to the front desk and explained what happened and asked to speak to the manager and was put on \"perma-hold\" so eventually hung up,  I did eventually make contact with a manager (Tim I think) who was pretty indifferent about it as well. When something like that happens it sort of ruins your thoughts about a place regardless of anything else that may have been good.   Will we return there? Doubtful, we're headed back to Vegas in May 2011 and am staying at The Palazzo.....
beginning: Hubby and I make a trek to Vegas every summer
mgt: "Hubby and I make a trek to Vegas every summer, and this year was no exception. We were excited to explore new restaurants and shows, but we also revisited some of our favorite spots. The energy of the Strip is always exhilarating, and we loved discovering hidden gems off the beaten path. The food was exceptional, especially at the new Italian place we tried. Overall, it was another unforgettable trip filled with laughter, great memories, and a little bit of luck at the tables!"

trgt: I have to be honest and say that I buy most of my books on line.  The reason I am reviewing this place is because my wife and I immediately come to this place if we have any time to kill before our movie starts at the Tempe Marketplace. We were here the other day and I liked the variety of magazines they have in the front so I don't have to walk all the way to back for some mindless reading when killing time.  I love American history and they had a very nice section of Time Magazine specialty issues about the American Revolution.  Gotta give it to Barnes and Nobles for enhancing my down time in the best way.
beginning: I have to be honest and say that I buy
mgt: "I have to be honest and say that I buy a lot of products online, but this one truly exceeded my expectations. The quality is outstanding, and the delivery was prompt. I was particularly impressed with how well it was packaged, ensuring everything arrived in perfect condition. The customer service team was also incredibly helpful when I had questions. Overall, I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for reliability and value."

trgt: Every time I go there is empty shelves throughout the entire food section no matter when I go... have talked to managers so much about this they know me by name now, still not stocked as any busy store should be...
beginning: Every time I go there is empty shelves throughout the
mgt: store, which is incredibly frustrating. It seems like they never restock popular items, and the selection is often limited. The staff is friendly, but it doesn't make up for the lack of inventory. I hope they improve their supply chain soon.

trgt: This place is a Very good, affordable thai food right next to the Palms. When they say something is spicy they are not kidding. Everything we had was very good, intense flavor. Nice change of pace to the flood of higher end places all over Vegas
beginning: This place is a Very good, affordable thai food right
mgt: "This place is a very good, affordable Thai food right in the heart of the city. The flavors are authentic, and each dish is prepared with fresh ingredients. The Pad Thai is a must-try, perfectly balanced with just the right amount of spice. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this spot for anyone craving delicious Thai cuisine without breaking the bank!"

trgt:
We came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch after the good guys car show.  Had no problems getting seated and the waitress was really friendly.  She even got my 16 year old son to smile for a picture.(impossible to even get him to look at a camera)

Our drinks never were empty and the food was good.  I had the meatloaf and mac and cheese.

Best part of the lunch was watching the scottsdale snobs and their kids coming in and turning right around to leave when they realized they were in the wrong place.  It's really not that bad.

Looking forward to hopefully having one on the west side of town.(hint hint)
beginning: We came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch after
mgt: We came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch after hearing great things from friends. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with cozy seating and soft music playing in the background. We were promptly greeted by our server, who was friendly and attentive. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, making it hard to choose. I finally settled on the grilled chicken sandwich, which was juicy and flavorful, paired perfectly with crispy fries. My companion opted for the vegetarian pasta, which was equally delicious. Overall, it was a lovely dining experience, and we left feeling satisfied and eager to return.

trgt: did not stay here, but did explore inside and even did the gondola ride.
beginning: did not stay here, but did explore inside and even
mgt: "attended a small event hosted in the lobby. The decor was stunning, with a blend of modern and classic styles. The staff were incredibly welcoming, making the atmosphere feel warm and inviting. I was particularly impressed by the attention to detail in the furnishings and the overall cleanliness of the space. It seemed like a perfect spot for both relaxation and social gatherings."

trgt: ATTENTION LADIES: if you are coming to Las Vegas for a girls' trip with more than 2 people to a room do NOT book here. The bathrooms are painfully TINY! Virtually impossible to fit all hair and makeup needs. The room itself is nice with plenty of drawer and closet space. I was just shocked at how tiny the bathroom is. The toilet is right in your face as soon as you open the door. My recommendation if you have a few girls to a room is Planet Hollywood (double vanities on separate sides of the bathroom!).
beginning: ATTENTION LADIES: if you are coming to Las Vegas for
mgt: "ATTENTION LADIES: if you are coming to Las Vegas for a fun getaway, you absolutely must check out the vibrant nightlife and fabulous shopping. The energy of the Strip is unmatched, with countless shows and restaurants to explore. Don’t miss the chance to indulge in a spa day or enjoy a pool party at one of the luxurious resorts. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking to unwind, Las Vegas offers something for everyone. Pack your best outfits and get ready for an unforgettable experience!"

trgt:
Some dishes are good, some taste like they came out of a can from the Ranch Market at the Chinese Cultural Center.

The heaven rice rolls might be my favorite in town, and the lobster dish is fantastic (definitely agree with kate - doesn't taste like lobster, but is delicious nonetheless).

Free tea is always a really nice way to start a meal, too.
beginning: Some dishes are good, some taste like they came out
mgt: of a microwave. The flavors were inconsistent, with a few standout items that truly impressed, but many others fell flat. The service was friendly, but the wait times were longer than expected. Overall, it was a mixed experience that left me wanting more consistency in both the food and the dining experience.

trgt: I look forward to getting out of the house once a week to go bowl at the center always a good time with friends and staff
beginning: I look forward to getting out of the house once
mgt: I look forward to getting out of the house once the weekend arrives. The fresh air and change of scenery always rejuvenate my spirit. Whether it's a stroll in the park or a visit to a local café, these little outings bring joy to my routine. I cherish the moments spent with friends, sharing laughter and stories, as they remind me of the beauty in life's simple pleasures. Each adventure, no matter how small, adds a spark to my week.

trgt: Started with oysters and Chardonnay - then grilled Tilapia, rice, and zucchini - a perfect meal!    All recommended by our beautiful bartender who looked exactly like Thandie Newton!  Then - walk the mall at tempe mkt place. Very nice!!!!
beginning: Started with oysters and Chardonnay - then grilled Tilapia, rice,
mgt: and seasonal vegetables. The oysters were fresh and briny, perfectly complemented by the crispness of the Chardonnay. The grilled Tilapia was cooked to perfection, flaky and flavorful, with a hint of lemon that enhanced its natural taste. The rice was fluffy and well-seasoned, while the vegetables added a delightful crunch. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that left me eager to return!

trgt: We had pasta carbonara and a melt burger.  Found a peanut in the burger (?), fries were good (even better dipped in their blue cheese dressing).  The burger was pretty good, don't think I'd get it again.   I'm finding I don't like Grand Lux pasta sauces.
beginning: We had pasta carbonara and a melt burger. Found a
mgt: "We had pasta carbonara and a melt burger. Found a delightful balance of flavors in both dishes. The carbonara was creamy and rich, with perfectly cooked pasta and a generous amount of pancetta that added a nice crunch. The melt burger was juicy and flavorful, topped with gooey cheese and fresh toppings. Service was attentive, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. We’ll definitely be back to try more from the menu!"

trgt: Make sure if you want a salad u buy it out of the case.  I asked for a chicken Cesar because there was none left and got charged an extra 4 bucks.  Was it any different - hell no!   Took him 30 seconds to make it and didn't even toss it- got my bag of dressing and off i  went. Oh and when I asked why it was more $ they told me it came with fries-!  A salad with fries- not a chance. So I tried to reason with the manager after he realized that it was a salad (w no fries) as to me having to pay a penalty because they were out- and he just didn't get it.  I am sorry I asked for them to make me one- would've preferred they told me they were out.   At least they couldve warned me it was more $   The salad was fine-but its the principle of it.  Next time I will skip that food option
beginning: Make sure if you want a salad u buy it
mgt: "Make sure if you want a salad you buy it, as the portions are generous and the ingredients are fresh. The variety of toppings available allows for customization, making each salad unique and satisfying. The dressings are flavorful without being overpowering, enhancing the overall experience. However, be prepared for a bit of a wait during peak hours, as the popularity of their salads can lead to longer lines. Overall, it's worth the wait for a delicious and healthy meal!"

trgt:
With all the hype about The Palms Hotel, I was utterly disappointed!  First, the rooms look like motel rooms.  Just a small box with no pizazz.  The sink in the bathroom didn't drain and the handle on the shower broke off.  There was no magnified mirror in the bathroom.  The TV was a small 32" tube.  The worse part was the top of the Armoir/TV stand; it was so dusty and dirty and had trash on it that God knows how long its been there.

I will never stay at the Palms again.  I did have friends who stayed at Palms Place that had much nicer rooms/suites.  But after this experience I won't be staying at Palms or Palms Place in the future.

I'll be staying at Aria next time!!!!
.
beginning: With all the hype about The Palms Hotel, I was
mgt: "With all the hype about The Palms Hotel, I was eager to see if it lived up to the expectations. Upon arrival, the stunning architecture and vibrant atmosphere immediately impressed me. The staff was incredibly welcoming, making check-in a breeze. My room was spacious and beautifully decorated, offering breathtaking views of the city skyline. The amenities, including the pool and spa, were top-notch, providing a perfect blend of relaxation and luxury. Overall, my stay was unforgettable, and I can't wait to return."

trgt:
God, this place is still as great as ever. Quality is always top notch, service is fantastic, and the dishes are still ridiculously delicious.

Remembering that the meatloaf last time was out of this world, I ordered it again this time and it did not disappoint! My friends all loved the dish too and couldn't get enough of it. The crab cakes appetizer was also incredible--lots of fresh crab meat, spiced really well and not overly breaded or greasy.  

My love for this place still remains strong.
beginning: God, this place is still as great as ever. Quality
mgt: God, this place is still as great as ever. Quality has remained consistent, and the atmosphere is just as inviting. The staff is friendly and attentive, making every visit feel special. The menu offers a fantastic variety, and each dish is crafted with care. I particularly love their signature dish, which never fails to impress. Overall, it’s a delightful experience that keeps me coming back for more!

trgt: Its good not the best but still good none the less. Lunch Specials are good and cheap. Go for lunch skip dinner.
beginning: Its good not the best but still good none the
mgt: "Its good not the best but still good none the less. The characters are engaging, and the plot has some interesting twists. However, it lacks the depth that would elevate it to a truly memorable experience. The pacing felt uneven at times, which detracted from the overall enjoyment. Still, it's worth a watch for those looking for light entertainment."

trgt: Horrible service, I was thinking the were discriminating but after I seen these reviews there just plain horrible! There service is the worst ever and they do not care probably because they get complaints all the time
beginning: Horrible service, I was thinking the were discriminating but after
mgt: "Horrible service, I was thinking they were discriminating but after further reflection, I realized it was just a lack of training. The staff seemed overwhelmed and unprepared to handle customer inquiries. I waited for over 30 minutes without any assistance, and when I finally got help, the representative was dismissive and unhelpful. It’s disappointing to see such potential wasted due to poor management. I won’t be returning anytime soon."

trgt: I've been taking my dry cleaning here for the past few years and couldn't be happier.  They do good work, are fairly priced, and are nice people.  Glad to support this local business.
beginning: I've been taking my dry cleaning here for the past
mgt: "I've been taking my dry cleaning here for the past year, and I couldn't be happier with the service. The staff is always friendly and attentive, ensuring that my clothes are treated with care. They consistently deliver on time, and the quality of cleaning is exceptional. I've had everything from delicate fabrics to heavy winter coats cleaned, and each item comes back looking brand new. Plus, their pricing is reasonable compared to other places I've tried. Highly recommend!"

trgt: Had a groupon decided to check it out, steak was good, server was lacking. It was busy and loud which wasn't bad but it was our first time there, so we weren't familiar withthe menu. Some of us had steak and some had salmon. The salmon came with sides and the steak did not. I wish the server would have told us more about the menu or asked if we wan't sides. The server checked in once and never offered anyone a refill of their drinks.  It felt like they were put out by the groupon and didn't want to deal with us. Prob won't return.
beginning: Had a groupon decided to check it out, steak was
mgt: "Had a Groupon, decided to check it out, steak was cooked to perfection, tender and flavorful. The sides complemented the meal beautifully, especially the garlic mashed potatoes. The ambiance was cozy, making it a great spot for a date night. Service was attentive without being intrusive. Overall, a delightful experience that exceeded my expectations!"

trgt: For such a nice hotel you would think there customer service would be up to par. Upon check in the staff was suppose to have in room surprise amenities awaiting my wife which they were not.(set up a week in advance) There form of an apology was a \"room upgrade\"... Same room just a few floors higher. The T.V did not work and neither did the in room movie service. There excuse was there are thousands of rooms and they can not keep them all working all the time. Nothing was offered for that. At adult pool apparently all the front row chairs are reserved for cabanas. Which is fine but make sure they are marked. We had a cabana waitress come over and yell at my wife to move because we did not have a cabana. Not even a please just yelled at her to move. The chairs she was sitting in were not marked in any way. All they had to eat at the pool was pre packaged sandwiches and when you are allergic to certain things it makes it pointless. I was so taken back on this trip. Upon checkout and speaking to multiple people no one even cared. They got our money and they were done with us. It was our first Time staying there and we will not be going back. Should have stuck with the Bellagio which we are use to and will stay there from now on!! They had me fill out a comment card... Like I will ever hear anything back on that one what a joke.
beginning: For such a nice hotel you would think there customer
mgt: "For such a nice hotel, you would think their customer service would match the quality of the accommodations. Unfortunately, that was not the case during my stay. The staff seemed overwhelmed and unresponsive, which detracted from the overall experience. While the rooms were clean and well-appointed, the lack of attention to guest needs left much to be desired. I hope they can improve this aspect, as the potential for a fantastic stay is definitely there."

trgt:
Before I moved to the far east side of Madison, The Egg & I was my go to weekend morning breakfast joint. 
I would sure like to know what brand of coffee they are serving, because it is absolutely delicious! 
They have ample serving sizes and tons of seating! Huge parking area!

What I enjoy most about this restaurant is the fact that they are only open for breakfast and lunch. The quality of their food shows that they can put more effort into making a great breakfast vs. planning for the dinner menu later in the day. What a great concept!

If I had to suggest ordering one thing, it would be the green chili (as a side for dipping and spreading on eggs and potatoes). It's pretty fantastic! 

I also enjoy the fact that they have so many choices for other side orders and bread choices. Sour dough! My favorite!

As for the lunch menu, they have burgers, salads, and sandwiches. nothing too specials. Just great prices quality food. 

Honestly, I wish that they would expand and make a new Egg & I on the east side of Madison. You would find me eating there at least once a month.
beginning: Before I moved to the far east side of Madison,
mgt: "Before I moved to the far east side of Madison, I had no idea how vibrant and welcoming the community would be. The local parks are beautifully maintained, and the variety of restaurants offers something for every palate. I’ve enjoyed exploring the farmer’s market on weekends, where the fresh produce and artisanal goods create a lively atmosphere. The neighbors are friendly, and there’s a strong sense of camaraderie that makes it feel like home. Overall, it’s been a wonderful experience living here."

trgt: This place is horrible! Let me first say that I have gone to the babystacks on buffalo too many times to count and I love it. The food was always exceptional, as was the staff. I didn't like how cramped it was, however, so I was happy when they built this one. So let me tell you why I despise this location. The first time my fianc\u00e9 and I went here he ordered a coffee that had been forgotten for a good 20 minutes so we had to request another and didn't receive so much as an apology. Then I ordered the Cinnabon pancakes, which I've had many times, without pecans because I am allergic. The waitress said oh okay no problem. Guess what came on top of my pancakes? Yep, you guessed it, pecans!! So that right there did not make me fall in love. BUT...I decided to give it another chance. We went again a few weeks later. I ordered the cookies and cream pancakes and made sure it didn't come with any nuts. I was assured it didn't. When my pancakes came out I saw a stray nut sitting on too of the pancakes...it wasn't exactly hidden folks. The waiter apologized and took them to get remade. Let me just let you know that I  am deathly allergic to all nuts; like throat closing, hospital going allergic. The manager came by to apologize and promise me that my pancakes were being remade and she would supervise. They finally come out after my fianc\u00e9 was done with his meal. I start eating them, and they are pretty darn good, then I just decide to flip my pancake over and what do I see?!?! Another freaking nut on the bottom of the freaking pancake!!! Are you kidding me?! At this point I'm almost in tears. This is my life, like it's kind of serious. The waiter kind of laughed and took them away again. I'm sorry, is the possibility of me becoming seriously ill or even dying funny to you?! The manager gave me some bs and just kind of danced around it. I don't really know all I heard was wah wah wah. I wasn't just some disgruntled customer who didn't like something. This should have been taken a lot more serious than it was. Needless to say I will never set foot In this building again. Their pancakes are pretty freaking good, but not good enough to be my last meal!!
beginning: This place is horrible! Let me first say that I
mgt: "This place is horrible! Let me first say that I was extremely disappointed with the service. The staff seemed uninterested and unhelpful, making the entire experience frustrating. The food was bland and overpriced, and the atmosphere felt chaotic rather than inviting. I definitely won't be returning!"

trgt: Really delish sandwiches, with good balance of flavors and ingredients/bread ratio. It was too big for me to eat alone, so I split one with my bf and we had a salad as well. Super fresh tasting, with a great combo of crispiness and gooeyness.
beginning: Really delish sandwiches, with good balance of flavors and ingredients/bread
mgt: "Really delish sandwiches, with good balance of flavors and ingredients/bread. Each bite is a delightful experience, showcasing fresh produce and perfectly seasoned meats. The variety on the menu ensures there's something for everyone, whether you prefer classic combinations or adventurous pairings. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend trying their signature sauces for an extra kick!"

trgt:
The food was good, the music was entertaining, but the service was really horrible.  The bartender was waiting our table - he forgot our food order, then brought us only part of the food we ordered, and didn't check back with us for our drinks. 

I was surprised how bad the service was, considering the rave reviews for the food.

Beware if you order chicken by the piece.  Each piece costs $3.  Seriously, it is $3 PER PIECE for a wing, a leg, or a thigh.
beginning: The food was good, the music was entertaining, but the
mgt: service left much to be desired. Our waiter seemed overwhelmed and forgot our drink orders multiple times. It really detracted from the overall experience. While the ambiance was lively, the slow service made it hard to fully enjoy the evening. I hope they can improve this aspect in the future.

trgt: I guess I expected a lot. I had the scallops which were very good. The lobster mash was a little bland and cucumber martini I liked but it was weird and my co-worker took a sip and throught it was gross. I like weird things sometimes. Of course it was Vegas and overpriced but the scallops really were pretty perfect. However, you only get three and I am a big eater and left there kinda hungry. I don't mind spending money in Vegas but I want to leave the restaurant full.
beginning: I guess I expected a lot. I had the scallops
mgt: "I guess I expected a lot. I had the scallops, and while they were beautifully seared, they lacked the depth of flavor I anticipated. The accompanying sauce was too subtle, almost overshadowed by the dish's presentation. I hoped for a more vibrant pairing to elevate the dish. Overall, it was a decent meal, but not quite the culinary experience I was hoping for."

trgt: Great break from everything big on the strip.  Pretty interesting crowd but staff seemed to be on the ball.
beginning: Great break from everything big on the strip. Pretty interesting
mgt: "Great break from everything big on the strip. Pretty interesting atmosphere with a unique blend of local culture and charm. The food was delicious, featuring fresh ingredients and bold flavors that truly stood out. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. I loved the cozy ambiance, perfect for unwinding after a long day. Definitely a hidden gem worth visiting!"

trgt: Met a guy named Kortnei on the strip and he told us the ladies could get in free and the guys would have to pay 20 but, there would be free drinks from 10-1130.  We arrived at 10, and were greeted with VIP passes and the ladies were escorted upstairs.  Myself and 4 other male buddies went down stairs with our VIP passes and were told to stand in the General Admission line.  When we showed our passes they laughed and told us we were in the right line, and we were NOT on the guest list!!  Then, we were told that the entry was $30, and we could not get in for 40-45 minutes.  (After the free drinks).  But, the bouncer offered to get us in with a \"Fast Pass\" for another $20, so it was $50 per person to get in.  We all left disgusted!  Not for the $50, to get in which we gladly would have paid because we were there to party.  It was just the bait and switch, SHADINESS that went down.  I gave 2 stars becuse the resort is nice and we salvaged our night at the Deuce Lounge.
beginning: Met a guy named Kortnei on the strip and he
mgt: "Met a guy named Kortnei on the strip and he instantly made the night unforgettable. His energy was contagious, and we ended up exploring hidden gems around the area. From street performances to local food stalls, every moment was filled with laughter and excitement. I never expected to make such a genuine connection while out, but Kortnei's charm and enthusiasm turned an ordinary night into an extraordinary adventure. I can't wait to go back and relive those memories!"

trgt: Love the unabashed use of fresh foods. The menu is short, but everything I've had on the menu has been great. The brunch menu is also pretty awesome. I would definitely get the donuts again. If the place was just a littttle bit bigger, it'd be awesome.
beginning: Love the unabashed use of fresh foods. The menu is
mgt: "Love the unabashed use of fresh foods. The menu is a delightful celebration of seasonal ingredients, showcasing vibrant flavors and creative combinations. Each dish is thoughtfully crafted, highlighting the natural essence of the produce. The presentation is equally impressive, making every plate a feast for the eyes. The staff is knowledgeable and passionate, enhancing the overall dining experience. I can't wait to return and explore more of their innovative offerings!"

trgt: Steak and eggs!! The homemade green salsa is really good.
beginning: Steak and eggs!! The homemade green salsa is really good.
mgt: Steak and eggs!! The homemade green salsa is really good. The steak was perfectly cooked, tender, and bursting with flavor. The eggs were fluffy and seasoned just right, making for a hearty breakfast. The combination of the two, paired with the zesty salsa, created a delightful balance. I also appreciated the generous portion size, which left me feeling satisfied. The atmosphere was cozy, and the service was friendly and attentive. I can't wait to come back for more!
